popup.title: Luskan
popup.description: The '''City of Sails''' , was the northernmost major port city ruled by pirate [[High Captains]] and the [[Host Tower of the Arcane]].

popup.title: Neverwinter
popup.description: The '''City of Skilled Hands''' and the '''Jewel of the North''', a major bustling, cultured, and cosmopolitan city-state in northwest [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: Waterdeep
popup.description:
The famed '''City of Splendors''' – the most important and influential city in all of [[Faerûn]]. A marvelous cosmopolitan city of great culture, arts, and academia. Its cultural impact was as grand as its trade.

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Waterdeep|here]].

popup.title: Akanamere
popup.description: The large freshwater lake, located in the [[Akanal]] peninsula, between the [[Akanapeaks]] to the north and the [[Maerthwatch]] to the south. The [[Blade Kingdoms]] sat on the lake's north-western shores, and a kingdom of friendly [[nixie]]s inhabited its depts.

popup.title: Colletro
popup.description: A prosperous city-state that dealt in olive oil and grapes, the main adversary of [[Sumbria]] among the cities of the [[Blade Kingdoms]].

popup.title: Zutria
popup.description: The city-state of the [[Blade Kingdoms]] that laid on the shores of the [[Akanamere]] and in the lush [[Hills of Apion]].

popup.title: Sumbria
popup.description: The biggest city of the [[Blade Kingdoms]], known for its wealth, armies, arts, and sciences.

popup.title: Kirenzia
popup.description: One of the two smallest independent city-states of the [[Blade Kingdoms]] that was decimated during the [[Blade Wars]] of [[1217 DR]].

popup.title: Lomatra
popup.description: A provincial and militaristic city-state with its main industry being fishing.

popup.title: Lotoli
popup.description: The southernmost city-state of the [[Blade Kingdoms]].

popup.title: Trevi River
popup.description: The river that fed into the [[Akanamere]].

popup.title: Hills of Apion
popup.description: The hilly valley on the south-eastern side of the [[Akanapeaks]].

popup.title: Valley of Umbricci
popup.description: A sprawling green mountain valley in the [[Akanapeaks]], home of olive and grape farmers. It belonged to [[Colletro]] and separated from the rest of the [[Blade Kingdom]]s by a single mountain pass.

popup.title: Akanapeaks
popup.description: The mountain range in [[Chessenta]] that formed its historical western border.

popup.title: Sea of Moving Ice
popup.description: A collection of icebergs and frost-covered isles that floated in the waters of [[northwest Faerûn]].

popup.title: Reghed Glacier
popup.description: A glacial wasteland north of the Spine of the World and the namesake of the [[Reghedman]] [[barbarian]]s.

popup.title: Mirabar
popup.description: A mining city of great wealth, home of the [[Axe of Mirabar]] – an army of around two thousand, including [[human]]s and five hundred [[dwarves]].

popup.title: Reth
popup.description: One of the largest and most powerful city-states in the [[Vilhon Reach]]. It was a high-walled and fast-growing trading port city of [[Chessenta]].

popup.title: Hlath
popup.description: A powerful [[Chondath]]sn port city-state that ran on two industries – fishing and logging.

popup.title: Nunwood
popup.description: The main source of lumber for [[Reth]] and [[Hlath]], protected by the [[Emerald Enclave]] and creatures that used hit-and-run tactics during the night.

popup.title: Gap of Reth
popup.description: One of the very few passages across [[Akanapeaks]] that connected the city of [[Reth]] with [[Airspur]].

popup.title: Emerald Corridor
popup.description: Also known as the '''Emerald Way''', it was the main trade route in [[Chondath]] that stretched along the [[Vilhon Reach]] from the city of [[Arrabar]] to [[Hlath]] and further to [[Reth]].

popup.title: Wavecrest
popup.description: One of two islands that made up the [[Eyes of Silvanus]] on the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], protected by reefs and also the magic of the [[Emerald Enclave]].

popup.title: Ilighôn
popup.description: The island home of the [[Emerald Enclave]].

popup.title: Ixinos
popup.description: The island home to a matriarchal tribe comprised almost entirely of women and ruled by the [[amazon]] Queen.

popup.title: Sapra
popup.description: The only port city on the isle of [[Ilighôn]], ruled and guarded by the [[druid]]s of the [[Emerald Enclave]].

popup.title: Nun
popup.description: The village that stood on the southern shore of the [[River Nu]].

popup.title: Fields of Nun
popup.description: The open stretch of land running through the northern region of [[Chondath]] and the site of the [[Rotting War]].

popup.title: Samra
popup.description: A small [[Chondath]]an fishing town.

popup.title: Iljak
popup.description: A powerful city-state that participated in trade and exported fish and grains.

popup.title: The Old Road
popup.description: An old trade route that ran from [[Shamph]] in [[Chondath]], south through the [[Chondalwood]], through [[Elbulder]] in [[Sespech]], where it crossed the [[River Arran]], and then further south across the [[Golden Plains]] towards [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Timindar
popup.description: Once a small frontier town in [[Chondath]] on the edge of [[Satyrwood]], ruined in [[267 DR]]. The town's remnants were [[ghost]]-infested ruins.

popup.title: Shamph
popup.description: The metropolis known as the '''Crossroads City''' that grew fat and wealthy off of the [[Emerald Way]] trade.

popup.title: Orbech
popup.description: Once a logging settlement, it was destroyed in [[267 DR]], and by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], it was a collection of crumbling stone structures.

popup.title: Asple
popup.description: A small fishing community and a prosperous stone quarry on the north-western shores of the [[Vilhon Reach]].

popup.title: Torl
popup.description: An independent port city that once housed a rich [[gold]] mine.

popup.title: Aphrunn Mountains
popup.description: The mountain range that formed the southern border of the Republic of [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Lilit Pass
popup.description: The narrow chasm in the [[Aphrunn Mountains]] that led from the [[Halondar]] to the mining village of [[Daroush]].

popup.title: Daroush
popup.description: A small [[gold]]-mining village located in the [[Aphrunn Mountains]].

popup.title: Farshore Straits
popup.description: A thin marine passage between the island of [[Ilighôn]] and the [[Vilhon Reach]] mainland.

popup.title: Strait of Silvanus
popup.description: The marine passage through the [[Eyes of Silvanus]].

popup.title: Paddle Straits
popup.description: A narrow marine passage between the isle of [[Wavecrest]] and the land of the [[Vilhon Reach]].

popup.title: Sharksbane Wall
popup.description: A 135-mile (217 km.) long underwater defensive barrier protecting the realm of [[Serôs]].
popup.image: File:Threat from the Sea of fallen stars map.png

popup.title: Mussum
popup.description: An abandoned city in [[Chondath]] – a plague-ridden ruin, and home to the [[House of Holy Suffering]], a major temple to [[Ilmater]].

popup.title: Arrabar
popup.description: The capital city of [[Chondath]] and one of the primary port cities of the [[Vilhon Reach]], known for its crime and corruption. The heraldic symbol of the city was three golden balls on a white background.

popup.title: Mimph
popup.description: A coastal metropolis of [[Sespech]], only reachable by sea or overland travel as no road led to this city.

popup.title: Nimpeth
popup.description: One of the [[Free Cities of the Vilhon Reach]] built on the back of slaves, renowned for its high quality [[wine]] from [[Woren Vineyards]].

popup.title: Broken Hills
popup.description: The rough and rugged plot of land immediately beyond Nimpeth's northeastern wall turned into the agricultural wonder of the [[Vilhon]] – [[Woren Vineyards]].

popup.title: Fort Arran
popup.description: Previously known as '''Arranford''' – a small town, turned outpost that stood on the [[Golden Road]] between [[Sespech]] and the the capital of [[Chondath]] – [[Arrabar]].

popup.title: River Arran
popup.description: A river system found in [[Chondath]] and [[Sespech]] that crossed the [[Old Road (Vilhon Reach)|Old Road]] and the [[Golden Road]].

popup.title: Elbulder
popup.description: A logging town turned into a trading outpost.

popup.title: Nagaflow Keep
popup.description: A small keep, more of an outpost.

popup.title: Bridge Keep
popup.description: A keep of note along the [[Golden Road]].

popup.title: Kurrsh
popup.description: A village and a caravan stop allied with [[Innarlith]].

popup.title: Firesteap Citadel
popup.description: A military fortress under the control of [[Innarlith]].

popup.title: Berrywilde
popup.description: A large country estate owned by Senator [[Inthelph]] and used as a source of income for his family in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Naga Ford
popup.description: One of the two fords that split from the [[Old Road (Vilhon Reach)|Old Road]] only to be merged back further south.

popup.title: Roaringford
popup.description: One of the two fords that split from the [[Old Road (Vilhon Reach)|Old Road]] only to be merged back further south.

popup.title: Ormpetarr
popup.description: The capital city of [[Sespech]] that was known as the '''City of the Scar''' during the century that followed the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Golden Road
popup.description: The trade road that ran from [[Arrabar]] in [[Chondath]], through [[Ormpetarr]] to [[Innarlith]] on the [[Lake of Steam]] and then on to [[Shaarmid]] and [[Kormul]] in the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Golden Plains
popup.description: The land between the [[Nagaflow]] and [[Arran river]]s that was named for its tall, golden grasses. During the century that followed the [[Spellplague]], it was known as the [[Plaguewrought Land]].

popup.title: Innarlith
popup.description: The city-state located on the eastern tip of the [[Lake of Steam]] and renowned for its access to goods of any type, mostly acquired through illegal means.

popup.title: Trader's Way
popup.description: The caravan road that began on the [[Golden Road]] at [[Kormul]] and moved southeast, passing by the [[River Talar]], [[Rethmar]], [[Channathgate]], before climbing the [[Landrise]] and reaching [[Three Swords]], [[Eartheart]], and [[Delzimmer]], ending at [[Cathyr]] in [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Dunsel Trail
popup.description: The trade route that connected the [[Golden Road]] at [[Shaarmid]] with the [[human]] outpost of [[Khôltar]] and the [[dwarven]] city of [[Eartheart]] on the edge of the [[Great Rift]].

popup.title: Nagaflow
popup.description: The long and lazy river that began in [[Chondalwood]]. After linking with the [[Wintercloak River]], it widened into a deep, freshwater lake called the [[Nagawater]], then finally drained into the [[Vilhon Reach]] near [[Nimpeth]].

popup.title: Chondalwood
popup.description: Also known as the '''Satyrwood''', the large forest was located in [[Chondath]] in the [[Vilhon Reach]], stretching from the [[Nunwood]] to the [[Nagaflow River]]. It is also known as Satyrwood.

popup.title: Wintercloak River
popup.description: The river that connected the [[Deepwash]] lake with the [[Nagawater]].

popup.title: Nagawater
popup.description: The large, freshwater lake located in [[Sespech]] and named after a large population of [[water naga]]s that lived in the southern part of the lake.

popup.title: Nagalands
popup.description: The region bordering the northern parts of the [[Nagawater]].

popup.title: Nagarr
popup.description: The village sometimes marked as '''Kagarra''' on maps, also named '''Yacla''' around the 9{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Serpents' Holding
popup.description: The grassland located west of the [[Nagawater]], home to a large variety of [[spitting serpent]]s.

popup.title: Slithering Plains
popup.description: The plot of green land that bordered the [[Nagawater]]'s western shores.

popup.title: Naga Plains
popup.description: The green plains that bordered south-eastern shores of the [[Nagawater]].

popup.title: Iyrandrar
popup.description: A realm of isolationist [[gold elves]] of [[Chondalwood]].

popup.title: Ammathvale
popup.description: The small open valley separating the [[Lluirwood]] in the north from the [[Southern Lluirwood]] in [[Luiren]], spanning roughly 100 miles (160,000 meters).

popup.title: Dunfeld
popup.description: A small town in [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Fryndul
popup.description: A [[gnome]] village in the southern [[Shaar]] that traded in finely-cut [[gem]]s.

popup.title: Maerthwatch
popup.description: Also known as the '''Hills of Maerth''', a range of hills and mountains rich with [[beljuril]]s, [[jacinth]]s, and [[luspeel]].

popup.title: Gaj
popup.description: A major trade-town that exported [[copper]] wiring.

popup.title: River's Run
popup.description: A small town not far from [[River Nun]]'s source in the [[Chondalwood]].

popup.title: River Akax
popup.description: The river that flowed from the [[Akanamere]] in the southwest to empty into the western coast of the [[Bay of Chessenta]].

popup.title: Bay of Chessenta
popup.description: A large bay in the southern [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]. On its shores stood settkments of [[Soorenar]], [[Mordulkin]], and [[Luthcheq]].

popup.title: Oslin
popup.description: A small trading village in [[Chessenta]].

popup.title: Maerduuth
popup.description: A small trading village located in [[Chessenta]] that once was a city before falling in a war with [[Akanax]] in the early 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: City of the Werecrocodiles
popup.description: A half-sunken settlement in the [[Adder Swamp]] of [[Chessenta]], populated mostly by [[werecrocodile]]s.

popup.title: Maerch
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Akanax
popup.description: A harsh, warlike city in the [[Akanal]] region of [[Chessenta]], known for its talented smiths, its rigid military structure, and its intolerance of outsiders.

popup.title: Rodanar
popup.description: A town built around a fortress of [[Tchazzar]]. The city was decimated in a war with [[Akanax]] during the 12{{th}} century [[DR]], drastically reducing its size.

popup.title: Heptios
popup.description: A city-state in [[Chessenta]] controlled by [[Luthcheq]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was renowned for its academia and trade.

popup.title: Samnur
popup.description: A small coastal village with a monument commemorating a win over the [[Abolethic Sovereignty]] overlooking it from a hill.

popup.title: River Heptios
popup.description: A river that drained into the [[Bay of Chessenta]].

popup.title: Barren River
popup.description: Or the '''Jade River''', the river that began on the slopes of the [[Riders to the Sky]] mountains and drained into the [[Bay of Chessenta]].

popup.title: Apescoe
popup.description: A fisher's paradise built on a deep sheltered harbor in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], after the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Soolabax
popup.description: A walled town in [[Chessenta]] near the border with [[Threskel]].

popup.title: The Long Crawl
popup.description: The road that curved around the [[Bat of Chessenta]].

popup.title: Mordulkin
popup.description: Once a wealthy [[mage]]-ruled city-state on the [[Bay of Chessenta]]. In the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], it was ar ruined city inhabited by proud refugee [[mage]]s.

popup.title: Luthcheq
popup.description:
The '''City of Madness''' – a port city that valued its martial culture.

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Luthcheq|here]].

popup.title: Villon
popup.description: A town of note.

popup.title: Saden
popup.description: An independent, small thorp located in southern [[Chessenta]], on the bank of the [[Adder River]].

popup.title: Maerchwood
popup.description: The forest in the southern heartlands of [[Chessenta]], between the [[Adder River]] and the [[Winding River]].

popup.title: Cimbar
popup.description: A city-state in the [[Old Empires]] and a sometimes-capital of the empire of [[Chessenta]].

popup.title: Airspur
popup.description: A powerful trading port city in western [[Chessenta]] in the [[Old Empires]] and a highly cosmopolitan and multiracial city, with an impressively high population of [[orc]]s and [[half-orc]]s.

popup.title: Soorenar
popup.description: A city-state located on the western coast of the [[Bay of Chessenta]] that headed the [[Northern Alliance]], one of the three most powerful alliances in [[Chessenta]] as of the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Adder Swamp
popup.description: A dangerous expanse of [[lycanthrope]]-infested marshland that surrounded the [[Adder River]] delta in [[Chessenta]].

popup.title: Adder River
popup.description: The river that ran south to north from the [[Adder Peaks]] to empty into the [[Bay of Chessenta]] through the [[Adder Swamp]].

popup.title: Adder Peaks
popup.description: A mountain range in [[Chessenta]]. Both the [[Winding River]] and [[Adder River]] originated in the '''Adder Peaks'''.

popup.title: Winding River
popup.description: The longest and wildest river of the [[Old Empires]] region that connected the [[Adder Peaks]] and the [[Methmere]].

popup.title: Watchers' Cape
popup.description: A protrusion of land into the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] located in the country of [[Threskel]] known for its massive lighthouse [[Drakelight]].

popup.title: Mount Thulbane
popup.description: A once-dormant volcano located in [[Threskel]].

popup.title: The Long Beach
popup.description: A stretch of sandy coastland along northwestern [[Threskel]], where the land met the waters of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]. Home of many small communities of fishers.

popup.title: River of Metals
popup.description: The river named after its rich deposits of precious metals, especially [[gold]].

popup.title: Riders to the Sky
popup.description: The mountain range between southeastern [[Chessenta]] and northern [[Unther]], once home to an ancient [[aarakocra]] civilization.

popup.title: Dragonback Mountain
popup.description: A massive mountain and a long-dormant volcano - the northernmost peak of the [[Riders to the Sky]] that was the lair of [[Alasklerbanbastos]], the Great Bone Wyrm until [[1479 DR]].

popup.title: Fields of Pryollus
popup.description: The stretch of land used by the people of [[Threskel]] and [[Unther]], as a venue for sporting events and grand athletic competitions.

popup.title: Methmere
popup.description: Also known as '''Lake Meth''' – a lake in the frontier between the nations of [[Chessenta]] and ]]Unther]].

popup.title: Methwood
popup.description: A dense forest located in the frontier between the nations of [[Chessenta]] and [[Unther]].

popup.title: Shussel
popup.description: A small heavily-fortified fishing city and once a mining settlement.

popup.title: Sadamzar
popup.description: A small town on the shores of the [[Methmere]] in northern [[Unther]].

popup.title: Messemprar
popup.description: A city in [[Unther]] that, at some point during the country's history, was its largest city, but by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]] had shrunk both in importance and in size.

popup.title: Red Haven
popup.description: A small fishing village that suffered many attacks from [[sahuagin]] and pirates.

popup.title: Dalath
popup.description: A small mining town in the heartlands of [[Unther]], located near the eastern [[Smoking Mountains]].

popup.title: Ssintar
popup.description: A small trading and military outpost.

popup.title: Black Ash Plain
popup.description: A wasteland of black volcanic ash, home to [[brown dragon]]s and [[ash giant]]s.

popup.title: Unthalass
popup.description: The capital of [[Unther]] and one of the grandest cities in [[Faerun]].

popup.title: Firetrees
popup.description: A small town located in the [[Greenfields]] of [[Unther]] – a popular stop for caravans and ships traveling along the [[River Alamber]].

popup.title: Kaoll
popup.description: A small town in [[Unther]] on the shores of the [[River Angol]].

popup.title: River Alamber
popup.description: A long and swift river found in the [[Greenfields]] in southern [[Unther]].

popup.title: River Angol
popup.description: A long and swift river found in the [[Greenfields]] in southern [[Unther]].

popup.title: Sekras
popup.description: A small ruined city along the shore of the [[Blue Sword River]] in close proximity to the border with [[Mulhorand]], inhabited by [[werecrocodile]]s in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: River of Swords
popup.description: The river that served as the border between the lands of [[Mulhorand]] and [[Unther]].

popup.title: Aina
popup.description: A small coastal town in the nation of [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Smoking Mountains
popup.description: Also known as the '''Smoky Mountains''' or the '''Marthessel''', a range of mountains with active volcanoes.

popup.title: Greenfields
popup.description: An overly-fertile land of magically affected soil between the [[River Alamber]] and the [[River Angol]].

popup.title: Mount Fussel
popup.description: Or '''Mount Fussell''' – the westernmost volcanic peak found within the [[Smoky Mountains]].

popup.title: Mount Temmikant
popup.description: A volcanic peak found within the [[Smoky Mountains]], home of an old blind [[red dragon]] [[Guyanothaz]].

popup.title: Citadel of Black Ash
popup.description: The underground temple to [[Gilgeam]] located in the eastern [[Smoking Mountains]].

popup.title: Dust Road
popup.description: Also known as the '''Road of Dust''' - a commercial road running through [[Southeast Faerûn]] and [[East Faerûn]].

popup.title: Gheldaneth
popup.description: The second largest city in the nation of [[Mulhorand]], as well as one of its sixteen governments.

popup.title: Rauthgor
popup.description: Also known as the '''Rainbow Falls''' - a prominent waterfall located in [[Mulhorand]]. A small fortified settlement sprung up around the waterfall as [[1357 DR]].

popup.title: Cliffs of Leaping Horses
popup.description: A stretch of seaside cliffs in [[Mulhorand]], south of the [[River Rauthenflow]]'s mouth.

popup.title: Delgora
popup.description: A small coastal town that housed [[Mulhorand]]'s prime fishing fleet.

popup.title: Sampranasz
popup.description: The small town that functioned as the center for the [[Cult of Set]] in [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Aleaxtis
popup.description: The underwater '''Kingdom of the Sahuagin'''.

popup.title: Unthangol Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass through the [[Unthangol Mountain]]s that once was part of the [[Dust Road]].

popup.title: Alamber Sea
popup.description: The '''Sahuagin Sea''' – the primary trade avenue between the nations of [[Mulhorand]], [[Unther]], and [[Thay]] and neutral territory.

popup.title: Alaor
popup.description: A pair of islands on the [[Alamber Sea]] that, for many years, was considered a tharch of [[Thay]] and served as a strategical naval stronghold for the magocratic nation.

popup.title: Ship of the Gods
popup.description: A volcanic island on the [[Alamber Sea]] and the cite of a secret temple to [[Geb]] called the [[Golden Forge]].

popup.title: Mourktar
popup.description: An independent city-state that later became the capital of [[Threskel]] that maintained an adversarial relationship with the sahuagin kingdom of [[Aleaxtis]].

popup.title: Thamor
popup.description: An independent trading city that accommodated merchants from [[Unther]] and [[Mulhorand]] waiving any taxation.

popup.title: Nethra
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Teth
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]],

popup.title: Hilbrand
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]] with a population of 20,000 in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Lasdur
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Taskaunt
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Murbant
popup.description: A previously-independent coastal settlement that came under the control of [[Thay]] during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], under the greater [[tharch]] of [[Priador]].

popup.title: Neldorild
popup.description: Or '''Neldorild''' – the fourth largest city in [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Council Hills
popup.description: A clump of hills in the [[Eastern Shaar]] where the territories of several Shaaran tribes met.

popup.title: Lake of Salt
popup.description: Or '''Azulduth''' – a shallow body of water, fed by the [[River of Swords]]. It was surrounded by partially-looted [[Sauroid]] ruins, many of which extended deep under the earth and were primarily inhabited by [[yuan-ti]].

popup.title: Surbroar
popup.description: A city located in the country of [[Mulhorand]] that sat on the [[River of Spears]] and on the [[Great South Road]] due north of [[Ulzel]].

popup.title: Ulzel
popup.description: A town located in the country of [[Mulhorand]] within the [[Great Vale]] on the [[Great South Road]].

popup.title: Great South Road
popup.description: It moved north to south through central [[Mulhorand]], originating in at the border with [[Thazalhar]], and passing south through the [[Great Vale]] and past border with the [[Eastern Shaar]]. Along the way, it crossed the [[River Rauthenflow]], the [[River of Shadows]], and the [[River of Spears]].

popup.title: River of Shadows
popup.description: A rocky and treacherous waterway that began near the [[Sword Mountains]] and emptied into the [[Alamber Sea]] near the city of [[Skuld]].

popup.title: Jhalhoran
popup.description: A major center of worship for [[Osiris]].

popup.title: Klondor
popup.description: A small town in [[Mulhorand]], located on the foothills of the [[Sword Mountains]].

popup.title: Mishtan
popup.description: One of [[Mulhorand]]'s sixteen preceptual governments and one of the centers of [[Osiris]] worship. It was the gateway to the [[Land of the Dead]]—the resting place of Mulhorand's pharaohs and their families.

popup.title: River of Spears
popup.description: The river that irrigated the majority of the farms located in the nation of [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Sword Mountains
popup.description: The barrier in [[Mulhorand]] between the [[Plains of Purple Dust]] and the rest of the nation.

popup.title: Nezras
popup.description: A town inhabited by a group of [[wizard]]s descended from the mighty [[Nezram]] the World-Walker of [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Lonely Lake
popup.description: A small oasis found within the [[Plains of Purple Dust]] in [[east Faerûn]] and the [[Hordelands]].

popup.title: Fields of Ganath
popup.description: A patch of fertile land in [[Murghôm]] that bordered [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Castle Al'hanar
popup.description: A ruined fortress built during the time of the Kingdom of [[Eltabranar]], once the base of the [[Knights of the Eternal Dragon]], an order of [[Myrkul]].

popup.title: Buldamar
popup.description: A small village along the eastern shore of [[Azulduth]] formed around the ruins called the [[Vaults of Record]].

popup.title: Azun
popup.description: A small town along the western shore of [[Azulduth]] and a waystop for caravans traveling between the [[Council Hills]] to [[Durpar]] and the [[Shining Lands]].

popup.title: Hillgard
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Sharawood
popup.description: A haunted forest also knoen as the '''Drakewood''', located along the coast of the [[Gulf of Luiren]], overrun with monsters and [[undead]].

popup.title: Mulharahold
popup.description: A town in [[Mulhorand]] situated due east of [[Maerlar]] and the [[Great South Road]] near the border of [[Murghôm]] south of [[Murghyr]].

popup.title: The Road of the Dawn
popup.description: The road that connected the city of [[Skuld]] with [[Khalab]] on the shores of the [[Brightstar Lake]].

popup.title: Skuld
popup.description:
The '''City of Eternity''' - the capital of [[Mulhorand]]. Survivors of the [[Spellplague]] were rebuilding the nation in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Skuld|here]].

popup.title: Maerlar
popup.description: The city on the crossroads of the [[Great South Road]], [[Great East Road]], and the [[Road to the Dawn]] in north [[Mulhorand]]. The city's main duty was to maintain guards at the crossroads and protect incoming trade.

popup.title: Unthangol Mountains
popup.description: A range of mountains located in the [[Old Empires]] area of [[Faerûn]], between southern [[Unther ]]and the [[Eastern Shaar]].

popup.title: Jeradin
popup.description: A small town on the foothills of the [[Unthangol Mountains]] just south of the source of the [[River Angol]].

popup.title: Torsch
popup.description: A small trade town that did business with [[Chondath]], larger [[Vilhon Reach]], and from the [[Old Empires]].

popup.title: Hardcastle
popup.description: A small city strategically built at the crossroads of three major caravan routes.

popup.title: Fuirgar
popup.description: Or the '''Land of the Stone Giants''' – a small mountain range and surrounding lowland found in the [[Hordelands]] and [[east Faerûn]]. Not surprisingly, home to hundreds of [[stone giant]]s.

popup.title: Rolling Stone Gap
popup.description: A mountain pass between the northern section of the [[Giant's Belt Mountains]] and [[Fuirgar]].

popup.title: Grinning Skull Oasis
popup.description: The oasis, named because it was shielded from the harsh wind by the skull of a long-dead great [[dragon]].

popup.title: Plains of Purple Dust
popup.description: A windy desert located east of the [[Dragonsword Mountains]].

popup.title: Midwinter Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass in the southern region of the [[Giant's Belt Mountains]] that connected the plains of the [[Eastern Shaar]] and the [[Beastlands]] with the southwestern corner of [[Raurin]].

popup.title: Raurin
popup.description: The '''Dust Desert'' and the '''Desert of Desolation'', once the center of the ancient empire of [[Imaskar]].

popup.title: Giant's Belt Mountains
popup.description: THe mountains to the northeastern border of the [[Beastlands]] and [[Durpar]].

popup.title: River Sarren
popup.description: The river that originated in the [[Giant's Belt Mountains]] within [[Veldorn]], and flowed briefly south into [[Durpar]] before emptying into the [[Golden Water]].

popup.title: Landrise
popup.description: A large, sprawling cliff that speared through the middle of the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Great Rift
popup.description: A chasm and the traditional home of [[Faerûn]]'s [[gold dwarves]].

popup.title: Riftlake
popup.description: The large body of water in the middle of the [[Great Rift]], fed from the north by the [[River Shaar]] and from the south by the [[Rift River]].

popup.title: Brightfields
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Balaj
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Riftwood
popup.description: An isolated forest located about 50 miles (80.5 kilometers) east of the [[Great Rift]], home to a variety of animals and beasts, including [[snake]]s, [[panther]]s, and [[giant beetle]]s.

popup.title: Bloodlake
popup.description: A small lake south of the [[Sharawood]].

popup.title: Beland
popup.description: A town located in the far eastern stretches of the [[Eastern Shaar]] near the western foothills of the [[Giant's Belt Mountains]].

popup.title: Great Vale
popup.description: Also known as '''Asanibis''' – the breadbasket of the nation of [[Mulhorand]].

popup.title: Mystic Cornucopia
popup.description: The most significant temple of [[Isis]] in all of [[Mulhorand]], near the center of the [[Great Vale]], surrounded by a network of lush farms around where the tributaries of [[Mishtan]] and [[Klondor]] joined to form the [[River of Spears.]]

popup.title: Rift River
popup.description: The southern river that emptied into the [[Riftlake]].

popup.title: Eartheart
popup.description: The primary settlement of the [[gold dwarves]] in [[East Rift]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]] and their cultural and spiritual heart.

popup.title: Khôltar
popup.description: A small city on the edge of the [[Great Rift]] in south [[Faerûn]], known as the '''Iron City''' because of its high walls covered in [[iron]].

popup.title: Delthuntle
popup.description: THe commercial center and port in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Urbryur
popup.description: A gnome village in [[Altumbel]] – the primary exporter of chalk.

popup.title: Laothkund
popup.description: A city of 50,000 inhabitants.

popup.title: Escalant
popup.description: A prosperous coastal city situated on the mouth of the [[River Lapendrar]], that received trade from [[Chessenta]], [[Mulhorand]], [[Turmish]], and beyond.

popup.title: Thasselen
popup.description: An independent city located just south of the country of [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Bezantur
popup.description: The '''City of a Thousand Temples''' and the '''Citadel of Thieves''', a foreboding but prosperous port city located on the southern coast of the Thayan tharch of [[Priador]].

popup.title: River Thazarim
popup.description: The river that originated in the southwest region of the [[Sunrise Mountains]] in [[Thay]] and flowed west then southwest to empty into the [[Alamber Sea]].

popup.title: The High Valley
popup.description: A valley in the southern part of the [[Sunrise Mountains]], north of the [[Ganatheood]].

popup.title: Ganathwood
popup.description: A small forest found in the northern regions of [[Murghôm]], a minor source of wood for [[Mulhorand]], exporting it to [[Thay]].

popup.title: River Murghol
popup.description: A waterway found on the outskirts of [[Thay]] and the [[Great Amber Steppes]].

popup.title: Sultim
popup.description: A city and a major center of worship for [[Anhur]].

popup.title: Rauthil
popup.description: An important town due to it being the only place along the [[River Rauthenflow]] where a bridge was constructed, allowing for easy crossing.

popup.title: Murghyr
popup.description: The capital city of the country of [[Murghôm]].

popup.title: River Rauthenflow
popup.description: A waterway in northern [[Mulhorand]], known for possessing an exceptionally fast current.

popup.title: Songfarla
popup.description: An ancient and hidden [[rock gnome]] realm located in the eastern spur of the [[Sunrise Mountains]].

popup.title: Drubiev
popup.description: A town in the Great Amber Steppes of the Hordelands ruled by the [[Council of Five (Drubiev)|Council of Five]].

popup.title: Beacon Cairn
popup.description: The easternmost town of [[Rashemen]], and sat astride the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Dead Dwarf Bridge
popup.description: Or '''Clearflow Bridge''', a bridge near the [[Lake of Mists]] next to the small town of [[Drubiev]].

popup.title: Budennov
popup.description: A town on the southern shores of the [[Lake of Mists]].

popup.title: Strelsi
popup.description: A town on the southern shores of the [[Lake of Mists]].

popup.title: Antoumek
popup.description: A town on the southern shores of the [[Lake of Mists]].

popup.title: Clearflow River
popup.description: The river that flowed south from the [[Lake of Mists]] across the [[Great Amber Steppes]] until it connected with the [[River Murghol]].

popup.title: Almorel
popup.description: A cosmopolitan yet primarily [[human]] trade city on the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Hanging Place
popup.description: An open-aired section of [[Almorel]] on the [[Lake of Mists]].

popup.title: Breaker's Rocks
popup.description: A dangerous and infamous reef resting in the [[Lake of Mists]] at the mouth of the unnamed bay upon which the city of [[Almorel]] was founded.

popup.title: Nixie Deep
popup.description: A small region of the [[Lake of Mists]] offshore from [[Almorel], past the [[Breaker's Rocks]] in the eastern reaches of the [[Lake of Mists]].

popup.title: Lake of Mists
popup.description: The second largest freshwater lake in the [[Endless Waste]].

popup.title: Mountains of Copper
popup.description: A small mountain range that formed the northern border of [[Murghôm]], known for a large amount of [[copper]] ore found within.

popup.title: Ejen Horo
popup.description: The '''Valley of the God''', a lush garden-like lake-dotted valley that offered plentiful hunting as many animals were drawn to the bountiful vegetation.

popup.title: Ihandyl
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: River Ghaast
popup.description: A small river that began in the western region of the [[Shalhoond]] and was fed by many unnamed tributaries within the forest. It ran south for several hundred miles before reaching the northern banks of [[Gbor Nor]].

popup.title: Aerilpar Forest
popup.description: Or the '''Wood of Dark Trees''' a monster-infested forest rumored to have its trees animated by a foul [[wizard]].

popup.title: Liontongue River
popup.description: Also known as the '''River Pritan''' or the '''River Panka''', it stretched for several hundred miles along its path to the sea through [[Veldorn]], [[Estagund]], and a small part of [[Durpar]].

popup.title: Golden Water
popup.description: A bay located in the center of the [[Shining Lands]] and connected to the [[Great Sea]] through a narrow channel on its southern side.  The waters of this bay possessed a high mineral content, literally making them shine in the sunlight.

popup.title: Turelve
popup.description: A large city and a major launching point for caravans heading north or west out of [[Durpar]].

popup.title: Orpher
popup.description: A thriving coastal settlement ruled by the [[Trollslayer]]s [[chaka]].

popup.title: Sezilinta
popup.description: A large city in [[Durpar]] of 17,000 due to its proximity to the extensively-mined [[Giant's Belt Mountains]].

popup.title: Assur
popup.description: A small port city in [[Durpar]] that once was destroyed by [[giant]]s from the [[Beastlands]] but was rebuilt as a fortress city with a large garrison.

popup.title: Vaelan
popup.description: A huge city in [[Durpar]], made the nation's capital in [[1371 DR]].

popup.title: Ormpé
popup.description: A large coastal city that dealt in trade, fishery, and mining of the [[Curna Mountains]].

popup.title: Gust
popup.description: A small coastal town in southeastern [[Durpar]].

popup.title: Vathal
popup.description: A small island located on the [[Golden Water]] bay. It had no permanent settlements during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Mordyr
popup.description: A small island located on the [[Golden Water]] with no permanent settlements as of the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Kolapar
popup.description: A town in [[Estagund]] on the shores of the [[River Gundar]].

popup.title: Durgach
popup.description: A small coastal town along the small bay called [[the Throat]].

popup.title: Pyratar
popup.description: The capital of [[Var the Golden]].

popup.title: The Throat
popup.description: A small bay in northern [[Var]], a natural shelter for several notable towns, including Var's capital city [[Pyratar]].

popup.title: Curna Mountains
popup.description: The ''' Mountains of Wisdom''' that bordered [[Durpar]], [[Estagund]], [[Veldorn]], and [[Var the Golden]]. Famous of fabulous [[Curna emerald]]s and the [[Library of Curna]] –  a major center of worship for [[Curna]] within the [[Shining Lands]].

popup.title: Gundar Forest
popup.description: A small forest at the mouth of the [[River Gundar]].
popup.image: File:The Shining Lands - The Shining South 1993.jpg

popup.title: River Gundar
popup.description: A 200 miles (320,000 meters) long river in [[Estagund]].

popup.title: Old Vaelen
popup.description: A ruined former capital of the [[Beastlands]].

popup.title: Zabbasz
popup.description: A small town located in [[Estagund]],  directly southeast of [[Klionna]] and east of the [[Bay of Kings]].

popup.title: Bay of Kings
popup.description: The bay on the [[Great Sea]] that offered natural protection for the city of [[Klionna]], sheltering many of their warships and fishing boats from the fierce winter storms.

popup.title: Ulara
popup.description: A small town sat in the foothills of the eastern side of the [[Thrulaliel Mountains]] along the [[Great Trader's Way]].

popup.title: Lastarr
popup.description: An independent trading city

popup.title: River Madras
popup.description: A small waterway that flowed southeast from the [[Aerilpar Forest]] in [[Veldorn]] before joining the [[River Panka]] and heading due east to empty into the [[Golden Water]].

popup.title: Xiltor
popup.description: A small settlement ruled by a pair of beholder twins named [[Xaoch]] and [[Veoyh]].

popup.title: Chavyondat
popup.description: Previously known as '''Klionna''' – a port city and the capital of [[Estagund]].

popup.title: Naarlith
popup.description: A small group of islands located in the Great Sea, roughly 120 miles (190 km) south of the [[Shining Lands]].

popup.title: White Rocks
popup.description: A single island in the [[Great Sea]], roughly 250 miles off the coast, south of the town of [[Zabbasz]].

popup.title: Thruldar
popup.description: The most westerly outpost of Estagund, once a thriving town of 9,000, was ruined and destroyed by a [[druid]] named [[Voolad]] and his army of [[dark trees]].

popup.title: Toadsquat Mountains
popup.description: Or the '''Little Mountains''', was an [[ogre]]-infested mountain range on the northern border of [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Lluirwood
popup.description: Also known as the '''Long Fores'''. It spanned 300 miles (480 km) east to west across [[Luiren]] and was roughly 90 miles (145 km) wide.

popup.title: Fasruil
popup.description: The northernmost city in [[Luiren]], famous for the tasty red [[rhubarb]] that was traded across all of Luiren and other countries of the [[Shining South]].

popup.title: Djannath
popup.description: Also known as '''Otennath''' or '''Ojannath''', a small town along the coast of [[Hambone Bay]].

popup.title: Lluirvale
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Crimel
popup.description: A small town of a thousand inhabitants that dealt in logging of the [[Long Forest]], supervised by clergy of [[Yondalla]].

popup.title: Isle of Quelthiir
popup.description: Or '''Passion Island''', was a 100-mile-long and 10-miles-wide large sandbar, with low hills and sea grass with only the occasional stunted tree.

popup.title: Luirenstrand
popup.description: Better known as the '''Hambone Bay''', a bay and coastline in the [[Great Sea]] that formed one of the borders of [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Hornhollow
popup.description: A humble logging village that once was visited by a senile [[red dragon]] [[Craum Straug]], consumed by a flame producing coughing fit.{{approx}}

popup.title: Shoun
popup.description: A [[halfling]] settlement sported a host of bakeries, eventually giving rise to the phrase "fat as a Shounite" throughout [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Beluir
popup.description: The largest city (usually considered the capital) of the [[halfling]] realm of [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Chethel
popup.description: A coastal trading and shipbuilding city in the [[halfling]] realm of [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Krenadir
popup.description: Also seen as '''Krenalir''', a coastal city in the [[halfling]] realm of [[Luiren]].

popup.title: Mortik Swamp
popup.description: Also spelled '''Mortick Swamp''', inhabited by monsters, namely [[merrow]] and [[scrag]]s, which often raided nearby lands.

popup.title: Delzimmer
popup.description: A trade city in southeast Faerûn.

popup.title: Hazuth
popup.description: A city in [[Dambrath]], home to 20,000 people of various races that sold [[horse]]s as far as [[Westgate]] and [[Chondath]].

popup.title: Southern Lluirwood
popup.description: Or the '''Granuin Forest''', a mostly untamed wood, although the eastern border was patrolled by militia and [[halfling]] [[ranger]]s and [[druid]]s.

popup.title: River Tamthew
popup.description: Also known as the '''Lluirflow''', a small, approximately 100 miles (160 kilometers), river found in southern [[Luiren]] in the [[Shining South]].

popup.title: Ammathtar
popup.description: A city located in northeastern [[Dambrath]], home of the nation's largest [[horse]] pens.

popup.title: River Ammath
popup.description: The river that flowed along the eastern edge of the [[Gnollwatch Mountains]] and north across the [[Hills of the Dead Kings]] before emptying into the [[Melanith Bay]] near [[Hazuth]].

popup.title: Melanith Bay
popup.description: The bay named for Queen [[Melanith]], who ruled [[Dambrath]] during the 11{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: North Post
popup.description: A settlement of note on the [[Beastburn Lake]].

popup.title: Beastburn Lake
popup.description: A small body of water found in northern [[Dambrath]], where the [[River Ammath]] began its flow.

popup.title: Elveswatch
popup.description: A small city located in the [[Forests of Amtar]] in [[Dambrath]], famed for its production of [[bluewood]].

popup.title: River Caraguir
popup.description: The river that originated in the [[Gnollwatch Mountains]], flowed south across [[Dambrath]] before emptying into the [[Bay of Dancing Dolphins]].

popup.title: Luenath
popup.description: The second-largest city in [[Dambrath]], a favorite location for wealthy [[crinti]].

popup.title: Rialuil Plain
popup.description: Also known as the '''Rialuil Range''', it was an open grassland located in the nation of [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Three Swords
popup.description: A fortified town on the [[Trader's Way]] between [[Channathgate]] and [[Eartheart]] where the road scaled the [[Landrise]].

popup.title: Shield of the Rathgaunt Hills
popup.description: Also known as the '''Rathguant Mote''' during the [[Spellplague]] years, a  [[gnomish]] abbey dedicated to [[Gaerdal Ironhand]].

popup.title: Mount Hazail
popup.description: The highest peak of the [[Gnollwatch Mountains]], with the elevation of 11,500 ft. (3,500 m).

popup.title: Gnollwatch Mountains
popup.description: A medium-small mountain range that ran east to west through [[Dambrath]] for approximately 700 miles and eventually declined and became the [[Hills of the Dead Kings]] in the east. The slopes of the mountains were covered in  [[shadowtop]]s, [[suthwood]], and [[pine]] [[tree]]s.

popup.title: Dolphin's Climb
popup.description: The river that flowed from the southwestern range of the [[Gnollwatch Mountains]], past the city of [[Herath]], and into the [[Bay of Dancing Dolphins]].

popup.title: Herath
popup.description: The city that stood on the shores of the [[Dolphin's Climb]] river, where it merged with the [[River Dambron]]. It was [[Dambrath]]'s major source of mints for [[electrum]] and [[silver]] [[coins]].

popup.title: River Dambron
popup.description: A river that split and merged with the [[Dolphin's Climb]].

popup.title: Forest of Amtar
popup.description: A lush forest of heat and humidity, majority of which trees were [[suthwood]]. The dangerous woods were filled with [[choke creepers]], [[assassin vines]], [[roper]]s, and [[giant rhinoceros beetle]]s among other creatures.

popup.title: Prastuil
popup.description: The oldest and the most beautiful city in [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Swagdar
popup.description: The '''Outlaw Waste''', a large stretch of rolling grasslands located just northwest of [[Dambrath]] inhabited by several thousand bandits.

popup.title: Hills of the Dead Kings
popup.description: A hilly grassy region with occasional patches of [[pine]]s and [[shadowtop]]s in central [[Dambrath]], connected to the [[Gnollwatch Mountains]].

popup.title: Gate of the Iron Fangs
popup.description: A mysterious ruined city in the southwestern tip of the [[Forest of Amtar]], named after its two towers that flanked the rest of its ancient gates.

popup.title: Far Outpost
popup.description: A large [[Dambrai]] village and trading hub on the [[Hethar Penninsula]] that held a garrison of 500 cavalry and 20 warships.

popup.title: Darmesh
popup.description: A small town located on the [[Hethar Peninsula]], southeast of the town of [[Hethar]].

popup.title: Hethar
popup.description: A city in [[Dambrath]], a prime position to defend the southern portion of Dambrath from attack, with its smiths fully dedicated to field artillery.

popup.title: Hethar Peninsula
popup.description: A stretch of land located in southern [[Dambrath]] between the [[Great Sea]] to the south and the [[Bay of Dancing Dolphins]].

popup.title: Ramparts of Dambrath
popup.description: A series of fortified locations along the sharp cliffs of the [[Hethar Peninsula]] in southern [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Bay of Dancing Dolphins
popup.description: A large bay in [[Dambrath]], over 300 miles long, named after the pods of [[dolphin]]s that would elaborately play in a coordinated dance every day at dusk.

popup.title: Cathyr
popup.description: The metropolis capital city of [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Maarlith
popup.description: A small town in central [[Dambrath]] that laid at the end of the [[Trader's Road]].

popup.title: Conaluil Range
popup.description: A strip of land located in central [[Dambrath]], home of ranchos located in the northern hills.

popup.title: Coast of Pearls
popup.description: The coastal range west of the [[Kethid]] swamp and south of the [[Conaluil Plain]].

popup.title: Guilmarl
popup.description: A series of ruins, formerly a large city, located in southern [[Dambrath]].

popup.title: Great Swamp of Rethild
popup.description: Also known as the '''Great Swamp''' or ''Rethild'' and ''Kethid,''' a swamp in [[Dambrath]] filled with dangerous creatures and diseases like [[cackle fever]] and [[mindfire]].

popup.title: Ilimar
popup.description: A long-ruined [[sarrukh]] city from the time of the empires of [[Isstosseffifil]] and [[Mhairshaulk]].

popup.title: Westwatch
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Firesteap Pass
popup.description: The portion of the [[Golden Road]] thet crossed the [[Firesteap Mountains]].

popup.title: Duskwood
popup.description: The deepest and most untamed forest in the [[Border Kingdoms]] between the [[Realm of the Smoking Star]] and the [[Realm of the Ready Sword]].

popup.title: Firesteap Mountains
popup.description: The mountain range that stretched from the edge of the [[Lake of Steam]] to the forest of [[Chondalwood]], then went on to the northern border of the [[Shaar]] and into the lands beyond.

popup.title: Shaarwood
popup.description: A small forest found in the western [[Shaar]].

popup.title: River Shaar
popup.description: The river that originated from the [[Riftlake]] in [[Underhome]], flowed west through the [[Landrise]], eventually filling [[Lake Lhespen]] before turning south and joining the [[River Talar]] near the [[Misty Vale]].

popup.title: Shaarmid
popup.description: A small town located on the plains of the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Kormul
popup.description: A village that grew to be the '''City of Cults''' in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Rethmar
popup.description: A settlement of note in the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Channathgate
popup.description: A settlement of note in the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Channathwood
popup.description: A small forest found in the southern [[Shaar]].

popup.title: River Channath
popup.description: A waterway found in the southern [[Shaar]] near the border of [[Lapaliiya]].

popup.title: Rathgaunt
popup.description: A rocky outcropping located along the southern edge of the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Lake Lhespen
popup.description: A medium-sized lake found amid the sprawling plains of the [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Lhespenbog
popup.description: A small wetland of sprawling [[reed]]-fields used in creation of the [[enchanted]] [[staves]] – ''[[Aiedo wither-stick]]s''.

popup.title: Lhesper
popup.description: A ruined town by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], inhabited only by the [[Coiled Cabal]] who were searching for the [[Emeralds of Merrshaulk]].

popup.title: Sebben
popup.description: A settlement of note that once stood on the [[Dunsel Trail]].

popup.title: Wyrmbones
popup.description: A mountain range of note.

popup.title: Blaskaltar
popup.description: A ruined settlement by the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]], home to the [[First Shrine of the Queen of Air]], the first known shrine dedicated to [[Akadi]].

popup.title: River Talar
popup.description: A river in the [[Shaar]] and [[Lapaliiya]] that emptied into the [[Talar Bay]] and the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Talar Bay
popup.description: The bay in the [[Shining Sea]] on which the city of [[Sheirtalar]] was built.

popup.title: Misty Vale
popup.description: A hot, dense jungle east of the [[Dun Hills]] and north of the [[Bandit Wastes]], home to predatory horrors descended from [[Ilythiiri]] [[sorcerer]]s' castoff experiments.

popup.title: Dun Hills
popup.description: A hill range between [[Lapaliiya]] and the [[Shaar]], part of the [[Channath Vale]].

popup.title: Cliffs of Talar
popup.description: The cliffs towering above the [[River Talar]] where it crossed the [[Misty Vale]].

popup.title: Bandit Wastes
popup.description: An expanse of barrens or badlands between [[Lapaliiya]] and [[Halruaa]], home to monsters, among them were [[giant ants]], which dug a warren of tunnels beneath the barrens.

popup.title: Shaareach
popup.description: A small plain found in the western [[Shaar]].

popup.title: Shaareach Forest
popup.description: A small forest found in the southern [[Shaar]] near the plains of the [[Shaareach]].

popup.title: Mhair Jungles
popup.description: A prominent jungle forest found in southern [[Tashalar]] on the [[Chultan Peninsula]].

popup.title: Uzurr
popup.description: Or the '''City of Toiling Monks''', a member of the [[Lapal League]] and one of the [[Cities of the Seabreeze]]. It was devoted to [[Ilmater]], the Crying God.

popup.title: Assundath
popup.description: A small town located in the nation of [[Halruaa]], on the eastern side of the [[Bay of Azuth]] where it met the [[Great Sea]].

popup.title: Bay of Azuth
popup.description: A bay located in southeast [[Halruaa]] along the [[Great Sea]] with its calm sheltered waters easily fished by locals.

popup.title: Zhal
popup.description: A small town in the southern region of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Maerzalar
popup.description: A small town in eastern [[Halruaa]] within the southern region of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Muaraghal Mountains
popup.description: The '''East Wall''' mountains, also known as the '''Muaraghal Mountains''',  a range of mountains that formed the eastern border of [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Azhal Pass
popup.description: A naturally occurring pass through the [[Muaraghal Mountains]] where the town of [[Zhal]] was built.

popup.title: Maeruhal
popup.description: A city located in eastern [[Halruaa]] famed for its [[electrum]] mines and its five ''[[skyship]]''s permanently docked there.

popup.title: Achelar
popup.description: A small town in the northeast [[Halruaa]] among the western foothills of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Nath
popup.description: A large basin used by [[Halruaan]]s to herd livestock at the junction of the [[Nathaghal Mountains]] and [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Edouura
popup.description: A small town in north-central [[Haluraa]] that sat along the east bank of the [[River Aluar]].

popup.title: Salhantar
popup.description: A small town in central [[Halruaa]] on the eastern shore of the [[River Aluar]], north of [[Aluarim]].

popup.title: Aluarim
popup.description: A city located in the center of [[Halruaa]], where [[electrum]] was minted into coinage called [[skie]] in the Halruaan [[Royal Mint]].

popup.title: Nishtul
popup.description: A small town in central [[Halruaa]] on the eastern shore of the [[River Aluar]], where it emptied into [[Lake Halruaa]].

popup.title: Sulaziir
popup.description: A small town in central [[Halruaa]] along the eastern shore of [[Lake Halruaa]] and the north bank of the [[River Maeru]].

popup.title: Elchul
popup.description: A small farming village, the site of the [[Astral Inn]].

popup.title: Mithtar
popup.description: A small town in eastern [[Halruaa]], just west of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Lhaddas
popup.description: A small town in eastern [[Halruaa]] along the south bank of the [[River Maeru]].

popup.title: Lake Maeru
popup.description: A small body of water found in eastern [[Halruaa]] at the foot of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: River Maeru
popup.description: A waterway found in eastern [[Halruaa]] that flowed for approximately 200 miles (320,000 meters) before reaching the southeastern rim of [[Lake Halruaa]].

popup.title: Thunderhoof Pass‎
popup.description: A once important trade way through the [[Sword Mountains]] taken over by the [[Many-Arrows]] [[orc]]s in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], and recaptured by [[Neverwinter]]-sanctioned adventurers.

popup.title: Ash Ridge
popup.description: A dangerous mountain ridge, part of the [[Thunderhoof Pass‎]] that led towards the [[Old Owl Well]].

popup.title: Galdel
popup.description: A quiet city in central [[Halruaa]] known for its electrum master smiths.

popup.title: Zalazuu
popup.description: A city of rich green gardens and villas, located in southeast [[Halruaa]] nestled in the [[Bay of Azuth]].

popup.title: Mithel
popup.description: A small town and a favored docking spot for [[Durpar]]ian merchant ships.

popup.title: Letharr
popup.description: A small coastal settlement on the coast of the [[Great Sea]].

popup.title: Githim
popup.description: A small coastal town of note in [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Lake Halruaa
popup.description: The lake that dominated the center of the [[Halruaa]]n landscape, filled by the Rivers Halar, Maeru, and Aluar.

popup.title: River Aluar
popup.description: The river that originated around [[Mount Alue]] in the [[Nathaghal Mountains]], flowed south, meeting the [[High Aluar]] near the towns of [[Eru]] and [[Orhamphal]], before emptying into [[Lake Halruaa]] several hundred miles to the south.

popup.title: Mount Alue
popup.description: The dominant peak found in the [[Nathaghal Mountains]] in [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Nathaghal Mountains
popup.description: Also known as the [[North Wall]]. It formed [[Halruaa]]'s northern border and was home to dangerous creatures such as [[cyclopskin]], [[manticore]]s, [[roc]]s, [[cockatrice]]s, and [[medusa]]e.

popup.title: High Aluar
popup.description: A waterway that originated in the [[Lhairghal Mountains]], flowing southeast where it merged with the [[River Aluar]].

popup.title: Eru
popup.description: A small town that laid along the western banks of the [[River Aluar]], where it was joined by the [[High Aluar]].

popup.title: Orhamphal
popup.description: A small town on the eastern bank of the [[River Aluar]] where it was joined by the [[High Aluar]].

popup.title: Talathgard
popup.description: A fortress located in northwest [[Halruaa]] that guarded the entrance to the [[High Temple of Mystra]] deep underneath [[Mount Talath]].

popup.title: Mount Talath
popup.description: One of the tallest mountains in the western half of the [[Nathaghal]] range of [[Halruaa]] and the site of the [[High Temple of Mystra]].

popup.title: Talath Pass
popup.description: A naturally occurring rugged pass through the [[Lhairghal Mountains]] bordering western [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Alathil
popup.description: A small town that sat along the north bank of the [[High Aluar]] river near its midpoint.

popup.title: Lath
popup.description: A small town in central [[Halruaa]] just north of the banks of the [[River Halar]] and [[Lake Halruaa]].

popup.title: Halabar
popup.description: A small town located in central [[Halruaa]], due west of the [[River Aluar]].

popup.title: Zzuntal
popup.description: A small town located in the nation of [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Mairb
popup.description: A small town that laid in the shadow of [[Mount Talath]] and the [[Nathaghal Mountains]] southwest of the [[High Aluar]] river.

popup.title: Halar Hills
popup.description: The region that sat at the base of the [[Lhairghal Mountains]]' eastern slope just north of the [[Swamp of Akhluar]].

popup.title: Thilzoun
popup.description: A small town in the east banks of a northern tributary of the [[River Halar]] in the foothills of the [[Nathaghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Ssorsil
popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: Thom
popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: River Halar
popup.description: A river that originated from three unnamed tributaries flowing down from the [[Lhairghal Mountains]], joining within the [[Halar Hills]] to form the larger body of the main river, then flowed southeast through the hills and emptied into [[Lake Halruaa]] after traveling for several hundred miles.

popup.title: Halarahh
popup.description: A busy port city of majestic buildings and plazas – the capital of the wizard nation of [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: Bay of Taertal
popup.description: A bay that offered natural shelter to its numerous settlements and abundant population of [[date palm]]s used in the construction of ''[[Halruaan skyships]]''.

popup.title: Kilmaruu Swamp
popup.description: A stretch of [[undead]]-infested swamp and marshland where a ruined city stood. The swamp was the topic of the infamous [[Halruaa]]n strategic ''[[Kilmaruu Paradox]]''.

popup.title: Floodblest
popup.description: A small farming village and a caravan stop along the southern bank of the [[Neverwinter River]].

popup.title: Zoundar
popup.description: A town at the base of the [[Lhairghal Peaks]] that traded in [[electrum]] mining.

popup.title: Lhairghal Mountains
popup.description: Also known as '''the West Wall''', were a range of mountains that formed the western border of [[Halruaa]].

popup.title: River Ghalagar
popup.description: A 200-mile waterway that originated in the [[Lhairghal Mountains]], bisected the [[Akhlaur Swamp]] before ultimately reaching [[Lake Halruaa]].

popup.title: Swamp of Akhlaur
popup.description: Also known as the '''Swamp of Ghalagar''', was a magically created swamp from a ''[[gate]]'' to the [[Elemental Plane of Water]], closed permanently in [[1373 DR]].

popup.title: Lhair
popup.description: A small town where the [[House of the High One Ascendant]], a temple of [[Azuth]], was located.

popup.title: Nuulatha
popup.description: A small coastal town on the western side of the [[Bay of Taertal]].

popup.title: Khaerbaal
popup.description: The coastal city that was one of two bases for [[Halruaa]]'s navy, housing 50 ships, and 20 skyships, with most of its population working in the trade and shipping industries.

popup.title: Maezoun
popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.title: Halazé
popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.title: Kithyym
popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.title: Halagard
popup.description: The capital city of [[Halruaa]] up until the mid-1200's [[DR]].

popup.title: Halagard Channel
popup.description: The waterway that connected [[Lake Halruaa]] with the [[Great Sea]].

popup.title: Alu
popup.description: A coastal town of note.

popup.title: Orbedal
popup.description: A small town in the western foothills of the [[Muaraghal Mountains]].

popup.title: Mhairhetel
popup.description: The '''City of Renegades''' of the [[Serpentes]] nation of the [[Mhair Jungles]], populated by [[human]]s and [[yuan-ti]] alike.

popup.title: House Jordain
popup.description: The academy complex for the [[Jordain vizier]]s of [[Halruaa]] that only formally answered to the [[Netyarch]].

popup.title: Bay of Halruaa
popup.description: The bay that opened up the central portion of southern [[Halruaa]] to the [[Great Sea]] and connected with the [[Halagard Channel]].

popup.title: Bathmé
popup.description: A small town in the [[Halar Hills]], on the north bank of the [[River Halar]].

popup.title: Borah
popup.description: A small town on the edge of the [[Akhlaur Swamp]].

popup.title: Mount Talath
popup.description: A small town near the summit of the [[Mount Talath]] – a collection of homes for the staff and [[priest]]s who worked within the [[High Temple of Mystra]].

popup.title: Theymarsh
popup.description: A port town on the [[Lake of Steam]], famed for its delicate blown and worked glass – notably bird figurines, and fine dark [[lager]].

popup.title: Neth Stand
popup.description: A dark, thick forest on the [[Lake of Steam]] that contained underground volcanic vents that emitted sulfurous mists.

popup.title: Yallasch
popup.description: A city in the [[Border Kingdoms]] near its trade partner – the realm of [[Adaerglast]].

popup.title: Talagath's Gauntlet
popup.description: Also known as the '''Straits of Suldophur''' or the '''Strait of Storms''' – a small strait that connected the [[Lake of Steam]] and the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Talagath
popup.description: A small heavily forested island at the center of the strait known as [[Talagath's Gauntlet]].

popup.title: Ormpur
popup.description: An independent city-state also known as '''the City of Saffron'''.

popup.title: Sheirtalar
popup.description: The capital of [[Lapaliiya]] also known as the '''Shining City by the Sea'''.

popup.title: Sheirlantar
popup.description: The''' Tomb City''' of [[Lapaliiya]] on the  [[Lapal Way]] by the [[River Talar]], dedicated to the worship of the gods of the dead.

popup.title: Lapal Way
popup.description: The road that ran through [[Lapaliiya]] from the [[River Talar]] to [[Sammaresh]].

popup.title: Mouth of Istishia
popup.description: A natural arch used as a bridge across the [[River Talar]], along the [[Lapal Way]].

popup.title: Lushpool
popup.description: The '''City of Shimmering Pools''' of [[Lapaliiya]], by the mouth of [[Talar Bay]] of the [[Ithmong Peninsula]].

popup.title: Ithmong
popup.description: The '''Stormwracked City''' in [[Lapaliiya]] that stood atop a 50-foot high cliff.

popup.title: Lapalgard
popup.description: A large town in [[Lapaliiya]] based around the ancient stronghold known as the [[Fortress of Lapalgard]].

popup.title: Mierskar
popup.description: A small farming town vassal of [[Lushpool]].

popup.title: Dungar
popup.description: A small farming town in [[Lapaliiya]] that produced [[olive]]s and [[wine]].

popup.title: Ilyaport
popup.description: A port town and later a fishing village.

popup.title: Zashuma
popup.description: A small town mostly populated by [[rock gnome]]s that traded in [[olive]]s and [[wine]].

popup.title: Lhazantal
popup.description: The '''City of Smiths''', a small town that thrived in metalworking industries.

popup.title: Abreon
popup.description: A large town in [[Lapaliiya]] amidst low rolling hills, vineyards, and [[olive]] groves.

popup.title: Malaxer
popup.description: A large town in [[Lapaliiya]] with a population including a small number of [[wild dwarves]].

popup.title: Sammaresh
popup.description: The '''City of Dancing Dolphins''', famed for its [[emerald oyster]]s and [[pearl]]s that traded with nearby [[aquatic elves]].

popup.title: Dolphingulf
popup.description: A bay in the [[Chultan Peninsula]] between the realms of [[Lapaliiya]] and the [[Tashalar]] known for its abundant pods of [[dolphin]]s.

popup.title: Delphin Mountains
popup.description: A small mountain range found in northern [[Tashalar]]

popup.title: Procalith
popup.description: A ruined city of the [[Shoon Imperium]] that stood at the base of the [[Delphin Mountains]] overlooking the [[Dolphingulf]].

popup.title: Black Jungles
popup.description: A heavily forested region of southern [[Tashalar]].

popup.title: Tashan Gap
popup.description: A rather wide mountain pass found in northern [[Tashalar]] measured nearly 80 miles.

popup.title: River Amarast
popup.description: The river that began in the [[Delphin Mountains]] and flowed southeast for approximately 100 miles before emptying into the [[Lapal Sea]].

popup.title: Lapal Sea
popup.description: A prominent freshwater lake at the heart of the [[Chultan Peninsula]], connected with the [[Great Sea]] at the [[Lapalgulph]].

popup.title: River Scelptar
popup.description: A 300-mile-long river in the northeast of the [[Border Kingdoms]] with its mouth called the [[Scelptarmouth]].

popup.title: Scelptarmouth
popup.description: The mouth of the [[River Scelptar]].

popup.title: River Rith
popup.description: A river that flowed south from the northwest of the [[Border Kingdoms]] near the village of [[Arnglar]] to join the [[River Scelptar]].

popup.title: Pit of Vipers
popup.description: A sprawling stronghold and temple dedicated to [[Sseth]], the World Serpent, near the northwestern shore of the [[Lapal Sea]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Dolsel Gap
popup.description: A heavily patrolled mountain pass along the southern region of the [[Hazur Mountains]].

popup.title: Lapalgulph
popup.description: A natural bay connected to the [[Lapal Sea]] via the [[River Lapar]], guarded by a monstrous [[dragon turtle]] paid by the [[yuan-ti]] of [[House Jennestas]].

popup.title: River Lapar
popup.description: A 100-mile river on the southern end of the [[Lapal Sea]], patrolled by the [[yuan-ti]] from [[House Jennestas]].

popup.title: River Chun
popup.description: The river that originated near the heart of the [[Black Jungles]], flowed south for 100 miles before emptying into the [[Great Sea]].

popup.title: Tashluta
popup.description: The '''City of Slithering Vines''' – the capital city of [[Tashalar]], constructed within and atop a volcanic crater that opened up into the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Hazur Mountains
popup.description: A small mountain range that served as the border between [[Tashalar]] and [[Thindol]].

popup.title: River Dolsel
popup.description: The heart of trade in the region, the river in the [[Guthland]] that started in the [[Dolsel Gap]] and drained into the [[Thingulph]].

popup.title: Tashalar Basin
popup.description: A fertile stretch of land north of the [[Hazur Mountains]].

popup.title: Stormwall
popup.description: The narrow islet that extended out from the sea at the edge of the harbor, shielding the bay of [[Tashluta]] from storms coming landward from the sea.

popup.title: Thingulph
popup.description: A part of the [[Guthland]], the wide "mouth" of the large bay that dominated the center of [[Thindol]].

popup.title: Guth Mountains
popup.description: A small mountain range in the southeast corner of [[Thindol]], home to colonies of dangerous [[blood ape]]s.

popup.title: River Guth
popup.description: A river that originated in the [[Hazur Mountains]] in northeast [[Thindol]] with numerous bridges constructed across its treacherous shores and a cart road along the river's northern banks carved by [[gold dwarves]].

popup.title: Ormpur Bay
popup.description: The bay on which the city of [[Ormpur]] was built.

popup.title: Shipwreck Neck
popup.description: The eastern neck of the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Raging Reef
popup.description: A reef in the [[Lake of Steam]] between the cities of [[Derlusk]] and [[Yhep]].

popup.title: Derlusk
popup.description: A city of music that grew up around one of the busiest harbors in the [[Border Kingdoms]] southeast of the [[Dragonsmoke Ridge]].

popup.title: Yhep
popup.description: A fortified town located on the northerncoast of the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: The Lake Way
popup.description: The road that hugged the northeastern shore of the [[Lake of Steam]], stretching from the city of [[Ankhapur]] to the city of [[Innarlith]].

popup.title: Ankhwood
popup.description: A forest whose insect, animal, and plant populations mutated by ''[[wild magic]]'' and ''[[dead magic]]'' areas orbiting one another.

popup.title: River Ankhapur
popup.description: A small waterway that originated near the center of the [[Ankhwood]] and flowed southwest and west for 200 miles.

popup.title: The Ankh Road
popup.description: The road that connected the city of [[Ankhapur]] to the west and the town of [[Nagarr]] to the east.

popup.title: Dalelost
popup.description: A ruined city lying in the [[Land of the Lions]] near the [[Lake of Steam]], once a competitor of [[Yhep]] for much of the local [[pearl]] trade.

popup.title: Winterwood
popup.description: A [[pine]] and [[oak]]-filled woodland inhabited by [[orc]]s, [[green dragon]]s, and [[green elves]].

popup.title: Ruins of Tathtar
popup.description: A small ruined kingdom that once held lands in the [[Deepwing Mountains]], [[Cloven Mountains]], and the [[High Peaks]], home of bandits and countless monsters as early as the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Thornwash
popup.description: A 150 mi (240 km)-long waterway that flowed down from the [[Cloven Mountains]] and emptied into the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Ankhapur
popup.description: A metropolis that thrived on [[pearl]] industry.

popup.title: Coast Road
popup.description: A road that stretched along the [[Lake of Steam]]'s north-western shore from [[Ankhapur]] to [[Mintar]].

popup.title: Corsairs' Enclave
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Lake of Steam
popup.description: Also known as the '''Arnaden''', an inland sea connected to the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Arnrock
popup.description: An active volcano and the largest island in the [[Lake of Steam]], once – home to a population of [[strongheart]] [[halfling]]s who collectively called themselves the [[Arn]].

popup.title: Themasulter
popup.description: A coastal settlement of note.

popup.title: Thornwood
popup.description: The forest to the north of the city of [[Ankhapur]], known for its deadly flora - [[thornslinger]]s, [[choke creeper]]s, [[retch plant]]s, [[yellow musk creeper]]s, and many more dangerous and more intelligent plants.

popup.title: Saelmur
popup.description: A city on the [[Lake of Steam]], responsible for supplying the construction of the canal between the Lake of Steam and the [[Nagaflow]] with migrant workers in the mid-1360s [[DR]].

popup.title: Mintar
popup.description: A large city conquered by the [[Church of Bane]] in [[1362 DR]].

popup.title: Kzelter
popup.description: A farm town that once belonged to [[House Tethyr]], later conquered by [[Mintar]] in [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: Darkhope's Road
popup.description: The road connecting the farm town of [[Kzelter]] and the city of [[Mintar]].

popup.title: River Mintar
popup.description: A small waterway that originated within the western region of the [[Thornwood]], flowed south and west for 200 miles (320 kilometers), before emptying into the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Suldophor
popup.description: A port town on the [[Lake of Steam]] situated across [[Talagath's Gauntlet]] from [[Theymarsh]].

popup.title: Tulmon
popup.description: A stone metropolis ruled by [[sorcerer]] [[Arkanuirr Tchallem]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Yeshpek
popup.description: A large fortified city – a major center of the fishing trade, chain, and lock-making.

popup.title: Bezrim Bay
popup.description: A small inlet wedged between the [[Narrows Trail]] to the west with the island of [[Felmer's Keep]] and a small peninsula from the mainland in the east.

popup.title: Narrows Trail
popup.description: A small trail found along the eastern slopes of the [[Alimir Mountains]] near the [[Lake of Steam]], between [[Tulmon]] and the northernmost end of the mountains on [[Darkhope's Road]].

popup.title: Selpt
popup.description: A town of note located on the northern side of the [[Scelptarmouth]].

popup.title: Thur
popup.description: A town of note on the shores of the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Torich
popup.description: A city of modest size in the [[Sanrach Mountains]], known for exporting high quality [[salt]].

popup.title: Qurth Forest
popup.description: A wild forest that bordered the forest with the [[Barony of the Great Oak]], surrounded by many towns and ruins.

popup.title: Jundarwood
popup.description: A forest of note in the [[Border Kingdoms]].

popup.title: Felmer's Keep
popup.description: An island of note in the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Dragon Turtle Trail
popup.description: The trail that connected the city of [[Tulmon]] in the north and  town of [[Suldophor]] in the south on [[Talagath's Gauntlet]].

popup.title: Echoing Canyons of Kush
popup.description: Canyons in the southern part of the [[Alimir Mountains]] through which passed a road that began in the city of [[Tulmon]].

popup.title: Maridflow
popup.description: A river in eastern [[Calimshan]], named after the the [[marid]]s [[Haj]] and [[Luar]].

popup.title: Azure Falls
popup.description: Waterfalled on [[Mount Ulaarn]] that birthed the [[Maridflow]] river, created in [[−7687 DR]] during the [[Steam Clashes]].

popup.title: Mount Ulaarn
popup.description: A major peak in the central [[Alimir Mountains]], famous for being the site of the [[Azure Falls]].

popup.title: Mount Phevos
popup.description: The tallest peak in the [[Alimir Mountains]] with its west-facing cliffs' carvings known as the [[Eye Tyrant Cliffs]].

popup.title: Mount Kahdas
popup.description: The second tallest peak in the [[Alimir Mountains]], famous for the second half of the [[Eye Tyrant Cliffs]].

popup.title: Olodel
popup.description: An island, once a private hunting preserve for some eccentric, self-made [[Calishite]] merchants.

popup.title: Narruth
popup.description: The southwestern island sister of [[Olodel]].

popup.title: Allyn's Anvil
popup.description: An ancient stone circle situated high in the northern [[Alimir Mountains]].

popup.title: St. Wityn's Hospice
popup.description: A hospice of note, high in the [[Alimir Mountains]].

popup.title: Pevadaas Trail
popup.description: A small trail across the [[Alimir Mountains]] that branched from the [[Narrows Trail]].

popup.title: Monastery of St. Fanal
popup.description: A monastery, school, and library dedicated to [[Ilmater]] that stood on the northern side of the [[Pevadaas Trail]].

popup.title: Almraiven
popup.description: A port city that hosted [[Calimshan]]'s largest shipbuilding facility and the regional center for magical studies.

popup.title: Ajhuutal
popup.description: Ruins of a city flooded and destroyed during the [[Steam Clashes]] in [[−7687 DR]].

popup.title: Wreck of the Pasha's Palace
popup.description: Drowned ruins of Ajhuutal Pasha's Palace.

popup.title: The Dancing Dwarves
popup.description: A landmark in [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Seminary of St. Ihrvyn
popup.description: An affluent, religious art school in [[Calimshan]] operated by the [[Church of Ilmater]].

popup.title: Volothamp
popup.description: The Gem City of Calimshan, built upon the side of a cliff overlooking the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Tyrant's Road
popup.description: The stretch of the [[Coast Road (Lake of Steam)|Coast Road]] between [[Saelmur]] and ending just past [[Mintar]].

popup.title: High Peaks
popup.description: The western spur of the [[Cloven Mountains]].

popup.title: Plains of Pehrrifaal
popup.description: Plains on the southern edge of [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Five Spears Hold
popup.description: A mining town west of the [[Cloven Mountains]] on the southern borders of [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Praskallest
popup.description: Once the estate manor of Baron [[Laxaella Bronshield]], later a garrison that protected the borders of the barony and [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Tibold
popup.description:
A mining town in the [[Kuldin Peaks]] east of the [[Swimstar Creek]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Omlarandin Mountains
