popup.description: A mountain range in [[Tethyr]], richn in [[omlar]] [[gems]].

popup.title: Saradush
popup.description: Once a great bureaucratic center of [[Tethyr]], later a busy waystation for trade in the area surrounding the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Barakmordin
popup.description: An abbey in [[Tethyr]] dedicated to the Triad: [[Torm]], [[Ilmater]], and [[Tyr]].

popup.title: Ithal Pass
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Pass Ride
popup.description: Also known as '''Tyr's Road''', the road that branched from the [[Ithal Road]] and connected the keep of [[Barakmordin]] in the north with the town of [[Kzelter]] to the southeast.

popup.title: Ithal Road
popup.description: A major trade road from [[Zazesspur]] to [[Saradush]] and the [[Ithal Pass]].

popup.title: Mistletoe Keep
popup.description: Home to the [[druid]] [[Yuldar Llistiin]] – the lord protector and count of [[Mirkazar]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Adarthir
popup.description: A manor in [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Vorpal Tower
popup.description: A ruined tower strangely cleaved diagonally in two by some unknown force.

popup.title: Iskasshyoll
popup.description: A [[drow]] city with a large cavern as the main body and only a few buildings on the surface.

popup.title: Khanall
popup.description: The chief enclave of the [[Janessar]] in the northern foothills of the [[Marching Mountains]].

popup.title: School of St. Rucir
popup.description: A seminary of note located in the northern foothills of the [[Marching Mountains]].

popup.title: Magis Tor
popup.description: A five-towered structure in the northeast of the [[Forest of Mir]], once home to the [[Magis Mir]], a cabal of [[wizard]] adventurers from [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Allsihwann
popup.description: Ruins of the [[drow]] surface city, destroyed by the combined forces of surface [[elves]] and [[Tethyr]] long before the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Dallnothax
popup.description: A [[drow]] settlement with several surface structures and the majority of the town located within a cave.

popup.title: Holldaybim
popup.description: One of three prominent [[drow]] cities in the [[Forest of Mir]] with only several surface structures that dealt with trade and visitors.

popup.title: Argentor
popup.description: A village in the [[Forest of Mir]], that was transformed into a settlement earthsoul genasi on the [[Mir Spires]] during the century of [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Rutawwa
popup.description: The easternmost enclave of the [[Janessar]] in the [[Marching Mountains]].

popup.title: Myth Dyraalis
popup.description: An [[elven]] settlement protected by its own ''[[mythal]]'' in [[−375 DR]].

popup.title: Eyesvale
popup.description: A small glen between the [[Ithal Pass]] and the town of [[Kzelter]], the site of the [[Battle of Eyesvale]].

popup.title: Hospice of St. Mariam
popup.description: An [[Ilmatari]] monastery, a herbalist's shop, and a hospital.

popup.title: Skyship's Glade
popup.description: The glade that was once a secret landing site for [[Halruaan]] ''[[spelljammer]]s''. It was later used by [[illithid]] slavers.

popup.title: Lost Ajhuutal
popup.description: Ruins of a city flooded and destroyed during the [[Steam Clashes]] in [[−7687 DR]].

popup.title: Spider Swamp
popup.description: The fetid swamp, formed by a great [[marid]]'s death in the [[Steam Clashes]] of [[−7687 DR]].

popup.title: Volomir River
popup.description: The western river that ran through the [[Spider Swamp]].

popup.title: Quag River
popup.description: The eastern waterway that crossed the [[Spider Swamp]].

popup.title: Nykkar
popup.description: Nykkar, the Isle of Memory

popup.title: River of Ice
popup.description: A major river in eastern [[Calimshan]] rich with fish, where many nobles of the kingdom had their summer estates.

popup.title: Two Falls River
popup.description: The eastern tributary of the [[River of Ice]], named after its two waterfalls.

popup.title: Bottle Falls
popup.description: A large waterfall near the source of the [[Two Falls River]] that plummeted into an old lava tube and erupted from a hill to the southwest in an arc.

popup.title: Bakkal's Creek
popup.description: The western tributary of the [[River of Ice]], where once stood a temple to an ancient dark god whose name is now lost to history.

popup.title: Cold Eyes
popup.description: An enigmatic cliffside carving of giant eyes that overlooked the [[River of Ice]].

popup.title: Schamedar Plains
popup.description: The fertile countryside east of the city of [[Schamedar]], consumed by the [[Calim Desert]] during the [[Spellplague]] and before the [[Second Sundering]].

popup.title: Schamedar
popup.description: A large city – center for religious diversity in that country of [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Manshaka
popup.description: A metropolis in [[Calimshan]], the second largest gambling city in [[Faerûn]], infamous for its [[Blood Arenas]] and slavery.

popup.title: St. Taril's Monastery
popup.description: A monastery of note.

popup.title: Mount Sarengard
popup.description: One of the tallest peaks in the eastern [[Marching Mountains]] and the site of the [[Vault of Cloaked Midnight]] – the holiest temple to [[Vhaeraun]].

popup.title: Minthrux Vale
popup.description: A mountain vale between the [[Ruler's Ridge]] to the west and [[Mount Sarengard]] to the east.

popup.title: Ruler's Ridge
popup.description: Also known as '''Calim's See''', a peak where a grand battle against a powerful [[genie]] once took place, and a rumored habitat of a giant [[dragon]]-sized [[aurumvorax]].

popup.title: Second Necropolis of Nykkar
popup.description: The '''City of Sorrow''' necropolis' ruins where over 500,000 rulers and nobles were laid to rest between the Second and Fifth Ages of [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: St. Faelar's Cloisters
popup.description: A monastery of [[Ilmater]] dedicated to [[St. Faelar]], where [[monk]]s and [[ranger]]s taught escaped slaves mountain survival.

popup.title: Mount Abbalayat
popup.description: An isolated peak in the western [[Marching Mountains]], famous for being the home of the race of oracles called the [[Abbalayar]].

popup.title: Faeressar
popup.description: The westernmost enclave of the [[Janessar]] in the [[Marching Mountains]].

popup.title: First Necropolis of Nykkar
popup.description: A ruined necropolis where bodies of dead rulers of [[Coramshan]] were laid to rest.

popup.title: Keltar
popup.description: One of the oldest cities in [[Faerûn]], located in [[Calimshan]], famous for being the site of the [[House of the Broken God]].

popup.title: Calim River
popup.description: The largest river in [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Singing Rocks
popup.description: A collection of small islands off the coast of [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Calim Desert
popup.description: The rocky desert on the coast of [[Calimshan]], formed by an epic magical war between two [[genie]]s, the [[djinni]] [[Calim]] and [[efreeti]] [[Memnon]].

popup.title: Calimport
popup.description: The sprawling capital city of [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Amkethran
popup.description: A poor village embedded into an outcropping of rock that survived thanks to its fortified monastery and smuggling.{{approx}}

popup.title: Iyritrastrul
popup.description: The southern island of the duo known as [[the Tusks]], used as a stop to repair ships due to its abundant [[shadowtop]]s, [[duskwood]]s, and [[blueleaf]] [[tree]]s.

popup.title: Borammur
popup.description: The bigger northern island of [[the Tusks]] that once was a site of a prosperous [[copper]] mine, abandoned by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Gullet
popup.description: The perilous straight that separated [[The Tusks]], full of obtruding sea rocks – one of the most dangerous areas of the [[Sword Coast]] for marine traversal.

popup.title: St. Noradnar's Hermitage
popup.description: A remote [[Ilmatari]] hermitage named for and founded by the saint [[Noradnar]].

popup.title: Teshburl
popup.description: The most isolated town in [[Calimshan]] and the secondary shipbuilding site for the [[Nallojal]].

popup.title: Coast Trail
popup.description: An alternative road to the [[Trade Way]] as a means to travel from [[Calimport]] to Memnon along the shores of the [[Trackless Sea]], avoiding the [[Calim Desert]].

popup.title: House of St. Liwan's Blessing
popup.description: A monastery of [[Ilmater]] high on the cliffs along the northern stretch of the [[Coast Trail]], on the western coast of [[Calimshan]].

popup.title: Memnon
popup.description: A key port of trade for [[Calimshan]] and the former capital of the [[efreeti]] kingdom of [[Memnonnar]].

popup.title: Dashadjen
popup.description: An ancient ruined city of the [[Calim Empire]], founded in [[−6500 DR]].

popup.title: Teshyll
popup.description: A ruined ancient city – center for trade in the old [[Calim Empire]].

popup.title: Teshyllal Wastes
popup.description: The desert wastelands surrounding the ruins of the ancient city of [[Teshyll]].

popup.title: Calimban Knoll
popup.description: The stone circle marking where a battle was fought in the [[Calim Desert]] at the end of the [[Fourth Age of Calimshan]].

popup.title: Friary of St. Amahl
popup.description: A former [[caravanserai]], and an [[Ilmatari]] monastery in the middle of the [[Calim Desert]].

popup.title: Spinning Keep of Siri'wadjen
popup.description: The magical structure surrounding the ''[[Calimemnon Crystal]]'' in which the [[genie]]s [[Calim ]]and [[Memnon]] were entrapped in the [[Calim Desert]].

popup.title: Cyric's Hammer
popup.description: A 500-foot-tall pillar of rock along the [[Trade Way]] in the [[Calim Desert]].

popup.title: Shining Sea
popup.description: One of the great seas of [[Faerûn]] that stretched from the coastline of [[Chult]] in the south to the shoreline of [[Calimshan]] in the north.

popup.title: Aumrauth
popup.description: A realm of [[aquatic elves]] located in the [[Shining Sea]] and stretching from the island of [[Tharsult]] to the mouth of the [[River Scelptar]].

popup.title: Myratma
popup.description: One of the most important cities in [[Tethyr]], known for its s textiles.

popup.title: Red River
popup.description: A tributary of the [[River Ith]], also known as '''Lavender Creek''', with [[lavender]] flowers coating its shores.

popup.title: Maratimmir
popup.description: The ducal seat of [[Ankaram]] and, once, the official home of Duchess [[Vajra Valmeyjar]] of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Red Rivers Fields
popup.description: Grasslands of note, north of [[River Ith]].

popup.title: River Ith
popup.description: The longest river in [[Tethyr]] that began in the [[Snowflake Mountains|Snowflake]] and [[Omlarandin Mountains]].

popup.title: Memnonnar
popup.description: Ruyins of the city center of [[Memnon]] from the time when it was the capital city of the kingdom of [[Memnonnar (country)|Memnonnar]] under the Great Pasha [[Memnon (efreeti)|Memnon]].

popup.title: Daraqadim
popup.description: A former [[Calishite]] manor, located in the [[Calimmon County]] of [[Tethyr]]. After the [[Tethyrian Interregnum#Reclamation Wars|Reclamation Wars]], the keep became the county seat of Calimmon and the home of Her Excellency [[Kyrin Hawkwinter]].

popup.title: Fort Agis
popup.description: Also known as the [[Memnonnar Citadel]] – one of the border keeps of [[Tethyr]], collectively known as the [[Calimmon Garrisons]].

popup.title: Fort Tufenk
popup.description: A garrison fort located in southern [[Tethyr]]. It was also known as the '''Fortress of Fire.'''

popup.title: Iltakar Garrison
popup.description: One of the border keeps along the [[River Agis]].

popup.title: Fort Calim
popup.description: One of the forts along the [[River Agis]].

popup.title: Shoonach
popup.description: A sprawling ruin of the former capital of the [[Shoon Imperium]].

popup.title: Fort Teqlar
popup.description: One of the forts along the [[River Agis]].

popup.title: St. Saril's Priory
popup.description: A priory of the [[Church of Ilmater]].

popup.title: Qian Hillfort
popup.description: One of the forts along the [[River Agis]].

popup.title: River Agis
popup.description: Also known as the [[Memnon River]],  a wide and slow-moving waterway used by cargo-carrying and lumber barges.

popup.title: Ammathluir
popup.description: An important trading hub in [[Luiren]] in the [[Shining South]].

popup.title: Wizards' Reach
popup.description: The stretch of the [[Inner Sea]] that laid between [[Chessenta]] and [[Aglarond]], and to the broad plain on the Aglarondan peninsula that stretched between the Inner Sea and the [[Yuirwood]].

popup.title: River of the Dawn
popup.description: A waterway that was disputed over by  [[Mulhorand]] and [[Thay]].

popup.title: Thazalhar
popup.description: A small and sparsely populated region of [[Thay]], ruled by [[tharchion]] [[Milsantos Daramos]] until his death in [[1382 DR]].

popup.title: Pyarados
popup.description: A lawless metropolis with its walled inner-city dotted with beautiful parks, luxurious establishments, and grand palaces. Outside of the inner-city walls were winding mud-covered streets and ramshackle sheds.

popup.title: Surague Escarpment
popup.description: The eastern border of [[Pyarados]] – a sheer cliff face that further elevated the [[Sunrise Mountains]] above the [[Thayan Plateau]].

popup.title: Lake Thaylambar
popup.description: The largest freshwater lake in all of [[Thay]], cold as a slaver's heart, and inhabited by huge herds of [[dragon turtle]]s.

popup.title: River Eltar
popup.description: A small waterway that originated on the [[Thaymount]] and cascaded into the [[Lake Thaylambar]].

popup.title: Surag River
popup.description: A waterway that passed the [[Surague Escarpment]] and emptied into the [[Lake Thaylambar]].

popup.title: River Thay
popup.description: A large, sprawling river that served as a major thoroughfare for the movement of goods and people across northern [[Thay]].

popup.title: Delhumide
popup.description: A ruined [[demon]]-infested city in the [[tharch]] of the same name, once one of the greatest cities and bastions of power.

popup.title: River Gauros
popup.description: A relatively short river that was only partially navigable and offered little economic or tactical value to [[Thay]].

popup.title: River Mulsantir
popup.description: A prominent river found between [[Rashemen]] and [[Thay]] that flowed north into [[Lake Ashane]] and its southern section flowed west from the [[Sunrise Mountains]] to form [[Lake Mulsantir]].

popup.title: Tyraturos
popup.description: The city founded during an age of expansion of [[Mulhorand]], eventually claimed by [[Thay]].

popup.title: Priador
popup.description: The coastal [[tharch]] of [[Thay]], along the coast of the [[Alamber Sea]] that encompassed rolling plains and grasslands south of the [[First Escarpment]].

popup.title: High Road
popup.description: The road that crossed central [[Thay]], from [[Bezantur]] to [[Eltabar]].

popup.title: Eastern Way
popup.description: The road that stretched from [[Nethjet]] to the west and to [[Pyarados]] to the east.

popup.title: Amruthar
popup.description: Once an independent city within the [[Thayan]] [[tharch]] of [[Lapendrar]], it became the ruined '''Burning Amruthar''' in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: River Lapendrar
popup.description: The '''River of Sorrows''', named after the gold miners who died working its banks and the [[Aglarondan]] army that perished along the river.

popup.title: Tannath Mountains
popup.description: The southern part of the [[Dragonjaw Mountains]], starting south of the [[River Umber]].

popup.title: Tannath Gap
popup.description: Often called just '''The Gap''', was a forested highland between the [[Tannath Mountains]] and the rest of the [[Dragonjaw Mountains]], around the [[River Umber]], opposite [[Singing Sands]].

popup.title: Shyvar Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass across the [[Tannath Mountains]] on their eastern side.

popup.title: Umber Marsh
popup.description: A large patch of boggy land on the border of [[Aglarond]] and [[Thay]], virtually impassible with many small springs and streams running across the wetlands, and eventually daring into [[River Lapendrar]].

popup.title: Daustable's Morrum
popup.description: A small valley just off the [[Trader's Way]], bordered on its eastern edge by three large standing stones.{{approx}}

popup.title: Harboot's Tooth
popup.description: A pinnacle of rock resembling a long-stemmed wine glass jutting up out of the plain of the eastern [[Shaar]] about a day's swift ride north of [[Delzimmer]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Knife
popup.description: A pinnacle of stone rising between eighty and ninety feet, about four days wagon ride north of [[Delzimmer]]. Just to the east was a deep well that contained tainted water.{{approx}}

popup.title: Nethjet
popup.description: A city in [[Thay]].

popup.title: Lake Umber
popup.description: A freshwater lake at the base of the [[First Escarpment]] between [[Thay]] and [[Aglarond]], fed by glaciers of [[Thaymount]].

popup.title: Thayvian gold mines
popup.description: A giant mining complex under [[Thaymount]] that produced the [[gold]] that sustained [[Thay]]'s economy.

popup.title: Thayvian gold mines
popup.description: A giant mining complex under [[Thaymount]] that produced the [[gold]] that sustained [[Thay]]'s economy. Part of the mines collapsed in [[1362 DR]], burying the [[Zulkir]] of [[Alteration]], [[Maligor]].

popup.title: River Umber
popup.description: A fast-flowing river that originated in the glaciers of [[Thaymount]] and reached the [[Sea of Dlurg]].

popup.title: Eltabbar
popup.description: The former capital of [[Thay]] and the second largest city in the nation.

popup.title: Sunrise Mountains
popup.description: The mountain range that formed much of that [[Thay]]'s eastern border.

popup.title: Denzar
popup.description: A frontier mining town in the [[Gauros]] [[tharch]] of [[Thay]].

popup.title: Gauros Keep
popup.description: A [[Thay]]an keep on the eastern shore of the [[River Gauros]].

popup.title: Sur Road
popup.description: The road with its eastern end at the mining town of [[Denzar]].

popup.title: Chur Gathos
popup.description: The [[Thay]]an keep situated in the [[Daggertooth Pass]] across the [[Sunrise Mountains]].

popup.title: Daggertooth Pass
popup.description: A mountain passage across the [[Sunrise Mountains]] from [[Thay]] to the [[Endless Wastes]].

popup.title: Keluthar
popup.description: A settlement of note on the [[River Thay]] and the shores of [[Lake Thaylambar]].

popup.title: Umratharos
popup.description: A settlement of note, connected to the mining town of [[Denzar]] via the [[Sur Road]].

popup.title: Khopet-Dag
popup.description: Also known as the '''Spiderhaunt Peaks''', was a mountain range located in the [[Endless Wastes]], famed for the [[giant spider]] [[silk]] gathered by the [[Yaqubi]] people.

popup.title: Tomb of Faraz Khan
popup.description: One of the [[noble tombs]] that served as the final resting places of the khans of the [[Hordelands]].

popup.title: Thaymount
popup.description: The chain of volcanic mountains at the heart of [[Thay]], located within the [[tharch]] of the same name.

popup.title: The Citadel
popup.description: An ancient fortress carved into one of the highest peaks of [[Thaymount]] that predated [[human]]s.

popup.title: Hordelands
popup.description: '''The Endless Wastes''' or '''Taan''', the land of  horsemen tribes, most notably the [[Tuigan]]s.

popup.title: Yal Tengri
popup.description: '''The Great Ice Sea''', was an arm of the ocean that covered the north pole of [[Toril]] with all sorts of cold-loving creatures found in its waters.

popup.title: Many-Windowed Tower
popup.description: A slender tower home of [[lich] named [[Demchungchumrub]].

popup.title: Winterkeep
popup.description: A ruin that hid extensive subterranean passageways and chambers.

popup.title: Gorge of Gauros
popup.description: A rocky canyon that encompassed a stretch of the [[First Escarpment]].

popup.title: Lake Mulsantir
popup.description: A lake connected to [[Lake Ashane]] via the wide [[River Mulsantir]] with its waters patrolled by [[Rashemi]] ''[[witchboats]]''.

popup.title: River Sur
popup.description: A small river in the [[Unapproachable East]] that flowed down from a spring on the northern face of the [[First Escarpment]] of the [[Thayan Plateau]].

popup.title: Tezir-on-the-Marsh
popup.description: A [[Theskian]] fishing settlement.

popup.title: Surmarsh
popup.description: A dreary, humid swamp with its stench being especially wretched during the summer.

popup.title: Surthay
popup.description: The capital of the [[tharch]] of the same name and [[Thay]]'s natural harbor within [[Lake Mulsantir]].

popup.title: Mulsantir
popup.description: A great and prosperous city in southwest [[Rashemen]], located at the end of the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Two Stars
popup.description: A stone-walled trade crossroads town in [[Thesk]] at the intersection of the [[Cold Road]] and the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Tammar
popup.description: A large town in [[Thesk]], decimated by the [[Grand Army of the Tuigan]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], later rebuilt and grew to a population of 3,594 souls in [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Spearsmouth Dale
popup.description: A dale of note in [[Thesk]] on the edge of the [[Forest of Lethyr]].

popup.title: Phsant
popup.description: A large trading city if [[Thesk]] where the [[Tuigan Horde]] was defeated. It was renowned for its multicultural diversity and high population of [[Shou]], as well as [[orc]]s.

popup.title: Inkar
popup.description: A settlement in [[Thesk]] that stood on the [[Golden Road]].

popup.title: Phent
popup.description: A fortress city in [[Thesk]], along the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Thesk Mountains
popup.description: Bare, inhospitable mountains in [[Thesk]] that reached as high as 7,000 feet (2,100 meters).

popup.title: Golden Way
popup.description: A major trade route that started in [[Telflamm]], passed through [[Thesk]] and reached all the way to the empire of [[Shou Lung]] in [[Kara-Tur]].

popup.title: Forest of Lethyr
popup.description: One of the two forests that comprised the borders of the [[Great Dale]], guarded by [[druid]]s and [[ranger]]s as well as a few [[treant]]s.

popup.title: River Flam
popup.description: A river that began in the [[Forest of Lethyr]] and emptied into the [{Easting Reach]] south of the city of [[Telflamm]].

popup.title: River Eth
popup.description: A river found in the [[Forest of Lethyr]] in the [[Great Dale]].

popup.title: Ethdale
popup.description: Also known as '''Ethdil''', a small [[human]] and [[halfling]] town.

popup.title: Nyth
popup.description: A small city under the control of [[Telflamm]].

popup.title: Thassalra
popup.description: A city of note in [[Thesk]].

popup.title: Culmaster
popup.description: A settlement in [[Thesk]], a subject-city to [[Telflamm]].

popup.title: Milvarune
popup.description: A major multi-cultural port city in [[Thesk]] with trade and fishing being its main industries.

popup.title: Cape Dragonfang
popup.description: A minor peninsula – the westernmost point of the [[Dragonjaw Mountains]] that protruded into. the [[Easting Reach]].

popup.title: Nethentir
popup.description: A city in [[Thay]] located just at the foot of the [[First Escarpment]] inhabited by [[human]]s, Thayan legionnaires, and unruly [[gnoll]]s.

popup.title: Sea of Dlurg
popup.description: The sea between the nations of [[Thesk]] and [[Aglarond]], connected to the large [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Sea of Fallen Stars
popup.description: Or the '''Inner Sea''', the largest inland body of water in [[Faerûn]], home to many types of aquatic life, including kingdoms of [[dragon turtle]]s, [[aquatic elves]], [[merfolk]], and [[sahuagin]].

popup.title: Fang
popup.description: Or '''South Fang''' – a large barren and rocky piece of land that extended north into the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] from [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Telflamm
popup.description: The biggest and most important port city in [[Thesk]].

popup.title: Dragonjaw Mountains
popup.description: Mountains in [[Thesk]] inhabited by [[gnome]]s and [[copper dragon]]s.

popup.title: Emmech
popup.description: Also known as '''Undumor''' – a fortress town in [[Aglarond]] that fell under [[Thay]]an control in the 15{{th}} [[DR]].

popup.title: Singing Sands
popup.description: The site of the [[1194 DR]] event known as the [[Battle of the Singing Sands]] between [[Aglarond]] and the [[Red Wizards of Thay]].

popup.title: Easting Reach
popup.description: A calm and wide expanse of water at the northeast edge of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Kielbast
popup.description: A settlement of note, also known as '''Arn's Cove'''.

popup.title: Traders Bay
popup.description: The only interior waterway in [[Impiltur]] that had a reputation as a wretched hive of scum and villainy, granting it a colloquial name '''Traitor's Bay'''. It consisted of the western body of water called [[Bluefang Water]] and [[The Old Water]] to the east.

popup.title: Bay Town
popup.description: A humble settlement on the [[Traders Bay]] that was a haven for [[thieves]], pirates, and a slew of other unfavorable types.

popup.title: Outentown
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Songhal
popup.description: the enlightened town served as a center of learning for the kingdom of [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Sarshel
popup.description: A walled port city of [[Impiltur]], home to the [[Marhymbel House Shipways]] – the fastest ship-builder on the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Filur
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Dilpur
popup.description: An important [[Impilturian]] city of swelling numbers,

popup.title: Hlammach
popup.description: A bustling port city in [[Impiltur]] and the location of the nation's royal mint.

popup.title: Hill of Tombs
popup.description: The southernmost point in the [[Earthfast Mountain]] range, near the coast of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Lyrabar
popup.description: Previously known as '''Impil's Tor''', a great port city that served as the capital of [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Gray Forest
popup.description: Also known as the '''Tsurlar Forest''' with circles of the grand, gray-barked [[tree]]s with dark leaves that the [[moon elves]] who once dwelt here had turned themselves into.

popup.title: Spandeliyon
popup.description: A busy port city of note in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Ingdal's Arm
popup.description: A small [[human]] settlement and the site of the [[Battle of Ingdal's Arm]] of [[1065 DR]].

popup.title: Urve
popup.description: A settlement of note in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Urst
popup.description: A settlement of note in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Corth
popup.description: A town founded by colonists from [[Chessenta]] in [[756 DR]], later became a fishing settlement on [[Corth Cove]].

popup.title: Corth Cove
popup.description: A cove of sandy beaches with an ancient craggy rock at its center, visited by [[merfolk]] if old tales were to be believed.

popup.title: Kingdom of Mertwig
popup.description: A small kingdom once ruled by beloved King [[Mertwig]]. The location of the [[Last Pyramid in the Sand]], [[Mertwig's Maze]], the [[Purple Castle]], and the [[Royal Palace of Mertwig]].

popup.title: Veltalar
popup.description: Formerly '''Velprintalar'''', the primary port of [[Aglarond]], founded by colonists from [[Chessenta]] in [[756 DR]].

popup.title: Findar
popup.description: A settlement home to the descendants of refugees from the conflict between the [[human]]s and the [[half-elves]] of the [[Yuirwood]].

popup.title: Dhast
popup.description: A coastal hamlet with its folk being warry and mistrustful of outsiders.

popup.title: Orlthar
popup.description: A coastal settlement of note in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Furthinghome
popup.description: A trading port city in [[Aglarond]] and one of the oldest cities in the nation that exported [[fish]], flowers, [[herb]]s, and timber.

popup.title: Osker
popup.description: A fishing town in eastern [[Aglarond]], famed for its central clocktower and its daily parade of mechanical creatures.

popup.title: Dlusk
popup.description: A small fishing town famed for its annual festivals that attracted tourists from across [[Aglarond]], [[Thesk]], and [[Chessenta]].

popup.title: Relkath's Foot
popup.description: The largest permanent settlement in and the unofficial [[half-elven]] capital of the [[Yuirwood]].

popup.title: Halendos
popup.description: A large meadow one day's journey from the city of [[Veltalar]].

popup.title: Halendos Village
popup.description: A humble rustic wooden village of brightly painted homes, flower and vine-covered roofs, and green gardens.

popup.title: Mesring
popup.description: A settlement of note in [[Aglarond]].

popup.title: Yuirwood
popup.description: The ancient forest at the center of the nation of [[Aglarond]], named after the [[Yuir]], an ancient race of [[star elves]] who once dwelled in the forest.

popup.title: Glarondar
popup.description: A fortress town of black stone and the childhood home of a [[Harper]] agent [[Brenna Graycloak]].

popup.title: Watchwall
popup.description: A massive, magically engineered length of stone wall stretching from the fortress city of [[Glarondar]] to the slopes of [[Umbergoth]], thus extending the defensive barrier of the [[Dragonjaw Mountains]] another fifteen miles, sheltering [[Aglarond]] from the [[Red Wizards of Thay]].

popup.title: Umbergoth
popup.description: The tallest mountain in [[Aglarond]]. As of [[1368 DR]], it had never been scaled.

popup.title: Border Forest
popup.description: Also known as the '''Rystall Woos''', a large forest of [[pine]]s, [[oak]]s, and other deciduous trees with thick hard-to-traverse undergrowth, inhabited mostly by [[fey]].

popup.title: Whitehorn
popup.description: Named for the nearby sharp, snow-covered crags, it was a frontier trading and resupply town for prospectors, miners, and woodcutters located in the [[White Peaks]] mountain range, east of the [[Ride]].

popup.title: Citadel of the Raven
popup.description: A fortress of the [[Zhentarim]].

popup.title: The Ride
popup.description: An open cold steppe land situated between the [[Dragonspine Mountains]], the [[Border Forest]], and the [[Gray Land of Thar]].

popup.title: Ilinvur
popup.description: A mining settlement with its population decreasing drastically after the [[1360s DR]].

popup.title: Daggerford
popup.description:
A small but consequential town located in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]].
Interactive map can be found [[Map:Daggerford (14th Century DR)|here]].

popup.title: Delimbiyr River
popup.description: Or the '''River Shining,''' a river that ran through the [[Savage Frontier]] and the [[Western Heartlands]].

popup.title: Forest of Tethir
popup.description: Also known as [[Wealdath]], the largest forest in the [[Lands of Intrigue]] and the "single most important thing" that set the culture of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Trailstone
popup.description: An [[Amn]]ian village on the border with [[Tethyr]] that defected to the latter in [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: Toralth
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Castle Spulzeer
popup.description: Once home of the [[Spellseer]] family, the castle was transported to the [[Demiplane of Dread]] ''circa'' [[1367 DR]].

popup.title: Shildamere
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Riatavin
popup.description: A city in [[Amn]] and later – [[Tethyr]], governed by a group of merchants known as the [[Chosen Council]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Hillfort of Torbold
popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s [[Hillfort]]s.

popup.title: Olehm Passage
popup.description: A road that connected [[Hillfort]] of [[Torbold]] and the [[Tethir Road]].

popup.title: Dark Redoubt
popup.description: A secluded and hidden fortification of the [[Church of Cyric]].

popup.title: Tejarn Hills
popup.description: A grouping of hills in southeastern [[Amn]] with its inhabitants believed to be country bumpkins by the citizens of [[Athkatla]] and [[Murann]].

popup.title: Hillfort of Keshla
popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s [[Hillfort]]s.

popup.title: Trollford
popup.description: One of the crossings over the [[Amstel River]], considered to be the safest ford within 75 miles.

popup.title: South Road
popup.description: A road that began at [[Eshpurta]], passed [[Trollford]], and curved southwest across [[Tejarn Hills]].

popup.title: Amstel River
popup.description: A major river of eastern [[Amn]] that fed [[Lake Esmel]] that once served as the northern border of the kingdom of [[Valashar]].

popup.title: Eshpurta
popup.description: Or the '''"Shield City"''' of [[Amn]], a bustling military trade town in eastern [[Amn]].

popup.title: Axe Bridge
popup.description: A bridge over the [[Vudlur]] on a road that connected [[Keczulla]] and [[Eshpurta]].

popup.title: Vudlur
popup.description: One of the watercourses of the [[Esmelflow]].

popup.title: Star Bridge
popup.description: A bridge over the [[Golden Creek]] river along the road between [[Keczulla]] and [[Eshpurta]].

popup.title: Golden Creek
popup.description: One of the watercourses of the [[Esmelflow]], used by the people of [[Keczulla]] to pan for [[gold]].

popup.title: Trifin Creek
popup.description: A swiftly flowing small river with steep banks that joined the [[Amstel River]] just past the city of [[Eshpurta]].

popup.title: Eshpurta Road
popup.description: A major road in [[Amn]] that began in [[Athkatla]], crossed [[Trifin Creek]] river and ended in the city of  [[Eshpurta]].

popup.title: River Rimril
popup.description: A river in eastern [[Amn]] that was a part of the [[Esmelflow]] and joined [[Trifin Creek]] just outside the city walls of [[Eshpurta]].

popup.title: Eldath's Mount
popup.description: A peak in the [[Troll Mountains]] at which the great [[Green Goddess Falls]] was located. The falls were a part of the [[River Rimril]], and the [[Duskwood Dell]] into which the waters flowed was a sacred site to the goddess [[Eldath]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Green Goddess Falls
popup.description: The beginning of the [[River Rimril]], that cascaded off the [[Troll Mountains]] into [[Duskwood Dell]]. Afterward, the waters continued cascading in a number of smaller falls and pools called the '''Steps'''.{{approx}}

popup.title: Duskwood Dell
popup.description: The most sacred site of [[Eldath]] located in [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: Eldathyn
popup.description: A small tree village found within [[Duskwood Dell]] led by [[Alatoasz Berendim]], the Most Exalted Fallskeeper of [[Eldath]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Snakewood
popup.description: A relatively small forest located in eastern [[Amn]], named after a great number of black and green [[snake]]s that lived there.

popup.title: Burrowville
popup.description: A [[halfling]] town known for its [[Blueleaf Tobacco]] cultivation.

popup.title: The Ridge
popup.description: A long stretch of cliffs found in the eastern [[Cloud Peaks]] and the most extensively mined area in [[Amn]].

popup.title: Splendarrllur
popup.description: Also known as the '''Shining River''' among the [[shield dwarves]]) was one of the three greatest rivers of [[Amn]].

popup.title: Akarav's Bay
popup.description: The northernmost bay of the [[Lake Esmel]] in [[Amn]] famed for its mineral springs that kept its waters warm and rejuvinating.

popup.title: Scimitar
popup.description: A thermal resort located alongside the shore of [[Lake Esmel]] named after the scimitar-shaped peninsula in which it was located.

popup.title: Lake Esmel
popup.description: A famous lake in [[Amn]], the largest freshwater lake in the [[Lands of Intrigue]] with the "Monster of the Lake" residing in its depths.

popup.title: Keczulla
popup.description: A prosperous city that was the home of a diverse and rich mining industry.

popup.title: Giant's Dance
popup.description: An ancient ring of stones.

popup.title: Amnwater
popup.description: A small walled trade city on the [[Eshpurta Road]] between [[Crimmor]] and [[Keczulla]]  and the exporter of [[beer]] called [[Amnwater No.1]].

popup.title: The South Fork
popup.description: The road that connected [[Purskul]] and the trade city of [[Amnwater]].

popup.title: Gem Road
popup.description: The road between [[Esmeltaran]] and the gem-mining city of [[Keczulla]].

popup.title: Small Teeth
popup.description: A mountain range that formed the border between [[Amn]] and [[Muranndin]], inhabited by [[goblinoid]]s, [[ogre]]s, [[kobold]]s, and [[hill giant]]s.

popup.title: King's Arch
popup.description: A bridge across [[Esmel River]] and the town of [[Gambiton]].

popup.title: Esmeltaran
popup.description: A [[halfling]]-dominated city in eastern [[Amn]].

popup.title: River Esmel
popup.description: A major waterway in [[Amn]], and "the true backbone of Amnian riches."

popup.title: Shimmalshyr
popup.description: A river that fed [[Lake Esmel]]'s southeast.

popup.title: Coryllvol
popup.description: A village on the shores of [[Shimmalshyr]] that traded in welling water from the Shimmalshyr springs.

popup.title: Gambiton
popup.description: A town of note the sat on the crossing for two roads that connected it to [[Imnescar]] to the west and the [[Hillfort of Ishla]] to the southeast.

popup.title: Hyrzashyr
popup.description: A short river in [[Amn]] that fed [[Lake Esmel]] from the south, named during the existence of  the [[halfling]] kingdom of [[Meiritin]].

popup.title: Zinner
popup.description: A fishing village.

popup.title: Hillfort of Ishla
popup.description: One of Amn's Hillforts.

popup.title: Brost
popup.description: Or the '''Mushroom Village''', a trade town in the northern part of [[Tethyr]] that produced [[ale]]s, [[cider]]s, [[peach]]es, and [[mushroom]]s.

popup.title: Tethir Road
popup.description: One of the oldest trade roads in [[Tethyr]] and [[Amn]]. It connected [[Murann]] on the [[Sword Coast]] to [[Ormath]] in the [[Shining Plains]].

popup.title: Lake Weng
popup.description: A freshwater lake originally called the '''Lake of Amin'''. It was surrounded by small villages and fed by two rivers, eventually emptying into the [[Alandor River]].

popup.title: Alandor River
popup.description: A slow-moving and wide river of busy barge traffic.

popup.title: Crimmor
popup.description:
A fortified city known as the '''City of Caravans''' or the '''Caravan Capital of Amn'''.
Interactive map can be found [[Map:Crimmor (14th Century DR)|here]].

popup.title: Amnurflow
popup.description: The northernmost of the tributaries of [[Lake Weng]], named after General [[Amnur]].

popup.title: Comassur Creek
popup.description: A small tributary of the [[Amnurflow]] river in [[Amn]], known for its fishing and [[salmon]] spawning seasons.

popup.title: Rashturiver
popup.description: A river that fed [[Lake Weng]] that had a waterfall near its source and had a twisted course.

popup.title: Citadel Amnur
popup.description: A citadel established in the century that followed King [[Esmel Torlath]]'s death.

popup.title: Wengwater
popup.description: A dangerously fast tributary of [[Lake Weng]] filled with deadly rapids.

popup.title: Orlsfall
popup.description: A ruined town on the northern side of [[the Ridge]].

popup.title: Lake Way
popup.description: The stretch of [[Eshpurta Road]] between [[Crimmor]] and [[Amnwater]].

popup.title: Citadel Rashturl
popup.description: One of two [[Amn]]ian outposts built to defend against [[orc]]s in the north.

popup.title: Orc Road
popup.description: The patch of the [[Trade Way]] in the [[Zehoarastria]] region between [[Crimmor]] and [[Purskul]], surrounded by farms, family estates, and small agricultural communities.

popup.title: Purskul
popup.description: A granary city and a caravan stop with high [[half-orc]] and [[hin]] populations.

popup.title: Seventeen Sentries
popup.description: An ancient stone circle of seventeen monoliths.

popup.title: Nashkel Mines
popup.description: Iron mines operated by the town of [[Nashkel]]. Part of the [[Iron crisis]] that consumed the [[Sword Coast North]] in [[1368 DR]].

popup.title: Seawatcher
popup.description: A lighthouse located on a rocky outcropping along the stretch of the coast south of the library-fortress of [[Candlekeep]], west of the [[High Hedge]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Hawkhill Quarry
popup.description: A ''[[portal]]'' that was part of the ''[[Lost Princess Road]]'' was accessible from the [[Hawkhill Quarry]].

popup.title: Imnescar
popup.description: A small town and an agricultural center of [[Amn]] famous for its fruit production.

popup.title: Trademeet
popup.description: The '''City of Merchant's Peace''', the smallest of the region's caravans stops, built around [[Waukeen's Circle]], a prehistoric circle of seven upright stone slabs.

popup.title: Murann
popup.description: The '''Sailors' City''' metropolis that had a fruitful trade with the continent of [[Maztica]].

popup.title: Tarseth Bay
popup.description: The bay on the [[Sea of Swords]] where [[Murann]] was built.

popup.title: Spine of the World
popup.description: A mountain range that stretched across the northwest region of [[Faerûn]] from the [[Cold Run]] near the [[Sea of Moving Ice]], to the [[Ice Spires]] north of the [[Silver Marches]].
popup.image: File:Spine of the world IWD map.png

popup.title: Silverymoon
popup.description:
The '''Gem of the North''', the green city and the prime signatory state of the Confederation of the [[Silver Marches]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Silverymoon 15th century DR|here]].

popup.title: Isle of the Circle
popup.description: An island of note in the [[Korinn Archipelago]].

popup.title: River Chionthar
popup.description: A large and busy river that ran through the [[Western Heartlands]]. It supported trade as far inland as [[Iriaebor]].

popup.title: Baldur's Gate
popup.description:
A metropolis city-state, perhaps the most prosperous and influential merchant city on the western coast of [[Faerûn]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Baldur's Gate|here]].

popup.title: Sea of Swords
popup.description: A region of the [[Trackless Sea]] that separated the western coast of [[Faerûn]] from the [[Nelanther Isles]] and the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: High Forest
popup.description: A a vast forested remnant of the days of old, when all of [[Faerûn]] was covered in green and [[elves]], [[giant]]s, and [[dragon]]s ruled the world.

popup.title: Mosstone
popup.description: A green and cool walled caravan-stop town under the protection of [[The Archdruid's Grove]].

popup.title: Port Kir
popup.description: '''The Seacity of Tethyr''' – the center of guild activities in the nation of [[Tethyr]], ran by the [[Guild Council]] and the [[Lord-Mayor]].

popup.title: Druid's Drive
popup.description: The portion of the [[Trade Way ]]between [[Mosstone]] and [[Port Kir]].

popup.title: Prince Piiclar's Road
popup.description: The part of the [[Trade Way]] between [[Pork Kir]] and [[Zazesspur]], named after a [[Piiclar Strohm|famed prince]] of the [[Strohm Dynasty]].

popup.title: Mount Speartop
popup.description: The tallest mountain of the [[Cloud Peaks]], home to [[Icehauptannarthanyx]] and other gigantic sleeping [[dragon]]s.

popup.title: Hamlar Hills
popup.description: A cluster of the southern and western foothills of the [[Cloud Peaks]], the location of a vineyard planted by [[Vol Qirger]], and the small village of [[St. Carwell's Vale]].

popup.title: Zehoarast Floodplains
popup.description: The floodplains that encompassed the lowlands between the [[River Esmel]] and the [[Small Teeth]] and west of the [[Trade Way]].

popup.title: Battlescarred Bard
popup.description: An inn along the [[Trade Way]] in [[Zehoarastria]] that served such dishes as [[plate-of-gold]], [[warrior's head]], [[chopforest]], and glazed [[ham]].

popup.title: River Specie
popup.description: The westernmost river in [[Amn]] – an important source of [[gold]].

popup.title: Imnestream
popup.description: One of the most beautiful rivers of the [[Sword Coast]]. Cold and swift, it passed through pleasant flower meadows and small clusters of trees. When it reached the floodplains, the waters became muddy, but before that, they were clean and pure.

popup.title: Kalathtyr
popup.description: A small fishing village on the [[River Specie]], home to two dozen families.

popup.title: River Road
popup.description: The part of [[Eshpurta Road]] between [[Athkatla]] and [[Crimmor]].

popup.title: Goldspires
popup.description: A temple complex that was the main center of the worship of [[Waukeen]], The Merchant's Friend.

popup.title: Merchant's Bay
popup.description: The bay at the mouth of [[Alandor River]].

popup.title: Athkatla
popup.description:
The '''City of Coin''' – the oldest settlement and capital of the mercantile nation of [[Amn]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Athkatla|here]].

popup.title: Bitten Road
popup.description: The road between the town of [[Nashkel]] and the caravan city of  [[Crimmor]], part of the [[Trade Way]].

popup.title: Growling Hill
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Mountain of Skulls
popup.description: A temple of [[Cyric]], the Mad God, within the [[Cloud Peaks]], some 10 miles (16 kilometers) east of [[the Fangs]].

popup.title: The Fangs
popup.description: A pair of extremely steep mountains that marked the northern border of [[Amn]].

popup.title: Fang Pass
popup.description: The mountain way that passed the duo of extremely steep mountains known as [[the Fangs]].

popup.title: Scarsiir's Crag
popup.description: The crag that once was [[silver dragon]] [[Eacoathildarandus]]'s lair.

popup.title: Abbey of Highsong
popup.description: A temple to [[Milil]], the Guardian of Singers and Troubadours, built by the [[Sorlyn]] [[priest]] [[Velmos Sonder]] in [[1360 DR]].

popup.title: Minsor Vale
popup.description: A fishing village built atop the ruined former capital of [[Minsorran]].

popup.title: Ideepton
popup.description: A small fishing village that traded in [[fish]] and root vegetables with blue glowing waters, sacred to the followers and clergy of the [[Church of Eldath]].

popup.title: Edive
popup.description: A fishing village of note.

popup.title: Shatar
popup.description: A fishing village of note.

popup.title: Cloud Peaks
popup.description: The mountain range that marked the northern border of [[Amn]] inhabited by [[mountain goat]]s and reckless mountain climbers.

popup.title: Zazesspur
popup.description: The ancient port city, the former capital of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Firedrake Bay
popup.description: The scenic bay located between the [[Tethyr Peninsula|Tethyr]] and the [[Starspire Peninsula]]s, the habitat of [[star lobster]]s and the eponymous [[fire drake]]s on its southern shores.

popup.title: Firedrake Shores
popup.description: The costal region on the [[Dragon's Neck Peninsula]] that encompassed the eastern shore of the [[Firedrake Bay]], County [[Kargrove]], and County [[Greenshores]].

popup.title: The Race
popup.description: A tract of water located off the southern edge of the [[Tethyr Peninsula]] in [[West Faerûn]] with merchant ships that sailed it being under the protection of the [[Calimshan]] navy.

popup.title: Starspire Peninsula
popup.description: A rocky and sparsely-inhabited peninsula, part of the [[County Starspur]] in [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Bay of Bormul
popup.description: The bay on the southern side of the [[Starspire Peninsula]].

popup.title: Battles' End
popup.description: An old [[Calishite]] castle that stood on a high hill, 25 miles west of [[Port Kir]].

popup.title: Cloister of St. Ramedar
popup.description: A prison and a sanitarium for the mentally ill, run by the [[Ramedaran Brotherhood]], a monastic order in the [[Church of Ilmater]].

popup.title: Mount Adiir
popup.description: One of the highest peaks in the [[Starspires]], the location of the [[Cloister of St. Ramedar]].

popup.title: Kirgard
popup.description: A fort used by forces of [[Mosstone]] and [[Port Kir]], as well as the residence of the Count of County [[Greenshores]] in [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Kaalinth
popup.description: A long-collapsed keep, home of [[Harptos]] the Inventor. The city's ruins became a drowned dungeon just off the coast of the [[Dargon's Head Penninsula]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Starspire Mountains
popup.description: A mountain range that stretched from the highlands of eastern [[Tethyr]] to a spur of the [[Starspire Penninsula]], inhabited by [[displacer beast]]s and [[peryton]]s.

popup.title: Hawkwing's Brook
popup.description: Also known as '''Banshee's Brook''' or '''Tethir Brook''' – a tributary of the [[Sulduskoon River]] that flowed down through [[County Uluran]].

popup.title: Uluran Keep
popup.description: A fort that occasionally served as home to the count of [[Uluran]].

popup.title: Argentwing Dell
popup.description: A small valley between [[Hawkwing's Brook]] and the [[Sulduskoon]], roughly shaped like a [[butterfly]].

popup.title: Sulduskoon River
popup.description: A major spring-fed river in the kingdom of [[Tethyr]] named after the tribe of [[Suldusk]] [[elves]].

popup.title: Tall Trees
popup.description: An elven tree settlement where the oldest trees in the [[High Forest]] could be found, protected by the [[Druids of Tall Trees]].

popup.title: Lythari's Den
popup.description: Home to [[lythari]] in the [[Weldath]].

popup.title: Bunlap's Fort
popup.description: Fort that was once occupied by a mercenary named [[Bunlap]], who ran a logging operation that murdered and enslaved [[elves]] of [[Weldath]].

popup.title: Lythari's Den
popup.description: Home to [[lythari]] in the [[Weldath]].

popup.title: Lythari's Den
popup.description: Home to [[lythari]] in the [[Weldath]].

popup.title: Swanmay's Glade
popup.description: A portion of the [[Wealdath]] forest where the [[Nebulae Pool]] and the [[Calathalureenteir]] could be found.

popup.title: Nebulae Pool
popup.description: Or the '''Pool of Stars'' – a peaceful forest lake on the northwestern end of the [[Swanmay's Glade]]. A lone [[swanmay]] once lived on the lake but was belied gone or dead by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Calathalureenteir
popup.description: The forest river that crossed [[Swanmay's Glade]].

popup.title: Moonglade
popup.description: Or the '''Seeding Forest''' as of the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: The Eight's Tree
popup.description: An [[elven]] court manor built in a huge many-branched [[oak]], hidden in the depts of [[Weldath]].

popup.title: Suldanessellar
popup.description: An [[elven]] city in the [[Forest of Tethir]] and the site of the [[Tree of Life]] – a colossal tree and the source of great magical power.

popup.title: Snowflake Mountains
popup.description:
A mountain range that formed the borders between [[Tethyr]], [[Amn]], and [[Erlkazar]], once home to a great [[red dragon]] [[Fyrentennimar]]. Part of the [[Iltkazar Range]].

'''Note: This map shows incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Castle Trinity
popup.description:
The headquarters of a sect worshiping the goddess [[Talona]], the Mother of all Plagues. The castle's main body was built underground.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: The Dells
popup.description:
Three high plateaus that rose above the [[Shilmista]] forest, used as defensible high ground by the [[elves]] against monsters of the [[Snowflakes]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Daoine Dun
popup.description:
Also known as the '''Hill of the Stars''' – a hill that hid a large cavern complex used by [[elves]] for defense and as a ceremonial ground.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Syldritch Trea
popup.description:
Ancient trees within the [[Shilmista]] forest, once menaced by evil [[wizard]] [[Dorigen Kel Lamond]] in [[1361 DR]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Deny Ridge
popup.description:
A high rock ridge in the of the [[Forest of Shadows]] – a defensive lookout for the [[elves]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Shilmista
popup.description:
Or the '''Forest of Shadows''' that encompassed the kingdom of the [[wild elf]] [[Elbereth]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: River Valashar
popup.description: A river in the region of the former kingdom of the same name. The river began in the lower peaks of the [[Snowflake Mountains]] and cascaded down in three sets of waterfalls into a deep forest pool, before flowing northwest towards [[Trollford]].

popup.title: Spirit Soaring
popup.description:
A large and beautiful cathedral-library complex dedicated to [[Deneir]], erected after the fall of the [[Edificant Library]] in [[1362 DR]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Shining Stream
popup.description: The primary tributary of the [[River Ith]] began in the [[Snowflake Mountains]].

popup.title: Swimstar Creek
popup.description:
A tributary of the [[Shining Stream]], which in turn was a tributary of [[Tethyr]]'s [[River Ith]]. It began in the [[Kuldin Peaks]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Impresk Lake
popup.description:
An ice-cold lake in [[Erlkazar]] fed by a large number of rivers and streams.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Carradoon
popup.description:
A shipwrights' town on the southern shore of [[Impresk Lake]], southeast of the [[Snowflake Mountains]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Troll Mountains
popup.description: The mountain range known as the "gateway to the northeast."

popup.title: Khalleshyr
popup.description: One of the rivers of the [[Esmelflow]] and a major tributary of the [[Amstel River]].

popup.title: Magar's Hill
popup.description: A hill of note between the [[Snakewood]] and the [[Fireflow]] river.

popup.title: Trollstooth Run
popup.description: A creek that began in the [[Qadim Hills]] and served as the eastern branch of the upper river [[Khalleshyr]].

popup.title: Fireflow
popup.description: Also known as the '''Gaping Stream''', an icy cold creek that began at the [[Gaping Face Cascade]] and served as the western branch of the upper [[Khalleshyr]] river.

popup.title: Gaping Face Cascade
popup.description: A waterfall that burst from a spring in the side of a rock face in the [[Troll Mountains]] and was the start of the [[Gaping Stream]].

popup.title: Bargewright Inn
popup.description: An important wayside hub for travelers of all sorts located on [[Jundar's Hill]] overlooking [[Ironford]] on the [[River Dessarin]].

popup.title: Ironford
popup.description: The bridge over the [[River Dessarin]] that connected the [[Bargewright Inn]] to the west and [[Womford]] to the east.

popup.title: Womford
popup.description: Or '''Wyrmford''', a tiny village on the banks of the [[River Dessarin]], named after a dragon was defeated in the area. The [[Friendly Bat]] was it most notable location in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Gulf of Storms
popup.description: A mountain valley in the [[Troll Mountains]].

popup.title: Fort Ilbratha
popup.description: An abandoned fort in the eastern foothills of the [[Troll Mountains]], nothing but stone foundations by the  mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Qadim Hills
popup.description: Hills that encircled the [[Troll Mountains]]'s eastern, southern, and western foothills, beginning north of [[Trollford]] and running until the [[Greenfields]].

popup.title: Assar's Peak
popup.description: A mountain in the [[Troll Mountains]] of [[Amn]] overlooking the valley known as the [[Gulf of Storms]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Mount Batyr
popup.description: The peak in the [[Troll Mountains]] into which the famed [[Wailing Dwarf]] was carved.

popup.title: Brigands' Gorge
popup.description: The four-mile-long deep canyon in the northern part of the [[Troll Mountains]].

popup.title: Mount Sklagarra
popup.description: A peak in the [[Troll Mountains]] east of the [[Smokespire]] volcano.

popup.title: Smokespire
popup.description: An extinct volcano in the [[Troll Mountains]] and home of the great [[dragon]] [[Balagos]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Herald's Hall
popup.description: An opulent manor on an island on a subterranean lake – the secret headquarters of the [[Heralds of Faerûn]].

popup.title: Mount Thalangar
popup.description: One of the mountains overlooking the [[Gulf of Storms]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Quarrelshigh
popup.description: A fortified [[gnomish]] village, located about five miles (eight kilometers) west of the [[Wailing Dwarf]].

popup.title: Wailing Dwarf
popup.description: A massive stone sculpture of a [[dwarf]] named for the sound made by wind passing over and through the cavernous ears, eyes, and mouth.

popup.title: Longsaddle
popup.description: A sleepy little hamlet between the [[Crags]] and the [[Evermoors]], the location of the [[Ivy Mansion]] – home of the famous wizardly [[Harpell]] family.

popup.title: The Trollrise
popup.description: The hilly land immediately east of [[Longsaddle]].

popup.title: Shalane River
popup.description:
The short river that flowed from [[Impresk Lake]] to [[Shalane Lake]]. The river was suitable for travel by experienced boaters.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Tagarath
popup.description: A village on the [[Tethir Road]] between [[Riatavin]] and the [[Vilhon Reach]] at the ford across the [[Shining Stream]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Elbencort
popup.description: A [[gnome]] located on the [[Tethir Road]] east of [[Riatavin]] where it forded the [[Shining Stream]] on the border between County [[Valashar]] and County [[Morninggold]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Kholmeth
popup.description:
A shepherding village closest to the baron's hunting lodge in the central [[Snowflakes]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Fallen Trees Fastness
popup.description:
A religious site dedicated to [[Eldath]]. The Keeper of Fallen Trees Fastness in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] was [[Meirthond Arbreet]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Bowgentle's Grove
popup.description:
A calm glade in the south of the forest and the burial place of the [[wizard]] [[Bowgentle]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Nightglow
popup.description:
Cavern lair of [[red dragon]] [[Fyrentennimar]], killed in [[1361 DR]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Dark Horns Temple
popup.description:
A temple in the [[Snowflake Mountains]] dedicated to [[Mystra]], the Mother of All Magic, sacked by [[orc]]s in [[1117 DR]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Giant's Plain
popup.description: Massive lush plains inhabited by large herds of migratory beasts of the [[Western Heartlands]] and a hunting ground for the [[Sword Coast]] [[dragon]]s.

popup.title: Giant's Run Mountains
popup.description: The mountain range in the west of the [[Vilhon Reach]] in the [[Shining Plains]], part of the greater [[Iltkazar Range]].

popup.title: Breakback Pass
popup.description: A pass that faced the famous [[Wailing Dwarf]] of the [[Troll Mountains]].
popup.image: File:Lake of the Snake and Lake of Snows.png

popup.title: Mount Dodild
popup.description: The peak beneath which the city of [[Cairnheim]] was located.
popup.image: File:Lake of the Snake and Lake of Snows.png

popup.title: Lake of Snows
popup.description: A placid lake situated in the eastern reaches of the [[Giant's Run Mountains]], overlooked by [[Mount Dodild]] and the [[Breakback Pass]].

popup.title: Cloven Mountains
popup.description: A wide and barren mountain range rising from the waters of the [[Deepwash]], home to a handful of warring [[goblinoid]] and [[orc]]ish tribes.

popup.title: Orgoth's Tower
popup.description:
The abandoned tower of [[Orgoth the Tainted]], who was said to have been slain by three [[fiend]]s he summoned.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Rhianna
popup.description: An estate that once was in [[Amn]]ian lands.

popup.title: Yiiloan Wayside
popup.description: A wayside stop of note.

popup.title: Fieldswalk
popup.description: Or '''Triford Trail''', a road that moved south from [[Riatavin]].

popup.title: River Track
popup.description: A road that moved south from the [[Yilloan Wayside]] manor.

popup.title: Cloak Wood
popup.description: An ancient, thickly grown forest in the [[Western Heartlands]], infested by [[giant spider]]s, [[korred]]s, [[kampfult]]s, [[quickling]]s, [[satyr]]s, [[stirge]]s, and other deadly creatures.

popup.title: Cloak Wood Mine
popup.description: A series of mining tunnels, originally run by the [[dwarves]] of [[Clan Orothiar]], taken over by the [[Iron Throne]] and flooded in [[1368 DR]].

popup.title: Nashkel
popup.description: A small [[Amn]]ian mining town.

popup.title: Beregost
popup.description: The town halfway between [[Baldur's Gate]] and [[Amn]], location of the [[Song of the Morning]] temple complex.

popup.title: Durlag's Tower
popup.description: A large tower that once belonged to [[Durlag Trollkiller]], said to be haunted by a powerful entity.

popup.title: Gullykin
popup.description: A small [[hin]] settlement couple of miles from [[Durlag's Tower]] and by the overgrown, fallow, rubble field that was once the elven town of the [[Firewine Bridge]].

popup.title: Firewine Bridge
popup.description: A ruin that once was an elven trading town devastated by a sorcerous battle in [[1168 DR]].

popup.title: Ulcaster School of Wizardry
popup.description: A magical academy, destroyed in the early 12{{th}} century [[DR]], with a population of magic spirits and horrific creatures infesting the ruins.

popup.title: Shining Plains
popup.description: A portion of the [[Vilhon Reach]], named after the visual effect of sunlight hitting the plains.

popup.title: Assam
popup.description: Also known as the "oasis in the plains." A small city and a caravan center, surrounded by herd animals and numerous caravans and their beasts of burden.

popup.title: Field of Tears
popup.description: A plot of land in the [[Shining Plains]] and the cite of a historic battle of [[326 DR]] between [[Ormath]], [[Lheshayl]], and the [[Tenpaw tribe]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Lheshayl
popup.description: A small city of the [[Shining Plains]] that prided itself on its cavalry and the [[Plainsteed]] [[horse]] export.

popup.title: Ormath
popup.description: A small city of the [[Shining Plains]] that used mercenary companies such as the  cavalry-based [[Order of the Silver Lance]].

popup.title: Pikemen's Folly
popup.description: A busy trade route that ran between the city-state of [[Hlondeth]] and the city of [[Ormath]] in the [[Shining Plains]].

popup.title: Rushing Hills
popup.description: A series of rocky outcroppings that laid southeast of the city of [[Lheshayl]], home of the [[Krakk't]] tribe of [[thri-kreen]].

popup.title: Urml
popup.description: A settlement of [[grippli]] at the far eastern end of the [[Wetwoods]].

popup.title: Wetwoods
popup.description: Also known as the '''Flooded Forest''', a misty bog of [[fungus]]-coated trees.

popup.title: Wet River
popup.description: A waterway that began on the slopes of the [[Orsraun Mountains]], emptying into the [[Long Arm Lake]].

popup.title: Shalane
popup.description: A small fishing town renowned for the best shipbuilders of all [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Shalane Lake
popup.description: The northwestern narrow part of the [[Deepwash]] connected to the [[Impresk Lake]] via the [[Shalane River]].

popup.title: Deepwash
popup.description: The largest freshwater lake in the [[Vilhon Reach]], filled by tributaries from the [[Cloven Mountains]] and the [[Deepwing Mountains]].

popup.title: Llorbauth
popup.description: The the capital of the kingdom of [[Erlkazar]] in [[Shalanar]] Barony, known for its [[Old One Eye]] [[beer]].

popup.title: Duhlnarim
popup.description: A port city to the north of the [[Cloven Mountains]] in [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Surkh
popup.description: The '''City of Lizards''', a small city inhabited by [[lizardmen]] and [[lizard king]]s, governed by King [[Griss'tok]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Golconda
popup.description:
A petty kingdom between [[Turmish]] and [[Erlkazar]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Goblin Marches
popup.description: A narrow region north of [[Cormyr]] populated by roving bands of [[goblinoid]] raiders.

popup.title: Stonelands
popup.description: A rocky and hilly region of harsh beauty marked by knife-edged ridges, deep ravines, caverns, and overhangs.

popup.title: North Ride
popup.description: Or '''Northride''', a road that began at [[Tilverton]] and ended at [[Voonlar]] in the [[Moonsea]] region.

popup.title: Farsea Marshes
popup.description: A wetland that once was home to an ancient civilization lost to time. The remnants of their astonishingly resilient structures were buried beneath the wetlands.

popup.title: Tun River
popup.description: An expansive waterway surrounded by the floodplains unsuitable for farmland.

popup.title: Shore of Sorrow
popup.description: The border of the [[Farsea Marshes]] and the [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Tempest Valley
popup.description: A mountain valley in the [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Chala's Mine
popup.description: A mine of note.

popup.title: Castle Kilgrave
popup.description: Also known as '''New Acheron''', a castle once claimed by [[Bane]]'s avatar, ruined in [[1358 DR]].

popup.title: Cave of Wickedness
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Gnoll Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass through the [[Storm Horns]], a part of a trade route, and a major [[coal]] producer for the city of [[Arabel]].

popup.title: Castle Crag
popup.description: A castle in northern [[Cormyr]] designed to protect it from the threats of the [[Stonelands]].

popup.title: Spotter's Peak
popup.description: The peak that rose above [[Castle Crag]] and the [[Gnoll Pass]].

popup.title: Stonebolt Trail
popup.description: A long trail that crossed the [[Stonelands]] of [[Cormyr]], connecting the [[Gnoll Pass]] in the south with the [[Shadow Gap]] in the north, passing west of [[Tilverton]].

popup.title: Twin Peaks of Urlspur
popup.description: A duo of mountains in the [[Thunder Peaks]] where the [[Immerflow]] began.

popup.title: Falls of Tumbling Stars
popup.description: A waterfall and hidden mountain valley in the [[Thunder Peaks]] at the beginning of the [[Immerflow]] river.

popup.title: Valley of Crushed Stones
popup.description: A mountain valley south of the [[Falls of Tumbling Stars]].

popup.title: Lake Sember
popup.description: A medium-sized freshwater lake and the location of [[Hyaline]], an ancient [[sea elf]] city and the [[Crystalline Towers]].

popup.title: Highmoon
popup.description: A large town and the capital of [[Deepingdale]] and the location of the [[Tower of the Rising Moon]].

popup.title: Thunder Gap
popup.description: Or '''Thunder Pass''',  an east-west pass in the [[Thunder Peaks]] leading to [[Sembia]] and the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: East Way
popup.description: A major trade route that connected the city of [[Arabel]] in [[Cormyr]] and [[Yhaunn]] on the easternmost part of [[Sembia]].

popup.title: Immerflow
popup.description: The northeastern tributary that fed the [[Wyvernwater]].

popup.title: Hullack Forest
popup.description: A forest that was once a part of the huge forest of [[Cormanthor]].

popup.title: Immer Trail
popup.description: The road that hugged the [[Wyvernwater]]'s northwestern shores.

popup.title: Hultail
popup.description: Once known as '''Rallyhorn''', a small port village known for its fishery and famous [[Trindar Shipyards]].

popup.title: Thunder River
popup.description: Or '''Thunderflow''', a busy waterway used for trade between [[Cormyr]], the village of [[Hultail]], and the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: Stag Skull Bridge
popup.description: A bridge that crossed the [[Thunder River]] in the town of [[Thunderstone]].

popup.title: Thunderstone
popup.description: A small town with the [[Hawklin]] and [[Huntsilver]] noble families' holdings.

popup.title: Hidden Vale
popup.description: A secluded valley inhabited by [[gnome]]s, known for its vast varieties of species of wildflowers.

popup.title: Highcastle
popup.description: A village named after a keep located just south of it and guarded by the [[Pegasus Archery Company]].

popup.title: Juniril
popup.description: A village in eastern [[Cormyr]] and the site of a battle between King [[Galaghard]]'s armies and those of the [[Witch Lords]] in [[900 DR]].

popup.title: Wheloon
popup.description: A small city on the junction of the [[Wyvernflow River]] and the [[Way of the Manticore]].

popup.title: Wyvernwater
popup.description: The star-shaped freshwater lake at the center of [[Cormyr]], connected to the [[Dragonmere]] via the [[Wyvernflow]].

popup.title: Wyvernflow
popup.description: The river that flowed from the [[Wyvernwater]] lake into the [[Dragonmere]].

popup.title: Orvaskyte Keep
popup.description: Once a fortified outpost that marked the northern border of [[Orva]], later [[Cormyr]], ruined in [[−702 DR]].

popup.title: Lost Refuge
popup.description: A [[Cormyrean]] keep placed near the border of the [[Vast Swamp]], claimed by the [[Church of Shar]] and their allies in the [[Shadowscale]] [[lizardfolk]] tribe and a band of [[shadar-kai]] in the early 1370s DR.

popup.title: Darkflow River
popup.description: A slow and short river in the [[Vast Swamp]] with dark inky waters.

popup.title: Vast Swamp
popup.description: A dangerous swamp populated by tribes of [[lizardfolk]], [[hobgoblin]]s, and other [[goblinoid]]s, [[orc]]s, [[gnoll]]s, and [[troll]]s.

popup.title: Kirinwood
popup.description: An agricultural [[Cormyr]]ean village.

popup.title: Battlerise
popup.description: A hamlet named after nearby [[Battlegate Castle]] that belonged to the [[Auantiver]] noble family.

popup.title: Dreamer's Rock
popup.description: A hamlet named after a long, flat hill that sheltered it from storms off the [[Lake of Dragons]] to the south.

popup.title: Monksblade
popup.description: A village in [[Cormyr]] known for its fine food and accommodation, making it a popular stop for people traveling to [[Sembia]].

popup.title: Way of the Manticore
popup.description: A long road that connected the nations of [[Cormyr]] and [[Sembia]], beginning in [[Hilp]] and ending in [[Selgaunt]].

popup.title: Golden Ruins
popup.description: A series of yellow stone ruins in the [[Eastern Plains]].

popup.title: Ghars
popup.description: A village turned market town in the [[Eastern Plains]].

popup.title: Tomb of Chonis
popup.description: A mysterious tomb in the [[Eastern Plains]].

popup.title: Unknown Shrine
popup.description: A mysterious ruined structure in the [[Eastern Plains]].

popup.title: Thunder Way
popup.description: A road that began at [[Wheloon]], hugged the [[Wyvernwater]]'s southeastern shores, passed [[Highcastle]], and ended in [[Saerb]] in the [[High Dale]].

popup.title: Besert
popup.description: A settlement of note that laid between [[Ghars]] and [[Thunderstone]].

popup.title: Azoun's Hold
popup.description: A keep of note.

popup.title: Daerlun
popup.description: A [[Sembia]]n city surrounded by a huge 500-foot-tall curtain wall erected by the [[Netherese Empire]].

popup.title: Bluemist Trail
popup.description: A minor road that hugged [[Dragonmere]]'s northern shore beginning in [[Marsember]], passing [[Wormtower]], [[Dawngleam]] and then jutting up north, ending on the [[Water Trail]].

popup.title: Wood of Sharp Teeth
popup.description: Or '''Glimmerwood''', a dense forest where one could gather [[maiden's milk]] and [[bellows root]] [[herb]]s, inhabited by  [[satyr]]s, [[dryad]]s, and a small number of [[werewolves]].

popup.title: Vehlarr
popup.description: A ruined [[werewolf]] settlement destroyed in [[720 DR]] by [[Selûne]], however, it was rumored it still existed on another ageless plane.{{approx}}

popup.title: Hooknose Crag
popup.description: A mountain pass in the [[Thunder Peaks]] from [[Cormyr]] to the [[High Dale]].

popup.title: Black Mountain
popup.description: A peak on the southern side of the [[Hooknose Crag]].

popup.title: Shalass Road
popup.description: The roadway found in western [[Sembia]] that connected [[Daerlun]] in the north with [[Urmlaspyr]] in the south.

popup.title: The Neck
popup.description: The canal between the [[Dragonmere]] and the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Urmlaspyr
popup.description: A [[Sembia]]n city known for having some of the best glassblowers in [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: River Thunn
popup.description: The waterway that ran from the high lands of the [[Dragon Coast]] down into the harbor of the city of [[Westgate]] on the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: The Grand Ride
popup.description: The road that ran from [[Westgate]] southeast to the town of [[Reddansyr]].

popup.title: Trader's Road
popup.description: A road from the [[Sunset Vale]] through the [[Dragon Coast]], from [[Easting]] to [[Starmantle]].

popup.title: Viper Temple
popup.description: An abandoned temple dedicated to a serpentine [[yuan-ti]] deity that stood on the passage across the [[Sanrach Mountains]].

popup.title: Lantan-Samarach portal
popup.description: An illicit logging camp of the [[Lantan]]ese [[gnome]]s, hidden within the [[Samarlogh]], connected to the island-nation by a ''[[gate]]''.

popup.title: Thelve
popup.description: The largest island located immediately west off the shores of [[Candlekeep]], covered in fissured granite, temperate woodlands, and thousands of seabirds.

popup.title: Arthoum
popup.description: The smallest of the islands west of the shores of the fortress library of [[Candlekeep]], known for its geyser-like blowholes that released clouds of steam and water mist during storms.

popup.title: Nairn's Tomb
popup.description: A small island honeycombed by ancient dwarven tunnels that descended deep into the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Askalet
popup.description: The island named after [[Askalath]], the wizard who once occupied a ruined tower on the island with a long shaft that connected it to the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Skoond's Run
popup.description: The strait that separated the island of [[Thelve]] from the three islands to the south – [[Arthoum]], [[Nairn's Tomb]], and [[Askalet]].

popup.title: Racewind Passage
popup.description: The strait between [[Thelve]], [[Askalet]] and the [[Sword Coast]] mainland that was known for its swift winds during the day and wet fog at night.

popup.title: Sklorn
popup.description: A shipwreck-littered pirate island, home to a species of dimwitted fat [[gray coaster]] seabirds.

popup.title: Unglur
popup.description: The middle of the three islands of the [[Crab Reach]] located west of Thelve, haunted by the dreaded [[Spirit of Unglur]].

popup.title: Raerest
popup.description: The westernmost island of the [[Crab Reach]] once dominated by pirates, later claimed by [[lizardfolk]] of its large unnamed swamp.

popup.title: Cauldron of the Reach
popup.description: The cartographic name given to the hazardous waters between the isle of [[Thelve]] and the trio of islands known as the [[Crab Reach]].

popup.title: Borlyth Bay
popup.description: A small bay with rocky shores named after the monster-infested village of [[Borlyth]] on its northern shore.

popup.title: Cloak Bay
popup.description: Also known as '''Raetheless'' among the [[Fair Folk]], one of the two bays just south of the [[Cloakwood]].

popup.title: Cape Raeth
popup.description: A sparsely-populated peninsula of rocky cliffs to the southwest of the [[Cloakwood]] that formed the western border of [[Cloak Bay]].

popup.title: Orthul's Notch
popup.description: An almost completely abandoned hamlet that survived on salvaging and [[fish]]ing for [[crab]], [[silverfin]]s, and [[laethe]].

popup.title: Candlekeep
popup.description: The famous library-fortress that stood proud as a bastion of enlightenment and knowledge on the [[Sword Coast]].

popup.title: Coast Way
popup.description: A long, well-traveled trade road, a part of the much larger [[Trade Way]] that started at [[Calimport]] in the south and went along the coastline all the way north to [[Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Way of the Lion
popup.description: The path that led from the [[Coast Way]] to [[Candlekeep]].

popup.title: Bandit City
popup.description:
A fortress of the largest bandit tribe in the region – the [[Grey Ghosts]], led by
the outcast [[Chessenta]]n mercenary
[[Furifax]] in the mid 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Deepwing Mountains
popup.description: A small, east-west mountain range populated by a number of large, flying monsters, including [[manticore]]s, [[griffon]]s and [[hippogriff]]s, [[red dragon]]s, and [[wyvern]]s.

popup.title: Elupar
popup.description: A small fishing village in the [[Vilhon Reach]] that stayed out of its [[lizardfolk]] neighbor's – Surkh's business out of fear.

popup.title: Lachom
popup.description: A free city that worked bountiful fiends in the valley between the [[Deepwing Mountains]] and the [[Cloven Mountains]].

popup.title: Aralent
popup.description: The settlement that was the site of the [[House of the Harmed]] temple of [[Ilmater]].

popup.title: Spines of Surkh
popup.description: Or the '''Spines of the Serpent''',  the southern peaks of the [[Deepwing Mountains]], a traditional burial land of the [[lizardfolk]] inhabitants of the city of [[Surkh]].

popup.title: Valley of the Eye
popup.description: A dangerous valley that laid in the heart of the [[Deepwing Mountains]] from whence the [[Vilhon Reach]] began. It was rumored to be home to a colony of beholders.{{approx}}

popup.title: Calyaun
popup.description: A coastal [[fish]]ing village, mostly abandoned due to pirate raids and monster attacks coming from the [[Cloakwood]].

popup.title: Eldelorr
popup.description: A fishing hamlet only inhabited by a few hardy folks who lived on the edge of the [[Cloakwood]].

popup.title: Sumbur Rock
popup.description: A half-abandoned fishing village buildt on a safe anchorage on the tiny peninsula known as the [[Fang (Sword Coast)|Fang]].

popup.title: The Fang
