popup.description: A small point known as the Fang that separated [[Cloak Bay]] from the smaller [[Borlyth Bay]].

popup.title: Borlyth
popup.description: A monster-infested ruined helmet.

popup.title: Ausabbason
popup.description: A sparsely-populated hamlet connected to the [[Coast Way]] by wagon-trail curling southeast around the end of [[Cloakwood]].

popup.title: The Jaws
popup.description: A stretch of rocky beach between [[Ausabbason]] and [[Candlekeep]] with jagged rocks about a mile off the coast, making the area perilous to naval vessels.

popup.title: Ulgoth's Beard
popup.description: A hamlet on the cliffs at the mouth of the river [[Chionthar]], surrounded by rolling grassy hills.

popup.title: Berdusk
popup.description: Also known as the '''Jewel of the Vale''', a city in the [[Sunset Vale]] and the location of the [[Harper]] [[Twilight Hall]].

popup.title: Uldoon Trail
popup.description: The road that ran through the [[Greenfields]] from [[Nashkel]], through [[Greenest]] and [[Berdusk]], before culminating in [[Asbravn]].

popup.title: Trader's Road
popup.description: A road that connected the [[Sunset Vale]] and the [[Dragon Coast]] from [[Easting]] to [[Starmantle]].

popup.title: Bloodhorn
popup.description: A great mountain crag overlooking [[Sessrendale]], lair of [[red dragon]] [[Thraxata]].

popup.title: Tilver's Gap
popup.description: One of the three passes through the [[Thunder Peaks]] mountain range.

popup.title: Semberholme
popup.description: An abandoned [[elf|elven]] city of [[Cormanthyr]], by [[1344 DR]].

popup.title: Sessrenglade
popup.description: A town or village in [[Sessrendale]] and the primary settlement of that realm.

popup.title: Bristar
popup.description: A village of [[moon elves]] in [[Deepingdale]]  that protected the [[Lake Eredruie]], once part of the settlement called '''Velethuil'''.

popup.title: Lake Eredruie
popup.description: An exceptionally beautiful pool fed by the [[Glaemril]] river, protected by the [[moon elves]] of [[Bristar]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Volkumburgh Vale
popup.description: A rugged snowy valley nestled in the [[Thunder Peaks]], south of [[Thunder Gap]].

popup.title: White Ford
popup.description: A fortified and inhabited crossing over the [[River Arkhen]] guarded by [[Archendale]] major garrison.

popup.title: Copper Gulp
popup.description: Numerous [[copper]] mines with a half of them being actively developed.

popup.title: Dancing Place
popup.description: A hidden valley of the [[High Dale]], holy place for many [[elven]] and [[human]] religions.

popup.title: Wyvernfang
popup.description: A large stone summit amid the [[Thunder Peaks]] located just a bit northeast of [[High Dale]] and inhabited by a particularly dangerous roost of [[wyvern]]s.

popup.title: Kulta
popup.description: A settlement in Sembia that lay north of [[Huddagh]] at the end of [[Dornsar's Ride]].

popup.title: Huddagh
popup.description: A settlement in [[Sembia]] that laid along the [[Way of the Manticore]], famed for its unique purple mineral water wells.

popup.title: Infested Hills
popup.description: Hills at the southern end of the [[High Dale]] and the [[Thunder Peaks]].

popup.title: Saerb
popup.description: A small [[Sembia]]n village inhabited by merchants that preferred a quiet life in the countryside instead of the chaos of the cities.

popup.title: Thunder Way
popup.description: A wagon track that passed through the [[High Dale]], connecting [[Saerb]] in [[Sembia]] to [[Thunderstone]] in [[Cormyr]].

popup.title: The Dawnpost
popup.description: A prominent roadway found in [[Sembia]] that connected [[Daerlun]] in the west with [[Ordulin]] in the east

popup.title: Belduuk Road
popup.description: A roadway found in [[Sembia]] that connected [[Saerloon]] in the south with [[Saerb]] in the north.

popup.title: Archenbridge
popup.description: The only major settlement in [[Archendale]] and one of the most important trading hubs in the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: River Arkhen
popup.description: Also known as the '''River Elzimmer''', it was fed by the [[Arkhen Falls]], which emerged from [[Mount Thalagbror]], in the [[Thunder Peaks]].

popup.title: Arkhen Vale
popup.description: A long valley within [[Archendale]], created by the [[River Arkhen]]. Either side of the gorge was beset by steep cliffs leading down into the swift current of the [[Arkhen]].

popup.title: Mount Thalagbror
popup.description: The mountain named after an [[ogre mage]] named [[Thalagbror]], the starting point for the [[River Arkhen]] in the [[Thunder Peaks]].

popup.title: Arkhen Falls
popup.description: The largest and most beautiful waterfall in all of the [[Dalelands]], formed by a spring shooting out from [[Mount Thalagbror]] and cascading down the southern face of the northern ridge of the [[Thunder Peaks]].

popup.title: Mount Drakkor Rouge
popup.description: A semi-extinct, partially flooded volcano in the southern [[Thunder Peaks]].

popup.title: Volkumburgh
popup.description: A tiny rustic village nestled in the foothills of the [[Thunder Peaks]] that traded in [[sheep]] and [[wool]].

popup.title: High Pasture
popup.description: A set of ruins near the village of [[Volkumburgh]].

popup.title: College of Rune Magics
popup.description: A school dedicated to the study and practice of [[rune magic]] situated south of the [[Volkumburgh Vale]] on a wide natural ledge opposite the other college.

popup.title: College of Shaping Magics
popup.description: A school dedicated to the study and practice of shaping magics, situated south of the valley on a wide natural ledge opposite the other college.

popup.title: Temple of the Dragon Oracle
popup.description: A temple constructed by the [[Cult of the Dragon]] within [[Mount Drakkor Rouge]].

popup.title: Dornsar's Ride
popup.description: The road that connected towns of [[Kulta]] and [[Huddagh]].

popup.title: Hilp
popup.description: A small town in southern [[Cormyr]] of many tall, narrow shops with homes above them shingled with slate.

popup.title: Starwater River
popup.description: A major waterway of treacherous sandbars, which made it dangerous to those who were not familiar with them.

popup.title: Hermit's Wood
popup.description: A large forest in southern [[Cormyr]], lying southwest of [[Wheloon]] – a common destination for foragers, hunters, and loggers.

popup.title: Blister Trail
popup.description: A minor road that began in [[Immersea]], curved along the [[Wyvernwater]]'s southern shores and ended in [[Wheloon]].

popup.title: Gladehap
popup.description: A small village nestled within a dell known as the [[Lost Lake]].

popup.title: Mistwood Trail
popup.description: A trail that began in [[Wheloon]] and moved southeast towards the [[Dragonmere]], crossing the [[Evenbrook]], [[Kirinwood]], the [[Kirintar Stream]], and ending in [[Dawngleam]].

popup.title: Marsark's Grove
popup.description: A dangerous monster-infested hole.

popup.title: Nesmyth
popup.description: A farming village in southern [[Cormyr]] with a tumultuous history.

popup.title: Ongul's Water
popup.description: A small community in a wooded valley just northwest of [[Hermit's Wood]], with its only significant industry being a [[gristmill]].

popup.title: Hunters' Isle
popup.description: A small forested island at the center of a small lake – [[Ongul's Water]]'s namesake, that drained into the [[Starwater River]].

popup.title: Bogbrook
popup.description: A farming village in southern [[Cormyr]], named after a spring that rose there to form a marsh.

popup.title: Moonever
popup.description: A small town that supplied [[oyster]]s to the inland communities.

popup.title: Blustich
popup.description: A small hamlet known for its ''windraising'' dances that summoned winds strong enough to blow the [[hickory]] nuts off the [[tree]]s.

popup.title: Immersea
popup.description:
A medium-sized town in the [[Immer Stream Valley]], the ancestral holdings of the [[House Wyvernspur]] of [[Cormyr]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Immersea|here]].

popup.title: Dragoneye Way
popup.description: A small coastal road that connected [[Suzail]] to [[Marsember]].

popup.title: Marsember
popup.description:
The '''City of Spices''', a metropolis and the busiest port in the entire kingdom of [[Cormyr]].

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Marsember|here]].

popup.title: Suzail
popup.description:
The capital of [[Cormyr]] and the seat of power, named after [[Suzara Obarskyr]], the mother of the first king.

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Suzail – 15th Century DR|here]].

popup.title: Kallamarn
popup.description: A small farming village famed for its large, tart, green [[apple]]s called [[Kallamarn Catsheads]].

popup.title: Gray Oaks
popup.description: A small town of farmers just north of [[Calantar's Bridge]].

popup.title: Calantar's Way
popup.description: A long road running north to south between the cities of [[Arabel]] and [[Suzail]].

popup.title: Calantar's Bridge
popup.description: A bridge across the [[Starwater River]], part of the [[Calantar's Way]].

popup.title: Mouth o' Gargoyles
popup.description: A village in the [[King's Forest]], situated on the [[Starwater Road]], where it crossed [[Starwater River]], famed for its [[oil]]s and oilmakers.

popup.title: Westgate
popup.description:
A seedy and squalid metropolis—with a history of piracy, powerful crime syndicates, and nameless vampiric crime-lords.

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Westgate|here]].

popup.title: Reddansyr
popup.description: A small settlement with a well-earned reputation as an adventurers' town because it was a good source of information for such people.

popup.title: Teziir
popup.description: A small city protectorate of [[Cormyr]], protected by a force of 500 warriors of the [[Watch of Teziir]].

popup.title: Pros
popup.description: A small port town, ruined by the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Ilipur
popup.description: A large port town, badly damaged by the [[Spellplague]], later in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], controlled by the band of pirates called the [[Blue Dawn]].

popup.title: Turnstone Road
popup.description: A short road running from the town of [[Pros]] to [[Elversult]].

popup.title: The Plunge
popup.description: A short road that ran from the town of [[Ilipur]] to [[Elversult]].

popup.title: Elversult
popup.description: A rich community and an important trading up and mercantile center that facilitated both honest and illegitimate trade across the [[Eastern Heartlands]] and beyond.

popup.title: Dragonmere
popup.description: Or the '''Lake of Dragons''', a large saltwater lake connected to the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] with its shores belonging to [[Cormyr]], Sembia]], and the [[Dragon Coast]].

popup.title: Priapurl
popup.description: A small town, once besieged by a one-[[orc]] army [[Slogg Ogrum]], defeated by the [[Mindgulph Mercenary Company]] in [[1365 DR]].

popup.title: Proskur
popup.description: A trading city in [[Cormyr]] with a long-standing history of thieves' guilds that operated out in the open and a haven for the unscrupulous [[Red Wizards]].

popup.title: High Road
popup.description: The road that began in [[Easting]], led from to [[Proskur]], into the [[Storm Horns]], through the hamlet of [[Old Axe]] and under [[Skull Crag]], then through the [[Eagle Peak]] before coming to [[High Horn]].

popup.title: Bridge of Fallen Men
popup.description: The bridge across the [[Tun River]], on the [[High Road]] between [[Proskur]] and [[Skull Crag]].

popup.title: Fort Helm
popup.description: A [[Cormyr]]ean fortress of note.

popup.title: Greatgaunt
popup.description: A settlement of note in [[Cormyr]].

popup.title: Crevasse of Lost Fortune
popup.description: A point of interest in the southern [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Temple of Eternal Death
popup.description: A temple of note in the southern [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Marsh of Tun
popup.description: Also known as the '''Fens of Tun''', a moderate-weather swamp lying in the [[Tunlands]] between the [[Sunset Mountains]] and the [[Stormhorns]].

popup.title: Tun Plain
popup.description: Or the '''Tunlands''', a region of grassy steppes and wetlands in the [[Western Heartlands]] roughly encompassing the area between the [[Sunset Mountains]] and the [[Storm Horns]] north of [[Proskur]].

popup.title: Skull Crag
popup.description: A [[human]] hamlet overshadowed by a large rock that had been made into a shrine to [[Kelemvor]].

popup.title: Mine of Cursed Gold
popup.description: A mine of note in the western [[Stormhorns]].

popup.title: Eagle Peak
popup.description: A [[human]] hamlet built on a large outcrop that served as a popular caravan stop.

popup.title: Ruins of Chonis' Temple
popup.description: A ruin of note at the center of the [[Stormhorns]].

popup.title: Valley of Broken Sky
popup.description: A valley of note in western [[Stormhorns]].

popup.title: High Horn
popup.description: A huge [[Cormyte]] military stronghold at the top of [[High Horn mountain]] that guarded the road to the west through [[High Horn Pass]].

popup.title: High Horn Pass
popup.description: A pass leading east to west through the [[Storm Horns]] mountain range into [[Cormyr]], passing close to the mountain [[High Horn]] and to the stronghold of the same name.

popup.title: Lightning Peak
popup.description: A tall peak on note at the heart of the [[Stormhorns]].

popup.title: Aunkspear
popup.description: A village of [[horse]]breeders along [[Calantar's Way]].

popup.title: Blisterfoot Inn
popup.description: An inn that stood by ruins of [[Crownport]] fort in [[Cormyr]].

popup.title: Yeoman Bridge
popup.description: A settlement that stood on a bridge across [[River Arabel]] that laid on the [[Immer Trail]].

popup.title: River Arabel
popup.description: Also known as the '''Sword River''', a river that began in the [[Storm Horns]] and fed the [[Wyvernwater]] from the northwest.

popup.title: The Dead Well
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Umar Hills
popup.description: The foothills of the [[Small Teeth]] mountains on the north and south sides, famous for their legendary [[Umar Witch]] and shepherd trails.

popup.title: Imnesvale
popup.description: A small village located in the [[Umar Hills]], infamous for its legends  of the [[Umar Witch]] that returned every century to capture, torture, and kill villages and their children.{{approx}}

popup.title: Night's Rest Inn
popup.description: A humble roadside inn along the [[Triboar Trail]],

popup.title: Leilon
popup.description: A small mining town located on the edge of a shallow mudflat between the [[Mere of Dead Men]] and the crags of the Sword Mountains. It served as a convenient resting place for weary travelers on the [[High Road]].

popup.title: Phandalin
popup.description: A prosperous village in the 10{{th}} century [[DR]] that was raided and ruined by [[orc]]s, resettled in the late 14{{th}} century DR, ruined by the [[Spellplague]], and resettled once more in the late 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Phandalin Cold Iron Mines
popup.description: Old [[cold iron]] mines taken over by [[orc]]s after [[Phandalin]]'s ruination and reopened in [[1374 DR]].

popup.title: Triboar Trail Region
popup.description: A stretch of foothills and rolling, sparsely-wooded plains extending between the [[Sword Mountains]] to the south and the [[Neverwinter Woods]] to the north.

popup.title: Zundle
popup.description: A village, long-vanished by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Way of the Dragon
popup.description: The road that connected the capital of [[Suzail]] with other towns along [[Cormyr]]'s western region bordering the [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Espar
popup.description: A hamlet in [[Cormyr]], located north of [[Waymoot]], the hometown of the famed [[Knights of Myth Drannor]].

popup.title: Tyrluk
popup.description: A small village at the base of the [[Storm Horn Mountains]]

popup.title: The Warm Waterfall
popup.description: The waterfall that birthed [[Starwater]]s western tributary.

popup.title: Arabel
popup.description: A fortified metropolis known as the '''Caravan City''' of [[Cormyr]] that stood  at an important crossroads of the [[High Road (Cormyr)|High Road]], [[Calantar's Way]], the [[East Way]], and the [[Moonsea Ride]].

popup.title: Minroe
popup.description: A [[gem]]-mining town west of the [[King's Forest]].

popup.title: Waymoot
popup.description: A small town in the [[King's Forest]] where pelts from the [[Thunder Peaks]] and the [[Storm Horns]] were sold.

popup.title: Eveningstar
popup.description: A small unwalled farming town producing [[milk]], [[egg]]s, poultry, [[mutton]], [[carrot]]s, [[bean]]s, and [[parsnip]]s, as well as value-added goods such as [[cheese]], [[parchment]], [[wool]], and [[wine]].

popup.title: Eveningstar Gorge
popup.description: The gorge formed by the [[Starwater River]] that allowed relatively easy access to the [[Helmlands]] and the [[Storm Horns]] being the only route for mounts across the [[Stonecliff]].

popup.title: Stonecliff
popup.description: A perilous rocky escarpment that formed a natural wall along the north side of The [[High Road]] with the [[Eveningstar Gorge]] being the only route that mounts and livestock could take up or down across.

popup.title: Haunted Halls
popup.description: A legendary dungeon located in the western side of the [[Starwater Gorge]].

popup.title: Dhedluk
popup.description: A beautiful small town surrounded by a stockade at the heart of the [[King's Forest]], encircled by massive trees and dappled sunlight.

popup.title: Ranger's Way
popup.description: A short forest trail in the [[King's Forest]] linking [[Waymoot]] and [[Dhedluk]].

popup.title: Collinwood
popup.description: A village located on the edge of the [[King's Forest]] to the south from the [[High Road (Cormyr)|High Road]]

popup.title: Starwater Road
popup.description: The road that began in [[Immersea]], moved west into the [[King's Forest]], and crossed the [[Starwater]] before turning north to terminate at [[Eveningstar]].

popup.title: Plungepool
popup.description: A pond of note in the [[King's Forest]].

popup.title: Stag Steads
popup.description: A collection of small steads used by [[Cormyr]]ean nobility as hunting lodges.

popup.title: River Sharragh
popup.description: A small forest river that fed the [[Plungepool]].

popup.title: Knightswood
popup.description: A settlement of note on the western bank of the [[Starwater]] river.

popup.title: Forgotten Keep
popup.description: A ruined [[Netherese]] lookout tower in the [[Helmlands]].

popup.title: Redspring
popup.description: A settlement of note on the edges of the [[Helmlands]] and the [[Redwoods]].

popup.title: The Redwoods
popup.description: A. small forest at the [[River Arabel]]'s begging on the edge of the [[Helmhands]].

popup.title: Blackstone
popup.description: The [[Theresparin]] family manor, turned haunted mansion after the inhabitants' disappearance in [[1018 DR]]. The manse was claimed by the Crown for safekeeping in case Theresparins were ever to return.

popup.title: Valkur's Roar
popup.description: A settlement if note.

popup.title: King's Forest
popup.description: The forest that belonged to the Crown of [[Cormyr]], once home to [[elves]] but abandoned to humankind.

popup.title: Thunder Peaks
popup.description: The range of mountains that ran in a north–south line, marking the eastern edge of [[Cormyr]].

popup.title: Storm Horns
popup.description: The wild and untamed mountains that marked the western and northern frontier of [[Cormyr]] in the [[Eastern Heartlands]].

popup.title: Telvanlu
popup.description: The capital city of the [[aquatic elf]] kingdom of [[Naramyr]].

popup.title: Overmoor Trail
popup.description: The road that ran from [[Elversult]] northwest to [[Proskur]], passing through the [[Gritstone Moorland]].

popup.title: Lightning Steppes
popup.description: A steppe to the southwest of the [[Dragonmere]].

popup.title: Gritstone Moorland
popup.description: A region of wetlands found on the eastern stretch of the [[Dragon Coast]] in the [[Eastern Heartlands]].

popup.title: Bloodtower
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: The Monolith
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Redwater
popup.description: A settlement that served as a destination for [[Helmite]] pilgrimages.

popup.title: Redwater Lake
popup.description: The lake that was fed by the [[Lake of the Snake]] by means of the [[River Reddan]].

popup.title: Dawngleam
popup.description: A fishing village that launched a joint venture with [[Dragonmere]]'s [[merfolk]] to set up protected their [[clam]] beds.

popup.title: Seaspring
popup.description: A village of note along the [[Darkflow River]]'s eastern shores.

popup.title: Meadow of Red Water
popup.description: A landmark east of the [[Darkflow River]].

popup.title: Nolin
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Water Trail
popup.description: The road that hugged the eastern shore of the [[Darkflow River]], connecting the towns of [[Seaspring]] and [[Nolin]] to [[Kirinwood]] to the west.

popup.title: Jarliel
popup.description: A settlement of note on the western shore of a minor waterway.

popup.title: Koril's Well
popup.description: A landmark of note at the beginning of a minor waterway.

popup.title: Keep of Sir Dirlar
popup.description: A keep on the edge of the [[Vast Sawmp]].

popup.title: Battle of Ponar
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Realm of Wailing Fog
popup.description: A mysterious boggy territory under constant cover of mists with echoing eery calls traveling through the air. Even [[dragon]]s were afraid to talk about that realm.

popup.title: Cliff of Lost Lovers
popup.description: A cliff landmark of note.

popup.title: Tilverton Scar
popup.description: A ruined city of [[Tilverton]] as of [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Halfhap
popup.description: A heavily fortified small town that held a large [[Purple Dragons]] garrison.

popup.title: Goblin Burial Ground
popup.description: A stronghold of note.

popup.title: Shouk's Ambush
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Battle of Broken Bones
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Bospir
popup.description: A small sheep market town accessible from the [[East Way]] via a minor trail.

popup.title: Masoner's Bridge
popup.description: A bridge across the [[Immerflow]], part of the [[East Way]].

popup.title: Hillmarch
popup.description: A small mining town famed for its production of high-quality brasswork.

popup.title: Dragon Trail
popup.description: A trail that connected the [[Mountain Ride]] to the mining town of [[Hillmarch]].

popup.title: Mountain Ride
popup.description: A part of the [[Calantar's Way]] that split into the [[Stonebolt Trail]] and the [[Moonsea Ride]] after passing through the [[Gnoll Pass]].

popup.title: Battle of South Horn
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Lake of the Snake
popup.description: A small lake on the [[Dragon Coast]], south of the [[Horse Prairie]] and east of the [[Giant's Run]].
popup.image: File:Lake of the Snake and Lake of Snows.png

popup.title: Wyrm's Hamlet
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: Horse Prairie
popup.description: A land area in the [[Dragon Coast]] that ran from the [[Castaway Coast]] on the [[Dragonmere]] in the north, to the [[Giant's Run]] mountains to the south.

popup.title: Blacknight Manor
popup.description: The manse of [[Indrith Shalla]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ginger Palace
popup.description: The trade embassy of [[Shou Lung]] in the [[Eastern Heartlands]].

popup.title: Nameless Swamp
popup.description: A wetland of note.

popup.title: Smuggler's Bank
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: River Reddan
popup.description: The river that ran east by northeast from the [[Lake of the Snake]] towards the [[Redwater]].

popup.title: Cliffs of Karthaut
popup.description: Coastal cliffs of note.

popup.title: Snake Road
popup.description: The road that crossed the [[Horse Prairie]], connecting [[Elversult]] with [[Wyrm's Hamlet]].

popup.title: River Lurlar
popup.description: A humble waterway of note.

popup.title: Caves of Hurok
popup.description: An underwater landmark of note.

popup.title: Lake of the Long Arm
popup.description: A vast lake found in the [[Dragon Coast]] region with the [[Shou]] nation of [[Nathlan]] located on its souther shores.

popup.title: Old Axe
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Maloren's Rest
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Mage Keep
popup.description: A keep of note.

popup.title: Swords Hollow
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: Threetrees
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: Nyka's Rest
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: Sunset Mountains
popup.description: A pair of mountain ranges separated by the [[Far Hills]], an almost impenetrable barrier between the [[Eastern Heartlands|Eastern]] and [[Western Heartlands]].

popup.title: Far Hills
popup.description: A group of high landrises located in the [[Western Heartlands]] and separated the [[Sunset Mountains]] into two ranges.

popup.title: Yellow Snake Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass in the northern [[Sunset Mountains]], where the [[River Reaching]] began its flow.

popup.title: Wormtower
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Smuggler's Stone
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Accardi
popup.description: A small coastal village connected to the city of [[Westgate]] by a trail.

popup.title: Castaway Coast
popup.description: A section of coastline along the [[Dragonmere]] between the towns of [[Pros]] and [[Teziir]].

popup.title: The Skeleton Shore
popup.description: The coastline along the [[Dragonmere]] that stretched from [[Teziir]] in the west all the way to [[Westgate]].

popup.title: Nalufaen
popup.description: A sub nautical settlement of note.

popup.title: Corsuor
popup.description: A small underwater settlement of [[aquatic elves]].

popup.title: Easting
popup.description: A small town in the [[Western Heartlands]], once home to the great sage and expert botanist named [[Rulthaven]].

popup.title: Burning Eye
popup.description: A tall mountain of the [[Sunset Mountains]] with a large signal tower at its summit used to alert settlements, including [[Easting (town)|Easting]].{{approx}}

popup.title: High Moors
popup.description: A stretch of mist-covered uncultivated land on the frontier of [[Cormyr]].

popup.title: Dusk Road
popup.description: A moderately traveled trade road that started at [[Elturel]] and ended at [[Iriaebor]].

popup.title: Darkhold
popup.description: The westernmost of three strongholds within which the [[Zhentarim]] consolidated their power. It stood on the side of the [[Grey Watcher]] mountain.

popup.title: Grey Watcher
popup.description: The mountain where the infamous citadel of the [[Darkhold]] stood within the [[Darkhold Vale]].

popup.title: Iriaebor
popup.description: The '''City of a Thousand Spires''', a large city-state within the nation of [[Elturgard]], known for its political squabbles all well documented in the local [[chapbook]] called ''[[Malanxer's Tongue]].''

popup.title: Elturel
popup.description: A city-state on the [[River Chionthar]], the center of agriculture and trade in the region.

popup.title: Troll Hills
popup.description: A series of hills along the coastal area of the [[Western Heartlands]], covered in [[oak]] [[tree]]s and patches of [[razorgrass]].

popup.title: Kheldrivver
popup.description: A small hamlet founded as a monastic community worshiping [[Oghma]], the Patron of all Bards.

popup.title: Winding Water
popup.description: The river that flowed from several tributaries as far away as the [[Marsh of Chelimber]], and eventually flowed into the [[Sea of Swords]] south of the [[Troll Hills]].

popup.title: Roaringshore
popup.description: A small lawless and isolated village nestled in a small deepwater cove on the coast.

popup.title: Lathtarl's Lantern
popup.description: A small fishing village at the mouth of the [[Winding Water]].

popup.title: Warlock's Crypt
popup.description: The keep home to the ancient [[lich]] [[wizard]] [[Larloch]], the Shadow King, a survivor of the fallen empire of [[Netheril]].

popup.title: Trollclaws
popup.description: A region of [[troll]]-infested hills along the [[Sword Coast]].

popup.title: Fields of the Dead
popup.description: A stretch of rolling hills east of [[Baldur's Gate]] littered with bones of the dead of many ancient battles.

popup.title: Trollclaw Ford
popup.description: A hamlet located where the [[Winding Water]] was crossed by the [[Coast Way]].

popup.title: Thundar's Ride
popup.description: A moderately traveled trade road that branched southwest off of the [[Trade Way]] just south of [[Boareskyr Bridge]] and merged with the [[Coast Way]] a few miles north of [[Baldur's Gate]].

popup.title: Skuldask Road
popup.description: A moderately traveled trade road that branched off of [[Thundar's Ride]] near the center of the [[Fields of the Dead]], passed [[Elturel]], and ended just south of [[Berdusk]].

popup.title: Tempus's Tears
popup.description: The village at the intersection of the [[Skuldask Road]] and [[Thundar's Ride]] inhabited by [[dwarves]] and [[gnomes]].

popup.title: The Friendly Arm Inn
popup.description: A walled fortress and a hamlet with the inn rising high above the town walls, with its serving wenches rumored to be magically disguised [[iron golem]]s.

popup.title: Lizard Marsh
popup.description: A large [[lizardfolk]], giant insect, [[black dragon]]-infested bayou in the delta of the [[Delimbiyr]] river.

popup.title: Misty Forest
popup.description: A fog-filled, rainy forest, west of the [[High Moor]], that was also an [[elf|elven]] kingdom.

popup.title: Gillian's Hill
popup.description: The smallest of the four hamlets that laid on the [[Trade Way]] that stretched to the south of [[Daggerford]]. The town was named after [[Gillian Cantilar]], the famed protector of the Trade Way.

popup.title: Liam's Hold
popup.description: A small hamlet about a day's travel south of [[Daggerford]] nestled at the top of te two-acre-wide flat-topped tor of rock that overlooked the area.

popup.title: The Stronghold
popup.description: A small keep that once was used as a monastery and a hidden temple of [[Bhaal]], abandoned during the [[Time of Troubles]] and later gifted to the [[Hero of Daggerford]] in [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Bowshot
popup.description: A town named for its location, being a "bowshot" from the [[Misty Forest]] when the village was founded.

popup.title: The Way Inn
popup.description: A famous landmark and a caravan stop on the [[Trade Way]] situated atop a grassy plateau.

popup.title: High Moor
popup.description: A large, monster-infested, open moorland in [[western Faerûn]], created in about [[-10500 DR]] when the kingdom of [[Miyeritar]] fell.

popup.title: Reaching Woods
popup.description: A large forest in the [[Western Heartlands]] with its northern offshoot being called the '''Northdark Wood'''.

popup.title: Skull Gorge
popup.description: A long, steep, and narrow gorge that ran along the northernmost stretch of the [[River Reaching]] just downstream of the [[Misty Stair]] waterfalls.

popup.title: Misty Stair
popup.description: Waterfalls that birthed [[River Reaching]] in the [[Sunset Mountains]].

popup.title: Hill's Edge
popup.description: A city on the [[Dusk Road]] also known as the '''Forgotten City of Sunset Vale'''.

popup.title: Drawn Swords
popup.description: An isolated village found in the [[Backlands]] of the [[Western Heartlands]] that sat atop a hill with the tower of [[Swordskeep]] at its center, surrounded by rows of cottages.

popup.title: Dusk Road
popup.description:
A moderately traveled trade road that circled the [[Reaching Woods]] and its [[Forest of the Wyrms]] offshoot to the north, connecting [[Asbravn]], [[Elturel]], and everything in between.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Marsh of Chelimber
popup.description: A marsh or pungent [[sulfur]]ous steam pools inhabited by numerous [[lizardfolk]], [[bullywug]]s, and [[siv]]s.

popup.title: Greycloak Hills
popup.description: A small group of hills and mountains located north of [[Evereska]], known as the '''Tomb Hills''' in the days before the [[moon elf]] settlement.

popup.title: Evereska
popup.description:
The hidden city-fortress of the [[elves]] in the North.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Halfway Inn
popup.description:
A tavern and inn located in the mountains near [[Evereska]] used as a mercantile hub for the [[elves]] to trade with the other denizens of the north.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Serpent Hills
popup.description: A range of rocky hills in the [[Western Heartlands]] inhabited by snakes, [[yuan-ti]], and [[grimlock]]s.

popup.title: Hammer Hall
popup.description: A log house and adjoining stables, surrounded by a wooden palisade built by [[Men of Hammer Hall]] to serve as the base of operation for delving into the [[Halls of the Hammer]].

popup.title: Halls of the Hammer
popup.description: An old [[dwarf|dwarven]] stronghold that had been long-abandoned by the mid—14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Orogoth
popup.description: One of the most dangerous locations in the [[High Moor]] – a ruined villa inhabited by [[black dragon]]s and connected it to the [[Serpent Tunnels]] of [[Najara]].

popup.title: Xonthal's Tower
popup.description: An isolated settlement found within the [[Savage Frontier]] inhabited by herders, farmers, and fishers, built around an [[Xonthal's Tower|enigmatic black tower]].

popup.title: Mount Hlim
popup.description: The southernmost peak of the [[Greypeak Mountains]] that towered over the village of [[Xonthal's Tower (village)|Xonthal's Tower]].

popup.title: Serpent's Tail Stream
popup.description: A flooding river stream lined with gravel that ran through [[Najara]] in the [[Western Heartlands]].

popup.title: Forest of Wyrms
popup.description: Also known as '''Ss'kowlyn'raa'' by the [[yuan-ti]], a dark and dangerous forest of  [[pine]]s and tall [[redwood]] [[tree]]s.

popup.title: Yarthrain
popup.description: A small village comprised a handful of great stone houses that surrounded a ruined stone castle, founded in the late 13{{th}} century [[DR]], by the [[Amn]]ian mercenary [[Zelarravyan Fangshield]].

popup.title: Hill of Lost Souls
popup.description: A lone mountain that stood in the middle of [[Pelleor's Prairie]] in the [[Backlands]], haunted by the [[ghost]]s of fallen [[human]], [[goblin]], and [[orc]] soldiers.
popup.image: File:Hill of Lost Souls treasure map.PNG

popup.title: Pelleor's Prairie
popup.description: A large, a warm, dry, and windy grassland located in the [[Backlands]].

popup.title: Asbravn
popup.description: A small town found in the [[Western Heartlands]] that lay in a shallow valley in between the [[Dusk Road]] and the [[Uldoon Trail]].

popup.title: Hluthvar
popup.description: A walled trade town on the [[Dusk Road]] in the [[Sunset Vale]], east of the Reaching Woods.

popup.title: Corm Orp
popup.description: A small fast-growing [[hin]] town in the [[Western Heartlands]] famed for its unique species of [[grape]]s known as "blue eyes," used to produce sour [[wine]]s and grape-based dyes for export.

popup.title: Qheldin's Mask
popup.description: A small fishing, hunting, and farming river hamlet.

popup.title: River Reaching
popup.description: The waterway that began in the [[Sunset Mountains]], flowed through the [[Skull Gorge]], entered the [[Reaching Woods]], and finally emerged to pour into the [[River Chionthar]] near [[Scornubel]].

popup.title: Fendarl's Gate
popup.description:
A small shepherd village on the upper [[River Chionthar]] with its tiny castle and an inn resting atop a rocky knob beside the bank.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Trielta Hills
popup.description: Hills, home to many communities of [[gnome]]s and a few [[halfling]]s with occasional [[silver]] and [[gold]] mining operations.

popup.title: Hardbuckler
popup.description:
A small town of [[gnome]]s and a favorite stop for traders along the [[Dusk Road]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Well of Dragons
popup.description: The fortress operated by the [[Cult of the Dragon]], built within a dormant volcano that once served as an ancient [[dragon]] graveyard.

popup.title: Ladydove
popup.description: Once a village, mostly destroyed by a [[dire dragon]] by the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], with only the [[Dire Dragon Inn]] still being inhabited after the ruination.

popup.title: Highstar Lake
popup.description: A legendary body of water located in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]], known for many mystifying appearances and mysterious disappearances.

popup.title: Hark River
popup.description: The waterway that fed the [[Highstar Lake]] from the west, sprouting off the [[Delimbiyr River]].

popup.title: Dungeon of the Hark
popup.description: An underground bandit stronghold beneath the ruined village of [[Moorsedge]], on the northern edge of the plateau that held the [[High Moor]].

popup.title: South Wood
popup.description: A forest within the [[Triangle of Trees]] in the [[Savage Frontier]], a popular stomping grounds for the outdoorsmen of [[Gray Vale]].

popup.title: Zelbross
popup.description: A hamlet in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]] on the [[Delimbiyr Route]], halfway between [[Loudwater]] and [[Secomber]].

popup.title: Loudwater
popup.description: Also known as the ''City of Grottos''', a picturesque garden city home to a pleasant and thriving cosmopolitan community of [[human]]s, [[half-elves]], and [[elves]] venerating [[Mielikki]].

popup.title: Cave of Blooming Stone
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Phantom's Cloister
popup.description: A haunted ruined cloister.

popup.title: Orlbar
popup.description: A village on the junction of the [[Loagrann]] and [[Greyflow]] rivers.
popup.image: File:Orlbar and Fortress of the Eternal Despot.jpg

popup.title: Grayflow
popup.description: The waterway that began in the [[Graypeak Mountains]], ran northward toward [[Llorkh]], before veering west. It was joined by the river [[Loagrann]] south of [[Orlbar]], and then flowed into the [[Delimbiyr River]] with a confluence at [[Loudwater]].

popup.title: Loagrann River
popup.description: The river that was formed by the joining of three tributaries—two of which were named [[Skull Creek]] and [[Whitewater]]—flowed from the northern part of the [[Greypeak Mountains]].

popup.title: Skull Creek
popup.description: One of the three tributaries of the [[Loagrann River]] that cascaded from the northern part of the [[Greypeak Mountains]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Whitewater
popup.description: One of the three tributaries of the [[Loagrann River]] that cascaded from the northern part of the [[Greypeak Mountains]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Delimbiyr Road
popup.description: Also known as the '''Delimbiyr Route''' and the '''Shining Trail''', the road ran from [[Loudwater]] in the east to the [[Trade Way]], north of [[Daggerford]].

popup.title: Tanglefork Woods
popup.description: A small forest in the [[Grayvale]], at the southwestern fringe of the great [[High Forest]], between it and the [[River Delimbiyr]] and the [[Delimbiyr Road]] and just east of the [[Heartblood River]] where it joined the Delimbiyr.

popup.title: Heartblood River
popup.description: The river that started somewhere in the [[Star Mounts]] and joined the river [[Delimbiyr]] just off the eastern edge of the [[High Forest]].

popup.title: Shining Falls
popup.description: A stunningly beautiful waterfall in the [[Graypeak Mountains]] that formed part of the [[River Delimbiyr]] and marked the beginning of the [[Delimbiyr Vale]].

popup.title: Llorkh
popup.description:
A large [[human]] town in the [[Gray Vale]], decimated by [[stone giant]]s in the late 1400s [[DR]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Forgotten Forest
popup.description: A small but mysterious forest of [[treant]]s and [[fey]] creatures found in the [[Backlands]] of the [[Western Heartlands]].

popup.title: Triboar
popup.description: Also called the '''Town Where Only Gwaeron Sleeps''', a proud and lively trading town of roaming merchants, caravanners, and other travelers.

popup.title: Purple Hills
popup.description: A range of hills on the coast of [[Tethyr]] lying in [[County Vintor]] in the duchy of the [[Purple Marches]].

popup.title: Jester's Green
popup.description: A small town named after a small inn of the same name that was destroyed by a ''[[meteor swarm]]'' after the innkeeper tried to swindle a [[Red Wizard]].

popup.title: Northbank
popup.description: The land north of the [[Starwater River]].

popup.title: The Sward
popup.description: The land on the [[Starwater]]'s southern shores, west of the [[Calantar's Way]].

popup.title: Gorthin
popup.description: A hamlet north of [[Kirinwood]] by the source of the [[Evenbrook]] with its inhabitants foraging in the nearby bogs, guarded by the local [[druid]]s.

popup.title: Mistwater River
popup.description: I minor waterway with two tributaries: the [[Evenbrook]] by the hamlet of [[Gorthin]] and the [[Kirinar Stream]] south of [[Kirinwood]].

popup.title: Kirinar Stream
popup.description: One of the [[Mistwater River]]'s tributaries.

popup.title: Evenbrook
popup.description: One of the [[Mistwater River]]'s tributaries.

popup.title: Sunset Hill
popup.description: A thinly spread-out hamlet built around a famously haunted hill of the same name.

popup.title: Slingdyke
popup.description: A settlement of note that laid just west of the [[Mountain Ride]] and southwest of its crossing with the [[Dragon Trail]].

popup.title: The Laughing Head
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Mount Shalandragar
popup.description: A mountain of note, south of the [[High Horn]] and west of [[Espar]].

popup.title: Griffon Hill
popup.description: A thorp in the [[East Reaches]] on the edge of the [[Stonelands]], named after [[griffon]] population, long-gone by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Hornshield
popup.description: A settlement of note at the foothills of [[Mount Shalandragar]] in the [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Huthduth
popup.description: A mountain shepherd village just east off of the [[High Road]].

popup.title: Nathlekh
popup.description: The '''City of Cats''', the capital of the [[Shou]] nation of [[Nathlan]].

popup.title: Cedarsproke
popup.description: Also known as the '''Garden of Eldath''', a small, independent city in the middle of the [[Gulthmere Forest]], inhabited and ruled by [[druids]].

popup.title: Starmantle
popup.description: Once a busy port city, it was turned to bruins by the [[Spellplague]] in [[1385 DR]] and was resettled by the late 15{{th}} century DR, reaching the size of a village.

popup.title: Gulthmere Forest
popup.description: The forest that served as the rough boundary between the [[Dragon Coast]] and the [[Vilhon Reach]]. Overgrown with [[pine]] and [[cedar]], it was the "seat of power" for the Vilhonese [[druid]]s.

popup.title: Telpir
popup.description: An independent city on the [[Dragon Coast]] north of [[Turmish]], with the nation's borders within eyesight of Telpir's walls.

popup.title: Amry
popup.description: A coastal settlement found along the eastern stretch of the [[Dragon Coast]] that had a good trading relationship with the [[Fellowship of the Purple Staff]].

popup.title: Storna
popup.description: An island in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] not far from [[Telpir]], used as a monster-breeding ground by [[Endreth Molipher]] and three [[wizard]] business partners starting around [[1359 DR]].

popup.title: Whamite Isles
popup.description: A cluster of small islands in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], controlled by the [[Emerald Enclave]] after [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: Wayrock
popup.description: An island and an 11,000-ft. (3,400-m) mountain in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]. It held ruins, and a temple of [[Cyric]] the Mad God.

popup.title: Starmantle Bay
popup.description: The bay that stretched from [[Starmantle]] to the east.

popup.title: Treefall Pass
popup.description: A narrow path through where the [[Mountains of the Alaoreum]] met the [[Orsraun Mountains]].

popup.title: Cedar River
popup.description: A waterway that passed through the [[Gulthmere Forest]] used by merchants and traders of [[Cedarspoke]].

popup.title: South Cedar River
popup.description: Also known as the '''Xian River''', the southern tributary of the [[Cedar River]].

popup.title: Orsraun Mountains
popup.description: The largest range of mountains south of the [[Spine of the World]].

popup.title: Orbrekh
popup.description: A slim branch of the [[Orsraun Mountains]] inhabited by a [[mountain giant]] clan called the "]]community of the high brows]]."

popup.title: North Cedar River
popup.description: The northern tributary of the [[Cedar River]].

popup.title: Baernwood
popup.description: A hamlet was due west of [[Telpir]], within the treeline at the [[Gulthmere Forest]]'s western edge.

popup.title: Nleeth
popup.description: A [[Turmish]]-sponsored tourism-financed city-state, one of the [[Free Cities of the Vilhon Reach]].

popup.title: Amah
popup.description: A city-state of the [[Free Cities of the Vilhon Reach]] that maintained neutrality between [[Turmish]] and [[Chondath]].

popup.title: Aelor
popup.description: Once a bustling mining town, it stumbled into decline and was mostly abandoned until being resettled some years before [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: Mmount Ugruth
popup.description: A mountain of note, home to the fearsome [[Candlekairn]] clan of [[orc]]s.

popup.title: Hlondeth
popup.description: The '''City of Serpents''', an ancient and powerful city-state ruled by the [[Extaminos]] family, with mixed blood that was not quite [[human]].

popup.title: Churning Bay
popup.description: The violent gulf on the Vilhon Reach, where the city of [[Hlondeth]] was founded.

popup.title: Bare Bones Hill
popup.description: A hilly plot of land nestled between the [[Halondar]] and the [[Aphrunn Mountains]] in the southwestern part of the [[Halondar Valley]],  favored by the lovers seeking a tryst during annual celebrations of the F[[east of the Moon]].

popup.title: Mount Kolimnis
popup.description: Or '''Eversmoke''', a well-known active volcano in the [[Aphrunn Mountains]] of [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Lightless Lake
popup.description: Also known as the '''Moonmere''', the lake that hid the [[Fane of Shadows]] dedicated to [[Shar]].

popup.title: Fane of Shadows
popup.description: A temple that journeyed the worlds on the currents of the secret [[Weave]]. It materialized on a certain date at midnight and stayed only temporarily in each world for a short time.

popup.title: Monastery of Oghma
popup.description: A small monastery in the [[Gulthmere Forest]] dedicated to the worship of the deity [[Oghma]], destroyed in the late 1300s [[DR]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Prespur
popup.description: A duo of islands with the [[Cormyer]]ean town of [[Palaggar]] located on the larger one and [[Sembian]] town of [[Uarhold]] on the smaller one – the [[Traitor's Isle]].

popup.title: Greenest
popup.description: The only sizable town along the [[Uldoon Trail]] in the [[Greenfields]].

popup.title: Greenfields
popup.description: A geographical region of rolling grasslands in the [[Western Heartlands]].

popup.title: Scornubel
popup.description: Also known as the [[Caravan City]], a major tradestop for caravans and merchant barges.

popup.title: Triel
popup.description: A small village in the [[Fields of the Dead]].

popup.title: Soubar
popup.description: A small village on the [[Trade Way]].

popup.title: Boareskyr Bridge
popup.description: A major landmark and a bridge invaluable for trade in the surrounding regions.

popup.title: Fort Tamal
popup.description: Formerly known as [[Bridgefort]], a fortified keep rebuilt and strengthened ''circa'' [[1450 DR]].

popup.title: Troll Claw Woods
popup.description: A small forested area of the [[Troll Claws]] infested with giant [[boring beetle|boring]] and [[bombardier beetle]]s, [[monstrous humanoid]]s, [[giant spider]], and, of corse, [[troll]]s.

popup.title: Coast Way Crossing
popup.description: The crossing of the [[Coast Way]] and the [[Winding Water]], east of the [[Coast Way forest]].

popup.title: Coast Way Forest
popup.description: A minor forested area west of the [[Coast Way crossing]].

popup.title: Bloodbark Grove
popup.description: A grove of [[blackthorn tree]]s and [[belladonna]] plants in the southern stretch of the [[High Moor]], inhabited by greater [[basilisk]]s, [[dire wolves|dire]], as well as [[dread wolves]].

popup.title: Dead Man's Pass
popup.description: A rocky passage, part of the [[Trade Way]], just southeast of [[Dragonspear Castle]].

popup.title: Dragonspear Castle
popup.description: A [[dwarf|dwarven]] fortress with a tumultuous history, serving as home to [[monstrous humanoid]]s, becoming the battleground for two wars between [[Faerûn]]ians and [[devil]]s from the [[Nine Hells]], and used as a stronghold by the [[angel]]ic [[Shining Lady]] during her crusade against Hells.

popup.title: Battle of Bones
popup.description: An old battlefield in the [[Western Heartlands]] encircled by mountains of  [[basalt]] and [[limestone]], infested by [[undead]].

popup.title: Trollbark Forest
popup.description: A forest with low vales that hid a multitude of bogs and swamps, inhabited by [[giant slug]]s, [[fell troll]]s, and [[choker]]s.

popup.title: Orlumbor
popup.description: A small rocky barren island and a city-state famed for its skilled, in-demand shipwrights.

popup.title: Blade Cliffs
popup.description: A chain of dangerous high cliffs with its lands belonging to the [[Exeltis]] family.

popup.title: Castle Exeltis
popup.description: The estate of the [[Exeltis]] family and a once-famed winery that produced [[Exeltis Ice Wine]] from a species of unique local [[grape]]s.

popup.title: Crab's Claw Coast
popup.description: A wild patch of crooked coastal cliffs and steep ridges, named not for crabs but for the cliffs' shape. Its many coastal caves and grottoes were popular among pirates and smuggles.

popup.title: Wild Pastures
popup.description: A plot of lush wildland used as dangerous pastures by the shepherds of [[Liam's Hold]].

popup.title: Wild Hills
popup.description: A barren plot of land that stretched between the [[Lizard Marsh]] and the hamlet of [[Gillian's Hill]].

popup.title: Lonely Barrens
popup.description: A craggy and secluded area located to the south of the [[Delimbiyr River ]]and east of [[Daggerford]] with private [[Edalseye's Tower]] rising from a single bridgeless crag.

popup.title: Brush of Barbs
popup.description: A secluded and thorny overgrown forest, home of [[Govan Irfandel|Irfandel]]'s druidic [[Stone Circle of Govan]].

popup.title: Wyvernhunt
popup.description: A shepherding community in the western foothills of the [[Storm Horns]] in the vicinity of the [[Wyvernhunt Keep]].

popup.title: Battlegate Castle
popup.description: A ruined castle atop a hill, once the seat of the extinct [[Auantiver]] noble family.

popup.title: Journey's Rest
popup.description: The inn that was operated by the [[vampire]]s [[Ryanna]] and [[Moria]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ironguard
popup.description: A "stonedelve" tomb in the [[Stonelands]].

popup.title: Arabel Springs
popup.description: The source of the [[River Arabel]], located in the hills just southeast of [[Arabel]] city.

popup.title: Border Outpost
popup.description: A fort of note, west of [[Ironguard (tomb)|Ironguard]] and north of [[Arabel]].

popup.title: Irondrake Rock
popup.description: The ruin, collapsed in [[1357 DR]] by [[Shandril Shessair]], killing a clone of [[Manshoon]].

popup.title: Tethgard
popup.description: An ancient, ruined city of overgrown and mostly isolated pillars, arches, half-arches, and stairs, guarded by [[watching spirit]] of [[Duskreene]], Lady of Tethgard.

popup.title: Witch-Lord's Castle
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Rivior's Keep
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: DaRoni's Cave
popup.description: Home to [[Nadul DaRoni]],  a [[gnomish]] hermit, artist, and inventor.

popup.title: Dark Wind Pass
popup.description: A minor mountain pass across the [[Storm Horns]].

popup.title: Hunting Lodge
popup.description: A hunting lodge of note.

popup.title: Mistinarperadnacles's Lair
popup.description: An abandoned shrine cavern, turned into the [[red dragon]] [[Mistinarperadnacles Hai Draco]]'s lair.

popup.title: Alaghôn
popup.description: An ancient metropolis and the capital of [[Turmish]] and a busy port hub.

popup.title: Karsus's Keep
popup.description: A destroyed keep of note.

popup.title: Krigala Gate
popup.description: A ''[[gate]]'' to the plane of [[Krigala]].

popup.title: Ilimar
popup.description: A long-ruined [[sarrukh]] city from the time of the empires of [[Isstosseffifil]] and [[Mhairshaulk]].

popup.title: Vamar's Tower
popup.description: The tower home to a hermit [[lich]] who lived in [[Serôs]] and studied aquatic magics.

popup.title: Machran Spire
popup.description: A mountainous outcropping of [[granite]] found near the village of [[Gurnth]].

popup.title: Gurnth
popup.description: A village inhabited by [[human]] [[Nobanion]]-cultists who followed the "survival of the fittest" creed.

popup.title: Ilsaadya
popup.description: An underwater village of  [[ixitxachitl]].

popup.title: Anaxadren
popup.description: One of the Six Holy Cities of the [[ixitxachitl]] nation in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Skull Crag Keep
popup.description: The keep of the [[Roadwarden Guard]], the patrolmen of the [[High Road (Cormyr)|High Road]].

popup.title: Ilrham
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Xyladren
popup.description: One of the Six Holy Cities of the [[ixitxachitl]] nation in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], known as the [[Xedran Reefs]].

popup.title: Ilkab
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Ilonem
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Xedras
popup.description: An aquatic city of note.

popup.title: Berydren
popup.description: One of the Six Holy Cities of the [[ixitxachitl]] nation in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], known as the [[Xedran Reefs]].

popup.title: Ilsyries
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Ilderus
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Cliffs of Atin
popup.description: Sea-cliffs on the border of [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Starfall Stream Pool
popup.description: A settlement that was one of the most popular rendezvous spots for lovers who sought intimacy during the [[Feast of the Moon]], also called the [[Festival of Lovers]].

popup.title: Anglaspark's Lair
popup.description: Lair of the [[blue dragon]] son of a ruler of [[Turmish]], dragon [[Anaglathos]].

popup.title: Anaglathos' Lair
popup.description: The infamous lair of the [[blue dragon]] ruler of [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Temple of Grumbar
popup.description: A temple dedicated to [[Grumbar]], the King of the Land Below the Roots, located at the heart of the [[Orsrauns]].

popup.title: Eldath's Gate
popup.description: A magic ''[[gate]]'' of note.

popup.title: South River
popup.description: A small [[elf|elven]] village with a small population of [[human]]s and [[halfling]]s who migrated there across the mountains in the early-to-mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Xorhun
popup.description: Also known as '''Corellon's Cradle''' and '''Lifeblood Falls''', a city inhabited by [[elves]] and [[gnome]]s – a community that hearkened back to an ancient elven civilization.

popup.title: Gildenglade
popup.description: A metropolis buried under several hundred feet of ash and hot mud in [[1423 DR]], with the dead counting at almost 50,000.

popup.title: Lake of Drifting Stars
popup.description: A freshwater lake and a popular rendezvous spot for lovers who sought a romantic encounter during the [[Feast of the Moon]].

popup.title: Nonthal
popup.description: A city, reputed for being the most peaceful and stable in the nation of [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Oberiner's Well
popup.description: A beautiful and peaceful place around [[1360 DR]], turned a lawless haven for criminals.

popup.title: Jathrin's Jump
popup.description: A virtually lawless town by high cliffs with its economy fueled by black market trade, stolen goods, and illicit substances.

popup.title: Centaur Bridge
popup.description: A small town named after a stone bridge that arched over a small pond located in the ancient deep [[Dancing Forest]].

popup.title: Dancing Forest
popup.description: A small forest that grew along the [[Turmway]] and sheltered the town of [[Centaur Bridge]], notable for its seemingly permanent thick white mist.

popup.title: Draconnis' Lair
popup.description: The cave once inhabited by a tribe of [[hill giant]]s and their leader – glutinous [[blue dragon]] [[Draconnis]].

popup.title: Halfling Settlement Ruins
popup.description: A halfling village of burrows and overgrown hovels, including a tavern and a shrine to a hin deity, abandoned by the 1360s [[DR]].

popup.title: Mount Andrus
popup.description: A semi-active volcano, sacred to the [[Church of Talos]], located in the [[Mountains of the Alaoreum]] in [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Mountains of the Alaoreum
popup.description: A collection of northern peaks in the [[Orsraun Mountains]] set apart from the rest of the range by [[Treefall Pass]], overlooked the [[Gulthmere Forest]].

popup.title: Ironfang Deep
popup.description: Sometimes mistakenly labeled as '''Ironfang Keep''', or called the '''Kingdom of Ironfang''' by the dwarves, was the main underground settlement in the [[Mountains of the Alaoreum]].

popup.title: Swordslake Creek
popup.description: A humble [[human]] mining hamlet built around a keep; however, by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], the keep was nothing but a shattered ruin.

popup.title: Morningstar Hollows
popup.description: Once was a small fishing village, abandoned due to the continual flooding of the [[Alaoreum River]], by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] – home to a tribe of [[lizardfolk]].

popup.title: Alaoreum River
popup.description: A flooding river that began in the [[Mountains of the Alaoreum]], ran south along the shoreline of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], and ended in [[Evenstar Lake]].

popup.title: Evenstar Lake
popup.description: The lake fed by the [[Alaoreum River]] in the [[Evenstar Vale]], surrounded by dense forests.

popup.title: Merrydell
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Banathar
popup.description: Also called '''Banthar''', a small mining village in [[Turmish]] with a shrine dedicated to [[Silvanus]] among its very few landmarks.

popup.title: Regalia
popup.description: A village of note.

popup.title: Illowwood
popup.description: A forest-village named after a lush dense stand of [[shadowtop]]s just to the west.

popup.title: Ironcloak
popup.description: A ruined town – a brutal example of how the [[Emerald Enclave]] dealt with those who damaged the environment.

popup.title: Ravilar's Cloak
popup.description: A wild and rowdy mining town, a hot-spot for treasure seekers.

popup.title: Dauntshield
popup.description: A small and sleepy village atop a rock ridge with a rich industrial past.

popup.title: Quorngar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Ulver's Lance
popup.description: A quiet little town in [[Turmish]] with its main industry being cart-building and [[wood]]carving.

popup.title: The Five Lions
popup.description: A quaint inn on a side-trail a little way beyond the lip of the [[Allascar]] valley and on the steep slope down to the great [[Faraway]] forest.

popup.title: Allascar
popup.description: A great valley in [[Turmish]].

popup.title: The Faraway
popup.description: A great forest in [[Turmish]].

popup.title: Zustild
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Holdensword
popup.description: A fairly isolated farming hamlet built around the stronghold known as The [[Hold of the Sword]].

popup.title: Karthoon
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Vollermar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Ruined Cities
popup.description: A collection of four ruined cities northwest of the [[Evenstar Lake]] and [[Alaghôn]], southeast of the [[Swordslake Creek]].

popup.title: Sambryntyn
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Moonhunt Down
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Velorn's Valor
popup.description: A small town in that accepted refugees from across the country – [[Morningstar Hollows]], after the [[Alaoreum River]] turned their home into an uninhabitable bog.

popup.title: Wyvernstone
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Tarnring
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Perloush
popup.description: A great valley in [[Turmish]], at its 'mouth' in the east, the land opened into some of the few plains to be found in Turmish near the village of [[Tarnring]].

popup.title: Peldrathan's Pool
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Bistal's Bottom
popup.description: A small village with its name painted on the local [[watermill]], surrounded by lush green trees and gardens.

popup.title: Tharsult
popup.description: An independent island nation in the [[Shining Sea]] that grew bigger in the century that followed the [[Spellplague]], only to return to its former state with the [[Second Sundering]].

popup.title: Urbeth
popup.description: The largest city of [[Tharsult]] and the island's main port.

popup.title: Myth Drannor
popup.description: The '''City of Song''', a great [[elf|elven]] city, ruined in the [[Weeping War]] of [[711 DR]], remained a monster-infested ruin until resettled in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], and destroyed once again in the [[Second Sundering]], leaving it a sparsely-populated ruined town.

popup.title: Yûlash
popup.description: A fortress town with a tumultuous history of ruinations, occupations, and conflicts between [[Zhentil Keep]] and [[Hillsfar]].

popup.title: Zhentil Keep
popup.description: Once the most powerful city in the [[Moonsea]] region as well as the main base of operation for the [[Zhentarim]], ruined in the 15{{th}} century by the [[Shadovar]], and still in the early stages of restoration ''circa'' [[1491 DR]].

popup.title: Hillsfar
popup.description: A powerful metropolis city-state infamous for its xenophobia and [[human]]-first politics.

popup.title: Elventree
popup.description: A sylvan community in the West Branch of the [[Moonsea]], built atop huge trees, hollowed-out stumps, and caves.

popup.title: Elmwood
popup.description: A small farming community accidentally destroyed in [[1491 DR]], when a ''[[devastation orb]]'' intended to be set off in [[Mulmaster]] left only a single survivor.

popup.title: Mulmaster
popup.description: The '''City of Danger''', an independent city-state, led by the [[High Blade]] and the council of the [[Blades (Mulmaster)|Blades]].

popup.title: River Lis
popup.description: Known as '''the Blood River''' by [[orc]]s, a shallow swampy river connecting the [[Moonsea]] to the [[Dragon Reach]].

popup.title: Phlan
popup.description: A city-state trapped in a cycle of ruination and rebuilding across centuries. The city was dedicated to the deity [[Tyr]] and its spiritual and physical well-being to the artifact of the ''[[Hammer of Tyr]]''.

popup.title: Maskyr's Eye
popup.description: A village located in the vale of the same name with its primary industry being farming and [[horse]]breeding.

popup.title: Bay of Phlan
popup.description: The bay on the [[Stojanow]] river where the city-state of [[Phlan]] stood.

popup.title: Stojanow
popup.description: Also known as the '''Barren River''', used to transport ore and minerals from the [[Dragonspines]] to the cities of [[Phlan]] and from there – to [[Melvaunt]].

popup.title: Stojanow Trail
popup.description: The trail that continued north from [[Phlan]] along the river [[Stojanow]] and the western side of the [[Quivering Forest]].

popup.title: King's Pyre
popup.description: A stunning monument, built into a cliff overlooking the sea, some {{SI|40|mi|k}} west of [[Phlan]].

popup.title: Labyrinthine Cavern
popup.description: A deep cavern labyrinth that once was home to a community of [[minotaur]]s who served [[drow]] masters.

popup.title: Ironfang Keep
popup.description: An ancient keep that already existed by [[-25000 DR]].

popup.title: Thentia
popup.description: A metropolis of folk with an impassioned sense of self-determination and a significant population of [[arcane]] spellcasters, guarded by a cavalry known as the [[Riders of Thentia]].

popup.title: Melvaunt
popup.description: A city of smithing and mercantile services, as well as factories serving as the port of entry to many travelers coming to the region.

popup.title: Serpent's Cowl
popup.description: A small village upstream of [[Boareskyr Bridge]], named for a [[yuan-ti]] city of [[Ss'thar'tiss'ssun]].

popup.title: Harkstag
popup.description: The village home of the [[Vigilant Riders]].

popup.title: Heartwing Estate
popup.description: An estate and a [[pegasus]] farm of the [[wizard]] [[Aluena Halacanter]].

popup.title: Dungeon of Swords
popup.description: Also known as '''Thardresk Crypt''', the family tomb of the royal [[House Thardresk]], ruling family of the ancient kingdom of [[Anauria]].

popup.title: Secomber
popup.description: A small, peaceful garden town that acted as the ''de facto'' border town between the relatively peaceful [[Western Heartlands]] and the more [[Savage Frontier]], along the [[Sword Coast]].

popup.title: Ardeep Forest
popup.description: Or the '''Faraway Forest''', a small but thick woodland that once encompassed much of the [[Sword Coast]], famed for its legendary [[Cloud palace|floating towers]].

popup.title: Crypts of the Deepening Moon
popup.description: A series of vaults that held the remains of ''laranlors'' and ''laranlas'' (kings and queens) from the ancient [[moon elf]] realm of [[Ardeep]].

popup.title: Dancing Dell
popup.description: A dell containing the ''[[Ladystone]]'', a sacred stone touched by [[Eilistraee]].

popup.title: Glen of Aloevan
popup.description: The site of a ''[[portal]]'' that led to a pocket plane wherein lay the [[ghost]] of the maddened ''laranla'' (queen) and [[Chosen of Mystra]] and [[Sehanine]], [[Embrae Aloevan]].

popup.title: Green Glade
popup.description: A clearing surrounded by exceptionally tall [[elm]]s, protected by a minor ''[[mythal]]''.

popup.title: House of Long Silences
popup.description: An ancient [[ivy]]-covered ruined palace made of white stone.

popup.title: House of Stone
popup.description: Or '''Stoneturn''', an immense square tower on the eastern edge of the [[Ardeep Forest]], surrounded by rumors of treasures and deadly stories.

popup.title: Nandar Lodge
popup.description: The foundations of a hunting lodge that was abandoned by its stubborn owner after repeated [[elf]] attacks.

popup.title: Phylund Hunting Lodge
popup.description: A stone keep in the western [[Ardeep Forest]], once used by the noble [[Phylund]] family, abandoned and taken over by the [[Red Wizard]] named [[Thegger Grynn]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Reluraun's Tomb
popup.description: A ruined tomb, the final resting place of [[Reluraun]], an [[elven]] [[warrior]] folk hero.

popup.title: Floshin Estates
popup.description: A parcel of lightly wooded land that belonged to [[House Floshin]], used as a base by the [[Red Wizards of Thay]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Harpshield Lands
popup.description: Territory owned by the [[Harpshield]] royal family, the location of the [[Dungeon of the Shield]].

popup.title: Dungeon of the Shield
popup.description: The dungeon underneath the [[Harpshield]] royal family castle.

popup.title: Talmost Lands
popup.description: The lands that belonged to the [[House Talmost]] and the locations of the [[Talmost Keep]].

popup.title: Talmost Keep
popup.description: Located just outside the end of the forest's northern spur and was the ruined royal seat of [[House Talmost]], never reclaimed by its descendants.

popup.title: Delimbiyran
popup.description: Ruins of the ancient [[human]] kingdom of [[Delimbiyran]].

popup.title: Trail Way
popup.description: A short trail that cut a shorter route from the [[Trade Way]] to the [[Delimbiyr Route]].

popup.title: Ardeep River
popup.description: The river that originated in the [[Ardeep Forest]] and flowed to the [[Sea of Swords]], where it forked into three branches forming a small delta.

popup.title: Selpir
popup.description: A slow and quiet creek that forked from the [[Ardeep River]] and the [[South Ardeep River]].

popup.title: Black Helm Tower
popup.description: The home of [[Black Vizor]], of the [[Heralds of Faerûn]], about a day's ride to the north and east of [[Daggerford]].

popup.title: Mount Illefarn
popup.description: A peak under which [[Clan Ironeater]] stood against Illefarn's destruction.

popup.title: Laughing Hollow
popup.description: A preternatural valley upriver from [[Daggerford]], filled with trees so dense, they created a day's twilight underneath.

popup.title: Sword Hills
popup.description: Hills on the [[River Delimbiyr]]'s southern shore.

popup.title: Moon Tower of Elembar
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Forlorn Hills
popup.description: A hilly region in [[northwest Faerûn]], once the center of the ancient [[shield dwarven]] kingdom of [[Dardath]].

popup.title: Iron Road
popup.description: Or the '''Ironford Trail''', a trail that stretched from the [[Bargewright Inn]] to [[Uluvin]].

popup.title: Crumbling Stair
popup.description: The remnant of a mansion named the [[House of Taeros]] that was built in the 6{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Watchers of the North
popup.description: The line of hills that formed the northern border of the [[Forlorn Hills]].

popup.title: Torstultok
popup.description: The keep controlled by the [[cleric]]s of [[Haela Brightaxe]].

popup.title: Amphail
popup.description: A village of 600, named after one of [[Waterdeep]]'s early warlords, [[Amphail the Just]].

popup.title: Red Larch
popup.description: A waystop on the [[Long Road]], seven days north of [[Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Tulbegh
popup.description: A coastal [[Sembia]]n town famed for producing glass bottles and baby food made with [[osquip]] [[milk]] and a certain type of [[seaweed]] mash.

popup.title: Surd
popup.description: A town in [[Sembia]], close to the shores of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], with its tunnels once used by [[Artus Cimber]] in a daring break out of his father, [[Scoril Cimber]], an infamous highwayman.

popup.title: Yhaunn
popup.description: A major coastal city in [[Sembia]] with its summer nights being especially hot due to densely-packed buildings blocking any cooling breeze from the sea.

popup.title: Yhauntan Bay
popup.description: The bay where the city of [[Yhaunn]] stood, between the [[Dragon Reach]] and the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]].

popup.title: Moonsea Ride
popup.description: Also called the '''Mountain Ride''' in [[Cormyr]], a road that ran northeast from [[Arabel]] until it reached [[Hillsfar]] on the southern shores of the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Spiderhaunt Wood
popup.description: A dangerous forest where spellcasters of all types came to gather [[spider]]-related [[spell component]]s.

popup.title: River Dalton
popup.description: The river that branched to the east from the [[River Lis]] and flowed east then south along a dense forest before emptying into the swampland of the [[Flooded Forest]].

popup.title: Rat Hills
popup.description: A stretch of coastline a short distance to the south of [[Waterdeep]], often used as a dump by the city.

popup.title: Stump Bog
popup.description: A bog to the east of the hamlet of [[Rassalantar]], inhabited by [[giant crab]]s, [[giant crayfish]], [[giant eel]]s, [[giant frog]]s, [[giant leech]]es, [[giant lizard]]s, [[giant wasp]]s, and [[giant slug]]s.

popup.title: Zundbridge
popup.description: A massive, squat bridge located about 10 miles (16 kilometers) southeast of [[Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Stormy Bay
popup.description: A broad inlet that formed along the northern coast of the [[Moonsea]], within which was a secluded isle that housed a small fishing village and a hidden camp of pirate slavers.

popup.title: Dragonspine Mountains
popup.description: A range of peaks in the western [[Moonsea]], rich with natural resources, including a wealth [[ore]], and black [[granite]].

popup.title: Scoured Lands
popup.description: Farmlands abandoned with [[Plan]]'s ruination and reclaimed by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Quivering Forest
popup.description: A forest stretching from the city of [[Phlan]] to the [[Dragonspine Mountains]], forming a border with the great gray waste of [[Thar]].

popup.title: Sorcerer's Isle
popup.description: An island located on the [[Stojanow River]] with the river splitting around the island, with a large [[silver]] pyramid occupying most of the island.

popup.title: Ticklebelly Hills
popup.description: A grouping of rocky hills and cliffs in the southern foothills of the [[Dragonspine Mountains]].

popup.title: Grass Sea
popup.description: A stretch of plains covered thickly with tall grass with occasional ruins breaking the sea of green.

popup.title: Arachnid Pathway
popup.description: A long forest trail that began at the [[Tethyamar Trail]] and moved southwest into the heart of the woods, ending at [[the Merchant's Calling]] and the [[Lakeside Trail]].

popup.title: Tethyamar Trail
popup.description: A trade road that ran the length of [[Daggerdale]] also known as the '''Daggerdale road.'''

popup.title: Stormpemhauder
popup.description: A small village of [[forest gnome]]s.

popup.title: Lake Melishar
popup.description: A clear, cool lake in the middle of the [[Spiderhaunt Wood]] with the [[Nature's Inn]] perched on its shores.

popup.title: Nature's Inn
popup.description: A small lakeside cabin inn on the [[Lake Melishar]].

popup.title: Lakeside Trail
popup.description: A forest trail that connected the [[Arachnid Pathway]] with [[Gothyl's Tower]].

popup.title: Gothyl's Tower
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Black Dwarf Mine
popup.description: A mining and smelting operation run by [[Aldurghen Stormhammer]] and four of his [[dwarven]] associates ''circa'' [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Long Road
popup.description: The inland trade route that stretched from [[Waterdeep]] in the south to [[Mirabar]] in the north.

popup.title: Evermoor Way
popup.description: The road from [[Triboar]] to [[Bridge Gate]] in [[Everlund]], and extending to [[Silverymoon]].

popup.title: Westbridge
popup.description: A farming village situated along the [[Long Road]] in the [[Savage Frontier]].

popup.title: Xantharl's Keep
popup.description: A walled village south of [[Mirabar]] built around a central keep.

popup.title: Rassalantar
popup.description: A hamlet and caravan stop on the [[Long Road]], just north of [[Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Sumber Hills
popup.description: A range of hills in the middle of the [[Dessarin Valley]].

popup.title: Death Shallows
popup.description: A shallow, flat depression, approximately 25 miles east of [[Waterdeep]], with its river shore cliffs dotted with caverns.

popup.title: Dolblunde
popup.description: A ruined [[gnomish]] city in the [[Underdark]], the lair of an immensely powerful [[dracolich]] [[Daurgothoth]], and home to [[red dragon]] [[Themberchaud]] in the late 1490s [[DR]].

popup.title: Goldenfields
popup.description: Or the '''Granary of the North,''' an abbey with walled crop and grain fields of spectacular scope and size.

popup.title: Amphail Road
popup.description: A road that connected the village of [[Amphail]], the city of [[Waterdeep]], and the [[Bargewright Inn]].

popup.title: River Dessarin
popup.description: A major cold river that flowed through the [[Savage Frontier]], flowing from the [[Dancing Falls]] at the base of the [[Lost Peaks]].

popup.title: Dancing Falls
popup.description: The beginning of the cold northern [[River Dessarin]].

popup.title: Maiden's Tomb Tor
popup.description: A landmark of note with "Bandit Tunnels" running deep underneath, connecting the surface world with  the ruins of [[Dolblunde]] in the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Gaustar's Creek
popup.description: A long, swift-flowing stream in the [[Dessarin Valley]] and a tributary of the [[River Dessarin]].

popup.title: Cairn Road
popup.description: A battered wagon trail between the village of [[Red Larch]], and the [[Long Road]]'s [[Bargewright Inn]].

popup.title: Larch Hills
popup.description: Hills across the river from [[Sumber Hills]] across which the [[Dessarin Road]] moved northwards.

popup.title: Dessarin Road
popup.description: A trail leading from [[Beliard]] though the [[Larch Hills]], the badlands, and plains to [[Bargewright Inn]].

popup.title: Sarcrag
popup.description: A small jutting crag that formed a perfect natural lookout and a clearly-visible from afar landmark.

popup.title: Circle of the Deepening Moon
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Redcliffs
popup.description: The cliffs along the coast northwest of [[Waterdeep]], famed for their red hue in the light of the setting sun.

popup.title: Red Rocks
popup.description: A tiny archipelago in the [[Sea of Swords]] just to the northwest of [[Waterdeep]]. The rocky outcroppings were inhabited by [[harpies]]. [[peryton]]s, and at least one known [[manticore]].

popup.title: Alsapir's Rock
popup.description: A former lair of the [[copper dragon]] [[Gaulauntyr]], afterward occupied by a [[deepspawn]] and its offspring.

popup.title: Hall of Reflected Moonlight
popup.description: A chapterhouse of the [[Order of the Blue Moon]], a group devoted to [[Selûne]] and [[Mystra]], hidden within the [[Red Rocks]].

popup.title: Bryndraeth Estate
popup.description: The estate home of [[Brianne Byndraeth]], a 14{{th}} century [[DR]] [[Masked Lord of Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Roaring Dragon House
popup.description: A fortified gambling hall built for rowdy games, sports, and patrons.

popup.title: Kheldell
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Thornhold
popup.description: Also known as the '''Stoneshaft Hold''', a fortress home of the [[dwarven]] [[Clan Stoneshaft]].

popup.title: Westwood
popup.description: A part of a group of forests referred to by some as the [[Other Woods]] and others as the [[Moonwoods]].The forests in this group were [[Lurkwood]], [[Southkrypt Garden]], [[Southwood]], [[Moonwood]], and [[Westwood]].

popup.title: Kryptgarden Forest
popup.description: Also known as '''Tsordvudd''', was a small but ancient and foreboding forest, once a site that once housed long-lost realms of the [[elves]] and [[dwarves]].

popup.title: Sword Mountains
