popup.description: A range of arc-like peaks northwest of [[Waterdeep]] and east of the [[Mere of Dead Men]], home to [[orc]]s and [[troll]]s.

popup.title: Hall of Whirling Blades
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Olothontor’s Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[blue dragon]] [[Olothontor]] on [[Mount Araddyn]].

popup.title: Mount Araddyn
popup.description: The mountain inhabited by  an unusual [[blue dragon]] [[Olothontor]].

popup.title: Marune's Stronghold
popup.description: The underground stronghold once occupied by [[Shadow Thief]] [[Marune]], on the [[Mount Helimbrar]].

popup.title: Mount Helimbrar
popup.description: The southernmost peak of the [[Sword Mountains]].

popup.title: Hespheira
popup.description: A small village located at the base of [[Mount Sar]], ruined as of [[1136 DR]].

popup.title: Mount Sar
popup.description: A mountain peak in the [[Sword Mountains]], the second most southern in the entire range.

popup.title: Nasaqh Estates
popup.description: Fortified family home of the [[Nasaqh]] family.

popup.title: Tormel River
popup.description: A waterway found in the land of [[Thar]] that originated in the body of water referred to as [[Bloodmuck]] and flowed southwest, passing by the city of [[Melvaunt]] before emptying into the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Phlan Path
popup.description: The main road that connected the cities of [[Phlan]] and [[Melvaunt]].

popup.title: Sword Trail
popup.description: A minor road that connected the cities of [[Melvaunt]] and [[Thentia]].

popup.title: River Thent
popup.description: A river that originated from [[Lake Thentar]] in the Great Grey Land of [[Thar]], and flowed southward into the [[Moonsea]] lake.

popup.title: Lake Thentar
popup.description: A small lake from where the [[River Thent]] originated.

popup.title: Stone Trail
popup.description: A rough dirt road that connected [[Westbridge]] and [[Beliard]].

popup.title: Beliard
popup.description: A small trading village that was home to, as well as a meeting place for, the many cattle ranchers that drove their herds across the nearby hills.

popup.title: Halls of the Hunting Axe
popup.description: Halls that were part of the [[dwarven]] realm of [[Besilmer]] before falling into ruin when the realm fell.

popup.title: Dragonisle
popup.description: The largest island in the [[Pirate Isles]], populated by around 4,000 pirates and was geographically dominated by the [[Earthspur]].

popup.title: Earthspur
popup.description: The 8,000-foot-high (2,438 meters) mountain at the southern end of the [[Dragonisle]] in the [[Pirate Isles]].

popup.title: Immurk's Hold
popup.description: The largest city found within the [[Pirate Isles]] ruled in accordance with a set of pirate traditions, known as [[Immurk's Code]].

popup.title: Jaws Strait
popup.description: Or simply '''The Jaws''', a small straight found within the [[Pirate Isles]], near the islands of [[Teltar]] and [[Sarr]].

popup.title: Ulgar's Isle
popup.description: Also known as '''Ulgar Isle''', home to the [[Chessenta]]n [[vampire]] [[Ulgar]] and his [[undead]] minions.

popup.title: Fang Rocks
popup.description: A dangerous reef formation situated near the halfway point in the waters between [[Kelthann]] and the [[Dragonisle]].

popup.title: Hawk's Isle
popup.description: A forest-covered island in the [[Pirate Isles]], inhabited by deformed victims of an old plague.

popup.title: Kelthann
popup.description: The island also known as the '''Gateway to Sembia''', a smuggling port inhabited by [[human]] and [[hin]] worshipers of [[Grumbar]].

popup.title: Moonwatch Hills
popup.description: A grouping of rather unremarkable hills along the [[Phlan Path]].

popup.title: Vanishing Hills
popup.description: A grouping of hills, the source of the [[Trank River]], which ran south and opened up into the [[Twilight Marsh]] and the actual [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Giant's Cairn
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Grimshackle Jail
popup.description: An aging and decaying prison tower on the shores of the [[Stojanow River]].

popup.title: Iron Route
popup.description: The brigand-filled dangerous coastal road between [[Zhentil Keep]] and [[Phlan]].

popup.title: Mirg Isle
popup.description: An island and a pirate stronghold.

popup.title: Telfar
popup.description: A small island in the southern [[Pirate Isles]] with an excellent natural harbor that made it a popular resting point for pirates returning from the open sea.

popup.title: Sarr
popup.description: A tiny storm-battered island with. a ruined lighthouse.

popup.title: Sumbar
popup.description: An island near the center of the [[Pirate Isles]] along the northwest edge of [[the Bowl]] inhabited by the mysterious [[Oracle of Nasmen]].

popup.title: Lith
popup.description: An unsettled island inhabited by a brood of ravenous [[neogi]].

popup.title: Lurath
popup.description: A small island of roughly 20 square miles, populated by primitive but friendly [[elvish]] creatures and several types of dangerous [[dinosaur]]s.

popup.title: Ilthan
popup.description: A medium-sized storm-battered island with no major settlements but an old ruin in the center and a population of [[cyclopskin]].

popup.title: Alphar Isle
popup.description: A large island of several friendly harbors, populated by around 3,000 pirates.

popup.title: Alphar
popup.description: The largest settlement on the [[Alphar Isle]] with its own independent form of government separate from the influence of any pirate captains.

popup.title: Bulta
popup.description: A small and mysterious island inhabited by a wide assortment of half-sized animals called the [[minimal]]s.

popup.title: Oresk
popup.description: A small island with several natural harbors and three pirate strongholds.

popup.title: Paldir
popup.description: A small island with a large mountain dominating its landscape, mostly inhabited by ex-pirates and fortune seekers.

popup.title: Tan
popup.description: A small volcanic island with a large smoking crater at its center, that rumbled occasionally.

popup.title: The Bowl
popup.description: An open area of the deep sea found in the center of the [[Pirate Isles]].

popup.title: The Windrace
popup.description: A prominent strait that stretched roughly from the [[Bowl]] in the south to [[Alphar Isle]] in the north.

popup.title: The Spoon
popup.description: A small strait found within the [[Pirate Isles]] situated in the east and northeast region; it ran along the southern edge of the [[Alphar Isle]] and the eastern shore of [[Ilthan]] and bordered [[the Bowl]] to the south.

popup.title: Sylkiir
popup.description: An island of note.
popup.image: File:Threat from the Sea of fallen stars map.png

popup.title: Myth Nantar
popup.description: Also known as the '''City of Destinies''', an underwater city about 56-64km (35-40 miles) west of the [[Whamite Isles]].

popup.title: Procampur
popup.description: Formerly known as '''Proeskampalar''', the richest city-state on the north coast of the [[Inner Sea]], a proud, well-mannered, and orderly city with its districts dividing it by function and occupation.

popup.title: Tsurlagol
popup.description: '''The Gateway to the Unapproachable East''', a persevering trade city.

popup.title: Ravens Bluff
popup.description: The metropolis known as the '''Living City''', known for its industries, spectator sports, competitive events, gambling, and rich culture of arts.

popup.title: Glacier of the White Worm
popup.description: The glacier – a great river of ice, situated high in the [[Earthspur Mountains]] between the [[Moonsea]], [[Damara]], [[Impiltur]], and [[the Vast]].

popup.title: Adhe Wood
popup.description: A forest infected with numerous arachnid monsters.

popup.title: Lone Rock
popup.description: A tiny island known for its [[juniper]] plants.

popup.title: Brynwood
popup.description: The forest that covered a large area between the [[Earthfast Mountains]] and the [[North Road]], lying north of the towns of [[Maerstar]] and [[Sevenecho]].

popup.title: Stormcrest Trail
popup.description: Or '''Tsurlagol Road''', a minor road that connected [[Sevenecho (hamlet)|Sevenecho]] and [[Tsurlagol]].

popup.title: Glorming Pass
popup.description: A major pass through the [[Earthfast Mountains]], a wild and dangerous place.

popup.title: Sevenecho
popup.description: Also called '''Sevone''', a small hamlet of some seventy people and the [[The Worried Wyvern]] inn open to travelers ''circa'' [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: High Haspur
popup.description: A village that laid high in the western [[Earthfast Mountains]], ruled for a number of generations by the [[gnomish]] [[Morninglight]] family.

popup.title: Maerstar
popup.description: A poor but hardworking town known for its [[horse]] breeders.

popup.title: North Road
popup.description: A major road in [[the Vast]] that crossed the region. It began in [[Procampur]] to the south and ended all the way north in [[Mulmaster]] of the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Helve's Trail
popup.description: A minor road that ran from [[Maerstar]] to at [[High Haspur]].

popup.title: Sarbreenar
popup.description: A mountain hamlet in [[the Vast]], once the site of a [[gnomish]] keep, long-destroyed by [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: The High Trail
popup.description: A trail through the [[Earthfast Mountains]] that began in [[Procampur]] and ended in the city of [[Ravens BLuff]].

popup.title: Elvenblood Pass
popup.description: A major rugged pass through the [[Earthfast Mountains]], crossed by over a dozen narrow ravines, each thick with [[tree]]s, a favored hunting ground for marauder [[orc]]s, [[stirge]]s, and [[wyvern]]s.

popup.title: Vipers' Nest
popup.description: A secret base of the [[Vipers]], a bandit group in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], constructed inside a hill in Brynwood.

popup.title: Misty Vale
popup.description: A valley and temple to [[Eldath]] located in the [[Brynwood]], guarded by the druid only known as [[The Green Lady]].

popup.title: Dura's Vale
popup.description: A forest vale in [[Brynwood]] where the log cabin stood, once owned by the [[ranger]] named [[Dura Gerathu]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Moonsea
popup.description: Also known as the '''Dragon Sea''', a deep [[amethyst]]-colored natural lake just north of [[Cormanthor]].

popup.title: Hulburg
popup.description: A once small city on the northeastern shore of the [[Moonsea]], it regained a portion of its population in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], following ruination that lasted several decades.

popup.title: Rosestone Abbey
popup.description: The center of knowledge and scholarly activity in the [[Moonsea]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], partially ruined in a battle in [[1480 DR]].

popup.title: Sulasspryn
popup.description: A city in the [[Moonsea]] that was suddenly ruined in [[1307 DR]] as it was swallowed by a sinkhole and infested by [[drow]] and arachnids of the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Umberlee's Talons
popup.description: A naval landmark of protruding sharp rocks.

popup.title: Keldon Head
popup.description: One of the two rocky headlands that surrounded and sheltered the city of [[Hulburg]] and its harbors.

popup.title: Easthead
popup.description: One of the two rocky headlands that surrounded and sheltered the city of [[Hulburg]] and its harbors.

popup.title: The Arches
popup.description: Underwater jagged cliffs that were pushed above the waters of the [[Moonsea]] during the ''[[Spellplague]]'' and sank back during the [[Second Sundering]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Orofin
popup.description: Ruins of an oasis-city formerly known as ''Orolin'' the '''City of Magicians''', resettled by the [[Bedine]] people in the late [[1470 DR|1470s DR]].

popup.title: Dragon Reach
popup.description: The northwestern fjord of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] that stretched between [[the Vast]] and the [[Dalelands]]; the location of [[Selu'Maraar]] kingdom of [[aquatic elves]].

popup.title: Desertsmouth Mountains
popup.description: Or the '''Tethyamar Mountains''' and formerly known as the '''Teshan Mountains''', a range of mountains that separated the [[Dalelands]] region, to the east, from the great desert of [[Anauroch]] to the west.

popup.title: Earthfast Mountains
popup.description: Or simply the '''Earthfasts,''' a small mountain range inhabited by [[shield dwarves]] and [[goblin]]s.

popup.title: Earthspur Mountains
popup.description: Or simply the '''Earthspurs''', and sometimes named the '''Giantspike Mountains''' or the '''Dragonspike Mountains,''' a great mountain range in [[north Faerûn]] that bordered [[Damara]], [[Vaasa]], and [[Impiltur]] in the east with [[the Vast]] in the west.

popup.title: Anauroch
popup.description: Also known as '''The Great Sand Sea''', a magical desert in [[northern Faerûn]] created my a calamity in [[10 DR]].

popup.title: Ordulin
popup.description: The former capital of [[Sembia]], destroyed in a planar rift summoned by [[Elyril Hraven]] in [[1484 DR]].

popup.title: Hillsafar
popup.description: The largest of the three major [[dwarf|dwarven]] holds in the [[Galena Mountains]], famed for its production of piles of [[gem]]s exported throughout the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Gramble's Climb
popup.description: A mountain pass trade route through the [[West Galena Mountains]] just north of [[Mount Throndar]]. It connected the city of [[Hulburg]] with [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: Winterspear River
popup.description: A waterway that originated in the [[Galena Mountains]] from several tributaries, moved north, passing a lake and draining into the [[Moonsea]] at the city of [[Hulburg]].

popup.title: Twilight Marsh
popup.description: A coastal swamp typically blanketed with heavy rain and thick fog in the early hours of the morning, fed by the waters of the [[Trank River]].

popup.title: Trank River
popup.description: A calm minor waterway with seldom-encountered rushing rapids that originated in the [[Vanishing Hills]] and drained into the [[Twilight Marsh]].

popup.title: Glumpen Swamp
popup.description: The waters of the swamp amidst barren lands originated from the [[Lake Longreach]] found to the northwest in [[the Ride]].

popup.title: Sauros Island
popup.description: The island at the center of the [[Glumpen Swamp]], the location of a ruined keep taken over by [[lizardfolk]] sometime before the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Dragonden Pass
popup.description: A pass across the [[Dragon Spine Mountains]] that began near the [[Barren River]]'s source and zig-zagged north.

popup.title: Tweenhill Gap
popup.description: A rugged mountain pass across the foothills of the [[Dragonspine Mountains]] north of the [[Quivering Forest]], used by [[orc]]s and other marauding [[humanoids]].

popup.title: The Cold Field
popup.description: A flat, treeless moor permanently scarred by [[dragon's breath]] and haunted by [[ghost]]s of long-dead soldiers.

popup.title: Scardale Town
popup.description: The capital of the region of [[Scardale]], once a small city, its population dwindled during the century of the [[Spallpladue]].

popup.title: New Velar
popup.description: Formerly known as '''Harrowdale Town''' or '''Harrowdale''', the capital and largest settlement of [[Harrowdale]] region.

popup.title: Velarswood
popup.description: A forest near the center of [[Harrowdale]] with a temple to [[Eilistraee]] located in the north, which was guarded by a number of goodly [[drow]].

popup.title: Veralsburg
popup.description: A small, rustic town located on the western border of the [[Velarswood]], renown for its abundant flowers and [[melon]] harvests.

popup.title: Temple to Eilistraee
popup.description: A templed dedicated to [[Eilistraee]], The Dark Maiden, attended by goodly surface [[drow]] [[elves]].

popup.title: Duathamper
popup.description: Also known as the '''Elvenflow''', one of two major rivers running through [[Cormanthor]], deep and wide waterway spanned by three black [[granite]] bridges.

popup.title: Bell of the Depths
popup.description: One of the great mysterious sites in the [[Moonsea]], connected with the legendary [[Northkeep]], an island kingdom that was the first [[human]] citadel in the Moonsea region.

popup.title: Flooded Forest
popup.description: A section of the great forest of [[Cormanthor]] that laid beyond the [[River Lis]], flooded and transformed into a swamp home of [[lizardfolk]] and [[black dragon]]s.

popup.title: The Mage's Tower
popup.description: A mysterious tower on the edge of the [[Flooded Forest]] with no visible door and three arched windows at the very top.

popup.title: Tavilar
popup.description: A village on the [[Hunt Trail]], connected by trail with the mysterious [[Mage's Tower]].

popup.title: House of Moander
popup.description: A seemingly abandoned temple amidst the boggy woodlands, dedicated to [[Moander]], located north of [[Ylraphon]]. It was a lair of a number of greater [[darktentacles]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ylraphon
popup.description: A small [[human]] town on the eastern shore of the northern end of the [[Dragon Reach]], greatly damaged by the [[Dracorage]] of [[1373 DR]] and rebuilt and resettled by the late 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Calaunt
popup.description: A city-state that grew out of the village of '''Vespermouth''' to become the largest and the most influential in [[the Vast]] by [[1372 DR]], only for the title to be reclaimed by [[Ravens Bluff]] by [[1479 DR]].

popup.title: Tantras
popup.description: A large and influential oligarchic city-state of [[the Vast]].

popup.title: Gazzeth
popup.description: A ruined [[orc]]ish city of note.

popup.title: Seawave Ruins
popup.description: A coastal ruin of note.

popup.title: Bone Tower
popup.description: A fortified keep of note.

popup.title: Fire River
popup.description: A wide and mostly placid river that flowed west across the southern [[Vast]] with its only major cataract being a thundering waterfall near the village of [[Dragon Falls]].

popup.title: River Vesper
popup.description: A cold and clear river that began in a long series of heavy waterfalls and rocky cascades.

popup.title: Viperstongue Ford
popup.description: A ford where the [[Cross Road]] went over the [[River Vesper]], just south of the valley of [[Viperstongue]], a low saddle in the [[Troll Mountains]] that served as a major pass through the range.

popup.title: Viperstongue
popup.description: A low saddle in the [[Troll Mountains]] that served as a major pass through the range.

popup.title: Blanaer
popup.description: A mountain stopover village located on the [[Cross Road]], home of hardworking people who worked in agriculture and farming.

popup.title: Kurth
popup.description: Better known as '''Pirates' Rest''', a walled caravan stop town at the intersection of the [[Cross Road]] and the [[North Road]].

popup.title: Mount Wolf
popup.description: A mountain that towered over the [[North Road]], south of [[Maskyr's Eye]], known for ravenous packs of [[wolves]] in the past.

popup.title: Hollow Mountain
popup.description: Also known as '''Mount Grimmerfang''', at one point in history, the capital of both the [[orc]] kingdom of [[Vastar]] and the [[dwarf]] kingdom of [[Roldilar]].

popup.title: Three Trees Pass
popup.description: A major pass between the [[Troll Mountains]] and the [[Giantspike Mountains]].

popup.title: Thindilar
popup.description: A town populated by artisans and craftspeople located at the intersection of the [[Cross Road]] and [[Blaern's Trail]]

popup.title: Sendrin
popup.description: The village on the [[Long Reach]] and [[Blaern's Trail]], once a town of magic, it home to many big and impressive stone buildings, shops, and houses, standing around the crossroads.

popup.title: King's Reach
popup.description: Also called the '''High Reach''', a town on the [[River Vesper]]'s southern shore.

popup.title: Troll Mountains
popup.description: Also known as the '''Trollcrag Mountains''', a small mountain range in [[the Vast]], running north of the [[River Vesper]] from the [[Dragon Reach]] in the west to the [[Earthspur Mountains]] in the east.

popup.title: Dead Tree Hollow
popup.description: A village in [[the Vast]] lying on the [[North Road]] between [[Dragon Falls]] and [[Swords Pool]], where [[Blaern's Trail]] from [[Fallentree]] met the North Road.

popup.title: Swords Pool
popup.description: A village between [[Dead Tree Hollow]] and [[King's Reach]], home to the [[Nine Swords Company]] as of the mid-1370s [[DR]].

popup.title: Dragon Falls
popup.description: A small village just passed the bridge over the [[Fire River]] on its northern shore.

popup.title: Dragon Falls Waterfall
popup.description: The waterfall that began at a spring and cascaded over a bluff alongside the [[North Road]], before joining the [[Fire River]].

popup.title: Blaern's Trail
popup.description: The trail also known as '''Wandering Trail''', it stretched from [[Calaunt]] to [[Thindilar]], passed [[Sendrin]], and ended at the [[Dead Tree Hollow]].

popup.title: Hlintar
popup.description: A crossroads town located a good day's ride from [[Calaunt]] and from [[Tantras]].

popup.title: Cross Road
popup.description: The road from the city of [[Tantras]] at its most southern point to [[Kurth]] at its northern point.

popup.title: Bambryn
popup.description: A village on the crossroads of the [[Hlintar Ride]], between [[Hlintar]] and [[Dark Hollow]], and the [[Long Reach]], between [[Sendrin]] and [[Orlimmin]].

popup.title: Fallentree
popup.description: A village in [[the Vast]] by the side of the road amidst the lands of rolling hills with about a dozen small woods of dark [[pine]]s.

popup.title: Dark Hollow
popup.description: The village on the crossroads of the [[Hlintar Ride]] and [[Feldar's Trail]], named after the valley it sat in.

popup.title: Hlintar Ride
popup.description: A road that ran through [[the Vast]], connecting the city of [[Calaunt]] and the village of [[Dragon Falls]].

popup.title: Long Reach
popup.description: Also known as the '''Centaur Trail''', a trail that ran through [[the Vast]], connecting the village of [[Orlimmin]] and the town of [[King's Reach]].

popup.title: Orlimmin
popup.description: The village built where the [[Long Reach]] from [[Bambryn]] met the [[Tantras Trail]] between [[Tantras]] and the [[Highbank Forest]].

popup.title: Highbank Forest
popup.description: The village at the end of the [[Tantras Trail]] from [[Orlimmin]], at the intersection with [[Feldar's Trail]] between [[Dark Hollow]] and [[Mossbridges]], named for a steeply sloped and wooded hill that lay just to the north.

popup.title: Highbank Forest
popup.description:
A steeply sloped and wooded hill that laid just to the north of the Highbank Forest
Village; it provided shelter to the village against the strongest winter winds.

popup.title: Feldar's Trail
popup.description: Also called the '''Mosstree Trail''', the trail that connected the town of [[Mossbridges]] and the village of [[Fallentree]].

popup.title: Mossbridges
popup.description: A town that stood where the [[Coast Road]] between [[Ravens Bluff]] and [[Tantras]] crossed the [[Fire River]], over the bridge of the same name.

popup.title: Dagger Hills
popup.description: A hilly and rocky area south-east of [[Daggerdale]], sprinkled with sparse [[human]] hamlets and small farms, later overgrown with thickets and thorn fields and plagued by [[lycanthrope]]s in the century following the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Tarkhen Hills
popup.description: Rocky hills of note on the southwestern side of [[Daggerdale]] and the [[Tesh Valley]].

popup.title: River Tesh
popup.description: The river that flowed from the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]] in the [[Dalelands]] down to the western edge of the [[Moonsea]]. The lands around the river were known as the [[Tesh Valley]].

popup.title: The White Crag
popup.description: A ruined tower or battlement of undeterminable age atop a hill, reportedly older than the [[elven]] presence in the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: Freedale
popup.description: A town on a minor trail that ran along the northern shore of [[River Ashaba]], declined by the 15{{th}} century [[DR]] to a collection of lone huts with folk surviving through foraging and selling [[mushroom]]s, edible [[moss]]es, and various [[herb]]s to passing travelers.

popup.title: Dagger Falls
popup.description: A large stone-walled town under the rule of [[Zhentil Keep]], near a steep waterfall of the same name.

popup.title: Teshwave
popup.description: A small town ravaged and conquered by [[Zhentil Keep]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], becoming a rowdy home to [[human]] survivors of the occupation and Zhentish [[goblin]]s, [[gnoll]]s, and even the [[beholder]] named [[Manxam]].

popup.title: Voonlar
popup.description: A small farming town puppet of [[Zhentil Keep]] on an intersection of numerous trade routes.

popup.title: Shallain Freehold
popup.description: A settlement of note in the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: Shadowdale
popup.description: A farming community, once home to the Sage of Shadowdale, [[Elminster Aumar]].

popup.title: Anathar's Dell
popup.description: A well-defended inn in southern [[Daggerdale]], nestled between [[Serpentsbridge]] to the north and the [[Spiderhaunt Woods]] along the [[Tethyamar Trail]].

popup.title: Castle Daggerdale
popup.description: A ruined castle of the [[Morn]] family, rumored to hold vast hidden treasure, rebuilt in [[1407 DR]] by the [[Cormaeril]] family.

popup.title: River Ashaba
popup.description: Also known as the '''River Verire''' or '''Dagger River'''.

popup.title: Mount Dread
popup.description: A mountain that hid the dungeon that once belonged to the [[wizard|sorcerer]] named [[Azazabus]].

popup.title: Tomb of Damara
popup.description: The name given to ruined '''Damara's Castle''' long after its owner, [[wizard]] Lord [[Damara (wizard)|Damara]]'s death.

popup.title: Blackcreek Crossing
popup.description: A settlement of note in the [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: Shind Road
popup.description: A travel route from [[Voonlar]] toward the [[Moonsea]], plagued by [[fiend]]s summoned by the [[Order of the Crippled Fang]] in [[1373 DR]].

popup.title: Tesh Trail
popup.description: A roadway in the [[Moonsea]] region originating in [[Dagger Falls]] and continuing on to [[Zhentil Keep]].

popup.title: Bowshaft Way
popup.description: A large road originated in the west, branching east from the [[North Ride]], passed through [[Yûlash]] before reaching [[Hillsfar]] along the coast of the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: The Throat
popup.description: A major but short ride from [[Yûlash]] to [[Zhentil Keep]].

popup.title: Moander's Road
popup.description: A wide straight line road running from [[Yûlash]] to [[Myth Drannor]], the wider part of the road was carved by the [[Abomination of Moander]] in [[1357 DR]], later utilized by the [[Zhentarim]].

popup.title: Moander's Crypt
popup.description: A crypt of note once guarded by the [[elves]] and [[half-elves]] who founded [[Hillsafar]] ''circa'' [[637 DR]].

popup.title: Abarat's Folly
popup.description: Ruins that once were a settlement surrounding a tower of mage [[Abarat]] and a ''[[portal]]'' nexus.

popup.title: Monarch's Fall Glade
popup.description: The part of [[Cormanthor]] where the [[green dragon|green]] [[dracolich]] named [[Dretchroyaster]] laired in the 1400s DR.

popup.title: Oakengrove Abbey
popup.description: A [[human]] stronghold abbey about 20 miles of [[Ashabenford]], dedicated to [[Silvanus]] the Oakfater, founded in [[591 DR]].

popup.title: Abbey of the Golden Sheaf
popup.description: A prosperous walled abbey in [[Mistledale]] dedicated to [[Chauntea]] the Forest Mother.

popup.title: Krenalir Peninsula
popup.description: The peninsula that stretched from the [[Mortick Swamp]] east to the coast.

popup.title: Deepburrow
popup.description: A [[hin]] settlement in [[Luiren]] with extensive tunnels connecting to the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Thrulaliel Mountains
popup.description: Mountain range at the far eastern edge of the [[Toadsquat Mountains]] in [[Luiren]]

popup.title: Mortik City
popup.description: The legendary settlement ruin in the heart of the [[Mortik Swamp]], in the realm of the mysterious [[Bog King]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Uvaeren's Clearing
popup.description: A forest clearing along the [[North Ride]] where [[Ashabenford]] was located.

popup.title: Ashabenford
popup.description: The capital and largest settlement of [[Mistledale]], a well-protected pastoral agrarian dale.

popup.title: Essembra
popup.description: The largest town and center of trade in [[Battledale]], before it was abandoned in the early 15{{th}} century [[DR]] during the [[Sembia]]n war with [[Netheril]].

popup.title: Standing Stone
popup.description: A large, imposing stone obelisk commemorating peace between the [[elves]] of [[Cormanthyr]] and the Dalesmen, destroyed by the [[drow]] in [[1374 DR]] and rebuilt in [[1425 DR]].

popup.title: Dysrisa
popup.description: Once a small village whose residents were known for their skill with animal husbandry and foraging of rare berries and roots.

popup.title: Old Elven Court
popup.description: An ancient elven settlement abandonved by the Fair Folk and destroyed by the [[drow]].

popup.title: The Darkwoods
popup.description: The part of [[Cormanthor]] infamous for the [[Darkwoods Massacre]] [[orc]]s and [[elves]] in [[335 DR]].

popup.title: Aluianti
popup.description: A former [[gold elf]] village, abandoned after the [[Weeping War]] and fitted with traps.

popup.title: Ferrengrove
popup.description: An entirely arboreal abandoned [[green elf]] village for [[elves]] serving in the [[Moonshadows]].

popup.title: Briarbosk
popup.description: An abandoned settlement of note.

popup.title: Grove of Darkness
popup.description: A grove of note.

popup.title: Pool of Yeven
popup.description: A small lake found within the [[Yevenwood]] in [[Battledale]].

popup.title: Dark Moon Temple
popup.description: A temple and monastery on a summit in the [[Cloud Peaks]], dedicated to [[Shar]] and the [[Dark Moon heresy]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Heretic Temple
popup.description: A fortified temple dedicated to [[Shar]] and the [[Dark Moon heresy]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Marching Mountains
popup.description: A heavily forested mountain range on the northern border of [[Calimshan]], known as the '''Dragons' Wall''' in the ancient past.

popup.title: Temple of Bhaal
popup.description: An abandoned temple of [[Bhaal]] swallowed by a mire on the southeastern edge of the [[Forest of Mir]].{{approx}}
popup.image: File:Temple of bhaal forest of mir.png

popup.title: Evertrees
popup.description: An ancient ruin, inhabited in the days before the fall of [[Myth Drannor]].

popup.title: Tsornyl
popup.description: Later known as '''The Darkwatch''', an [[elven]] settlement ruined by [[Moander]] in [[75 DR]], with the dark deity mutating and twisting every living thing in the town and around it.

popup.title: Moonrise Hill
popup.description: An old [[moon elf]] village near a [[wyvern]]-infested crag called the [[Moonrise Crag]], formerly known as '''Ssrenshen''' in the days of old [[Myth Drannor]].

popup.title: Moonrise Crag
popup.description: A great and ancient [[wyvern]]-infested rock knob.

popup.title: Corellon's Glen
popup.description: A border portion of greater [[Cormanthor]].

popup.title: Venom's Knoll
popup.description: A hilly stretch of note.

popup.title: Dimswart Manor
popup.description: Manor home of the 14{{th}} century sage of [[Suzail]] and adventuring companion of [[Azoun Obarskyr IV]], father of [[Gaylyn Wyvernspur]].

popup.title: Tangled Vale
popup.description: A notable part of [[Cormanthor]].

popup.title: The Scar
popup.description: Also known as '''Wyvern's Rift''', the massive, eponymous gorge that spanned the width of [[Scardale]] within the southern [[Dalelands]].

popup.title: Sar-Andatal
popup.description: A ruined outpost once administrated by [[Tenyajn Haell]], a general in the [[Cormanthyr]]an army.

popup.title: Eerienne
popup.description: A ruined village that once served as a retreat for [[elves]] disillusioned with the empire of [[Cormanthyr]] opening its doors to other races.

popup.title: Tangled Trees
popup.description: An [[elven]] settlement that rose on the ruins of a small village called '''Faelorin'''.

popup.title: Duathamper
popup.description: Once a large village and a military outpost that traded with old [[Myth Drannor]], many centuries a ruin by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Selgaunt
popup.description:
Once known as '''Chancelgaunt''', a major trade port city and the capital of [[Sembia]]. .

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Selgaunt|here]].

popup.title: Saerloon
popup.description: Once known as '''Chondathan''', an old [[Sembia]]n city known for its exotic tastes and gothic architecture, sprinkled throughout with [[gargoyle]]s and other decorations, and for its mercantile activity, seasoned by thievery and intrigue.

popup.title: Glaun Bog
popup.description: A swamp of note, to the south of [[Sun Hills]].

popup.title: Dun Hills
popup.description: A series of hills in [[Tasseldale]] in the [[Dalelands]] that separated Tasseldale from [[Deepingdale]] and inhabited by wild [[ponies]].

popup.title: Semberflow
popup.description: A minor waterway that flowed from [[Lake Sember]] to the [[River Ashaba]], guarded by [[aquatic elven]] [[warrior]]s.

popup.title: Glaemril
popup.description: Also known as the '''Deeping Stream''', a small river that started in the southern spur of the woods of [[Cormanthor]] at [[Lake Eredruie]] and flowed into the [[River Ashaba]].

popup.title: Arch Wood
popup.description: A dark and dense logging forest in [[Archendale]] filled with [[oak]]s, [[ash]]es, [[elm]]s, [[shadowtop]]s, and [[duskwood]]s.

popup.title: Hidden Hand of Fate
popup.description: A temple complex dedicated to [[Hoar]] with its influence on the rise as Hoar's following in [[Chessenta]] declined.{{approx}}

popup.title: Cape of Wyrms
popup.description: Also known as '''Wyrmtail''', or simply '''the Tail''', a sea-cave-riddled promontory on the [[Paddle Straits]], named after a [[black dragon]] hatchling war of the early 1300s [[DR]].

popup.title: Blackfeather Bridge
popup.description: A village in [[Featherdale]] on [[Rauthauvyr's Road]] on the southern end of the bridge of the same name,

popup.title: Rauthauvyr's Road
popup.description: A major road that ran north–south through the [[Dalelands]], from an intersection with the [[Moonsea Ride]] at the [[Standing Stone]] southbound to the [[Sembia]]n city of [[Ordulin]].

popup.title: Abbey of the Just Hammer
popup.description: An abbey in [[Tasseldale]] dedicated to [[Tyr]].

popup.title: Wright's Ferry
popup.description: A small village in [[Featherdale]], halfway between the [[Blackfeather Bridge]] and [[Feather Falls]], inhabited by [[pig]] farmers. A site of a [[horse]]-drawn ferry and the bizarre ring of stones called the [[Chessmen of Valsprendar]].

popup.title: Feather Falls
popup.description: A waterfall, a natural landmark that indicated the border between [[Featherdale]] and [[Scardale]].

popup.title: Feather Falls
popup.description: A village at the bottom of the [[Feather Falls (waterfall)|waterfall of the same name]], the primary dock for boats that navigated down the [[River Ashaba]].

popup.title: Chandlerscross
popup.description: A clean, fresh-looking town in [[Scardale]] that served as its capital city, during the occupation of the dale by a coalition of foreign forces during the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Scarsdeep
popup.description: A town in [[Scardale]] that rose to prominence during the occupation of the dale by a coalition of forces during the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Hap
popup.description: A small village in [[Battledale]] at the base of the former volcano, [[Haptooth Hill]], known for its export of [[herb]]s and [[acorn butter]].

popup.title: Haptooth Hill
popup.description: The inactive volcano and the location of the village of [[Hap]].

popup.title: Peldan's Helm
popup.description: A small town of walled stone cottages located in the western region of [[Mistledale]].

popup.title: Tegal's Mark
popup.description: The ''de facto'' capital of [[Tasseldale]], a picturesque town between two wooded hills, surrounded by a garden.

popup.title: Ashaba Road
popup.description: The road that ran through the great canyon called the [[Scar]], from [[Feather Falls]] to [[Scardale Town]].

popup.title: Abbey of the Sword
popup.description: A large temple to [[Tempus]] in [[Battledale]], which was built atop a network of caverns leading to ''[[portals]]'' to the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Aencar's Manor
popup.description: A splendid estate, this former home of a warlord located off [[Rauthauvyr's Road]]. It was unmistakably haunted.

popup.title: Moontassel
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Glaun
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Arrowmark
popup.description: A hamlet that was renowned for its skilled fletchers and [[bow]]-makers.

popup.title: Halfcrag
popup.description: A small but crowded village of tall and narrow buildings separated by cramped lanes, located in [[Tassledale]].

popup.title: Tasselheart
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Tasselway
popup.description: A road that connected the town of [[Archtassel]] with [[Rauthauvyr's Road]], south of the [[Blackfeather Bridge]].

popup.title: The Lone Tower
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Orc Fort
popup.description: An [[orc]]ish fortification in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Shipwreck Graveyard
popup.description: A major ruin on note.

popup.title: Zhentilar Trail
popup.description: An important roadway for the [[Zhentilar]] as it connected [[Zhentil Keep]] with the [[Citadel of the Raven]].

popup.title: Teshpost Trail
popup.description: A small roadway in the [[Moonsea]] region that connected [[Teshwave]] with the [[Citadel of the Raven]].

popup.title: Mount Tesh
popup.description: Or '''Trollgaunt Mountain''', a mountain in [[Teshendale]], known for disappearances and reports of ghostly ''[[dancing lights]]''.

popup.title: The Maiden's Loss
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Elven Watch Tower
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Isle of Moas
popup.description: A mysterious island in the [[Moonsea]].

popup.title: Elven Ruin
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Elua's Ride
popup.description: A small road connecting [[Hillsfar]] and [[Elventree]].

popup.title: Elua's Lighthouse
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Point Iron
popup.description: A once profitable [[iron]] mine, claimed by the [[duergar]] in [[1367 DR]].

popup.title: Beluar's Hunt
popup.description: Or simply '''the Hunt'', a series of hills found in the north of [[the Vast]], west of the [[North Road]] between [[Kurth]] and [[Maskyr's Eye]].

popup.title: Maskyr's Trail
popup.description: A trial that branched from the [[North Road]], north of the hamlet of [[Maskyr's Eye]], moved west, across the roods, the [[River Dalton]], and the [[River Lis]], ending at the [[Lis Path]].

popup.title: White River
popup.description: A small frigid river found in the [[Earthspur Mountains]] that flowed down from the [[Glacier of the White Worm]].

popup.title: West Harbor
popup.description: A small walled bog village, renowned for its [[Harbor Mead]], said to be in decline in the years that followed the 1370s [[DR]].

popup.title: Crossroad Keep
popup.description: An old fortress once controlled by [[Neverwinter]], a base for the [[Graycloaks of Neverwinter]], and a trading hub on the [[Sword Coast]].

popup.title: Halfaxe Trail
popup.description: A footpath through the forest of [[Cormanthor]] that began around the 1180s [[DR]].

popup.title: Lis Ruins
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Fort Dalton
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Dalton's Lighthouse
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Galena Mountains
popup.description: A massive and forbidding mountain range that formed a natural border around [[Vaasa]] in [[Northeast Faerûn]].

popup.title: Glister
popup.description: The only [[human]] settlement in [[Thar]].

popup.title: Point Moonsea
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: The Ruined Trail
popup.description: A coastal trail that connected the city of [[Thentia]] and [[Hulburg]], reaching the ruins of [[Sulasspryn]] via the [[Coastal Path]].

popup.title: The Coastal Path
popup.description: A path between [[Hulburg]] and [[Sulasspryn]].

popup.title: Wailing Tower
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: The Burning Daggers Lair
popup.description: The lair of [[Kossuth]]-worshiping [[orc]] cultists in a cave system twenty miles from [[Glister]], with a natural rift to the [[Elemental Plane of Fire]] at the cavern's lowest point.

popup.title: Fangjaws Hold
popup.description: A dozen of stone and turf lodges encircled by a palisade, home to the [[Skullsmashers]] [[orge]]s.

popup.title: The Red Claws Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[Red Claws]] tribe of [[goblin]]s and [[hobgoblin]]s in an ancient [[cyclopean]] ruin of an [[orge]] hold.

popup.title: Bloodskull Keep
popup.description: A fortified keep of the [[Bloody Skull]] [[orc]] tribe.

popup.title: Manslayers Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[Manslayers]] tribe of [[Thar]].

popup.title: Jade Skull Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[Jade Skull]] tribe of [[ogre]]s ruled by the [[Kur-Tharsu]] [[oni mage]]s.

popup.title: Bloody Hands Lair
popup.description: The home to the [[Bloody Hands]] tribe of [[Thar]].

popup.title: Vaprak's Hammer Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[Vaprak's Hammer]] tribe of [[ogre]]s ruled by the [[Kur-Tharsu]] [[oni mage]]s.

popup.title: Crystal Sphere Lair
popup.description: The lair of the [[Crystal Sphere (tribe|Crystal Sphere]] tribe of [[ogre]]s ruled by the [[Kur-Tharsu]] [[oni mage]]s.

popup.title: Rupert's Way
popup.description: The road that stretched from [[Berdusk]], past [[Fendarl's Gate]], and ended at [[Iriaebor]].

popup.title: Skullwatch
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Lundeth
popup.description: A village made up of sun-fired [[clay]] huts on the edge of the desert of [[Anauroch]].

popup.title: Thandril
popup.description: A ruin of note in the Sunset Foothills,

popup.title: The Tunwash
popup.description: A minor waterway that drained into the [[Marsh of Tun]].

popup.title: Aris
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Wyrmhall
popup.description: A swamp hamlet of note.

popup.title: Swampgate
popup.description: A swamp hamlet of note.

popup.title: Abandoned Keep
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Mount Rausrawna
popup.description: A mountain of note, north of [[Griffon Hill]].

popup.title: Castle Nacacia
popup.description: A stronghold of note.

popup.title: Hunter's Hills
popup.description: The foothills of the [[Desertmouth Mountains]].

popup.title: Gwarch
popup.description: A settlement in the northern [[Stonelands]], near the [[Teerac (lake)|Teerac lake]].

popup.title: Teerac
popup.description: A body of water of note in the [[Stonelands]].

popup.title: Amazandar
popup.description: Once, the '''City of Gems''' of the [[Anauria]] kingdom, ruined by the dessert's expansion in [[111 DR]].

popup.title: Stonewoods
popup.description: A small forest in [[Hunter's Hills]], on the edge of the [[Stonelands]].

popup.title: Arntethyl
popup.description: The high alpine valley where the [[River Tesh]] formed and cascaded into the [[Dalelands]], the location of a [[Zhentish]] supply encampment that supplied routes across the Great Dessert.

popup.title: Fort Locke
popup.description: A simple swamp fort held by the [[Graycloaks of Neverwinter]], destroyed in [[1374 DR]].

popup.title: Highcliff
popup.description: A village built around a castle of the same name. It was greatly damaged during the [[Shadow War]] of [[1374 DR]], but was rebuilt shortly after.

popup.title: Arvahn
popup.description: A ruin of note, the location of the [[Riverguard Keep (Neverwinter Wood)|Riverguard Keep]], a gem mine, and the [[Temple of Seasons]].

popup.title: Ember
popup.description: A village ruined and its inhabitants butchered by [[Luskan]] in [[1374 DR]].

popup.title: Weeping Willow Inn
popup.description: A lone inn, the only place of comfort and rest within many miles.

popup.title: Maiden's Glade
popup.description: A sacred [[druid]] sanctuary.

popup.title: New Leaf
popup.description: A small but prosperous village that traded in [[zalantar]] wood.

popup.title: Abandoned Mine
popup.description: A mine abandoned by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], claimed by [[duergar]] in [[1374 DR]].

popup.title: Orlath Wood
popup.description: Woods on the edge of the [[Great Sand Sea]].

popup.title: Tower Hlithal
popup.description: A fortress once held by [[goblinoid]] and [[orc]] armies of [[Araugel]].

popup.title: The Burn
popup.description: Once a [[goblin]]-infested forest, incinerated with magic into a stretch of barren land between the [[Shaddan Hills]] to the [[Hunters' Hills]].

popup.title: Shaddan Hills
popup.description: Hilly territory west of [[the Burn]], named after [[Shaddara the Fair]], the most famous queen of ancient [[Anauria]].

popup.title: The Quarter of Emptiness
popup.description: The last remnant of the [[Anauroch]] in the century after the [[Spellplague]]. The region returned to its former state in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Moander's Footstep
popup.description: The region of the dessert that housed a river and a swamp in the century that followed the [[Spellplague]] and reverted to its desert state in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Wyvernstones of Hullack
popup.description: A group of [[menhir]]s at a site sacred to [[Eldath]].

popup.title: Rasilith
popup.description: An ancient ruined city, resettled by the [[Bedine]] [[human]]s in [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Araugul
popup.description: The great ruined fortress-city capital of [[Hlundadim]] in the [[Goblin Marches]].

popup.title: Mount Shaddath
popup.description: A mountain at the eastern edges of the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]] with the [[Shaddath]] just to its south.

popup.title: Shaddath Gap
popup.description: A mountain passage across the [[Desertsmouth Momuntains]], south of [[Mount Shaddath]].

popup.title: The Stoneway
popup.description: A gap in the southeastern [[Desertsmouth Mountains]].

popup.title: Tower Ramanath
popup.description: An ancient ruined [[Netherese]] border fort.

popup.title: The Holl
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Lake Miir
popup.description: The lake where cities of [[Helvara]] stood with its waters inhabited by [[blue-scaled brench]] and [[spicy crabfin]].

popup.title: Port Miir
popup.description: A city of money-lenders and caravans, abandoned and ruined after an earthquake buried [[Berothir's Trail]] that connected it with [[Shadowdale]]. By the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], the ruins were barren and occupied by [[orc]]s and other much worse monsters.

popup.title: Berothir's Trail
popup.description: A mountain road that once connected [[Port Miir]] with the [[Tower of Ashaba]], long-destroyed by an earthquake by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ironthrone Mountain
popup.description: The northernmost peak on the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]].

popup.title: Rulvadar
popup.description: A ruined pacifist [[Netherese]] settlement.

popup.title: Mhaelos
popup.description: A ruined [[Netherese]] settlement.

popup.title: Ulshantir
popup.description: Ruins of a small settlement in the Lost Kingdom of [[Asram]].

popup.title: Oum
popup.description: Ruins of a crossroads settlement on the border between ancient nations of [[Hlondath]] and [[Asram]].

popup.title: Miirsar
popup.description: Ruins of a port town within the ancient nation of [[Asram]].

popup.title: Helvara
popup.description: A city of the  Lost Kingdom of [[Anauria]], ruined in [[111 DR]] after a horde of [[orc]]s and [[goblinoid]]s destroyed the nation.

popup.title: Anauril
popup.description: Once known as '''the City of Swords''', a ruined city of ancient [[Anauria]].

popup.title: Phelajarama
popup.description: Once known as '''the City of the Serpent''', the ruined capital of the Lost Kingdom of [[Asram]].

popup.title: Finder's Keep
popup.description: The ruined laboratory keep of [[Finder Wyvernspur]], a [[Harper]] founder turned  [[deity]].

popup.title: Tortured Land
popup.description: A barren area in the northernmost [[Moonsea]] region, inhabited by [[Ondonti]] [[orc]]s who followed the teachings of of [[Eldath]], the Goddess of Peace and Quiet Places.

popup.title: Delhalls
popup.description: A [[dwarf|dwarven]] mine, reopened ''circa'' [[1479 DR]], using the labor of dwarven slaves.

popup.title: Black Road
popup.description: The trade route that ran through the great desert of [[Anauroch]], winding west from the ruins of [[Teshendale]] to [[Llorkh]] at the foot of the [[Graypeak Mountains]].

popup.title: Vale of Lost Voices
popup.description: A sacred part of [[Cormanthor]] used as a burial place for honored [[elf]] [[warriors]] with [[Rauthauvyr's Road]] passing through the middle of it.

popup.title: Galath's Roost
popup.description: An abandoned bandit hold that was rumored to hold great treasure.

popup.title: Hunters' Down
popup.description: A forested height landmark in [[Deepingdale]].

popup.title: Sharburg
popup.description: A once-abandoned keep in [[Tasseldale]], the place that crated dish called [[Beef Sharburg]], resettled in [[1441 DR]] by a family of eccentric artists from [[Sembia]].

popup.title: Sun Soul School
popup.description: A monastery school for the [[Sun Soul]] [[monk]]s.

popup.title: Archtassel
popup.description: A unwalled village in [[Tasseldale]] inhabited by woodcutters and trappers, known for its [[brethyl fur]].

popup.title: The Fork
popup.description: A crossroads located seemingly at the end of the world, the location of the ruins of [[Ghaurin's Hold]] and a quality roadside inn called the [[Wildlands Rest]].

popup.title: Ascore
popup.description: The ruins of a port city of the [[dwarf|dwarven]] nation of [[Delzoun]].

popup.title: Morueme's Cave
popup.description: The home of the [[blue dragon]] clan the [[Blood of Morueme]].

popup.title: Dragondoom
popup.description: The mountain location of [[Morueme's Cave]] in the eastern end of the Nether Mountains.

popup.title: Nether Mountains
popup.description: A chain of dark peaks that once marked the boundary between the ancient empires of [[Netheril]] and [[Delzoun]].

popup.title: Far Forest
popup.description: One of a group of three forests named the [[Triangle of Trees]]; it was full of small lakes, some of which had become stinking marshes infested by [[will-o'-wisp]]s and a few [[chuul]].

popup.title: Ice Mountains
popup.description: Also known as the '''Ruathym Mountains''', the mountain range location of [[Citadel Adbar]].

popup.title: Vordrorn Forest
popup.description: A small but dangerous forest of [[pine]] trees and muskeg bogs at the base of the [[Ice Mountains]].

popup.title: Adbar Road
popup.description: A road connecting [[Citadel Adbar]] with the [[Fork Road]].

popup.title: Fork Road
popup.description: An east-to-west road joining [[Sundabar]] at the western end to [[the Fork]] at the eastern end.

popup.title: Citadel Adbar
popup.description: The [[dwarf|dwarven]] fortress named for [[King Adbar]], built in [[-272 DR]].

popup.title: Deadsnows
popup.description: A fortress town filled with visitors and travelers thanks to a [[gold]] rush. It was ruined in the [[Spellplague]] but by the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], it was resettled and active once again.

popup.title: Cold Wood
popup.description: Or '''Glimmerwood''', a forest on the edge of the [[Silver Marches]] inhabited by [[barbarian]]s, [[ettin]]s, [[bebilith]]s, and various predatory beasts.

popup.title: River Redrun
popup.description: The waterway that began in the [[Druarwood]] and flowed southeast past the [[Moonwood]] and the [[Night Trees]] through the [[Moonlands]]. It flowed past [[Citadel Felbarr]] and joined another river from the [[Rauvin Mountains]] to form the [[River Rauvin]] in the [[Sundabar Vale]].

popup.title: River Rauvin
popup.description: The cold waterway that began in the [[Rauvin Mountains]] and merged into the [[River Surbrin]] and eventually drained into the [[Dessarin River]] and out to the [[Sea of Swords]].

popup.title: Rauvin Mountains
popup.description: A small purple-hued mountain range located in the [[Silver Marches]].

popup.title: Dead Orc River
popup.description: Also known as '''Orc Creek''', a tribunary of [[River Rauvin]].

popup.title: Maldobar
popup.description: A small village north of [[Sundabar]].

popup.title: Sundabar
popup.description: Also known as '''Citadel Sundbarr''', one of the wealthiest and most militaristic cities within the nation of [[Luruar]].

popup.title: Turnstone Pass
popup.description:
A vallery passage through the 
[[Nether Mountains]].

popup.title: Vercy Wood
popup.description: A forest of note on the border of the wider [[Ride]] and the Fallen Kingdom of [[Barze]].

popup.title: Garumn's Climb
popup.description: A trade route through the [[West Galena Mountains]] that connected [[Vaasa]] to the [[Moonsea North]].

popup.title: Avang
popup.description: A small community on the western edge of [[Vaasa]] of 500 [[human]]s and [[dwarves]].

popup.title: Dragon Necropolis
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Valley of the Falls
popup.description: A mountain valley of note where the [[Naed Creek]] began.

popup.title: Falls of Ixce
popup.description: A waterfall of note there the [[Telstang Brook]] began.

popup.title: Giant's Head Rock
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: North Glister Path
popup.description: A path across the foothills of [[Galenas]] that connected the town of [[Glister]] and the [[Ilinver Trail]].

popup.title: Castle Vathar
popup.description: A massive fortress located among the hills east of the [[Dragonspine Mountains]] that housed a host of soldiers from the city-state of [[Phlan]].

popup.title: Glumpen Swamp
popup.description: The swamp fed by the waters of the swamp originated from [[Lake Longreach]] found to the northwest in the [[Ride]].

popup.title: Hawksroost
popup.description: A village destroyed by [[ogre]]s in [[1299 DR]].

popup.title: Ilinvur Trail
popup.description: A winding path that began at [[Castle Vathar]] and ended in the village of [[Ilinvur]].

popup.title: Lake Longreach
popup.description: A closed lake found in the [[Moonsea North]], fed from three streams that flowed down from the nearby mountains, the [[Telstang Brook]], [[Naed Creek]], and [[Razack's Tears]].

popup.title: Naed Creek
popup.description: A stream that originated in the [[Valley of the Falls]] and snaked west towards the [[Lake Longreach]].

popup.title: Telstang Brook
popup.description: A long stream that flowed northwest from the [[West Galena Mountains]], west through [[Vercy Wood]], before joining with [[Razack's Tears]] and emptying into Lake Longreach.

popup.title: Way of the Powrie
popup.description: A trail that ran through the [[Moonsea North]] from the village of [[Ilinvur]] to the [[gnoll]] community of [[ Frozen Flindyke]].

popup.title: Barze
popup.description: The remnants of an ancient fallen kingdom ruled by King Barze.

popup.title: The Silver Road
popup.description: A 165 mile-long road that linked [[Silverymoon]] and [[Sundabar]].

popup.title: Samargol
popup.description: The '''City of Veils''', the tropical capital city of [[Samarach]] that housed a quarter of the Samarachan population.

popup.title: River Samar
popup.description: The only major river within the kingdom of [[Samarach]] that originated in the [[Sanrach Mountains]].

popup.title: Bay of Omgar
popup.description: A bay bordered by the [[Snout of Omgar]] peninsula.

popup.title: Samar Bay
popup.description: A smaller bay in the [[Bay of Omgar]], where  [[Samargol]]'s docks were built.

popup.title: Taruin
popup.description: The '''City of Seven Spices''', a large city that stood on the junction of the creeks that merged, forming the [[River Samar]], renowned for its [[spice]]s and [[salt]] production.

popup.title: Rassatan
popup.description: Or '''The City of Gilded Pearls''', a city atop a cliff of buildings carved into the walls of the [[Sanrach Basin]].

popup.title: Sorl
popup.description: A settlement of note located at the [[Sorlmar Pass]] across the [[Sanrach Mountains]].

popup.title: Mines of Selgol
popup.description: Mines that produced high-quality salt, worked by the people of [[Torich]].

popup.title: Narubel
popup.description: Also known as '''The City of Seasnakes''', the city built into a series of sea caves that honeycombed the cliffs of a natural harbor.

popup.title: Snout of Omgar
popup.description: A peninsula that protruded out from the mainland and formed the western border of the [[Bay of Omgar]], named after the great [[sea serpent]] [[Omgar]]. It was formed into an island following the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Ahoyhoy
popup.description: A fort [[tortle]] settlement established after the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Snapping Turtle Bay
popup.description: A bay of note on the [[Wild Coast]] of [[Chult]].

popup.title: Samarlogh
popup.description: A dense and dangerous ruin-littered jungle that covered the northern rim of [[Samarach]], inhabited by [[corollax]]es and large carnivorous [[sloth]]s.

popup.title: Narubel Pass
popup.description: A dangerous and mostly forsaken mountain pass that connected the independent coastal city of [[Narubel]] in the north with [[Samarach]] in the south.

popup.title: Samagard
popup.description: A large town found in western [[Thindol]] on on the [[River Gur]].

popup.title: Sormarl Pass
popup.description: An active mountain pass found between [[Samarach]] and [[Thindol]] by the [[River Gur]].

popup.title: River Gur
popup.description: A small river found in [[Thindol]] used for trade.

popup.title: Rassatan Bay
popup.description: The bay at the foothills of the [[City of Gilded Pearls]], rich with golden [[pearl]]s and [[oyster]]s.

popup.title: Chokemist Cave
popup.description: The home to one of the last colonies of ''[[chokemist]]'' plants in [[Samarach]].

popup.title: Nimbre
popup.description: A small agricultural village that produced [[corn]], [[grain]]s, and large [[boar]]s.

popup.title: Omgar's Teeth
popup.description: A rocky patch of reefs and shallows along the eastern shore of the [[Samar Bay]].

popup.title: Sanrach Mountains
popup.description: The dominant geographical feature within [[Samarach]] that provided a physical shield for the veiled kingdom, in addition to its magical mask.

popup.title: Singing Caverns
popup.description: A melodious jungle cave system near a lake, inhabited by rare giant green spiders.

popup.title: Tempest's Fury
popup.description: A great stone tower surrounded by a magical maelstrom that turned the forested lands around it into a dangerous swamp.

popup.title: Xo'rill's Black Market
popup.description: A hidden black market ran by a group of industrious [[illithid]]s, whose goods ranged from exotic items, foods, and animals. to magical research and [[Underdark]] slaves.

popup.title: Haunted Mine
popup.description: An abandoned mine by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Tchinggult
popup.description: A large town along the banks of the [[River Tching]], once a prominent waystop along the road from [[Narubel]] to [[Thindar]].

popup.title: River Tching
popup.description: A small river was formed from numerous creeks originating in the [[Tching Mountains]], near [[Tchinggult]], flowed south and east to empty into the [[Thingulph]] south of [[Lundeth]].

popup.title: River Salban
popup.description: A small river that originated in an underground spring within the [[Sanrach Mountains]].

popup.title: Tching Mountains
popup.description: A small mountain range surrounded by plains, inhabited by a lone hungry [[chaos roc]].

popup.title: Salban Falls
popup.description: A massive waterfall, part of the [[River Salban]], where it plummeted off a cliff overlooking the grasslands below.

popup.title: Selgaunt Bay
popup.description: The bay of [[Selgaunt]] where the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] touched the city, and the [[River Arkhen]] drained into the sea.

popup.title: Delselar
popup.description: The '''City of Succulent Jewels''', a large unwalled city on the water.

popup.title: Lundeth
popup.description: Or the '''City of Whirring Waters''', a large city in the foothills of the [[Hazur Mountains]].

popup.title: Cape Talath
popup.description: A rocky outcropping found near the border of [[Thindol]] and [[Tashalar]] surrounded by treacherous waters expelled from the vast subterranean waterway known as [[Labrand's Folly]].

popup.title: Thindar
popup.description: A large unwalled city and the capital of [[Thindol]], sprawled across a filled-in marsh.

popup.title: Deltar
popup.description: A large town on a small peninsula along the [[Thingulph]]'s western rim, surrounded by submerged islets and numerous shipwrecks.

popup.title: Gurdeth
popup.description: Or the '''City of Stilts''', a small, regularly flooded city of buildings perched atop poles and tied to each other for stability.

popup.title: Psamma
popup.description: A small town along the southern bank of the [[River Gur]] built atop ancient deep subterranean [[yuan-ti]] tombs and graves.

popup.title: Peaks of Flame
popup.description: A range of volcanic mountains in the center of [[Chult]], said to be the point of entry of [[Dendar]] the [[Night Serpent]] when she will enter [[Toril]] at the end of the world.

popup.title: Wyrmheart Mine
popup.description: A highly productive dwarven mine in the [[Kobold Mountains]], renowned in [[Chult]] for its vast collection of [[diamond]]s and [[emerald]]s.

popup.title: Shilku
popup.description: A ruined coastal town in [[Chult]], much of it was encased in volcanic rock.

popup.title: Shrine of the Heart
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Bay of Chult
popup.description: A bay fed by the Rivers [[Soshenstar]] and [[Tiryki]] and the location of [[Port Nyanzaru]].

popup.title: Mbala
popup.description: A town located atop a sheer plateau northwest of the [[Aldani Basin]] in [[Chult]], once the seat of power of an ancient Chultan kingdom.

popup.title: Ataaz Kahakla
popup.description: Or the '''Gorge of Death''', a high river canyon on the [[River Tath]].

popup.title: Heart of Ubtao
popup.description: An [[earthmote]] that hovered over the [[Aldani Basin]] in Chult during the century that followed the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Jahaka Bay
popup.description: A coastal inlet fed by the [[River Tath]] tha spanned 20 miles across and twice that distance inland.
popup.image: File:Wyrmheart Mine - Tomb of Annihilation map.jpg

popup.title: Jahaka Anchorage
popup.description: A 15{{th}} century port settlement for pirates and slavers.

popup.title: Ataaz Yklwazi
popup.description: Also known as the '''Gorge of Blades''', a volcanic canyon north of the [[Valley of Lost Honor]], named after its jagged shards of [[basalt]] that shot up from the ground.
popup.image: File:Wyrmheart Mine - Tomb of Annihilation map.jpg

popup.title: Nsi Wastes
popup.description: A stretch of blighted poisonous jungle and cut down trees.

popup.title: Palace of Ras Nsi
popup.description: The stone keep taken over by the warlord [[Ras Nsi]] and his [[undead]] horde.

popup.title: The Dawn Warrior
popup.description: A small and dangerous uncalled island of overgrown jungles that repelled numerous attempts to settle it since the 700s [[DR]].

popup.title: Refuge Bay
popup.description: A large bay in [[Chult]] that began south of [[Port Castigliar]], stretch to [[Ishau]] and was bordered by the [[Dawn Warrior]] island to the east.

popup.title: Kitcher's Folly
popup.description: A monument erected in honor of a would-be great explorer from [[Scardale]], Sir [[Ilyber Kitcher]], after his death, several centuries before [[1362 DR]].

popup.title: Altispinax Swamp
popup.description: A dangerous swamp, homeland of predatory [[altispinax]] [[dinosaur]]s.

popup.title: The Talons
popup.description: The forked tributaries of the [[River Delimbiyr]].

popup.title: Moon Pass
popup.description: An ancient gorge through which the [[River Rauvin]] flowed, splitting the eastern and western sections of the [[Nether Mountains]].

popup.title: Jalanthar
popup.description: A hamlet located on the trail between [[Everlund]] and [[Sundabar]]; in [[1372 DR]], the hamlet's defenses were boosted by a troop of the [[Argent Legion]] camping in the old ruins.

popup.title: Stone Stand
popup.description: A stone circle in the [[High Forest]] that contained a large [[oak]] [[tree]], grown from a cutting from the [[Grandfather Tree]], sacred to the [[Blue Bear]] and [[Tree Ghost]] tribes.

popup.title: Citadel of the Mists
popup.description: The castle dwelling of the mysterious lord known as [[Mistmaster]].

popup.title: Noktil
popup.description: A village of 50 buildings that exported wood and sweet baked goods, used as a base by adventurers who venture into the [[Hullack Forest]].

popup.title: Hellgate Dell
popup.description: Formerly the site of the '''Hellgate Keep''', a triangular ruin of the keep destroyed in [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: High Gap
popup.description: A hilly passage across the [[Graypeak Mountains]] from the [[River Delimbiyr]] to the [[Fallen Lands]].

popup.title: Elven Port
popup.description: Ruins of [[Elven Port]] on the border of the [[High Forest]] on the western shores of the [[River Delimbiyr]].

popup.title: Nar Kerymhoarth
popup.description: Also known as the '''Nameless Dungeon''' or the '''Sleeping Citadel''', an underground fortress below a stone bluff in the [[igh Forest]] near to [[Elven Port]].

popup.title: The Thousand Maws
popup.description: A group of one hundred caves located in the [[Nether Mountains]], the homes of the [[Thousand Fists]] [[orc]] tribe.

popup.title: Mount Thorog
popup.description: One of the two tallest mountains east of the [[Moon Pass]], named after a deceased [[orc]] chieftain.

popup.title: Telkoun's Tower
popup.description: A [[wizard]] stronghold consisting of one building with two double towers.

popup.title: Mount Ieldroun
popup.description: One of the two tallest mountains east of the [[Moon Pass]], named for a long-dead [[orc]] chieftain.

popup.title: High Thorog
popup.description: A small valley located between [[Mount Ieldroun]] and [[Mount Thorog]] in the [[Nether Mountains]].

popup.title: The Fallen Lands
popup.description: A barren area of the [[Savage Frontier]], home to many monsters and even more mysteries. In the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], it was beset with ''[[dead-magic]]'' zones, areas of ''[[wild magic]]'' and random discharges of ''[[witchfire]]''.

popup.title: Masulk's Tomb
popup.description: The ruined burial place of [[Masulk the Magnificent]], a vizar who was stricken by a terrible and incurable [[disease]].

popup.title: Taerymdoom
popup.description: A network of natural caves guarded by [[vargouille]]s, located in the southern borders of the [[Far Forest]]

popup.title: Greypeak Mountains
popup.description: Also known as '''Greypeaks''' or '''Gray Peaks''', a rugged and desolate mountain range famous for being exceptionally hard to traverse and home to many fearsome beasts, monstrous humanoids, and even aberrant beings that inspired terror in wary travelers.

popup.title: Lonely Moor
popup.description: Area of boggy terrain occupied by bands of [[gnoll]]s and [[bugbear]]s.

popup.title: Everwood
popup.description: Or '''Silverwood''', a small forest east of the [[Evermoors]].

popup.title: Everlund
popup.description: A city of merchant traders and caravan teams and was one of the greatest supporters of the league of the [[Silver Marches]].

popup.title: Everlund Pass
popup.description: The 50 miles (80 km) road from [[Everlund]] to [[Silverymoon]], which crossed the western end of the [[Nether Mountains]].

popup.title: Moonwyvern Inn
popup.description: A favorite stopover on the [[Everlund Pass]], especially for those doing business that would not be tolerated in most cities around [[Luruar]]; it served [[venison]] and [[fernwort]] bread, with [[fiddlehead soup]] and fried [[mushroom]]s when in season.

popup.title: Khelb
popup.description: A tiny village at the western end of [[Silverymoon Pass]].

popup.title: Striding Giant Rapids
popup.description: A section of rapids located around a [[petrified]] [[giant]] in the middle of the [[River Rauvin]], just downriver from [[Everlund]].

popup.title: Rauvinwatch Keep
popup.description: The headquarters for the [[Argent Legion]], the grand army that comprised soldiers from the member-cities of the [[Confederacy of the Silver Marches]].

popup.title: Xammux
popup.description: Or '''Caverns of Xammux''', a partially flooded cave system that contained the legendary [[Library of Tarchamus]].

popup.title: Weathercote Wood
popup.description: A forest of the [[Triangle of Trees]], located in the great expanse known as the [[Savage Frontier]] that existed from before the rise of [[Netheril]] and continued to endure despite the advancing of the desert of [[Anauroch]].

popup.title: Spellgard
popup.description: Formerly known as '''Saharelgard''',  the ruin of an ancient castle complex dating from the [[Netherese Empire]], located on a rocky ridge, northeast of [[Llorkh]], where the southern edge of the [[Fallen Lands]] met the eastern edge of the [[Anauroch]] desert.

popup.title: Dekanter
popup.description: Formally the [[Netherese]] '''Mines of Dekanter''', ruins found beneath the [[Graypeak Mountains]] in the [[Savage Frontier]].

popup.title: The Dire Wood
popup.description: Also known as the '''Enchanted Wood''', an ancient and supernatural area within the [[High Forest]] found in the North.

popup.title: Dawn Pass
popup.description: A passage across the [[Greypeak Mountains]] that split into the [[Dawn Pass Trail]] moving south and [[Zhentarim]]'s [[Black Road]] that crossed [[Anauroch]].

popup.title: Dawn Pass Trail
popup.description: The trail with its westernmost point being the town of [[Loudwater]] and ended at the [[Lonely Moor]].

popup.title: Parnast
popup.description: A small village in the [[Savage Frontier]] with a long history of being controlled by less-than-reputable organizations, such as the [[Zhentarim]] and the [[Cult of the Dragon]].

popup.title: Bleached Bones Pass
popup.description: Previously known as the '''Vale of Naurogloth''', an ancient route that wound through the [[Greypeak Mountains]] named for the end seemingly endless piles of sun-bleached bones that littered its length through the mountains.

popup.title: Taransen's Grave
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Jortay's Folly
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Stormkeep
popup.description: An [[obsidian]] tower in the shape of a sharp fang located in the [[Fallen Lands]].

popup.title: Reversed Obelisks
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Olostin's Hold
popup.description: A fortified keep home to about 200 people and provided security for about 600 farmers and ranchers in the surrounding area.

popup.title: The Woods of Turlang
popup.description: A thicket located amongst the northwestern grouping of trees in the [[High Forest]], watched over by [[Turlang]], and over 100 other [[treant]]s.

popup.title: Flint Rock
popup.description: The ancestral mound of the [[Elk tribe]] of [[Uthgardt]] [[barbarian]]s located in the [[Evermoors]].

popup.title: The Calling Horns
popup.description: An inn, and later, small settlement, south of the [[Evermoors]].

popup.title: Dead Horse Ford
popup.description: A crossing on the [[Dessarin River]], south of [[Calling Horns]], a part of [[Jundar's Pass]], the trail from [[Beliard]] to Calling Horns.

popup.title: Dead Horse Path
popup.description: A pathway that connected the [[Dead Horse Ford]] crossing with [[Noanar's Hold]].

popup.title: Noanar's Hold
popup.description: A village, just off the [[Evermoor Way]], just on the edge of the [[High Forest]].

popup.title: The Laughingflow
popup.description: Also known as the '''Trollflow'' in [[Nesmé]], a tributary of the [[River Surbrin]].

popup.title: Settlestone
popup.description: Also known as '''Dwarvendarrow''' and '''The Ruin''', a village outside of [[Mithral Hall]], resettled in [[1358 DR]] by the [[barbarian]]s of [[Icewind Dale]] under the leadership of [[Berkthgar]] in alliance with Mithral Hall.

popup.title: Menzoberranzan
popup.description: The '''City of Spiders''', located deep in the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Talntower
popup.description: An ancient dwarven waterwork that consisted of a spring-fed reservoir, channels, valves, and a collecting pool for drinking, watering animals, or bathing that was still in operation in the Year of Wild Magic, [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: Tall Trees
popup.description: The northeastern section of the [[High Forest]] believed to contain the oldest [[tree]]s in the [[High Forest]].

popup.title: Grandfather Tree
popup.description: An [[arakhor]], an elder form of [[treant]], which appeared as a monstrously large, gnarled [[oak]] [[tree]] located deep in the heart of the [[High Forest]].

popup.title: Lost Peaks
popup.description: Also known as the '''Lost Mountains''', a pair of isolated mountains located in the [[High Forest]] and the origin point of the [[Dessarin River]].

popup.title: Old Road
popup.description: A cracked cobblestone road that has partly fallen into disrepair and become overgrown by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: The Hall of Four Ghosts
popup.description: The ruined logging town of '''Caddarak''' by [[1370 DR]].

popup.title: Karse
popup.description: A city in the [[High Forest]] that became a ruin shortly after its founding.

popup.title: Black Plain
popup.description: A stretch of land located 40 miles east of the [[Hullack Forest]] just south of the [[East Way]], once a site of an [[oak]] forest, destroyed in a failed attempt to turn it into farmlands.{{approx}}

popup.title: Star Mounts
popup.description: An impressive and forbidding range of peaks located in the center of the [[High Forest]] – an inspiration for many fanciful tales and wild stories created by local troubadours and woodsmen of the North.

popup.title: Unicorn Run
popup.description: A river that started in the [[Star Mounts]] and joined the river [[Delimbiyr]] near [[Secomber]], its every natural race was said to have emerged from the womb of [[Chauntea]] onto [[Toril]].

popup.title: The Sisters
popup.description: A set of waterfalls running over cliffs south of the [[Star Mounts]]; seeing the [[moon]] rise over the Sisters and glimpse a [[unicorn]] atop a cliff was considered a blessing of good fortune from the goddess [[Mielikki]].

popup.title: North Fork
popup.description: A shorter tributary of the [[Unicorn Run]].

popup.title: Endless Caverns
popup.description: A series of deep-reaching cavern and tunnel complexes, home to [[Grimnoshtadrano]], the Riddling Dragon, and the [[lich]] [[Aumvor The Undying]].

popup.title: Stronghold of the Nine
popup.description: An underground cavern complex on the banks of the [[Unicorn Run]], originally a [[dwarf|dwarven]] hold.

popup.title: Uluvin
popup.description: A sleepy crossroads town situated on a cross-road or several trails, including the [[Iron Road]] and the [[Secomber Trail]], along with a trail that led along the [[Unicorn Run]] into the [[High Forest]].

popup.title: Secomber Trail
popup.description: The trail connecting [[Uluvin]] and [[Secomber]].

popup.title: The Greyvale
popup.description: A valley lying around the [[Greyflow]] and [[Loagrann River]]s and part of the greater [[Delimbiyr Vale]]

popup.title: Myth Glaurach
popup.description: Or '''Glaurachyndaar''', the '''City of Scrolls''', a ruined [[Eaerlann]]i garden city.

popup.title: Starsilver
popup.description: A tributary of the river [[Delimbiyr]] and one of [[The Talons]], on which [[Myth Glaurach]], the City of Scrolls once stood.

popup.title: Reitheillaethor
popup.description: A [[wood elf]] village that, for some of its history, existed as a winter retreat for the forest's [[elves]], a place for them to take up seasonal residence before continuing their nomadic ways in the warmer months of the year.

popup.title: Mhiilamniir
popup.description: Ruins of a city of the [[elven]] realm of [[Eaerlann]].

popup.title: Sheir Peninsula
popup.description: A peninsula in [[Lapaliiya]] – a massive [[granite]] outcrop extending westward, between the [[Ormpur Bay]] on the north and the [[Sheir Bay]] in the south.

popup.title: Funearil
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Chastel
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Aunthurr
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Nlintar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Umbarra
popup.description: An island of note.

popup.title: Untisczer
popup.description: Once one of the [[Cities of the Seabreeze]], destroyed by the [[Shoon Imperium]] in [[285 DR]].

popup.title: River Mhair
popup.description: A waterway located in the [[Mhair Jungles]] that fed the [[Lapal Sea]]'s eastern side.

popup.title: River Lemas
popup.description: The waterway that connected [[Lake Lemas]] with the [[Lapal Sea]].

popup.title: Lake Lemas
popup.description: A jungle lake connected to the [[Lapal Sea]] via the [[River Lemas]].

popup.title: Ss'dath'in'ssatath
popup.description: A ruin of note in [[Serpentes]], the Nation of Serpents.

popup.title: River Tharynd
popup.description: The river that was born in the [[Delphin Mountains]] and fed the [[Lapal Sea]]'s northern side.

popup.title: Abbey of Tharynd
popup.description: An abbey dedicated to the goddess [[Selûne]] hidden in a vast natural cavern.

popup.title: Ss'inthee'ssaree
popup.description: A ruined [[yuan-ti]] capital city controlled by [[House Se'Sehen]].

popup.title: Tashtan Coast
popup.description: The coastline in [[Tashalar]].

popup.title: Crypt of Anthilar
popup.description: The legendary secret lair of the [[lich]] [[Anthilar]], known as the [[Archmage]] of [[Untisczer]].

popup.title: Ss'yin'tia'saminass
popup.description: A ruined [[yuan-ti]] city controlled by [[House Jennestas]].

popup.title: Aztul
popup.description: A large but unremarkable fishing town found in southern [[Thindol]].

popup.title: River Lundeth
popup.description: Also called the '''Cascades'' because of its turbulent flow.

popup.title: The Chultengar
popup.description: The branch of the main jungle of [[Chult]] that encroached on Thindol and Samarach, inhabited by [[spirit naga]]s, [[pterafolk]], [[wild dwarves]], [[wyvern]]s, and [[Batiri]].

popup.title: Luo Peaks
popup.description: Or '''Sky Lizard Mountains''', a branch of the [[Peaks of Flame]] that jutted toward [[Thindol]] on the [[Chultan Peninsula]].

popup.title: Ishau
popup.description: A village sunken in the [[Spellplague]], home to reef and [[hunter shark]]s, along with aquatic [[dinosaur]]s called [[plesiosaur]]s.

popup.title: Lake Luo
popup.description: An alkaline lake located in the [[Valley of Embers]] that fed the [[River Olung]].

popup.title: Valley of Embers
