popup.description: A barren lowland covered in lava flows that spewed out of the [[Peaks of Flame]], the sky above was choked with clouds of ash and dotted with blazing cinders.

popup.title: Tulhospyr
popup.description: A ruin rumored to be the capital of a small kingdom of [[Tathtar]].

popup.title: Murpeth
popup.description: A settlement of note, the location of a temple to [[Beshaba]] where ''[[The Black Book]]'' once was kept.

popup.title: Ulkan
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Vale of the Reaver
popup.description: A lush valley named for its occupancy of devout followers of [[Garagos]], the Reaver.

popup.title: Llacerellyn
popup.description: An [[Underdark]] [[mind flayer]] settlement.

popup.title: Dunkapple Castle
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Jundar's Hill
popup.description: The location of a ford across the [[Dessarin River]] and the site of the [[Bargewright Inn]].

popup.title: Horn Stream
popup.description: A tributary of the [[River Surbrin]].

popup.title: Berun's Hill
popup.description: A bare-topped, conical hill that commanded a splendid view of the valley of the [[Dessarin River]] to the east.

popup.title: Mornbryn's Shield
popup.description: A swamp village on the edge of the [[Evermoors]], home of the 15{{th}} century [[paladin]] [[Xenk Yendar]] and the source of the famed delicacy – [[Shield moss]].

popup.title: Yartar
popup.description: A fortified city member city of the [[Lords' Alliance]].

popup.title: Port Llast
popup.description: A harbor town closely allied with [[Neverwinter]].

popup.title: Green Griffon Inn
popup.description: A roadside inn of note.

popup.title: Charwood
popup.description: A southeastern portion of the [[Neverwinter Wood]].

popup.title: Triboar Trail
popup.description: A trail that connected the [[High Road]] with the town of [[Triboar]].

popup.title: Conyberry
popup.description: A small farming village famous for the magical grove that was home to the [[elven]] [[banshee]] named [[Agatha]].

popup.title: Neverwinter Wood
popup.description: Previously called '''Llewyrrwood''', a dense forest that possessed a sense of magic within it.

popup.title: River Mirar
popup.description: Also known as the '''Tanlur''' to the ancient [[dwarves]], a cold waterway that began in the [[Spine of the World]], ran through the [[Valley of Khedrun]], until finally ending in [[Luskan]].

popup.title: The Crags
popup.description: A series of savage hills, broken mounds, and mountains found on the [[Sword Coast North]], and the location of the infamous volcanic [[Mount Hotenow]].

popup.title: Mount Hotenow
popup.description: Known to the ancient [[dwarves]] as '''Glaurimm''', a volcano deep in [[Neverwinter Wood]] that was the reason the [[Neverwinter River]] never froze over.

popup.title: Tower of Twilight
popup.description: The home to [[Malchor Harpell]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Starmetal Hills
popup.description: A series of rocky knolls named after a number of meteor showers that pelted this hilly area.

popup.title: Karsus Butte
popup.description: The [[petrified]] remains of the Momentary God [[Karsus]] with the city of [[Karse]] built at the "foot" of the fallen god, a [[marble]] shrine was located atop it.

popup.title: Mother-Of-Mists
popup.description: An island in the [[Trackless Sea]] lying some way south of [[Lantan]] and west of [[Chult]].

popup.title: Ssan
popup.description: Also called '''the Daughters''', a small archipelago near the [[Mother-Of-Mists]].

popup.title: Mistcliffs
popup.description: A mountain range that spanned the northwestern coast of [[Chult]], home to one of only four major colonies of [[aarakocra]] in all of [[Faerûn]] as of [[1372 DR]].

popup.title: River Soshenstar
popup.description: One of the three great rivers of [[Chult]], often used for travel by canoe, and it poured over a waterfall about every ten or fifteen miles on its journey to the sea.

popup.title: River Tiryki
popup.description: A minor river that flowed north from the back of a mist-shrouded canyon into the [[Bay of Chult]] near [[Port Nyanzaru]]; it was considered by many to be perhaps the most dangerous river in all of [[Chult]].

popup.title: Port Nyanzaru
popup.description: A port city and an [[Amn]]ian colony that gained independence in late 1480s [[DR]].

popup.title: Fort Beluarian
popup.description: A trade fort run by the [[Flaming Fist]] on behalf of the city-state of [[Baldur's Gate]].

popup.title: Kitcher's Inlet
popup.description: A minor inlet on the northern edge of the greater [[Refuge Bay]].

popup.title: Ataaz Muhahah
popup.description: Also known as the '''Laughing Gorge''' in the [[Chultan language]], a canyon on the [[River Olung]], a deep chasm over 100 feet (30.5 meters) in depth, at one point, crossed by the [[Monkey Bridge]].

popup.title: Kir Sabal
popup.description: A cliffside monastery home to a flock of [[aarakocra]] [[monks]], nestled into the side of a massive plateau that overlooked the surrounding jungle canopy.

popup.title: River Olung
popup.description: A major river inhabited by [[aldani]] and home to ''[[bara]]'' [[Mainu]], who appeared as a patch of darkness with golden eyes to those who saw her.

popup.title: Mezro
popup.description: The site of the great city of the [[Tabaxi (tribe)|Tabaxi humans]] of [[Chult]], transported to a pocket plane by its deity – [[Ubtao]] to protect it from the destruction of the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Port Castigliar
popup.description: Once a trade harbor town, emptied under the onslaught of the [[under]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Camp Righteous
popup.description: A military outpost of the [[Order of the Gauntlet]], ruined in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Camp Vengeance
popup.description: A forward camp for the [[Order of the Gauntlet]] for their operations in [[Chult]].

popup.title: Hisari
popup.description: An ancient, ruined [[sarrukh]] taken over by their descendants, the [[yuan-ti]].

popup.title: Valley of Lost Honor
popup.description: Once the last refuge of the [[Eshowe]] tribe before they were wiped out by [[Ras Nsi]].

popup.title: Kobold Mountains
popup.description: A mountain range on the western coast of [[Chult]], the site of the [[dwarven]] [[Wyrmheart Mine]].

popup.title: Land of Ash and Smoke
popup.description: The area of the jungle, scorched by volcanic activity, south of the [[Peaks of Flame]].

popup.title: The Cauldron
popup.description: A bay located on the southern coast of [[Chult]], bordering the [[Land of Ash and Smoke]].

popup.title: Shilku Bay
popup.description: A bay of note.

popup.title: Ss'zuraass'nee
popup.description: '''The City of Abominations''', a large [[yuan-ti]] city in the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Tor of Swords
popup.description: A [[granite]] upcropping on [[Pelleor's Praire]], where the abbey of [[Endar Aglandtor]], dedicated to [[Haela Brightaxe]], was dug into a series of caverns at the base of the Tor.

popup.title: Thelarn's Tomb
popup.description: A [[dwarven]] tomb underneath the [[Hill of Lost Souls]].

popup.title: Keep of the Lizard King
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Ithkyxan's Lair
popup.description: The home of a [[spirit naga]] serving King [[Ebarnaje]] and a guardian of ''[[portal]]s'' linking the [[Serpent Hills]] with the [[Slitherswamp]] level of [[Undermountain]].

popup.title: Ss'essethen'aa
popup.description: A city of twisting tunnels inhabited by [[yuan-ti]] [[cleric]]s of [[Sseth]] and [[ophidian]] laborers.

popup.title: Reeshov
popup.description: A fortified settlement located in the [[Underdark]], inhabited by [[grimlock]]s, [[quaggoth]]s, [[lizardmen]], and [[troglodyte]]s.

popup.title: Ss'khanaja
popup.description: An [[Underdark]] city inhabited mainly by high-class [[naga]]s and their staff.

popup.title: Great Petrified Serpent
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: River Catherine
popup.description: A stream found in the [[Serpent Hills]] that red the [[Serpent's Tail Stream]].

popup.title: Tsenviilyq
popup.description: A [[derro]] city in the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Lyran's Hold
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Talis
popup.description: An ancient ruined city built by the [[Talfirc]] people.

popup.title: Illith'arear
popup.description: An ancient [[druid]]ic circle of [[redwood]] [[trees]] with rune-engraved [[menhir]]s embedded within them.

popup.title: Ss'thar'tiss'ssun
popup.description: Ruins of the '''City of Fountains'''', a [[sarrukh]] realm.

popup.title: Crypt of the Six
popup.description: One of many [[Anaurian]] tombs littered throughout the [[Serpent Hills]].

popup.title: Thundertree
popup.description: A small village, ruined in [[1451 DR]].

popup.title: Cragmaw Castle
popup.description: A ruined castle, named after its inhabitants in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Cragmaw Hideout
popup.description: A cave base for the [[Cragmaw tribe]] of [[goblin]]s in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Old Owl Well
popup.description: A popular watering hole and rest stop for caravan traffic between [[Yartar]] and [[Neverwinter]].

popup.title: Wyvern Tor
popup.description: A crag in the [[Lost Hills]], northeast of the [[Sword Mountains]], and was easily seen by any on the [[Triboar Trail]] near the vicinity of [[Conyberry]].

popup.title: Lost Hills
popup.description: An especially perilous stretch of hills named for the magic that afflicted the region, which caused travelers to become hopelessly lost when passing within.

popup.title: Icespire Peak
popup.description: A mountain home to a fortress of [[frost giant]]s, and the ancestral home of a clan of [[dwarves]] that had ties to an ancient [[artifact]] that granted power over frost and cold.

popup.title: Wave Echo Cave
popup.description: A great cavern complex within the northern [[Sword Mountains]] and the location of the ''[[Forge of Spells]]''.

popup.title: The Place of the Unicorn
popup.description: A sacred grove where an [[avatar]] of [[Lurue]] was known to occasionally appear.

popup.title: Southkrypt Garden
popup.description: The ruins of a [[dwarfhold]] with its name derived from the fact that its [[dwarven]] inhabitants had constructed a magnificent garden around it.

popup.title: Morgur's Mound
popup.description: The ancestor mound of the [[Thunderbeast tribe]] of the [[Uthgardt]].

popup.title: Black Raven River
popup.description: Also known as the '''Blackford''', a tributary of [[River Mirar]] that flowed from the [[River Caves]] in the [[Spine of the Word]], through the [[Ice Lakes]], before merging with Mirar.

popup.title: Wreck of the Narwhal
popup.description: A mysteriously washed-ashore [[galleon]] that once sailed between [[Baldur's Gate]] and [[Chult]].

popup.title: Needle's Bones
popup.description: A massive grotto, resembling a sinkhole with a shallow pool of murky green water at the bottom.

popup.title: Baelrah
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Sujjar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Tsan
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Darluj
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Dtakkar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Anchoril
popup.description: A port city of note.

popup.title: Suj
popup.description: The southern companion of the island of [[Lantan]], a fairly hilly land with rocky pinnacles emerging from lush jungles.

popup.title: Lantan
popup.description: An island-nation in the [[Trackless Sea]], known for its advanced technology and the population's devout worship of [[Gond]].

popup.title: Orlil
popup.description: A small rocky island located off of the southeastern coast of [[Lantan]], another significantly smaller island off of Orlil's shores was home to a population of sentient [[wombat]]s and [[platypus]]es.

popup.title: The Suj-lan
popup.description: A deep bay on the isle of [[Suj]].

popup.title: The Sambar-Run
popup.description: A small straight that separated the islands of [[Lantan]] proper and [[Suj]].

popup.title: Gulf of Lath
popup.description: A narrow gulf cut into [[Lantan]] for roughly 75 miles (120 kilometers), running northeast into the island.

popup.title: Lethtar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Illul
popup.description: The center of the faith of [[Gond]] in the [[Realms]] and the site of the [[High Holy Crafthouse of Inspiration]].

popup.title: Sambar
popup.description: The capital city of [[Lantan]].

popup.title: Sundrah
popup.description: A city of note.

popup.title: Northern Means
popup.description: A windswept trail that connected the city of [[Luskan]] to the [[Frozenfar]].

popup.title: Ice Lakes
popup.description: A group of frigid lakes in [[northwest Faerûn]] including: [[Derthym]], [[Belardym]], [[Rarghraum]], [[Loroloth]], and [[Antaerth]].

popup.title: Blackford Road
popup.description: The road that connected the city of [[Luskan]] to [[Mirabar]].

popup.title: Orglaunt
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: House of the Axe
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Gauntlgrym
popup.description: The capital of the [[Delzoun]], reclaimed and ruled by King [[Bruenor Battlehammer]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ruins of Iniarv's Tower
popup.description: The tower home of the [[lich]] [[Iniarv]].

popup.title: Ravenwitch's Tree
popup.description: The home of the mysterious [[Ravenwitch]].

popup.title: Chare'en's Prison
popup.description: The ruined glass prison of [[Chare'en]] of the [[Army of Darkness]].

popup.title: Hundelstone
popup.description: A trade town of 1,200 [[gnome]]s, [[dwarves]], and [[human]]s.

popup.title: Fireshear
popup.description: A mining city in the [[Frozenfar]] that worked [[copper]] and [[silver]] veins.

popup.title: Ironmaster
popup.description: An isolated towered city built into the rocky walls of a valley in the [[Frozenfar]].

popup.title: Shaengarne River
popup.description: A river that flowed from [[Maer Dualdon]] in [[Icewind Dale]] to the [[Sea of Moving Ice]].

popup.title: Klauthen Vale
popup.description: An area of land claimed by [[Klauth]], a [[red dragon]], filled with the dragon-owned [[sheep]], [[goat]]s, and [[rothé]].

popup.title: Iron Trail
popup.description: The trail that connected [[Ironmaster]] and the [[Ten Trail]].

popup.title: Ten Trail
popup.description: A major trade route across the [[Spine of the World]].

popup.title: Ironmaster Vale
popup.description: A coastal valley littered with stone [[menhir]]s, in the [[Cold Run]] region of the [[Frozenfar]], where the [[Shaengarne]] river opened up into the [[Sea of Moving Ice]].

popup.title: Fireshear Vale
popup.description: A great crevasse that opened up the icy tundra of the [[Cold Run]], comprised of a long fissure that opened up into a massive crater.

popup.title: The Icepeak
popup.description: An island that was mostly made up of a huge volcano.

popup.title: Aurilssbarg
popup.description: The largest settlement on [[Ice Peak]] island that traded in [[scrimshaw]], [[oil]]s, and animal skins.

popup.title: Bjorn's Hold
popup.description: A small coastal trade settlement on [[Ice Peak]] island.

popup.title: Icewolf
popup.description: A small village located to the east of the [[Ice Peak]] volcano and south of a small [[Northlander]] complex.{{approx}}

popup.title: Ten Towns
popup.description: Frontier towns that dealt in [[scrimshaw]] from the great lakes of [[Maer Dualdon]] and [[Lac Dinneshere]]. The Ten-Towns were: [[Dougan's Hole]], [[Good Mead]], [[Easthaven]], [[Caer-Dineval]], [[Caer-Konig]], [[Lonelywood]], [[Bremen]], [[Termalaine]], [[Targos]], and [[Bryn Shander]].

popup.title: Kelvin's Cairn
popup.description: A lone 1,000-foot-tall mountain fronted by a river valley about as deep as the mount was high. The mountain top was always capped with snow and ice even through the short summer.

popup.title: Caravan Route
popup.description: The portion of the [[Ten Trail]] that stretched from the northern foothills of the [[Spine of the World]] to the town of [[Bryn Shander]].

popup.title: Iceflow
popup.description: A river that intercepted the [[Northern Means]].

popup.title: Auckney
popup.description: A a small fiefdom near the [[Spine of the World]].

popup.title: Maerlon Mountain
popup.description: A mountain to the northeast of the town of [[Auckney]].

popup.title: Cryshal-Tirith
popup.description: The site where [[Cryshal-Tirith]] was first erected in the 1350s [[DR]], in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], it, and other sites of the tower produced deposits of the ''[[black ice]]''.

popup.title: Cold Run
popup.description: A large stretch of frigid tundra that ran from the mouth of the [[Iceflow]] to [[Icewind Dale]].

popup.title: Lac Dinneshere
popup.description: One of the three great lakes of [[Icewind Dale]] inhabited by the [[knucklehead trout]] and mysterious and elusive [[aquatic elves]], last seen in [[1281 DR]].

popup.title: Maer Dualdon
popup.description: The largest of the three in the region, with deep azure waters, the location of the barbarian [[Burial Isle]]. Its shores were settled by four out of ten [[Ten-Towns]].

popup.title: Icewind Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass of note between [[Lac Dinneshere]] and [[Kelvin's Cairn]].

popup.title: Eastway
popup.description: A road from [[Bryn Shander]] to [[Easthaven]], that turned into a humble trail that ran further east towards the town of [[Kuldahar]].

popup.title: Redwaters
popup.description: Also known as '''Dellon-lune''', one of the three great lakes of [[Icewind Dale]].

popup.title: Shaengarne Ford
popup.description: A small logging village on the shores of the [[Shaengarne]] river by a bridge across, in [[Icewind Dale]] that hit its "golden age" due to prosperous lumber trade in the 1450s [[DR]].

popup.title: Wandering Village
popup.description: A nomadic village of hunters and gatherers that traveled the [[Frozenfar]] between the lands est of the [[Ten-Towns]] to the foothills of the [[Spine of the World]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Fields of Slaughter
popup.description: A large plot of tundra land that ran between the [[Spine of the World]] an the ruins of the [[Severed Hand]] by its edge.

popup.title: The Accursed Tower
popup.description: A ruined tower, swallowed by the earth in the [[Great Thaw]]. It once belonged to the [[necromancer]] named [[Damien Morienus]]. The tower's top was used as a local circle of stones.

popup.title: The Great Forked Tree of Mituki
popup.description: The ancient forked [[tree]] named after the legendary [[barbarian]] hero of the Fox and Sky.

link.label: The Great Forked Tree of Mituki

popup.title: Svardborg
popup.description: A [[frost giant]] fortress built atop an iceberg in the [[Sea of Moving Ice]].

popup.title: Nesmé
popup.description: A small frontier town that exported [[iron]] ore, [[steel]] [[weapon]]s, and [[armor]].

popup.title: Mithral Hall
popup.description: A [[dwarven]] stronghold beneath [[Fourthpeak Mountain]] in the [[Frost Hills]], home to [[Clan Battlehammer]].

popup.title: Frost Hills
popup.description: A barren region in the southern reaches of the [[Spine of the World]].

popup.title: Fourthpeak
popup.description: One of four sister mountains in the [[Spine of the World]], the location of the [[Mithral Hall]] stronghold.

popup.title: Moonwood
popup.description: Part of the [[Glimmerwood]], joined with the [[Cold Wood]], dominated by [[evergreen]]s, [[shadowtop]]s, and [[duskwood]]s.

popup.title: Citadel Felbarr
popup.description: Originally a [[dwarven]] citadel of over 25,000 souls that at different times in history had belonged to dwarves, [[human]]s, [[orc]]s, and, since [[1367 DR]], once again – the dwarves.

popup.title: Lurkwood
popup.description: Also known as '''Vurykvudd''' in the [[dwarven]] tongue, home to the [[Thunderbeast tribe]] dwelled within the wood.

popup.title: Grunwald
popup.description: A small, yet civilized [[Uthgardt]] village of the [[Thunderbeast tribe]].

popup.title: Griffon's Nest
popup.description: A permanent settlement of the [[Griffon tribe]] of [[Uthgardt]] [[barbarians]].

popup.title: River Khedrun
popup.description: A tributary of [[River Mirar]] that ran down the [[Spine of the World]] through the [[Valley of Khedrun]].

popup.title: Valley of Khedrun
popup.description: A [[dandelion]] and tall grass-filled valley where the [[River Mirar]] joined with the [[River Khedrun]].

popup.title: The Dungeon of Death
popup.description: A subterranean structure, once a [[dwarf|dwarven]] [[gem]] mine, until they were driven out by [[medusa]]e, who in turn were killed by [[troll]]s, and by the 1300s [[DR]], it was in the clutches of [[nabassu]] [[fiend]]s.

popup.title: Shining White
popup.description: The ancestor mound of the [[Griffon tribe]] of the [[Uthgardt]].

popup.title: Shining Creek
popup.description: A waterway that traveled through the center of the [[Lurkwood]], joined the [[Goblintide River]] before the resulting tributary met with the [[River Surbrin]].

popup.title: Goblintide River
popup.description: Also known as '''Gaurlynlur''', a waterway that ran through the eastern [[Lurkwood]], joined with [[Shining Creek]] before emptying into the [[River Surbrin]].

popup.title: Dungeon of Ruins
popup.description: A dungeon of note.

popup.title: Great Worm Cavern
popup.description: The traditional ancestor mound of the [[Great Worm Tribe]] of [[Uthgardt]], dedicated to the Great Worm beast totem.

popup.title: Castle of Illusion
popup.description: A remote keep protected by [[illusion]]s and [[glamer]]s, [[ward]]s, traps, and subtle yet deadly puzzles all through, below, and outside.

popup.title: Beorunna's Well
popup.description: A large settlement of the [[barbarian]]s of the [[Black Lion Tribe]] and the ancestral mound of Black Lion and [[Red Tiger tribe]]s.

popup.title: The Lonely Tower
popup.description: A tower of white stone, home to [[wizard]] [[Ssessibil Istahvar]].

popup.title: Druarwood
popup.description: A hillside forest, sparse and narrow, full of [[pine]], [[spruce]] firs, and [[conifer]]s.

popup.title: One Stone
popup.description: An ancestor mound for the [[Golden Eagle]], [[Red Pony]], and [[Sky Pony]] [[Uthgardt]] [[barbarian]] tribes

popup.title: Herald's Holdfast
popup.description: A spellguarded library complex that belonged to the [[Heralds of Faerûn]] and their primary repository of heraldic lore, history, genealogy, and artifacts from nearly all the [[humanoid]] races native to [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: Quaervarr
popup.description: A small woodland town in the [[Silver Marches]] that started out as a logging camp but grew to be a small town that both tended and logged the trees of the [[Moonwood]] with great care.

popup.title: High Hold
popup.description: A small town in the [[Rauvin Vale]] protected by [[Silverymoon]].

popup.title: High Ice
popup.description: A desolate monster-infested glacier, found directly north of the [[Anauroch]] desert that had been extended from its original size by the magic of the [[phaerimm]].

popup.title: Mulhessen
popup.description: A small town in [[Sembia]] located just north of [[Saerloon]] along [[Belduuk Road]].

popup.title: Tildaryn's Ride
popup.description: A small roadway found in eastern [[Sembia]] that connected [[Ordulin]] in the west with [[Yhaunn]].

popup.title: Coastwatch
popup.description: A small road found in [[Sembia]] that connected [[Yhaunn]] in the north with the smaller towns of [[Surd]] and [[Tulbegh]].

popup.title: Taela's Trail
popup.description: A roadway that connected [[Ordulin]] in the north with the smaller town of [[Surd]].

popup.title: Lurker in the Shallows
popup.description: A mysterious creature inhabiting the [[Yhauntan Bay]] rumored to reside in an enormous lair packed with treasure.

popup.title: Tupaal
popup.description: An underwater city of note.

popup.title: Quaelon
popup.description: An underwater settlement of note.

popup.title: Farr Windward
popup.description: A small settlement with the population strictly limited to outcasts, eccentrics, and their descendants, from many cities of the [[Sword Coast]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Cave of Lost Hope
popup.description: An underwater landmark of note.

popup.title: Ornstar
popup.description: A tiny hamlet southwest of [[Ordulin]].

popup.title: Yeven's Shrine
popup.description: A shrine of note.

popup.title: Griffonfang Bridge
popup.description: The bridge famed for the [[Treaty of Griffonfang Bridge]] of [[1439 DR]].

popup.title: Skultan
popup.description: A town known for its fences and smugglers of both [[Cormyr]] and [[Sembia]].

popup.title: Lion's Eye Oasis
popup.description: The lushest of the oases found in the entirety of the desert; at its center was a small lake, encircled by ascending grasslands, dotted with wildflowers and large boulders.

popup.title: Secret Place in the Sands
popup.description: A region of the [[Anauroch]] located south of the [[Quarter of Emptiness]].

popup.title: Hlaunga
popup.description: A secret, [[Zhentarim]]-manufactured oasis that served as a waypoint for Zhent caravans that traveled across the [[Great Grand Sea]] via the [[Black Road]].

popup.title: Road of Jackals
popup.description: One of the two paths across the [[Scimitar Spires]] in the [[Anauroch]] desert.

popup.title: Tel Badir
popup.description: A [[D'tarig]] village located along the eastern edge of [[The Sword]].

popup.title: Sixstreams River
popup.description: A waterway also known as '''The Arm''' that ran west from the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]] into [[Tel Badir]] and ended in the hot sands of [[Anauroch]].

popup.title: Bitter Well
popup.description: An oasis occupied by the [[Zhentarim]] spellcaster [[Yhekal]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Three Dead Camels
popup.description: A site of a historic battle.

popup.title: Darkenshield
popup.description: A small [[Cormyr]]ean village in the [[Stonelands]] which was destroyed by the forces of the Lost King [[Gondegal]] in [[1352 DR]].

popup.title: The Sunglade
popup.description: A clearing wherein ancient standing stones still stood – the oldest circle in the [[Yuirwood]].

popup.title: Reach Road
popup.description: The coastal road that connected [[Scardale Town]] and the town of [[Harrpwdale]].

popup.title: Neiroon's Hut
popup.description: Home of [[Neiron the Schemer]], a powerful 14{{th}} century [[DR]] [[ranger]].

popup.title: Hlintar Ride
popup.description: A major road that connected [[Calaunt]] with the town of [[Hlintar]] and the village of [[Dragon Falls]].

popup.title: Mirrormoss Bay
popup.description: Also known as '''Neirthoura''', the large bay at the northernmost end of the [[Dragon Reach]].

popup.title: Pirate's Doom
popup.description: A sunken [[nautiloid]].

popup.title: Komat's Cave
popup.description: An underwater landmark of note.

popup.title: Demonreef
popup.description: A dangerous reef of note.

popup.title: Coryselmal
popup.description: Ruins of the underwater '''Coral Capital''' of the [[aquatic elven]] empire of [[Arselmaly]].

popup.title: Eldath's Gate
popup.description: A magic ''[[gate]]'' of note.

popup.title: Orilidren
popup.description: One of the Six Holy Cities of the [[ixitxachitl]] nation in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] known as the [[Xedran Reefs]].

popup.title: Ilteon
popup.description: An underwater town of the [[ixitxachitl]] that worshiped [[Ilxendren]] before the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Orildren
popup.description: An underwater settlement of note.

popup.title: Ilramas
popup.description: An underwater town of the [[ixitxachitl]] that worshiped [[Ilxendren]] before the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Ageadren
popup.description: One of the Six Holy Cities of the [[ixitxachitl]] nation in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]], obliterated in [[1369 DR]] during the [[Twelfth Serôs War]].

popup.title: Ilkanar
popup.description: An underwater town of the [[ixitxachitl]] that worshiped [[Ilxendren]] before the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Thuridru
popup.description: An underwater settlement of note.

popup.title: Tor Augural
popup.description: An underwater city, part of the [[kuo-toa]]n nation of [[Olleth]].

popup.title: Grand Tor Arcanal
popup.description: The capital of the underwater [[kuo-toa]]n nation of [[Olleth]].

popup.title: Tor Evocal
popup.description: An underwater city, part of the [[kuo-toa]]n nation of [[Olleth]].

popup.title: Tor Charmal
popup.description: An underwater city, part of [[Olleth]], the [[morkoth]] country in [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Tor Thaumatal
popup.description: An underwater city, part of [[Olleth]], the [[morkoth]] country in [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Tor Abjural
popup.description: An underwater city, part of [[Olleth]], the [[morkoth]] country in [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Tor Arcal
popup.description: An underwater city, part of [[Olleth]], the [[morkoth]] country in [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Tor Necral
popup.description: An underwater city, part of [[Olleth]], the [[morkoth]] country in [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Somur
popup.description: An aquatic settlement of note.

popup.title: Voalidru
popup.description: A major [[merfolk]] city, obliterated by [[Iakhovas]] in the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Avina
popup.description: An underwater settlement, obliterated by [[Iakhovas]], its inhabitants turned into [[zombie]]s in the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Lacuan
popup.description: An underwater settlement, obliterated by [[Iakhovas]], its inhabitants turned into [[zombie]]s in the [[Twelfth Serôs War]] of [[1369 DR]].

popup.title: Xadea
popup.description: An underwater [[merfolk]] settlement of note.

popup.title: Naults
popup.description: An underwater settlement of note.

popup.title: Tor Phantal
popup.description: An underwater city, part of the [[kuo-toa]]n nation of [[Olleth]].

popup.title: Pumanath
popup.description: An underwater city, [[triton]] protectorate.

popup.title: Ahlorsath
popup.description: The capital of one of the three [[triton]] kingdoms in the [[Trench of Lopok]].

popup.title: Altarn
popup.description: One of the [[Brokenshores]] islands.

popup.title: Brokenshores
popup.description: An archipelago off the shores of [[Altumbel]].

popup.title: Vuuvaxath
popup.description: The capital of one of the three [[triton]] kingdoms in the [[Trench of Lopok]].

popup.title: Skullmount
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Us'rath
popup.description: An underwater city of note.

popup.title: Us'holm
popup.description: An underwater city of note.

popup.title: South Fang
popup.description: The easternmost part of the [[Easting Reach]], south of [[Cape Dragonfang]].

popup.title: New Sarshal
popup.description: A small fishing village on a stream rich with [[gold]].

popup.title: Mauberg's Oak
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Uthmere
popup.description: A small city turned walled village during the years of [[Spellplague]], that found a second life as a busy trade outpost as of [[1479 DR]].

popup.title: Even's Gulf
popup.description: The gulf that crowned [[Easting Reach]]'s northernmost end.

popup.title: Ilmwatch
popup.description: A large fortress-town that protected the infamous [[Buzzard Beak Harbor]] and traders of the [[Merchant's Run]], located on the northern end of the [[Easting Reach]], within the [[Farwater]] region of [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Buzzard Beak Harbor
popup.description: A small bay guarded by [[Ilmwatch]]; its ownership shared between [[Damara]] and [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Merchant's Run
popup.description: Sometimes called '''Merchants Run''' or the '''Merchants' Run''', a busy trade route that connected the realms of [[Damara]] and I[[mpiltur]] in the [[Cold Lands]].

popup.title: Cairnpur
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Maracrath
popup.description: A small town in [[Impiltur]], often used as an overnight stop for travelers along [[Merchant's Run]].

popup.title: Guidodale
popup.description: A small town in [[Impiltur]], often used as an overnight stop for travelers along [[Merchant's Run]].

popup.title: The Old Water
popup.description: Sometimes called '''Cold Water,'''  a large frigid lake located downstream beyond [[Bluefang Water]], along the [[Great Imphras River]].

popup.title: Bluefang Water
popup.description: A large cold lake found in northeastern [[Impiltur]] that sat downstream where the [[River Icehilt]] joined the [[Great Imphras River]], just northwest of the [[Herald's Road]].

popup.title: Herald's Road
popup.description: A major trade route that traversed [[Impiltur]], connecting the [[Royal Road]] to the [[Merchant's Run]] in the town of [[Ilmwatch]].

popup.title: The Crowned King
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: The Moaning Gorge
popup.description: A narrow valley nestled in the eastern ends of the [[Earthspurs]] and the [[Earthfast Mountains]].

popup.title: Purple Cliffs
popup.description: High coastal cliffs, colored purply by flowers and [[quartz]] deposits.

popup.title: Fortress Faithful
popup.description: A cliffside fortress that contained a castle, an abbey, and a garrison.

popup.title: Castle Tethyr
popup.description: A haunted ruin of what once was the largest castle in the [[Lands of Intrigue]] and the seat of power for [[Tethyr]]'s royal family.

popup.title: Saharkhan
popup.description: A [[granite]] keep that once belonged to Count of [[Bashyrvale]].

popup.title: Marakir
popup.description: A settlement known for its many produce stalls and woven goods.

popup.title: Canaith
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Ithalyr
popup.description: The ruins of the first royal palace of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Barrowsmorn
popup.description: A [[halfling]] farming community, the location of a massive [[rose]] garden nearly 1 mile long.

popup.title: St. Rhynda's
popup.description: A landmark and a ''[[gate]]'' of note.

popup.title: Vineshade
popup.description: The capital of [[wine]]making in [[Tethyr]] inhabited by [[halfling]] master vintners.

popup.title: Castle Dasaajk
popup.description: An abandoned castle of note.

popup.title: Krennasar
popup.description: The castle built for the Count of [[Tellyshal]], which changed hands in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], becoming home to Duchess [[Marilyn Haresdown]].

popup.title: Monastery of the Yellow Rose
popup.description: Also known as the '''Citadel of the White Worm''', a monastery dedicated to [[St. Sollars]] the Twice-Martyred and [[Ilmater]], the Broken God.

popup.title: Ravensburg
popup.description: The capital and largest city of the [[Duchy of Carmathan]] in the Kingdom of [[Damara]] that served as the ducal seat, it was sometimes called '''Ravensrock'''.

popup.title: Sudrav
popup.description: A small mining town that was politically aligned with [[Impiltur]] despite being part of [[Damara]].

popup.title: Tomrav
popup.description: A small mining settlement populated by [[human]]s, [[dwarves]], and [[half-orc]]s who helped the village remain friendly with neighboring [[goblinoid]] communities.

popup.title: Easting River
popup.description: The river that fed [[Even's Gulf]]'s northernmost point.

popup.title: Earthwood
popup.description: A thick and fertile swiftly-growing forest that grew out of stony, hilly soil, ensorcelled by an ancient [[druid]].

popup.title: Lake Icemelt
popup.description: A cold mountain lake near the [[High Pass]] south of the Earthwood.

popup.title: River Icehilt
popup.description: A small river that flowed from [[Lake Icemelt]] south out of the mountains via the [[High Pass]], and then west to east across the base of the mountains before merging with the [[Great Imphras River]] just north of the [[Bluefang Water]].

popup.title: High Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass of note through wich the [[River Icehilt]] flowed southeast.

popup.title: Valls
popup.description: A small city in [[Damara]] and the walled capital of the Duchy of [[Arcata]].

popup.title: Dunwood
popup.description: Also known as '''The Rawlinswood''' prior to [[1479 DR]], a large forest in the north of the [[Great Dale]].

popup.title: Relgar's Ford
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Red Bluffs
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Fell Pass
popup.description: A large rocky east-to-west vale in the [[Spine of the World]] where [[ghost]]s from old battles roamed.

popup.title: The Gate from World to World
popup.description: A landmark of note.

link.url: The Gate from World to World
link.label: The Gate from World to World

popup.title: Dead Orc Pass
popup.description: A narrow pass in the [[Rauvin Mountains]], one of the few ways through the mountains that were traversable by traders and other travelers.

popup.title: Yeshelmaar
popup.description: A major settlement in the [[Forest of Lethyr]] and the center of civilization in the [[Great Dale]].

popup.title: The Mucklestones
popup.description: A magical ring of standing stones that bordered a cleared-out, circular bowl on the land.

popup.title: Dun-Tharos
popup.description: A ruined city that was the seat of various men and women known as [[Nentyarchs]], occupied by the [[Chosen]] of [[Talona]], known as the [[Rotting Man]] in [[1371 DR]].

popup.title: Arches of Xenosi
popup.description: A ruined path, lined with great arches approximately forty or fifty feet.

popup.title: Fullpoint
popup.description: A small village in [[Thesk]] placed along a detour from the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Val-Murthag
popup.description: A ruined fortress-city that existed during the ancient empire of [[Narfell]], nothing but a series of collapsed stone walls by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Bezentil
popup.description: A walled trading settlement in the [[Great Dale]] that dealt in [[wood]]en items, [[herb]]s, produce, and [[leather]] goods.

popup.title: Great Road
popup.description: The single roadway that passed through the length of the [[Great Dale]] and that for many years separated the [[Dunwood]] and the [[Forest of Lethyr]], in the [[Unapproachable East]].

popup.title: Clymph Tower
popup.description: A ruined tower of note, linked with the [[Tower Threespires]] via a ''[[portal]]''.

popup.title: Tower Threespires
popup.description: A tower in the eastern forest linked by ''[[portal]]s'' with the [[Clymph Tower]].

popup.title: Nighthawk Tower
popup.description: A ruined tower of note.

popup.title: Kront
popup.description: A small crossroads settlement and trade outpost situated where the [[Great Road]] intersected with the [[Cold Road]], repudiated by the nearby nations of [[Thesk]], [[Rashemen]], and the tribes of [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Fell Wood
popup.description: A small haunted monster-infested wood in the mountains of the [[Spine of the World]].

popup.title: Cold Marshes
popup.description: Small frigid marshland adjacent to the [[Fell Woods]], infested with [[spider]]s, [[ettercap]]s, [[wyvern]]s, [[snow troll]]s, and frequented by [[barbarian]]s of the north.

popup.title: Black Raven Monastery
popup.description: A monastery dedicated to the teachings of the [[Black Raven (person)|Black Raven]], a near-mythical hero and a quasi-deity of the [[Uthgardt]] people. It hid a connection to the [[Underdark]] in [[Valas Belaem del Pharm]]'s tomb.

popup.title: River Caves
popup.description: A [[hook horror]]-inhabited cave complex, where [[Blackford]] spilled out onto the surface, that hid a [[duergar]] stronghold.

popup.title: Hand of the Seldarine
popup.description: An elven fortress later known as the '''Severed Hand''', built ''circa'' [[900 DR]], and destroyed by being pulled into [[Limbo]] in [[1312 DR]].

popup.title: Wyrm's Tooth Glacier
popup.description: A glacier carved out by the [[dwarves]] of [[Dorn's Deep]] into a massive, open-air temple complex dedicated to [[Dugmaren Brightmantle]].

popup.title: Dorn's Deep
popup.description: A [[dwarf|dwarven]] stronghold that at one time was allied with the [[elves]] of the [[Severed Hand]].

popup.title: Dragon's Eye
popup.description: A large volcanic structure, identifiable by its huge toothed maw and glowing "eye" with extensive caverns and subterranean passages underneath.

popup.title: Temple of the Forgotten God
popup.description: An isolated [[giant-kin]] subterranean temple found in the [[Spine of the World]] located in a canyon east of [[Kuldahar]].

popup.title: Vale of Shadows
popup.description: A mountainside valley built by the [[barbarian]] king [[Kresselack]] to be a collection of tombs in which he and his [[undead]] remained in the undeath.

popup.title: Kuldahar
popup.description: A mountain town built in the [[Kuldahar Valley]] surrounding the [[Great Oak]] that shielded the valley with its magical warmth.

popup.title: Kuldahar Pass
popup.description: A dangerous route that stretched from the town of [[Easthaven]], across mountains, and reached the [[Kuldahar]] Valley.

popup.title: Tower of Lamenation
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Citadel of Conjurers
popup.description: A dark tower built in the final years of the [[Narfelli]] empire, taken by [[Eltab]] in [[1373 DR]].

popup.title: New Moranay
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Royal Road
popup.description: A long, well-traveled road that spanned the [[Easting Coast]] in southern [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: The Shimmerglade
popup.description: A rocky clearing located within a small copse of [[pine]] trees found on the banks of the [[Icehilt River]] that featured a wide, unnaturally formed crater.

popup.title: Hall of Loyalty
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Borgar's Mill
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Three Horns
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Sidewinder River
popup.description: A winding and rough river, too dangerous for most shipping and dangerous to cross.

popup.title: Great Imphras River
popup.description: A system of three rivers found in [[Damara]] and [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Vordic Dun
popup.description: A rough-and-tumble mining town well-patrolled by the [[Warswords]] of [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: Laviguer
popup.description: A mining town and a hub for the mining industry in the [[Earthspur Mountains]].

popup.title: Tower Ithfel
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Belfry of Battle
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: The Prince's Road
popup.description: A road in the [[Uplands]] that connected [[Outentown]] in the east and [[Laviguer]] in the west.

popup.title: The Hunt Trail
popup.description: The trial that connected the towns of [[Ylraphon]] and [[Kurth (town)|Kurth]].

popup.title: Pass Trail
popup.description: The trail that connected the villages of [[Tavilar]] and [[Blanaer]] and linked the [[Hunt Trail]] and the [[Cross Road]].

popup.title: Lion's Walk
popup.description: Also known as '''Tantras Trail''', a road that connected the city of [[Tantras]] and the village of [[Highbank Forest]].

popup.title: High Country
popup.description: A territory filled with rocky moors and grassy plains and hills, bordered by the [[North Road]] and the [[Earthspur Mountains]].

popup.title: New Hope
popup.description: A [[halfling]] village of those hin who lost their homes in [[Raven's Bluff]] during a war in [[the Vast]] in the late 14{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Hidden Hollow
popup.description: A young town, built in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], part of the tiny [[Kingdom of Earthenmore]].

popup.title: Burrowbluff
popup.description: An agrarian town of [[halfling]]s and [[gnome]]s, situated on the juncture of the [[High Trail]] and the [[Ravens Bluff Road]].

popup.title: Portsoy
popup.description: A mostly-isolated small [[fish]]ing village that stood along a rarely-used coastal trail, traversable on foot only.

popup.title: Arbonne
popup.description: A tiny fishing village surrounded by farmlands with a single shipbuilder named [[Justin of Arbonne]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Helm's Hold
popup.description: A fortified cathedral dedicated to [[Helm]].

popup.title: Watcher's Forest
popup.description: The part of the [[Neverwinter Wood]], tended by some residents of nearby [[Helm's Hold]].

popup.title: Nightsedge
popup.description: A small village on the border of the [[Neverwinter Wood]] and often menaced by the forest's inhabitants, such as [[orc]]s and [[troll]]s.

popup.title: Windycliffs
popup.description: A small merchant town and a safe caravan stop named after powerful winds that battered the town at the base of a small cliff.

popup.title: Crossergate
popup.description: A small town and a caravan stop on the [[High Road]] that had a lot of accommodations and shops that serviced passing travelers.

popup.title: Vilnask
popup.description: A small mining town and a caravan stop on the [[High Road]] that produced raw [[silver]], [[iron]], and [[mithral]].

popup.title: Firward Mountains
popup.description: A small mountain range found in [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Erech Forest
popup.description: A dark and isolated forest on the edge of [[Rashemen]], inhabited by [[assassin vine]]s and s[[hambling mound]]s, as well as fearsome beasts like [[owlbear]]s, [[night hunter]]s, and at least one [[gray render]].

popup.title: Mount Nar
popup.description: A massive snowcapped mountain in the [[Firward Mountains]], visible across most of [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Falls of Erech
popup.description: A waterfall system where the [[River Erech]] emptied into the northern expanse of the [[Lake Ashane]] just south of the [[Long Road]] and [[Mistbridge]].

popup.title: Luirbrech
popup.description: A lake of note.

popup.title: Helena Gap
popup.description: A small mountain pass – the location of [[Bildoobaris]], a large tent city.

popup.title: Ormpur
popup.description: A waymeet town of note.

popup.title: Nar-sek Qu'tel
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Lake Mereth
popup.description: The westernmost lake of the [[Teardrops]].

popup.title: Lake Muirenon
popup.description: The largest of the [[Teardrops]] lakes in [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Huta Lake
popup.description: One of the smaller lakes forming the [[Teardrops]] in [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Lake Musker
popup.description: One of the lakes of the [[Teardrops]].

popup.title: Lake Ashane
popup.description: Also known as the ''' Lake of Tears''', a large, glacial lake that formed the western border of [[Rashemen]], known for its smell of red [[juniper]] berries.

popup.title: Cold Road
popup.description: A route in the [[Unapproachable East]], heading roughly north from [[Nethentir]] in western [[Thay]] to [[Hoarbridge]] in northern [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Hark's Finger
popup.description: Also known as '''Mount Jiksidur''' to the [[Nar]], the most prominent landmark found in the flatlands of central [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Citadel Tralkarn
popup.description: The seat of power of the [[durthans]] in [[Rashemen]] during the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], constructed in secret without alerting the hated [[hathran]]s.{{approx}}

popup.title: Denderdale
popup.description: The narrowest point in [[Dunwood]], sometimes used by travelers as a shortcut through the forest.

popup.title: River Erech
popup.description: A small waterway that originated in the [[Icerim Mountains]] and the [[Teardrops]], flowed south into [[Rashemen]] and connected with the northern shore of the [[Lake Ashane]].

popup.title: Mistbridge
popup.description: The bridge where the [[Long Road]] crossed over the [[River Erech]].

popup.title: Ragnor Camp
popup.description: A usual camping ground for the dangerous tribe of [[Nars]] – [[Ragnor (tribe)|Ragnor]].

popup.title: Towers of Smoke
popup.description: A [[Raumathar]]i ruin named after the plumes of smoke that constantly leaked from their tops.

popup.title: Iceborn River
popup.description: A river that formed from several smaller tributaries that flowed south from the [[Icerim Mountains]] along the border of [[Rashemen]] and ]]Narfell]].

popup.title: Icerim Mountains
popup.description: Mountains that were once part of the [[Great Glacier]], inhabited by many tribes, including the [[Tark]], [[Chif]], and [[Dagranost]].

popup.title: Fortress of the Half-Demon
popup.description: A ruined stone fort built in antiquity by the [[Nar]] people and had a huge [[iron]] gate fashioned into the face of a leering [[demon]].

popup.title: Huhrong's Road
popup.description: A prominent roadway found in northern [[Rashemen]] that stretched from [[Immilmar]] to [[Mulptan]] and continued northeast along the outskirts of the [[ndless Wastes]] until reaching [[Nathoud]].

popup.title: Ring of Blue Fire
popup.description: Or the '''Ring of Gray Flames''', a series of ruined towers arranged in a circle, found that dated back to the ancient empire of [[Raumathar]].

popup.title: Nathoud
popup.description: A fortified town that sat in the hill country at the feet of the southern slopes of the [[Icerim Mountains]], built by the [[Myir]] clan of [[Nars]].

popup.title: Urlingwood
popup.description: A wild, untamed forest that was considered to be of great importance to the [[Wychlaran]].

popup.title: Urling
popup.description: A small, hidden-away settlement, home to many witches of the nation's [[Wychlaran]].

popup.title: Immil Vale
popup.description: A magical valley in the northern stretch of the [[Running Rocks]] peaks, famous as the site of the [[Battle of Immil Vale]], that occurred in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Mulptan
popup.description: The great vast, wind-battered trade city of [[Rashemen]], overflowing with tents and stalls.

popup.title: Immilmar
popup.description: The capital city of [[Rashemen]] and seat of power for the nation's [[Iron Lord]], famous for its great crafters, whose goods were renowned across the [[Unapproachable East]] and the [[Cold Lands]].

popup.title: Taporan
popup.description: A small riverside settlement of stone buildings lined with cobblestone streets, both uncommon in [[Rashemen]].

popup.title: Shevel
popup.description: The greatest of [[Rashemen]]'s trading towns that laid on the great [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Tshasunta
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Red Tree
popup.description: A massive [[aspen]] [[tree]] and prominent landmark found within [[Immil Vale]], with half of the tree's leaves constantly changing colors as if it were autumn.

popup.title: Mulsanyaar Plateau
popup.description: A stretch of rugged terrain that sat in the shadow of the [[Sunrise Mountains]] to the east and was actually just a continuation of the northernmost branch of the [[Thayan Plateau]].

popup.title: Priory of the Depths
popup.description: A hidden temple dedicated to [[Umberlee]], its entrance hidden in shore cliffs and accessible via an underwater cave tunnel.

popup.title: Ashenwood
popup.description: A wild evergreen forest known for its large number of [[fey]] inhabitants and considered a sacred site filled with ancient magic.

popup.title: Citadel Rashemar
popup.description: A ring-shaped fortress in the [[Sunrise Mountains]], besieged and ruined by the [[Tuigan Horde]] in [[1360 DR]].

popup.title: Running Rocks
popup.description: A series of mountains of solid [[granite]], intercut by a series of chasms and canyons.

popup.title: River Ashan
popup.description: A short but swift-running raging river of fierce rapids, largely unusable by the [[Rashemaar]] people.

popup.title: River Rasha
popup.description: The great slow-moving broad river that was vital to the prosperity of the [[Rashemaar]] people

popup.title: River Fir
popup.description: A rather nondescript waterway that originated in the [[granite]] mountains of the [[Running Rocks]], connected with the great [[River Rasha]], before emptying out into the [[Lake Tirulag]].

popup.title: River Tir
popup.description: A river that served as a crucial trading route for the [[Rashemaar]] people.

popup.title: Lake Tirulag
popup.description: An ice-cold lake that provided great natural resources and cultural significance for [[Rashemen]].

popup.title: Tinnir
popup.description: A secluded village of whitewashed buildings, hidden away in a small forested valley on the southeastern shore of [[Lake Tirulag]].

popup.title: Omvudurth
popup.description: A sprawling black many-towered fortress owned by a small army of [[goblin]]s under the command of their chieftain [[Omvurr]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ferry Route
popup.description: A ferry route across the [[River Mulsantir]], part of the [[Golden Way]].

popup.title: Mount Omvulag
popup.description: A prominent peak located within the [[Sunrise Mountains]] between [[Rashemen]] and [[Thay]].

popup.title: White Rusalka Vale
popup.description: A vale that was a ''[[dead-magic]]'' zone on the shores of the [[Lake Ashane]] to all but [[Rashemi]] [[witch]]es.

popup.title: Dernovia
popup.description: A walled village surrounded by grain fields and cattle.

popup.title: Snowcat Mountain
popup.description: A mountain in the vicinity of the village of [[Dernovia]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Witch Tower
popup.description: One of the [[Rashemi]] [[Witch Tower]]s.

popup.title: Witch Tower
popup.description: One of the [[Rashemi]] [[Witch Tower]]s.

popup.title: Witch Tower
popup.description: One of the [[Rashemi]] [[Witch Tower]]s.

popup.title: Witch Tower
popup.description: One of the [[Rashemi]] [[Witch Tower]]s.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Lythari Gate
popup.description: One of the ''[[gate]]s'' to the [[lythari]] demi-plane.

popup.title: Witchboat Crossing
popup.description: A ''[[witchboat]]'' route across the [[River Mulsantir]], used exclusively by the [[Wychlaran]].

popup.title: Szass Tam's Keep
popup.description: A personal fortress of [[Szass Tam]]'s.

popup.title: Mines of Tethkel
popup.description: Mines of note.

popup.title: Forest Blood River
popup.description: A river of note that begin in the [[Giantspire Mountains]], crossed the [[Dunwood]] and emptied into the [[Easting Reach]].

popup.title: Lethyrstream
popup.description: A stream in the western part of the [[Forest of Lethyr]].

popup.title: Lake Flam
popup.description: A small forest lake of note.

popup.title: Mettledale
popup.description: A dale of note, surrounded by the [[Forest of Lethyr]].

popup.title: Lake Murthil
popup.description: A lake of note.

popup.title: Lethgate
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Solin
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Eastwatch
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: The Dalestream
popup.description: A stream that ran across the [[Great Dale]] and emptied into the [[Easting Reach]].

popup.title: Fortress Narder
popup.description: A ruined fortress of note.

popup.title: Giantspire Mountains
popup.description: Mountains that formed the snowy and rugged borders of [[Damara]] and [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Giantspire Gap
popup.description: Also called the '''Giant Gap''', the main pass through the [[Giantspire Mountains]] separating [[Damara]] and [[Narfell]].

popup.title: Qu'encesta Camp
popup.description: A camping land of the far-ranging tribe of [[Nars]] found in [[Narfell]], known for their savage nature.

popup.title: Dag Nost Camp
popup.description: A camping land of the fairly large tribe of [[Nars]], the most civilized of the Nars tribes, comparable to the people of neighboring [[Impiltur]].

popup.title: The Great Barrow
popup.description: Haunted ancient ruins, once inhabited by a brutal [[human]] tribe, used to burry their god-born leader.

popup.title: Evrelthed's Hill
popup.description: A small farmstead situated about a half-day's walk north of the [[Great Road]], on the [[Dalestream]]'s northern shore.

popup.title: Carwyth Hold
popup.description: A small settlement – a minor clanhold.

popup.title: Noonym's Hold
popup.description: A small settlement – a minor clanhold.

popup.title: Thyl's Hold
popup.description: A small settlement – a minor clanhold.

popup.title: Mavalgard
popup.description: A minor keep and surrounding village founded by the [[Impiltur]]an family of [[Clan Maval]].

popup.title: N'Jast
popup.description: A village in [[Narfell]] that sat at the crossroads of the [[Long Road]] and the [[Cold Road]].

popup.title: Bildoobaris
popup.description: Also called '''the Trade Fair'', a large seasonal tent city and the unofficial capital of [[Narfell]] as of [[1479 DR]], that dominated the plains for one tenday each summer.

popup.title: The Great Glacier
popup.description: Also called '''Pelvuria''', a large mass of frozen land created in [[-2550 DR]] by the god [[Ulutiu]].

popup.title: Nobis
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Icelace Lake
popup.description: A huge frigid lake in [[Narfell]] that was created from runoff from the [[Great Glacier]].

popup.title: Jiyyd
popup.description: A waymeet and trade center in [[Narfell]] that began as a camp in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]] and grew to be a permanent settlement in the 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Peltarch
popup.description: The biggest permanent settlement in Narfell as of [[1479 DR]].

popup.title: Selmast
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Howser's Mine
popup.description: A mine of note.

popup.title: Cutrock
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Howser's Trail
popup.description: A mountain trail that connected the township of [[Cutrock]] and [[Howser's Mine]].

popup.title: Zarach
popup.description: A small farming community an the primary trading hub of its barony, located at the convergence of the [[Great Imphras River]] and the [[Sidewinder River]]].

popup.title: Withermeet
popup.description: A small village found in the [[Barony of Polten]] that sat along the eastern bank of [[Lake Mogador]] on the [[Merchant's Run]] road.

popup.title: Daleport
popup.description: A tiny village situated in the [[Barony of Polten]] on the border with the [[Barony of Morov]] where the [[Icelace River]] met [[Lake Mogador]].

popup.title: Kinbrace
popup.description: An important unwalled farming town on the eastern banks of the [[Galena Snake]].

popup.title: Galena Snake
popup.description: A winding river that flowed down the [[Galena Mountains]].

popup.title: Icelace River
popup.description: A twisting, fast waterway that never froze over, even in the harshest of winters, but it was deadly cold if someone fell in.

popup.title: Morovar
popup.description: A larger town on the eastern bank of the [[Goliad River]].

popup.title: Steppenhall
popup.description: The village also known as '''Little Narfell''', it was a farming community located in the [[Duchy of Soravia]].

popup.title: Merkurn
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Goliad
popup.description: A small high-walled city and the seat of power for the [[Duchy of Brandiar]].

popup.title: Kinnery
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Goliad River
popup.description: An important waterway found in [[Damara]], ideally suited for barges transporting goods throughout the heartlands.

popup.title: Lake Mogador
popup.description: A crucial central location in [[Damara]] for both commercial and political reasons.

popup.title: Helgabal
popup.description: The metropolis formerly known as '''Heliogabalus''', once the seat of government until King [[Gareth]] moved the capital to [[Bloodstone Village]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], and later, moved back to Helgabal in the mid-to-late 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Ostrav
popup.description: A small walled farming village that survived and thrived due to its political neutrality.

popup.title: Trailsend
popup.description: The capital of the [[Barony of Polten]] – the center for travel of the surrounding region, and appealed to adventuring parties looking for work or seeking to explore the ruins in [[Rawlinswood]] or the [[Giantspire Mountains]].

popup.title: King's Road
popup.description: The major travel and trade route connecting most of the major cities in the Kingdom of [[Damara]].

popup.title: Praka
popup.description: One of the larger cities in the [[Barony of Ostel]] in [[Damara]], known for its stout outer walls and mighty towers.

popup.title: Portith
popup.description: A medium-sized town on the western bank of [[Lake Mogador]], a popular stopping point for travelers weary of the long road.

popup.title: Brotha
popup.description: A small agricultural village in the [[Barony of Ostel]].

popup.title: Ironspur
popup.description: One of the three major [[dwarf|dwarven]] holds in the northern [[Galena Mountains]] as of the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Helmsdale
popup.description: A small farming town found in the [[Duchy of Soravia]].

popup.title: Bloodstone City
popup.description: Previously known as '''Bloodstone Village''' and '''Bloodstone Gate''', the capital of the [[Kingdom of Bloodstone]] encompassing [[Damara]] and [[Vaasa]]; it was razed in [[1469 DR]] by the [[Warlock Knight]]s of Vaasa.

popup.title: Bloodstone Pass
popup.description: The only reasonable crossing point through the [[Galena Mountains]]; the fertile vale through which it passed was known as [[Bloodstone Valley]].

popup.title: Nigel's Ford
popup.description: The primary crossing point of the [[Beaumaris River]] in eastern [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: River Pelauvir
popup.description: Also called '''The River of Ice''', a cold river in the far north of the [[Moonsea]] region.

popup.title: Beaumaris River
popup.description: The river that flowed south from [[Mirror Lake]], turned east and cut [[Vaasa]] in half, flowed through the [[Galena Mountains]] at the [[Bloodstone Pass]], and headed to the south into [[Damara]].

popup.title: Mirror Lake
popup.description: An icemelt lake northwest of [[Vaasa]], fed by the [[River Pelauvir]] and the source of the [[Beaumaris River]].

popup.title: Citadel of the Collector
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Etuabe
popup.description: A settlement of note, connected to the [[Reach (trail)|Reach]] via a trail.

popup.title: Shattersoul River
popup.description: A glacier runoff river that began in the frigid [[Titan Peaks]], flowed south until it joined with the [[River Pelauvir]] before the current emptied into the [[Mirror Lake]].

popup.title: Sepulcher of Oceam
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Mount Okk
popup.description: A 12,000 feet (3,700 meters) mountain in the [[Alpuk]] region of the [[Great Glacier]].

popup.title: Ice Castle
popup.description: A massive castle constructed of ice that stood within a fissure at the base of the northern side of [[Mount Okk]], built by a group of evil [[Vaasa]]n [[wizard]]s.

popup.title: Ahtitlak
popup.description: An [[Ulutiun]] village within a cavern around a large communal fire.

popup.title: Lugsaas Chain
popup.description: Also known as the '''Southern Shield''', or '''Titan Peaks''', a chain of mountains in the south of the [[Great Glacier]], which formed the border with the [[Cold Lands]] to the south.

popup.title: Bottomless Bogs
popup.description: An extensive area of cold swampland, foul mires, and smelly lakes in northwestern [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: Shrine of the Tear
popup.description: Once the secret hiding place of the ''[[Tear of Selûne]]'', captured by the [[Zhentarim]] in [[1365 DR]].

popup.title: Modurt
popup.description: A town in [[Vaasa]], primarily inhabited by [[goblin]]s and an unusually large number of [[barghest]]s.

popup.title: Damaran Gate
popup.description: A massive fortification in [[Damara]] that completely spanned the eastern end of [[Bloodstone Pass]].

popup.title: Vaasan Gate
popup.description: Or '''Iron Divide''', a massive fortification in [[Vaasa]] that completely spanned the western end of the [[Bloodstone Pass]].

popup.title: Virdin
popup.description: A small mining town within the [[Valley of Bloodstone]].

popup.title: Bloodstone Mines
popup.description: A large mining complex that produces [[bloodstone]]s fames across [[Faerûn]], located within the [[Bloodstone Pass]].

popup.title: Waukeshire
popup.description: A small forest found within the [[Bloodstone Pass]] with the tunnel complexes of the [[Warren]] hidden underneath.

popup.title: Warrenwood
popup.description: Previously known as '''Sleepy Wood''', a small but densely overgrown forest within the [[Bloodstone Pass]].

popup.title: Windless
popup.description: A town in [[Bloodstone Valley]], once considered to be a suburb of [[Bloodstone Village]].

popup.title: Lake Midai
popup.description: A small but vital freshwater lake within the [[Bloodstone Pass]].

popup.title: Tower of the Sage
popup.description: A landmark of note. just outside the [[Bloodstone City]], across the [[Beaumaris River]].

popup.title: Samek
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Frost Keep
popup.description: A [[frost giant]] fortress inhabited by seventeen frost giants, one of which was a powerful leader that commanded the others.

popup.title: Raven Rock
popup.description: The ancestral mound of the [[Black Raven]] and [[Gray Wolf]] tribes of [[Uthgardt]] people.

popup.title: Crag Creek
popup.description: A tributary of the [[River Mirar]].

popup.title: Mines of Mirabar
popup.description: Mines worked by the [[dwarves]] of [[Mirabar]].

popup.title: Mines of Mirabar
popup.description: Mines worked by the [[dwarves]] of [[Mirabar]].

popup.title: Mines of Mirabar
popup.description: Mines worked by the [[dwarves]] of [[Mirabar]].

popup.title: Evermelt
popup.description: A subterranean hot spring found within a cave at the base of the [[Reghed Glacier]], a holy place to the [[Reghedmen]] [[barbarian]]s.

popup.title: Icingdeath's Lair
popup.description: A glacier lair of the [[white dragon]] named [[Ingeloakastimizilian]], brother to [[Icewind]], killed by [[Wulfgar]] in [[1356 DR]] and raised as an [[undead]] creature in [[1485 DR]].

popup.title: Print's Floe
popup.description: A series of strange ice floes named after an ancient [[orc]] leader and the ancestral home of the [[Frozenfar]] orcs; they were said to cure diseases and heal wounds; however, that hat was unconfirmed.

popup.title: Print's Floe
popup.description: A series of strange ice floes named after an ancient [[orc]] leader and the ancestral home of the [[Frozenfar]] orcs; they were said to cure diseases and heal wounds; however, that hat was unconfirmed.

popup.title: Print's Floe
popup.description: A series of strange ice floes named after an ancient [[orc]] leader and the ancestral home of the [[Frozenfar]] orcs; they were said to cure diseases and heal wounds; however, that hat was unconfirmed.

popup.title: Castle Naerytar
popup.description: A swamp castle that served as the base of operations of the [[Academy of Stargazers]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]] and as an outpost of the [[Cult of the Dragon]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Holk House
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Mornhaven Towers
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Mere of Dead Men
popup.description:
Also known as '''Merdelain''', meaning "Slow Marching Court" in [[Elvish]]; the swamp's sinister name referred to the thousands of [[dwarves]], [[elves]], and [[human]]s of the [[Fallen Kingdom]] who were slain here during the invasion of an [[orc]] army in [[
615 DR]].

popup.title: Wolfhill House
popup.description: A ruined manor, accessible via [[Wolfhill Way]] that connected the ruins to the [[High Road]].

popup.title: Wolfhill Way
popup.description: A  minor road that connected the [[High Road]] with the hill on which the ruins of the [[Wolfhill House]] stood.

popup.title: Shrine of Swords
popup.description: A shrine to [[Tempus]], the Lord of Battles, located off the [[High Road]] that offered shelter and protection to those that entered.

popup.title: Kheldell Path
popup.description: A path that connected [[Kheldell]] with the [[Long Road]] at [[Red Larch]].

popup.title: Redcliffs
popup.description: Dangerous sea rock cliffs just north of the [[Red Rocks]].

popup.title: Gundarlun Island
popup.description: A subarctic island lashed with long winter storms inhabited largely by [[Northmen]]; with [[Gundbarg]], the Gateway Port on the island's eastern shores.

popup.title: Purple Rocks
popup.description: A small archipelago of rocky outcroppings that sheltered its verdant valleys from the storms behind their sparse forested peaks.

popup.title: Whalebones
popup.description: A small archipelago named after the [[whale]] skeletons that could be found on the islands' beaches.

popup.title: Ioma
popup.description: One of the larger islands in the [[Nelanther Isles]] with only one town, appropriately called [[Ioma Town]].

popup.title: Isle of Skaug
popup.description: A small island in the [[Nelanther Isles]] with a single settlement called [[ Port of Skaug]].
popup.image: File:Rising Tide Map sea of swords.png

popup.title: Velen
popup.description: A port city on the [[Tethyrian Peninsula]], overlooking the [[Sea of Swords]], that served as the capital of the duchy of [[Cape Velen]], within the [[Kingdom of Tethyr]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]] and onward into the 15{{th}} century after the realm's independence was declared.

popup.title: Ruathym
popup.description: One of the larger islands north of the [[Moonshae Isles]] in the [[Trackless Sea]]; a rocky island with rugged coasts, narrow coves, green hills, forested purple mountains, and a few villages.

popup.title: Rethgaard
popup.description: A ruined ancient fortress of note, built by the [[dwarves]] of [[Haunghdannar]].

popup.title: Ruathym
popup.description: The largest settlement on the island of [[Ruathym]].

popup.title: Holgerstead
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Inthar
popup.description: A ruined fortress whose origins were unknown and that was avoided by almost all sailors.

popup.title: Dennik
popup.description: One of the larger but relatively featureless ilands of the [[Korinn Archipelago]] with its central plateau was prime land for grazing herds of animals.

popup.title: Dragonshome
popup.description: An island of note.

popup.title: Nerth
popup.description: An island of note.

popup.title: Ice Way
popup.description: A road that split from the [[Adbar Road]] and moved north.

popup.title: Tulrun's Tent
popup.description: A magical dwelling that looked like a colorful [[silk]] tent perched on top a plain wooden platform.

popup.title: Quaervarr Road
popup.description: The road that connected [[The Silver Road]] and the town of [[Quaervarr]].

popup.title: Ascalhorn River
popup.description: The westernmost rover of [[The Talons]].

popup.title: The Lurking River
popup.description: A tributary of the [[Goblintide River]].

popup.title: Bloodmuck
popup.description: A lake in the land of [[Thar]], the source of a short winding [[Tormel River]].

popup.title: The Skondarr
popup.description: A series of caves beneath [[Mount Tesh]] with its entrance on the southwestern side of the peak.

popup.title: Mount Horgrymborr
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Trading Post
popup.description: A trading outpost and a caravan stop, half a day horse ride south of [[Hillsfar]].

popup.title: Big Tree
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Wizard's Labyrinth
popup.description: A mysterious labyrinth ,grown out of thickets, trees, and shrubbery.

popup.title: Rock Quarry
popup.description: A rock quarry operated by [[human]]s and [[dwarves]].

popup.title: Ghost Lake
popup.description: A lake of note.

popup.title: Snowmantle
popup.description: A quiet and tranquil village o note, leveled in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], and resettled in the century that followed the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Flaming Tower
popup.description: Also known as the '''Tower of Flame''', a massive ruined tower on the northern border of [[Daggerdale]].

popup.title: Bone Dance
popup.description: A hill located in the [[Border Forest]] the site of ghostly apparitions of skeletal monsters that danced around the peak of the hill and attacked any intruders.

popup.title: Camnod's Cairn
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: River Zef
popup.description: A river of note that began in the mountains and tricked down into. the [[Border Forest]].

popup.title: Crescentflow
popup.description: A river of note that originated on the slopes of the [[White Peaks]] and snaked into the [[Border Forest]].

popup.title: Myth Ondath
popup.description: Formerly known as '''Yrlaancel''' and '''Ondathel''', a ruined city located in the [[Tortured Land]] of [[north Faerûn]].

popup.title: White Peaks
popup.description: A range of mountains located in the [[Moonsea North]] that divided the barren, desolate [[Tortured Lands]] in the north from the grassy steppes of [[the Ride]] to the south.

popup.title: Whitehorn Mountain
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Amaratha Stream
popup.description: A body of water that flowed south from the [[White Peaks]], named after [[amaratha]], a variety of light green jewel unique to [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: Citadel Ankhalus
popup.description: A keep north of the [[Vanishing Hills]], just southeast of [[Glumpen Swamp]], the base of the [[Masked Wizards of Ankhalus]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Toranth's March
popup.description: A trail that began near the city of [[Phlan]], at the [[Phlan Path]], and extended about 65 mi (100 km) north around the eastern edge of the [[Quivering Forest]] to [[Castle Vathar]].

popup.title: Frozen Flindyke
popup.description: A collection of [[gnoll]]-infested near-ruins in the [[Tortured Land]], located where a great bridge called [[Maram's Span]] crossed [[River Pelauvir]].

popup.title: Maram's Span
popup.description: The only bridge in the region across the [[River Pelauvir]].

popup.title: Razack's Tears
popup.description: A long stream that flowed north from the [[Dragonspines]], wound across [[the Ride]] before turning northeast and joining with [[Telstang Brook]].

popup.title: Verdigris
popup.description: A small mining settlement and vassal state of [[Phlan]], built along its namesake [[Verdigris Trail]], near the source of [[Razack's Tears]] waterway.

popup.title: Verdigris Trail
popup.description: A nearly-straight dirt trail that linked the community of [[Verdigris]] with [[Castle Vathar]] to the east.

popup.title: Glacier of the Silver Blades
popup.description: A glacier of note.

popup.title: Dragon's Claw Portal
popup.description: A ''portal'' of note.

popup.title: Mount Launt
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Mount Ombaddor
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Stoneshoulder Creek
popup.description: A creek that ran across the steppes of the [[the Ride]] just east of the [[Citadel of the Raven]].

popup.title: Lake Maltorus
popup.description: A late in the center of the plains situated between the [[White Peaks]] and the [[Dragonspine Mountains]], fed by the waters of the [[Stoneshoulder Creek]].

popup.title: Rogan's Sprint
popup.description: A long road that ran through [[the Ride]]; it originated in the mining town of [[Whitehorn]] in the [[White Peaks]], and extended east across the Ride to [[Verdigris]].

popup.title: Citadel of Strategic Militancy
popup.description: A fortress dedicated to the [[Red Knight]] and the heart of the [[Church of the Red Knight]] – its most major center of worship.

popup.title: Sunrise Spire
popup.description: A monastery dedicated to [[Lathander]], ruined in [[1177 DR]].

popup.title: Anga Vled
popup.description: A farming village of [[gnome]]s in the [[Fields of the Dead]].

popup.title: Aloum Lyndren
popup.description: A leaf farm owned by [[Tatha Beruel]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] located on the northern side of [[Skuldask Road]].

popup.title: Moonrise Towers
popup.description: A fortified temple complex and its surrounding town of [[Reithwin]], ruined in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] and taken over by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR.

popup.title: Fort Morninglord
popup.description: A keep in [[Elturgard]] garrisoned by the [[paladin]]s of the [[Order of the Companion]].

popup.title: New Breen
popup.description: A settlement of note, built in the century that followed the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Glass Mesa
popup.description: An enormous piece of translucent [[quartz]] which was forbidden to approach.

popup.title: The Whale's Flukes
popup.description: A tiny archipelago, west of [[Chult]]'s shores.

popup.title: Mintarn
popup.description: A popular and beautiful safe haven for those fleeing the authorities as well as neutral ground for conflicting parties to come to an accord; popular for its [[almond brandy]], [[lager]], and [[green wine]].

popup.title: Flamsterd
popup.description: A [[wizard]]-settled isle, named after the [[WAterdhavian]] mage named [[Flamsterd]].

popup.title: Carcathen
popup.description: A small western island in the [[Nelanther Isles]] with no noticeable ports, riddled with coastal caves.

popup.title: Darromar
popup.description: The metropolis formerly known as '''Ithmong''' and '''Calimaronn'''.

popup.title: Gorge of the Fallen Idol
popup.description:
Also known as the '''Gorge of Nomog-Geaya the Warrior''', a deep canyon carved by the [[River Ith]] in the county of [[Hazamarch]] in [[Tethyr]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Taurax Mountains
popup.description: Or '''Sunrise Mountains''', the mountain range that laid north of the [[Frozen Forest]] between the [[High Ice]] of the [[Anauroch]] to the west and the [[Great Glacier]] to the east.

popup.title: The Great Mount of Ghaethluntar
popup.description: A massive mountain in the extreme [[north Faerûn]], inhabited by [[gnoll]] miners who sent caravans down the [[Remorhaz Ride]] through the icy tundra, hauling 40 to 60 ore-laden sleds at a time from [[Mount Ghaethluntar]] to [[Frozen Flindyke]].

popup.title: Light in the Deep
popup.description: An aquatic landmark of note.

popup.title: Lotan's Abyss
popup.description: A body of water of note.

popup.title: Flamsterd's Sunken Tower
popup.description: An underwater ruin of note.

popup.title: Trackless Sea
popup.description: The ocean also known as the '''Trackless Ocean''', or '''Taylola''' on the continent of [[Maztica]].

popup.title: Sharksbane Wall
popup.description: A long underwater defensive barrier protecting the city of [[Serôs]].

popup.title: Mount Nirg
popup.description: A mountain of note.

popup.title: Ethvale
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Surcross
popup.description: A heavily fortified town in western [[Thay]] on the border with [[Thesk]].

popup.title: Gatlogh
popup.description: One of the nine towns of the [[sahuagin]] kingdom of [[Kurrimal]] and its predecessor [[Aleaxtis]], washed ashore and ruined during the [[Spellplague]].

popup.title: Erebos
