popup.description: A large city on the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] that could call up 8,000 troops and had a large fleet of ships with 5,000 marine soldiers.

popup.title: Jeblant
popup.description: A coastal village built in the century after the [[Spellplague]], swallowed by the [[Akanamere]] during the [[Second Sundering]].

popup.title: Pandrik
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Pandira
popup.description: An island within the [[Korinn Archipelago]] with the settlement of note named [[Westhaven]] as its port.

popup.title: Tetris
popup.description: A small southernmost island in the [[Korinn Archipelago]] inhabited by [[ffolk]] [[human]]s.

popup.title: Island of Viledel
popup.description: A tiny and mostly abandoned island – the location of the [[Island of Viledel]] and warring groups of [[orc]]s.

popup.title: Jacaman
popup.description: A small elongated isle located south of [[Dennik]].

popup.title: Rabin's Reef
popup.description: A forested island that was a popular summer destination for wealthy families, especially those of [[Ventris]].

popup.title: Ventris
popup.description: A major island within the [[Korinn Archipelago]] inhabited by [[human]]s, [[dwarves]], [[halfling]]s, and [[elves]].

popup.title: Chawdik
popup.description: A poor island that was part of the [[Korinn Archipelago]] that housed the the largest [[gnome|gnomish]] community among all the archipelago islands.

popup.title: Highport
popup.description: An island within the [[Korinn Archipelago]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Caftenor
popup.description: An island populated by [[halfling]]s with its one major settlement being [[Caftenor (town)|Caftenor Town]].

popup.title: Rottesheim
popup.description: A [[Northlander]] settlement on an unnamed island in [[Norheim]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Barret's Quay
popup.description: An island of note.

popup.title: Finback
popup.description: The southernmost isle of the [[Whale Bones]].

popup.title: Skadaurak Island
popup.description: The volcanic island home to [[Hoondarrh]], an ancient and powerful [[red dragon]].

popup.title: Greystaad
popup.description: A [[Northlander]] settlement on the island of [[Graygruun]] in [[Norheim]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Graygruun
popup.description: An island within the kingdom of [[Norheim]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Daryn's Rest
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Dalheim
popup.description: A [[Northlander]] village and the only settlement on the island.

popup.title: Llorgh
popup.description: A large island within the kingdom of [[Norheim]].

popup.title: Surtr's Maw
popup.description: The mountain that covered the southern half of [[Llorgh]].

popup.title: Northwind Strait
popup.description: A channel that connected the [[Trackless Sea]] with the [[Sea of Moonshae]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Cragmyr Keep
popup.description: A fortress of note.

popup.title: Myth Lharast
popup.description: A demiplane that existed beyond [[Toril]], the former ''[[mythal]]'' city and the center of [[Selûnite]] worship within [[Amn]].

popup.title: Dragon's Neck Peninsula
popup.description: The eastern part of the [[Tethyr Peninsula]], most of it covered in the [[Forest of Tethir]].

popup.title: Nacnarldar
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Tulmene
popup.description: A small settlement on the south coast of the [[Tethyr Peninsula]] known for being the largest fishing village in the region that occasionally traded goods with merchants.

popup.title: Monguldarath
popup.description: A small fortified keep that belonged to [[Tethyr]]ean Counts of [[Fyraven]], built atop a ridge just five miles southeast of the town of Tulmene, overlooking the waters of the [[Firedrake Bay]]

popup.title: Honorguard House
popup.description: A fortified manor of County [[Fyraven]].

popup.title: Burnt Bones Cove
popup.description: Once a prosperous settlement called [[Larungyr]], later a peaceful cove with remnants of the burnt town, on the north-eastern edge of the [[Dragon's Neck Peninsula]].

popup.title: Jhaansciim
popup.description: A small fishing village on the northern shores of [[Firedrake Bay]] along a minor dangerous trade route.

popup.title: Ommlur Hills
popup.description: The foothills of the [[Small Teeth]] located on the west side of the [[Trade Way]], noted for their pristine beauty.

popup.title: Imnescourse
popup.description: A roadway that ran across central [[Amn]] from the town of [[Imnescar]], along the edge of the [[Umar Hills]], through the town of [[Gambiton]], and ending at the city of [[Esmeltaran]].

popup.title: Bormton
popup.description: A ruined village in [[Amn]], raized in [[1347 DR]], by the people of [[Tethyr]] because they heard a rumor that the village took in some refugees who had escaped the carnage during the [[Ten Black Days of Eleint]].

popup.title: Twin Towers of the Eternal Eclipse
popup.description: A pair of towers used as a temple of [[Cyroc]], hidden high in the [[Small Teeth]] mountains, one on each side of the [[Trade Way]].

link.url: Twin Towers of the Eternal Eclipse
link.label: Twin Towers of the Eternal Eclipse

popup.title: Winter Edge
popup.description: A hamlet in [[Silver Marches]] that rose to prominence during the war with King [[Obould]] in [[1370 DR]].
popup.image: File:Two Swords Spine of the World.png

popup.title: Shallows
popup.description: Ruins of a hamlet destroyed in [[1370 DR]].
popup.image: File:Two Swords Spine of the World.png

popup.title: Uthgardt Hills
popup.description: Also known as '''Wild Hills''' or "where the Barbarians hunt."

popup.title: Arnise Hold
popup.description: The familial keep and homestead of the noble [[Arnise]] family that opened its guest house to travelers, offering them inn-like services.

popup.title: Carlsmere
popup.description: Once a favored summer home of the royal [[Tethyr]]ean Royal Family, turned into a haunted abandoned manse.

popup.title: Dragondown Rise
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Dragon's Head Peninsula
popup.description: The western part of the Tethyr [[Peninsula]], most of it covered in the [[Forest of Tethir]].

popup.title: Tordraken
popup.description: The ducal keep of the [[Duchy of Draknor]] and later the [[Cape Velen]] duchy, nestled on the northern seaside of the [[Dragon's Head Peninsula]] in [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Old Velmene Road
popup.description: The road that connected the city of [[Velen]] and the town of [[Tulmene]].

popup.title: Horn Cliffs
popup.description: High and mostly uninhabited sea-cave-riddled coastal cliffs of [[County Firedrake]].

popup.title: Acoval's Cove
popup.description: A cove famed for its rich [[pearll]] harvest.

popup.title: Dragon's Teeth Lagoon
popup.description: The peaceful body of water between the "jaws" of the [[Dragon's Head Peninsula]].

popup.title: Kossuth's Ire
popup.description: A long-dormant volcano located in the [[White Peaks]].

popup.title: Forharn
popup.description: A city of [[gnome]]s built within the darkest depths of the volcano.

popup.title: Cenotaph of the Lost Gods
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Oubliette of Madness
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Mount Akoro
popup.description: The peak that was the home to the [[Akoro]] tribe of [[goliath]]s, a group that fought the ancient [[Maram of the Great Spear]] centuries before [[Dale Reckoning]].

popup.title: Turnback Mountain
popup.description: The southernmost peak in the [[Abbey Mountains]].

popup.title: Aefarn
popup.description: Also known as the '''House of Gold''', a major center of the worship of [[Abbathor]], the [[dwarven]] god of greed.

popup.title: Remorhaz Ride
popup.description: An icy path that crossed the tundra west of the [[Great Glacier]], connecting [[Frozen Flindyke]] with [[Mount Ghaethlauntar]].

popup.title: The Stoneblade
popup.description: A magical blade plunged into a rock at the center of a great [[oak]] dell.

popup.title: Firedrake Road
popup.description: A winding trail that ran between the town of [[Mosstone]] and [[Velen]], along the [[Dragon's Neck Peninsula]] of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Blackthorn Manor
popup.description: A fortified ducal manor of the Duchy of [[Cape Velen]].

popup.title: The Bite
popup.description: The shoreline of the [[Dragon's Teeth Lagoon]]  in [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Tharamon Ruins
popup.description: A ruined vila of note, built along the [[Firedrake Road]].

popup.title: Presmer Ruins
popup.description: A ruined vila of note, built along the [[Firedrake Road]].

popup.title: Dargree Ruins
popup.description: A ruined vila of note, built along the [[Firedrake Road]].

popup.title: Manor Atheon
popup.description: The most famous of the abandoned villas on [[the Bite]], and a haunted ruin.

popup.title: Banshee's Point
popup.description: The small forest on the southernmost point of [[Cape Velen]] with terrifying whaling heard by passing ships.

popup.title: Cape Velen
popup.description: The small peninsula that gave the Duchy of [[Cape Velen]] its name.

popup.title: Downdragon Rise
popup.description: The forest that grew at the heart of the [[Dragon's Head]] behind the ruined villas.

popup.title: Asavir's Channel
popup.description: The often-sailed channel between the [[Nelanther Isles]] and the [[Tethyr Peninsula]], marked by two [[Sea Towers]] on its northern and southern ends.

popup.title: Monastery of St. Domin
popup.description: The '''Holy House of Domin''', a cloister, a navigation and seamanship school, and an orphanage of the [[Church of Ilmater]].

popup.title: The Archdruid's Grove
popup.description: A temple complex of sorts dedicated to [[Silvanus]], the Oak-Father, just outside the city of [[Mosstone]] and a center of the god's worship and home of the [[Archdruid]] of Mosstone.

popup.title: The Black Tomb of the Corsair
popup.description: The final resting place of King [[Haedrak II]] of [[Tethyr]], known as the Corsair Prince, made of black [[basalt]].

link.label: The Black Tomb of the Corsair

popup.title: Rock Orchard
popup.description: A hamlet best known for its [[apple]] harvests.

popup.title: Viperstone
popup.description: A hamlet best known for its dealings with [[Calishite]] [[alchemist]]s.

popup.title: Toaketh
popup.description: The hamlet that produced the famed ''[[Toaketh knives]]''.

popup.title: Khalid's Wall
popup.description: An ancient ruined wall that was built to separate the [[Dragon's Head Peninsula]] from the rest of [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Asharfall
popup.description: An estate that formerly was in [[Amn]]ian lands.

popup.title: Sunrise Orchards
popup.description: A plantation that formerly was in [[Amn]]ian lands.

popup.title: Tannithall
popup.description: A manor of note.

popup.title: Spulzeer Vale
popup.description: The vale where [[Castle Spulzeer]] once stood.

popup.title: Sentinel Tower
popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s outpost towers.

popup.title: Sentinel Tower
popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s outpost towers.

popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s outpost towers.

popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s outpost towers.

popup.description: One of [[Amn]]'s outpost towers.

popup.title: Esford
popup.description: A small town and a ford across the [[River Esmel]].

popup.title: Shepherdston
popup.description: A small village of shepherds and dairy farmers in southern [[Amn]].

popup.title: Harvest House
popup.description: A temple of note.

popup.title: St. Carwell's Vale
popup.description: A small village in the [[Hamlar Hills]] with a shrine dedicated to [[Eldath]].

popup.title: Black Spires of the Maiden
popup.description: A temple devoted to [[Loviatar]], the Maiden of Pain, located west of [[Ishla]] in the [[Vale of Wailing Women]].

popup.title: Vale of Wailing Women
popup.description: A mountain vale of note.

popup.title: Kossuth's Eyes
popup.description: A pair of dormant volcanoes in the [[Small Teeth]] mountains.

popup.title: Lost Xandar
popup.description: The site of a volcanic eruption that destroyed a city of ancient [[Tethyr]].

popup.title: Dark Embrace
popup.description: A crag of rock called [[Sharcrag]] that housed this temple to [[Shar]].

popup.title: Irphong
popup.description: An island that was only used as a marker to show the northern end of [[Asavir’s Channel]] with It's only notable feature being one of the [[Sea Towers]].

popup.title: Sea Tower
popup.description: One of the twin lighthouses that spilled magical light and marked the northern and southern ends of [[Asavir's Channel]].

popup.title: Sea Tower
popup.description: One of the twin lighthouses that spilled magical light and marked the northern and southern ends of [[Asavir's Channel]].

popup.title: Nemessor
popup.description: A small island located in the [[Nelanther Isles]] that housed only one settlement –  [[Black Skull Cove]].

popup.title: Mystics' Academy
popup.description: A school of magic located south of the city of [[Llorbauth]].

popup.title: Saarlik
popup.description: A ruined settlement of note.

popup.title: Dajaan
popup.description: A ruined settlement of note.

popup.title: Rivenshield
popup.description: A settlement of note inhabited by the [[Shieldbreakers|Shieldbreaker]] [[ogre]].

popup.title: Arglander River
popup.description: One of the major sources of the [[Deepwash]] lake located within the [[Ahlarkhem Barony]] in [[Erlkazar]].

popup.title: Shadebridge
popup.description: The only safe crossing point of the dangerous [[Arglander River]], along the road from [[Duhlnarim]] to [[Saarlik]].

popup.title: Garrison Innocence
popup.description: A fort of note.

popup.title: Nine Star Towers of Mystra
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Tor Arcana
popup.description: A fortified keep home of Count [[Dancon Riiklass]] and his wife [[Iimvara Riiklass]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Shelshyr House
popup.description: The fortified ducal seat of the [[Golden Marches]].

popup.title: Morninggold Keep
popup.description: Also called '''Gold Keep''' and '''Castle Morninggold''', the county seat of [[County Morninggold]] in the [[Golden Marches]] of [[Tethyr]]. It was the former home of then-countess and later queen [[Zaranda Star]].

popup.title: Winterview House
popup.description: A lone cottage six miles off the [[High Road]] atop a rocky gully, claimed by the [[giant]] named [[Snorri]] and his minions in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Havenmere
popup.description: A tiny village, mile or two south of [[Thunder Gap]], nestled midst mountains on the shores of the Havenmere Lake.{{approx}}

popup.title: The Keep
popup.description: A small keep with a moat, just half a mile into the [[Kryptgarden Forest]] atop a hill in the middle of a clearing, captured by the [[Lostafinga]] [[hobgoblin]]s for a short time in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Solbudar River
popup.description: A small river that passed [[Highmoon]] and  ran them miles northwest and ended in the [[Lake Marjahon]].

popup.title: Lake Marjahon
popup.description: A small lake where the [[Solbudar River]] ended.

popup.title: Ykslarin River
popup.description: A river of note, ten miles north of [[Highmoon]].

popup.title: Valshada
popup.description: A village on the upper reaches of the [[River of Ice]] that was used as a transit point for nearby ranchers.

popup.title: Traispek
popup.description: A village located twelve miles north of [[Valshada]] on the slopes of the [[Marching Mountains]].

popup.title: Canthrell
popup.description: An island of note.

popup.title: Threlloch
popup.description: A [[Northlander]] settlement located near the center of the island.

popup.title: Seawolf
popup.description: A village on [[Giantspine]] inhabited by [[Tempuran]]s, traditionally, the clergy was entirely made up of men, and women were barred from becoming priests of the Lord of Battles.

popup.title: Hammerstaad
popup.description: A fortified [[Northlander]] city and the seat of power for the king of [[Norheim]].

popup.title: Giantspine
popup.description: The largest island within the kingdom of [[Norheim]] in the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Giantspine Range
popup.description: The mountain range that was the dominant feature of the island, stretching from end to end for over 40 miles (64 kilometers).

popup.title: Oman's Isle
popup.description: A n island that was a part of the kingdom of [[Oman]].

popup.title: Strait of Oman
popup.description: A narrow channel of the [[Sea of Moonshae]] that separated the islands of [[Oman's Isle]] and [[Gwynneth]].

popup.title: Iron Bay
popup.description: Sometimes called '''Iron Keep Bay''', the best natural harbor available to the [[northmen]].

popup.title: Codsbay
popup.description: A small bay on the northern coast of the island of [[Gwynneth]] within the kingdom of [[Oman]].

popup.title: Codscove
popup.description: A small village along the northeastern coast of the island on the south side of the [[Strait of Oman]] on the [[Codsbay]], just northwest of the [[Codsbay Mire]].

popup.title: Codsrun Creek
popup.description: A small river that originated from the [[Shee Pool]] just north of the [[Myrloch]], flowed northeast from the lake through the western [[Winterglen]] before passing through the [[Codsbay Mire]] to reach the [[Codsbay]] and the [[Strait of Oman]].

popup.title: Codsbay Mire
popup.description: A wetland where the [[Codsrun Creek]] delta met the [[Strait of Oman]].

popup.title: Manger
popup.description: A small and isolated coastal town, ruined by the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Lillemaren
popup.description: A small town reduced to ruins after [[giant]]s passed through the region during the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Ramshorn
popup.description: A small village located on [[Oman's Isle]], reduced to ruins after [[giant]]s passed through the region during the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Grampalt Highlands
popup.description: A small mountain range located on [[Oman's Isle]] in the kingdom of [[Oman]], inhabited by [[giant]]s and [[fomorian]]s.

popup.title: Old Stone Wood
popup.description: A forest that contained the island's only ''[[moonwell]]'', located near the [[Cairn of Thelgaar Ironhand]].

popup.title: Trondhelm
popup.description: A small village of note, the birthplace of [[Thelgaar Ironhand]], a Jarl of [[Oman]] during the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Cairn of Thelgaar Ironhand
popup.description: The burial site of [[Jarl Thelgaar Ironhand]] of [[Oman]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Skien
popup.description: A small village located on [[Oman's Isle]], ruined by giants' passage through the region during the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Iron Keep
popup.description: A fortress on [[Iron Bay]] and the ancestral seat of power for the [[Northlander]] rulers of [[Oman]].

popup.title: Toaridge-at-the-Sun's-Setting
popup.description: The island that played an important role in the history of a powerful magic sword known as ''[[Taragarth]]''.

popup.title: The Rookery
popup.description: Also known as '''Pelath's Isle''', a low island had a thin grove of trees, a stone cottage with a garden, and numerous large rooks, inhabited by an old hermit [[mage]], [[Pelath]].

popup.title: Hook Isle
popup.description: A hook-shaped island, part of the [[Nelanther Isles]]; the [[Bay of Skulls]] near the center of the island gave it its noticeable crescent shape.

popup.title: Thordentor
popup.description: One of the largest islands by landmass in the [[Nelanther Isles]], it scared most pirates in the area off as each year, anywhere from 5–30 [[whale]]s beached themselves and died on its eastern and southern shores. Underneath the island stood a major stronghold of the [[Twisted Rune]].

popup.title: Castle Morose
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Sunderstaad
popup.description: A small town located in the kingdom of [[Gnarhelm]] situated on a small bay.

popup.title: Salmon Bay
popup.description: Also called the '''Firth of Helmsgate''', a prominent bay in northern [[Gnarhelm]].

popup.title: Death's Door
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Leechhome
popup.description: A swamp of note.

popup.title: Lake of the Leech
popup.description: A small freshwater lake that touched the northern edge of [[Leechhome]], the only major swamp in [[Gnarhelm]].

popup.title: Lake Sunder
popup.description: A freshwater lake located in northern [[Gnarhelm]], with the [[Farfair River]] entering its southwest shore and exiting to the sea on the northeast shore.

popup.title: Farfair River
popup.description: The river that originated where the [[Lisbunt]] and the [[Fairheight Mountains]] met, flowed west and then north around the base of the [[Lisbunt Mountains]] before reaching [[Lake Sunder]]'s southern shore, continuing on to the [[Sea of Swords]].

popup.title: Greentree
popup.description: The northwestern part of [[Cormanthor]].

popup.title: The Seat of Bane
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Halvan's Wood
popup.description: The eastern part of [[Cormanthor]] that laid beyond river [[Duathamper]].

popup.title: Fiddler's Pass
popup.description: A small village of shepherds, once menaced by the [[dragon]] named [[Jhannexydofalamarne]] in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{approx}}

popup.title: The Black Glen
popup.description: A circular clearing enveloped by charcoal-colored haze with a large black [[iron]] [[cauldron]] in the center.

popup.title: Houpshe's Cave
popup.description: The lair of [[Houpshe]], a [[greenhag]] and her gang of [[mongrelmen]].

popup.title: Thessinthorn's Tree House
popup.description: A massive wooden structure elevated on a cluster of huge trees, the home of [[Thessinthorn]], a [[greenhag]].

popup.title: Magglerak's Lake
popup.description: A tiny forest lake, fed by a stream that emptied into [[Lake Sember]], named after the [[seahag]] named [[Magglerak]].

popup.title: Vexia's Lair

popup.description: Jugged shoreline cliffs on the area known as [[Gull Cape]].

popup.title: Temezzer's End
popup.description: A small and shallow bay named after a minor [[Chessenta]]n lord, whose ship, the ''[[Bright Faring]]'' met its end here ''circa'' [[1286 DR]].

popup.title: Rathgarl's Bay
popup.description: A bay named after a retired amorous adventurer who settled on its beaches in the [[1320 DR|1320s DR]].

popup.title: The Wash
popup.description: A peaceful shallow bay named after its rhythmic waves rolling over the shores.

popup.title: Stormsnout
popup.description: The cape that sheltered [[Laothkund]] and the [[Laothlan Bay]].

popup.title: Laothlan Bay
popup.description: The sheltered bay on which the city of [[Laothkund]] stood.

popup.title: Aryll Bay
popup.description: The bay named after a small clearwater stream that emptied into it.

popup.title: Aryllswater
popup.description: A small clearwater stream named after a [[half-elven]] [[sorceress]] that lived there until [[127 DR]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Laspar Rock
popup.description: A cape of note with the [[Bright Shore]] washing its eastern end.

popup.title: Bright Shore
popup.description: The bay also known as the '''Bright Bay'''.

popup.title: Grayseas
popup.description: The mouth of [[River Lapendrar]]m known for its color due to the inky-black silt washed from upriver.

popup.title: The Dauntir
popup.description: A hilly land of rolling fields and busy farmlands between the [[Trade Way]], the [[River Esmel]], and the [[Small Teeth]].

popup.title: Revel's End
popup.description: A prison built on a cliff-side overlooking the [[Sea of Moving Ice]], used to hold some of the [[Sword Coast]]'s most heinous criminals.

popup.title: Island of Solstice
popup.description: The snowflake-shaped island where [[Grimskalle]], a frost giant fortress, stood way north in the [[Sea of Moving Ice]].

popup.title: Sunblight
popup.description: The fortress of the [[Sunblight]] [[duergar]] clan, connected to the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Necropolis of Ythryn
popup.description: Underground ruins of one of the spectacular enclaves of [[Netheril]] that soared across the skies over a millennium before the [[Era of Upheaval]].

popup.title: Cave of Black Ice Berserkers
popup.description: Abandoned [[dwarf|dwarven]] mines, taken over by [[Auril]]-worshiping [[white dragon]]s and ''[[black ice]]'' [[berserker]]s in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Renkilk's Cranny
popup.description: A cave complex with a zone of ''[[dead magic]]'', once inhabited by [[ogre]]s, who were driven out by the [[Church of Shar]] in the late 14th century [[DR]].

popup.title: Julkoun
popup.description: A hamlet on the [[Delimbiyr]] halfway between [[Daggerford]] and [[Secomber]].

popup.title: Risen Road
popup.description: A long road that connected [[Baldur's Gate]] with the city of [[Elturel]], the more preferred travel route to the [[Chionthar]] river barge.

popup.title: Rosymorn Monastery
popup.description: A ruined temple to [[Lathander]] that rove above the [[River Chionthar]] cliffs, taken over by a contingent of [[githyanki]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Moonhaven
popup.description: Later known as '''Bogrot''', a village ruined in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]] by the [[Sharran]] war.

popup.title: Emerald Grove
popup.description: A hidden [[druid]]ic grove dedicated to [[Silvanus]].

popup.title: Waukeen's Rest
popup.description: A roadside inn that catered to travelers of the [[Risen Road]] that suffered damage in a raid by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] in [[1492 DR]].

popup.title: Temple of Jergal
popup.description: An ancient temple to [[Jergal]], the Lord of the End of Everything, long ruined by the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Felshroun
popup.description: An independent diamond-shaped walled town on the cross-road between [[Blacksaddle]], the [[Realm of the Smoking Star]], and [[Shandolphyn's Reach]], along the northwest coast of the [[Border Kingdoms]].

popup.title: Ythtym
popup.description: A settlement of none.

popup.title: Alamontyr
popup.description: A large [[fish]]ing and agricultural town in the far northeast of the [[Border Kingdoms]], the easternmost notable settlement within the Border Kingdoms, and home to the largest community of craftspeople in the region.

popup.title: Gothaladreum
popup.description: An ancient cemetery once used by the folk of [[Port Llast]], located on the edge of the [[Neverwinter Wood]], long abandoned and ruined by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: West Dusking River
popup.description: A waterway of note in the [[Duskwood]].

popup.title: Luthbaern
popup.description: A small, crowded town in the north-western [[Border Kingdoms]], filled with buildings of slate and stone so close together there was barely any space for balconies between two buildings and cobblestone streets.

popup.title: Lammatar's Water
popup.description: A waterway of note in the [[Duskwood]].

popup.title: Sprynt
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Telcharn
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Beldargan
popup.description: A small town in the southern [[Border Kingdoms]] completely surrounded by the [[Barony of Blacksaddle]].

popup.title: Dunbridges
popup.description: A village in [[High Emmerock]] that exported [[Dunbradar cheese]] made with nuts, freshwater [[fish]], and high-quality woolen goods.

popup.title: Thort
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Urspreth
popup.description: A thorp of note.

popup.title: Myrinjar
popup.description: Or '''The Watched City''' – a small city of crowded with narrow buildings in the heart of [[Adaerglast]] surrounded by farmlands.

popup.title: River Glarth
popup.description: A waterway of note that began in the [[Jundarwood]] and poured into the [[Shining Sea]].

popup.title: Ranrath's Run
popup.description: A river with two major tributaries in the [[Neth Stand]].

popup.title: River Sarradra
popup.description: A waterway in the southwestern part of the [[Neth Stand]].

popup.title: Caldarth
popup.description: Also known as the '''River Racing''', a waterway of two major tributaries in the south of [[Jundarwood]].

popup.title: River Balaerit
popup.description: A river of note.

popup.title: Ebenfar
popup.description: The ruins of the ancient Ebenfar Empire, once ruled by the [[Shadowking]].

popup.title: Krypthome
popup.description: A secluded [[dwarf|dwarvish]] mine complex built into the side of a hill.

popup.title: Pink Trees
popup.description: The outcropping of hot pink [[alder]]s, permanently transformed by [[Elistar Els'edranor]], a brilliant but scatter-brined [[wizard]], sometime before the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Raptor's Lair
popup.description: A [[dwarf|dwarfish]] mine, taken over by [[utahraptor]]s in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Strabon's hut
popup.description: A hermit's cottage, attacked and ruined in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Woody Glen
popup.description: A sleepy town in the foothills of the [[Lost Peaks]], nestled in a wooded valley, known for its craftsmen and unique [[herb]]s.

popup.title: Olde Road
popup.description: A thin and rarely-used road that began on the [[Dead Horse Path]] and ran east into the [[Lost Peaks]] foothills.

popup.title: The Silver Mine
popup.description: A [[silver]] mine that stood on [[Overgrown Road]], in the forest west of [[Woody Glen]].

popup.title: Falling Rock River
popup.description: A minor waterway, the western tributary of [[Whisper Run]], that flowed west through the [[Brook Pond]] and the [[Frog Pond]].

popup.title: Whisper Run
popup.description: A minor waterway that flowed west through the [[Brook Pond]] and the [[Frog Pond]], and merging into the [[Falling Rock River]].

popup.title: The Warts
popup.description: A cluster of three low hills that rose around a stone circle of six monoliths.

popup.title: Mak'kat's Fort
popup.description: A wooden prison fort occupied by [[Mak'kat]] in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Earthsky Pass
popup.description:
A steeply sloped valley in the center of the mountains and the site of the [[Halls of the Sleeping Legion]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Halls of the Sleeping Legion
popup.description:
Catacombs underneath the ruins of the [[Chapel of the Blooded Moon]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Uthtower
popup.description: The ruined seat of power of the kingdom of Uthtower, built in [[146 DR]].

popup.title: The Shieldmaidens
popup.description: A small wall of hills pockmarked with surface mining in the 1100s [[DR]] that stripped them of [[copper]] deposits.

popup.title: Zarcel's Run
popup.description: A waterway that ran past [[Alamontyr]], merged with the [[Stormwind River]], and emptied into the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Stormwind River
popup.description: A waterway that merged with [[Zarcel's Run]] and emptied into the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Waevendusk River
popup.description: A waterway that merged with the [[West Dusking River]] and emptied into the [[Lake of Steam]].

popup.title: Xammandas Stream
popup.description: A forest waterway that merged into [[Lammatar's Water]] and eventually emptied into the [[Lake of Steam]] to the north.

popup.title: The Westwater Way
popup.description: The road that connected [[Luthbaern]] in the southwest and [[Felshroun]] in the northeast.

popup.title: The Long Trail
popup.description: A road that ran along the edge of [[Shaar]] and the southern edges of the [[Duskwood]], across [[The Realm of the Ready Sword]].

popup.title: Arthyn
popup.description: A large port town and an independent city-state with rich deposits of [[copper]] and [[iron]] in the surrounding hills.

popup.title: Waernd
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: Tumblestone River
popup.description: A minor waterway of note.

popup.title: Blackalblade
popup.description: A small city and the capital of [[Ondeeme]], one of the wealthiest cities in the [[Border Kingdoms]] famed for its [[gem]]cutters.

popup.title: Oeble
popup.description:
A well-known trade center and a haven for criminal activity in the region – a place built on the bones of betrayed men.

Interactive map can be found [[Map:Oeble|here]].

popup.title: Emrys
popup.description: A large town in the southern [[Border Kingdoms]] within the [[Talduth Vale]] governed by a council of six hereditary Grand Merchant Dukes.

popup.title: Rymdyl
popup.description: A hamlet of note.

popup.title: The Green Road
popup.description: A road that stretched me from [[Oeble]] to [[Bloutar]].

popup.title: The Bowshot
popup.description: A short and dangerous road through the thickest of the wild [[Owlhold]] that connected the [[Green Road]] to the north and the [[Longcrag Ride]] to the south.

popup.title: Longcrag Ride
popup.description: A road that connected the town of [[Emrys]] in the southwest and [[Beldargan]] in the northeast.

popup.title: Dapplegate
popup.description: A large independent town, home to a wide variety of crafters that benefited greatly from its large port district and both, domestic and international trade.

popup.title: Oparl
popup.description: A town of sixty large [[Calishite]] mansions that housed the main population center of [[Bedorn]].

popup.title: The Scelptar Road
popup.description: A riverside road that stretched from the town of [[Selpt]] to the town of [[Blackbarn]].

popup.title: Manywaters
popup.description: A small independent town known for its hot springs – [[Riven Rock Pool]], and the temple to [[Ilmater]] – [[Riven Healing House]].

popup.title: Sorndorn
popup.description: A village of note.

popup.title: Irl
popup.description: A village with its log cabins built along the roads curved around the front of The [[Bold Ki-rin]] inn.

popup.title: Arnglar
popup.description: A sleepy hill village surrounded by windswept pastoral grazing fields.

popup.title: Molina's Keep
popup.description: A fort located in the [[Valley of Khedrun]], ruined by the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Moon Stair
popup.description: A mysterious crumbled spiral staircase that rose above the water level and plunged underneath the [[Lake of Salt]].

popup.title: Ruins of the Serpent Kings
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Pyramid of the Seer
popup.description: A [[Mulhorandi]] tomb that remained on [[Toril]] during the [[Spellplague]] years.

popup.title: Blue Sword River
popup.description: A tributary of the [[River of Swords]].

popup.title: Mound of the Sleepless
popup.description: A ruin of note.

popup.title: Purple Spire
popup.description: An ancient and battered tower that stood over the ancient ruins of the [[Imaskari]] complex.

popup.title: Ragheb
popup.description: A small 15{{th}} century [[DR]] town built around an oasis and a small but deep lake known as [[Lake Ragheb]].

popup.title: Lake Ragheb
popup.description: The small but deep lake at the heart of the oasis and the town of [[Ragheb]].

popup.title: Al Qahara
popup.description: A hidden [[elf|elven]] town located in a cavern in the southern [[Raurin]] that traded with nearby oasis settlements.

popup.title: Tirumala
popup.description: Also known as the '''Holy City''' of the [[rakshasa]]s, a rich city-state built atop [[Durpari]] ruins. It was a trading partner of [[Estagund]] by [[1474 DR]].

popup.title: Blackfeather Barrens
popup.description: The area of the [[Beastlands]] that stretched between the [[Toadsquat Mountains]] and the [[Curna Mountains]].

popup.title: Quomec
popup.description: A large ziggurat crypt that sat in the jungles of northern [[Chult]] and stood twenty-eight levels tall.

popup.title: Cold Vale
popup.description: A wild and desolate region between the southern edge of the [[Cold Wood]] and the northern spur of the [[Rauvin Mountains]].

popup.title: Hammer Ford
popup.description: A [[Halfaxe Trail]]'s crossing of the [[Duathamper]].

popup.title: Hammer and Anvil
popup.description: A small tent-city outside the western walls of [[Eartheart]], filled with workshops.

popup.title: Underhome
popup.description: The surface entrance into the '''Great City of the Dwarves''', the capital city of the [[Deep Realm]] of the [[gold dwarves]] located within the [[Great Rift]].

popup.title: Underwatch
popup.description: A huge fortress, erected by [[dwarves]] to guard the entrance to [[Underhome]].

popup.title: Hro'Druathu
popup.description: A location of note on the crossing to the domain of [[Kunin Gatar]].

popup.title: Nar-Sek Qu'Istrade
popup.description: A neutral meeting ground of the tribes of [[Narfell]], also known as the '''Horseshoe Canyon'''.

popup.title: Kistrad
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Highwatch
popup.description: A fortress of note.

popup.title: Starglance Temple
popup.description: A temple of note.

popup.title: Rogarsheim
popup.description: The [[Northlander]] capital located on the [[Bay of Norland]], with its industry centered around [[fish]]ing, hunting, and shipbuilding.

popup.title: Bay of Norland
popup.description: A prominent bay that created a safe passage in the middle for ships while also helping to protect the bay from storms.

popup.title: Moray
popup.description: The westernmost territory of the [[Ffolk]] and the wildest of the southern [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Strait of the Leviathan
popup.description: The strait between the islands of [[Moray]] and [[Gwynneth]], named after a legendary aquatic child of [[Chauntea]].

popup.title: Gwynneth
popup.description: Also known as '''Sarifal''', the largest of the southern islands.

popup.title: Myrloch
popup.description: A large freshwater lake.

popup.title: Caer Corwell
popup.description: Also known as '''Corwell Town''', a small city and a castle of the same name.

popup.title: Corwell Firth
popup.description: An inlet of the [[Trackless Sea]] located off the island of [[Gwynneth]].

popup.title: Taskerleigh
popup.description: A small village attacked and destroyed by the [[green dragon]] [[Grimnoshtadrano]] in [[1364 DR]].

popup.title: Bloodgate Keep
popup.description: A small fortress claimed by the [[Thayan]]s in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Cromm's Hold

popup.title: Summit Hall
popup.description: The base and training monastery for the [[Knights of Samular]], an order dedicated to [[Tyr]].

popup.title: Rivergard Keep
popup.description: A stone fortification on the banks of the [[River Dessarin]], inhabited by the [[Cult of the Crushing Wave]] in [[1491 DR]].

popup.title: Feathergale Spire
popup.description: A fortified tower occupied by the [[Feathergale Knights]] of [[Waterdeep]] in [[1491 DR]].

popup.title: Scarlet Moon Hall
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Sacred Stone Monastery
popup.description: A monastery of note.

popup.title: Vale of Dancing Waters
popup.description: A sacred hidden vale dedicated to the goddess [[Sharindlar]], reachable via a hidden trail beginning by the [[Stone Bridge]].

popup.title: Stone Bridge
popup.description: A large single arch bridge across [[River Dessarin]] and a temple dedicated to [[Moradin]].

popup.title: Larch Path
popup.description: A minor road that stretched from [[Red Larch]] to the [[Stone Bridge]].

popup.title: Abandoned quarry
popup.description: A quarry abandoned by the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Black Maw Bog
popup.description: A small bog with a bridge that allowed the [[Long Road]] to cross over.

popup.title: Nettlebee Ranch
popup.description: A pasteral little farm run by the [[Nettlebee]] clan of [[halfling]]s that bred [[cattle]], [[sheep]], and [[ponies]].

popup.title: Helvenblade House
popup.description: A country estate owned by the noble [[Silmerhelve]] family of [[Waterdeep]].

popup.title: Jundar's Pass
popup.description: A passage through the eastern [[Dessarin Hills]] that began in the village of [[Beliard]] to the north.

popup.title: Dessarin Hills
popup.description: A grouping of rugged hills in the western stretch of the [[Savage Frontier]].

popup.title: Anderil Farm
popup.description: The farm run by the [[half-elf]] [[Selwyn]] and his wife [[Maygan]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Dellmon Ranch
popup.description: A prosperous farm with the Dellmon family being quite respected in the valley.

popup.title: Lance Rock
popup.description: A stone monolith outside of [[Red Larch]].

popup.title: Maligor's Tower
popup.description: The residence and a stronghold of sorts for [[Maligor]], the [[Zulkir]] of [[Alteration]] until his apparent death in [[1362 DR]].

popup.title: Whitebranch
popup.description: A [[Thay]]vian village of note with tent barracks outside.

popup.description: A tor landmark named for how starlight danced reflecting off it.

popup.title: The Old Man Tor
popup.description: A tor landmark of note.

popup.title: Faereld's Hold
popup.description: A keep in the western part of [[Sembia]] near its border with its cellars connected to the [[Underdark]].{{approx}}

popup.description: A passage across the [[Cambro Mountains]].

popup.title: Black Mountains
popup.description: A mountain range located on the island of [[Gwynneth]].

popup.title: Myrloch Vale
popup.description: A large vale located in the central part of the island of [[Gwynneth]] inhabited by numerous [[faerie dragons]].

popup.description: Wetlands of note.

popup.description: [[Giant]] ruins of note.

popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: Dynnatt
popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: Ieirithymbul

popup.title: Giant's Craw Valley
popup.description: A valley north of [[River Ashaba]], distinct for having a huge slab of shimmering [[obsidian]] that glowed with a violet hue.

popup.title: Lost Vale
popup.description: Also known as '''Tarkhaldale''', home to a magically-hidden settlement of [[saurial]]s.

popup.title: Swordcrag
popup.description: A small mining village that was reformed as an [[orc]] fortress.

popup.title: Tuern
popup.description: An island in the [[Frozenfar]] in the [[Trackless Sea]].

popup.description: A monastery of note.

popup.description: A portion of the [[Ithal Road]] just east of [[Darromar]].

popup.description: The portion of the [[Ithal Road]] between [[Barakmordin]] and [[Saradush]].

A settlement of note.

A settlement of note.

popup.description: A ruin of note.

The long-lost underwater tomb of the high
priest [[Patrizius]].

popup.description: A place of worhip dedicated to [[Shaundakaul]] atop a hill that disrupted all magical means of travel in the area.

popup.title: Teleportation Circle
popup.description: The [[enchanted]] circle where all magical attempts at transportation in the area around the [[Shrine of Shaundakaul]] ended up.

popup.title: Morden Winery
popup.description: A small secluded winery and a vineyard in a valley between two hills on a stream that fed into the [[Fire River]], run by [[maedar]] [[Vorlon]] and [[medusa]] [[Samanthiss]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{approx}}

popup.title: Sugar Hills
popup.description: The hilly terrain located around three miles south of the [[hin]] town of [[Burrowbluff]].

popup.title: Sugar Falls
popup.description: A small waterfall located several miles away from the [[hin]] town of [[Burrowbluff]] with a minor waterway pouring down the bluff, passing [[Sugar Hills]] and merging into the [[Dragon Reach]].

popup.title: Raven's Bluff Road
popup.description: The coastal road that connected the metropolis of [[Ravens Bluff]] to the north with [[Procampur]] in the south, and passing through [[Portsoy]] and [[Burrowbluff]].

popup.title: Saeraethra's Stream
popup.description: A minor waterway that ran from the [[Misty Forest]], through the [[Sword Hills]], and merged into the [[Delimbiyr River]] west of [[Daggerford]].

popup.title: Renstal's Tower
popup.description: The tower-home of [[Renstal Bulbnose]], a [[gnome]] [[spell]]-researcher from [[Ravens Bluff]].

popup.title: Fort Blood
popup.description: A fortification of note.

popup.title: Borthun's Walk
popup.description:
A mountain route through the [[Omlarandin Mountains]] that connected [[Praskallest]] and [[Saradush]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Spires Against the Stars
popup.description:
The most holy site of worship for the faithful of [[Beshaba]], the Maid of Misfortune.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Orator's Crag
popup.description:
A crag of note.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Furrowsrich
popup.description: One of the largest villages in [[Ahlarkhem]], it sat at the crossroads of roads leading to [[Duhlnarim]], [[Llorbauth]], and [[Five Spears Hold]].

popup.title: Quicksilver's Lair
popup.description: A [[dragon]] lair of note.

popup.title: Turbold's Crypt
popup.description:
The ancient [[Kuldin Peaks]] crypt of [[Turbold]], the local leader of the [[dwarves]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Kartak's Tomb
popup.description:
The [[Kuldin Peaks]] tomb of [[Kartak Spellseer]], a [[lich]] and [[necromancer]], a member of the [[Twisted Rune]].

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Ravimor's Cave
popup.description:
A huge chasm in the [[Kuldin Peaks]] mountains.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Turbold Vale
popup.description:
A vale in the [[Kuldin Peaks]], named after an ancient [[dwarf|dwarvish]] leader.

'''Note: This map shows the incorrect geography of the region. Please refer to 2{{nd}} edition maps.'''

popup.title: Rrinnoroth
popup.description:
A dwarven ghost town in the [[Kuldin Peaks]].

popup.title: Ford of Goliad
popup.description: A bridge over the [[Goliad River]], south of the city of [[Goliad]].

popup.title: Darlisan
popup.description: A small settlement of note.

popup.title: Brahms
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Canipe
popup.description: A settlement of note along [[Dormythyrr's Ride]].

popup.title: Dormythyrr's Ride
popup.description: A road in central [[Damara]] that connected [[Goliad]] and [[Ravensburg]], passing through the village of [[Canipe]].

popup.title: Sorath-Nu-Sum
popup.description: A city – the center of [[kuo-toa]] politics in the [[Underdark]].

popup.title: Troll Hills
popup.description: Hills of note in [[Thar]].

popup.title: Tharkul's Palace
popup.description: The seat of power of the [[Tharkul]] of the [[ogre]] kingdom of [[Thar]].

popup.title: Nouth
popup.description: The ruin of a tower and a walled stableyard, once, part of the human nation of King [[Beldoran]].

popup.title: Moortown
popup.description: Once – a ruined town, later – an outpost of the [[Cult of the Dragon]] and a settlement controlled by the [[Warlock Knights of Vaasa]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Moloth Caldera
popup.description: A large bog lake in the [[Bottomless Bogs]].

popup.title: Lake Throm
popup.description: A large bog lake in the [[Bottomless Bogs]].

popup.title: Kond
popup.description: A small settlement carved into the steep cliffs along the southern side of the [[Clefts of Razack]] above the [[Beaumaris River]] in [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: Clefts of Razack
popup.description: Also known as '''Razack's Scar''', a long gorge that wounded through central [[Vaasa]], through which the [[Beaumaris River]] ran.

popup.title: Dead Man's Walk
popup.description: A road that crossed almost the entire nation of [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: Sea of Frozen Tears
popup.description: Also known as the '''Sea of Tears''' or the '''Lake of Tears''' – a lake on the border between [[Alpuk]] and [[Vaasa]].

popup.title: Valley of the White Worm
popup.description: A passage through the [[Lugsaas Chain]] north of [[Castle Perilous]].

popup.title: Baunilorotha
popup.description: Ancient ruined, flooded, and frozen [[titan]] city on the northern side of the [[Sea of Frozen Tears]].

popup.title: Vaalathrim
popup.description: A [[zombie]]-infested ruin of a lost city.

popup.title: Turogor Crevasse
popup.description: A crevasse of note.

popup.title: Devoul's Tower
popup.description: A squat black tower, about thirty feet high, home to the [[wizard]] [[Devoul]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
popup.image: File:Revenge is Harder than Stone map.png

popup.title: Temple of Rillifane
popup.description: A small abandoned temple, overgrown and in a state of disrepair by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
popup.image: File:Revenge is Harder than Stone map.png

popup.title: Flat Burrow
popup.description: A tiny [[halfling]] village of seven burrow mounds on the edge of the [[Highbank Forest]], across the unnamed stream from the Highbank Forest Village.
popup.image: File:Revenge is Harder than Stone map.png

popup.title: Veilstone Peaks
popup.description: A mountainous region in the [[Sunset Mountains]], approximately 50 miles (80 kilometers) west of the [[Farsea Marshes]].

popup.title: Wolover's Keep
popup.description: The ruined home of the benevolent [[sorcerer]] [[Amry Wolover]], turned into a dungeon of nightmares by [[Icelia]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

popup.title: Inscribed Cliff
popup.description: A landmark of note.

popup.title: Lilac Pond
popup.description: Or '''Lilac Lake''', a small [[poison]]-filled pond with lightly yellowed waters, surrounded by blackened dead earth.

popup.title: Bedford
popup.description: A stone hut village of 500 built in the foothills of the [[Veilstone Peaks]] that specialized in growing [[potato]]es and [[pea]]s.

popup.title: Redronde
popup.description: A small wooden shack village of 840, known for its sporadic grain fields and intricate irrigation.

popup.title: Garnerr
popup.description: One of the larger settlements in the area, with a population of 1210, known as a manufacturer of carts, furniture, and chests.

popup.title: Anster
popup.description: A neat but poor village of 870, surrounded by a wooden fence and named after a noted 14 {{th}} century [[DR]] weaponsmith.

popup.title: Doff's Lake
popup.description: A serene, clear lake willed with [[pike]], [[bream]], [[loach]], and [[minnow]]s.

popup.title: Hetchit
popup.description: A small and dirty village of 610 with its streets filled with waste and sewage.

popup.title: Melcher
popup.description: A calm village of 870, known for green [[cookie]]s that possessed healing properties on par with powerful [[potion]]s.

popup.title: Terrinton
popup.description: A village of 1,400 situated on fertile farmlands of [[apple]]s, [[grape]]s, and other fruits.

popup.title: Wyldeoak Grove
popup.description: A [[druid]]ic habitat at the heart of the [[Highbank Forest]], located near a stream that emptied into the [[Fire River]].
popup.image: File:Revenge is Harder than Stone map.png

popup.title: Myth Iiscar
popup.description: The sight of a long-destroyed non-[[elf|elven]] ''[[mythal]]''.

popup.title: Wayfork Village
popup.description: A small agrarian community of cottages, farms, and one inn, simply named the [[Wayfork Inn]].

popup.title: The Reach
popup.description: A trail that ran from [[Vaasa]] through the [[Great Glacier]] to [[Sossal]].

popup.title: The Ice Run
popup.description: A network of ice-walled pathways cutting through the [[Great Glacier]].

popup.title: Cinnabar Wastes
popup.description: A region of cold and arid badlands in northeast [[Vaasa]] named for the reddish color of the local rock formations.

popup.title: Frohm's Rest
popup.description: A settlement of note on the northern shores of the [[Taak Lake]].

popup.title: Assassins Guild of the Galenas
popup.description: Or the '''Citadel of Assassins''', was an assassins guild based in the [[Galena Mountains]] in [[Damara]].

popup.title: Mines of Tethyamar
popup.description: Ruins, once home to one of the greatest dwarven communities in north [[Faerûn]].

popup.title: Teshenfall Pass
popup.description: A mountain pass that allowed access to the [[Anauroch]] from the [[Tesh Valley]].

popup.title: Rose Garden
popup.description: A maze-like supernatural garden of various species of [[rose]]s that grew in the southeast corner of the [[Battle of Bones]].

popup.title: Sigil Fernel's lair
popup.description: The lair of sadistic [[necromancer]] [[Sigil Fernel]] who created stitched together [[undead]] monstrosities.

popup.title: Pond of Tears
popup.description: A small pond near the middle of the [[Battle of Bones]], said to had been filled with the tears from the dead and dying soldiers who perished at the Battle of Bones in [[1090 DR]].

popup.title: Phthta Thak's lair
popup.description: Home of [[Phthta Thak]], a scientist who studied naturally-occurring [[undead]] from her extensive underground home.

popup.title: Xehil Yldin's lair
popup.description: Underground fortress of the ancient [[lich]] [[Xehil Yldin]].

popup.title: Keep of Pale Night
popup.description: A [[vampire]]-infested keep of [[Mordoc SeLanmere]] built on the edge of the [[Battle of Bones]] and guarded by his [[nightwalker]] army.{{approx}}

popup.title: Pontswain
popup.description: A small coastal town located on the island of [[Gwynneth]] within the [[Moonshae Isles]].

popup.title: Moonwell
popup.description: One of ''[[moonwell]]s'' – magical pools of water in the [[Moonshae Isles]], sacred to the [[Earthmother]] and her [[druid]]s.

popup.description: One of ''[[moonwell]]s'' – magical pools of water in the [[Moonshae Isles]], sacred to the [[Earthmother]] and her [[druid]]s.

popup.title: O'Malley
popup.description: A small town located along the halfway point on [[Corwell Road]] between [[Caer Corwell]] in the west and [[Kingsbay]] in the east.

popup.title: Fenton
popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.description: A mountain range located on the island of [[Gwynneth]] stretching for over 75 miles (120 kilometers) and forming most of the southern border of [[Myrloch Vale]].

popup.title: Lowhill
popup.description: A small halfling town a mile outside of [[Caer Corwell]] on the isle of [[Gwynneth]].

popup.title: Corwell Harbor
popup.description: A narrow bay harborage in the [[Corwell Firth]].

popup.title: Wyngate
popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: Greystone
popup.description: A small coastal town of note.

popup.title: Castle of Skulls
popup.description: An abandoned castle built entirely of skulls.

popup.title: Dragon Head
popup.description: A rocky peninsula located on the island of [[Gwynneth]].

popup.title: Pirates' Caves
popup.description: Pirates' caves and coves of note.

popup.title: Horstall
popup.description: A small coastal settlement of note.

popup.title: Llyrath Forest

popup.title: Kingsbay
popup.description: A small coastal town.

popup.title: Kingsbay

popup.title: Mere Adammair

popup.title: Tetauctaa
popup.description: A village populated by [[Maztican]]s brought over by the [[Cat Lord]].

popup.description: A glade of note in the [[Llyrath Forest]].

popup.title: Siren's Grotto
popup.description: A grotto of note.

popup.title: Tír faoi Thoinn

popup.title: Thorndyke
popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: Deepglen

popup.description: A settlement of note.

popup.title: MacSheehan
popup.description: A small town of note.

popup.title: Pengram

popup.title: Moonwell
popup.description: One of ''[[moonwell]]s'' – magical pools of water in the [[Moonshae Isles]], sacred to the [[Earthmother]] and her [[druid]]s.

popup.title: Manann's Scar
popup.description: A landmark on note.

popup.title: Maloren Sods
popup.description: A large coastal swamp on the island of [[Snowdown]].

popup.title: Harloch
popup.description: The largest lake located on the island of [[Snowdown]].

popup.title: Mal Sul
popup.description: A small lake found in the north-central part of the island with a ''[[moonwell]]'' in a forest on its shores.

popup.title: Mal Feargal
popup.description: The northernmost and smallest of the [[Snowdown]] lakes.

popup.title: Harloch
popup.description: A minor village on [[Snowdown Ride]] that bore the name of the lake it stood on.

popup.title: Westhaven

popup.title: Us'holm
popup.description: An underwater city of note.
